text:
Draft at Margaritaville at Universal Studios Florida. Mostly clear, amber color with a little white head. Piney and fruity aroma. A fruity sweetness up front with a medium bitterness in the finish. Nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber pour with a thin one finger head. Aromas of malt, pine and citrus fruits. Initial taste of lemon, followed by a sweet malty body; flavors of apricot, orange and peaches. Medium body with a crisp creamy mouth feel. Strong hop character with a semi-sharp bitterness and a bitter dry finish. I love this beer. One of my favorite IPAs.

Good enjoyable, drinkable American IPAA could be a little higher on hops in the flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pretty good IPA. Tastes better than average. Good bite to it. Nice bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

DISCLAIMER:
I do not like IPA's. However, if I were to drink one, I would drink this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I rarely drink any of the bitter side of beer, IPAs. I did find this one passable. Was not overpowering

Wow what a good beer. I can't believe that I haven't had it before. What a secret IPA, if you haven't had it yet get it immediately

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured a deep golden hue w/ large white head and minor sticky lacing. Moderate to bold sweet malty and bright citrus aromas. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a bold lingering bitter finish. Tastes are caramel, pine, grapefruit pith, and jackfruit. Medium bodied.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml can. Minimally milky, orangey, deep golden colour with average to huge, homogeneous, frothy to creamy, largely lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Piney citrusy and slightly floral, hoppy aroma, slightly biscuity, caramel malty background, notes of orange, tangerine, marmalade, lemon zest, some peppermint and menthol. Taste is bitter, citrusy, piney and slightly floral hoppy, caramel malty backbone with a biscuity and minimally (pea) nutty touch, notes of lemon, orange, tangerine, lemon zest, marmalade, peppermint and menthol overtones; lasting bitter finish. Clean, crisp - excellent!

Beautiful cloudy golden color with a nice thick foamy head. Taste is straight forward IPA with medium to strong taste if hoops, followed with hints of citrus, pine and spruce. Great tribute to the great UP north river after which it was named. One of the great beers of Michigan!

What is there left to say? The once and future king. If I was a jack-ass, Id say its a little creamy for my taste up front, but what do I know?  My only real beef is that its too heavy for an extended summer canoe fishing trip.    I also appreciate that Bells doesnt churn out 50 different versions of this (looking at you, Ballast Point Sculpin.)
Clear dark yellow, off-white lacing foam head. Nice hoppy aroma and bitter taste. Like it. (Houston 201705)

Pours a light amber with mild white head. Scent is hops and citrus with malt undertones. Taste is similar with prominent hops early on but nice biscuit notes involved. Medium body and a crisp dry finish. Truly one of the better IPAs.

Bells is now available in the area so how about it? A grand pour, all cloudy orange and white on top. The smell gives great promise, grapefruit and pine needles. A drink delivers a restrained hoppiness and citrus, perhaps a touch of dough. Strong persistent bitterness, maybe my favorite quality from the brew.
Bottle pours clear amber color with small white head. Aroma - Nice and smooth, floral, fruity. Taste - Hoppy bitterness, orange, malt, pine, mango and grapefruit. Very well balanced.
Draft- Numerous places-Golden pour w/a thick white head. Fresh hop aroma & flavor. Bready, fruitful....very easy to drink. A great go to IPA. Easy drinking, alcohol is well hidden.
12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thick fluffy off white head. The aroma is very floral and grapefruit. The flavor is once again full of grapefruit and some breadiness.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 A cloudy blond appearance. BTHA is a full flavored ale, with slight bitter finish. Interesting hop blend. A good IPA
To old to rate...but..Cloudy orange with creamy head. Citrusy nose. Sweet and medium bodied with a relatively hoppy grapefruity finish. The mouthfeel is light and creamy.

Many breweries seem to do a decent job with IPAs, but this is still my favorite:
*The name calls to mind one of my favorite short stories, Big Two-hearted River
*Just looking at the trout on the label unwinds the spring in my mind a couple clicks
*It comes from Kalamazoo, where we lived 3 years and where my son was born, so experiencing it is sort of like old trout John returning to his native stream.
*I like the 16-oz. can, which is just right for throwing into or digging out of a cooler.
*When I get philosophical, I can lament the fact Bells still hasnt figured out that two-hearted is a compound adjective, and needs a hyphen.
*It tastes great, especially with things like grilled shrimp, carrot cake, or both.

Hazy orange with a lasting beige head that leaves a nice Brussels lace. Sweet malt with citrus hop aroma. Medium body that is slightly dry. Just the right amount of hops bitterness without over doing it. Alcohol is well hidden. Perfect finish.

This ale is brought from New york to me in Alingsås from my daughter and her partner. A gift I really appreciate. Centennial hops gives a long taste-feeling. Pine and grapefruit. I can not feel the alcohol. Good balance and harmony. I long for this ale in our Systembolaget.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2017 Pours a beautiful burnt gold with a rocky two finger head that lasts forever and leaves plenty of lovely lace. Smells of citrus, pine resin and a touch of pineapple and orange zest. Taste follows nose with fresh citrus and a palate smacking bitterness but with a nice balance of malt backbone.  Medium bodied with a long tasty finish. Refreshing, delicious, near perfect.

Nice amberish golden with a bit of foam. Aroma is fresh and resinous, just a small hint of honey. Taste is superbly balanced, nice herbal hops nice clean body and super drinkable beer. Could drink this by the pints when its as fresh as it is now.

Robe orangée et limpide. Une jolie mousse blanche se forme mais tient peu. Arômes résineux, mielleux, malté, fruits confits. Goût agrumes, mielleux. Le résineux arrive en fin de bouche avec des fruits confits. Texture légèrement huileuse, carbonatation fine et moyennement abondante. 
Délicieux.
Dunkles gelb schöner schaum, im geruch pinie citrus etwas Harz, im Geschmack leicht fruchtig citrus pinie etwas blumig harzig herb, schmeckt
This made my two hearts grow two sizes like the grinch. Time to go save Christmas
Orange-gold pour with two fingers of white foam. Tropical and citrus fruits plus some pine resin. Good stuff.

Clear, golden color. Nice, white head. Pine , malt , tropical fruits in aroma. Distinctive, malty backbone with just enough of hoppy bitterness. Supertasty IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden with decent head and the aroma of floral hops. Taste is not as bitter as most IPAs making it very easy drinking. Could chug this one easily. Very refreshing and is going well with the yard work I am doing today.

A real classic IPA in style - taste of american hops, lots of grapefruit, citrus and resin, and a light caramel and biscuit malt backbone. Honey golden in color. Still solid even after all the crazy changes and advances in IPA styles.

Botella. Unclear deep golden colour, medium white head, ok lacing. sweet tropical fruity hoppy citrus pine aroma. Flavour is very hoppy, exotic tropical fruits, citrys pine, sweet, bitter. Long lasting sweet like dry and bitter hoppy fruity citrus finish.
Crystal clear dlhiney colored pour. Big fluffy off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit and pine. Taste is bitter and mostly piney with some citrus. Pretty good

One of the best, still a wonderful IPA amid the sea of fruit salad interpretations dominating the style these days. Huge herbal citric nose, and the pour--good lord, its gorgeous, a glorious gold-orange with a frothy head giving up massive lace. Taste starts with a caramel-citrus malt heft, then gains a thick, chewy center before the hops pump up the finish with a healthy bitterness. Lovely, lovely beer.

12-ounce can poured briskly into glass, Half-inch head with minimal lacing. Aroma: pine needles, citrus. Flavor: pineapple, peach, orange, grapefruit, pine. Refreshing hopiness; nicely balanced bittersweet. For 7 percent alcohol, very drinkable -- dangerously so.
I absolutely love everything about this beer. I havent drank anything else since I found it.
Great pine driven bitterness and aromatics with solid malt backbone. Highly drinkable.
Hazy orange colour with big white head. Aroma of peach, orange, grapefruit. Nice body with very balanced taste.

Pours a clear yellow orange, gigantic pillow of a head. Huge fruit on the nose - pineapple, orange, more orange; nice dose of pine, bready malts and spicy hops to balance it out. Taste is balanced and smooth - orange and grapefruit off the start, herbal hoppy middle, short bready finish. Persistent but pleasant citrus hop presence throughout. This is a great beer.

Draft. Pours a medium well retained, off white head, over very slightly hazy, ambre (SRM 8) body........nose is light pin, resin, heavy fruits with grapefruit dominating, mild cracker, hints of bread, from the malts, balance to the hops.......taste is lightly floral honey sweet, with mild tones of toffee/caramel, moderate bread, finishing with pine, resin, citrus primarily grapefruit, moderate to mild bitterness, balance slightly to the hops......mouth feel, moderate body, mild alcohol, medium carbonation. This is a quite typical and classic style of the current type IPA. BJCP 8/3/16/4/7

12 oz single purchased from Lifesource in Salem OR
$2
Pours the typical American IPA colour of burnt orange with a small cream coloured head. Nice lace down the glass.
 Nice sweet citrus and soft spruce type hop aromas..floral aspects also. Some hay like malts..pretty complex aromas.
Nice piney bitter orange zest taste.. small amount of caramel malts.then more hop bitterness.
Very good mouth feel with generous carbonation it compliments the buzzing bitterness well.
A very nice IPA.
A classic.

Butelka. Aromat intensywny, chmielowy. Mango, mandarynka. W smaku przejrzałe owoce, dominują mango, papaja. Goryczka średnia, w punkt. Wysycenie średnie. Pijalność ekstremalnie wysoka. Można to piwo pochłonąć w kilka sekund. Alkohol tak jakby go nie było. 

Ciężko po etykiecie zorientować się kiedy zabutelkowali piwo lub do kiedy jest data ważności. Nie mniej jednak jak na moje doświadczenie nie jest to piwo najświeższej jakości.
great hoppy and floral aromatics. crisp. clean. bitter character, but not overwhelming. enjoyable. slightly resinous finish.

(12oz bottle) AROMA: fresh hop nose, citrus peel, pine bark, herbaceous. APPEARANCE: medium amber, creamy white head, decent visible carbonation, just a little unclear. TASTE: grain, roasted malt, tobacco, soy sauce, tannin, grape seed/skin, some herb and coriander, solid hop finish. PALATE: medium body, crisp up front, a little frizz, slightly oily, moderately long dry finish. OVERALL: yummy beer. Lots of hoppiness without being only about the hops, drinkable, balanced.
Clear golden, very nice white head. Aroma: orange, pine, malt. Medium to light body, medium to heavy sweetness, medium bitterness. Hoppy flavour, nice balance. Nice short bitter finish.

Leje sie jasne delikatnie zamglone, piana bardzo wysoka biała i zbita. 
Zapach, jak na piwo pewnie nie najświeższe jest spoko ale nie urywa. Iglaki lekko przejrzałe owoce tropikalne i cytrusy, delikatny karmel. 
Smak bardzo fajnie wytrawny, na finiszu czuć lekko karmelową nutę ale przyjemną. Rześkie iglaste z bardzo przyjemną delikatnie zalegającą goryczką ale w przyjemny sposób, cytrusowa nuta też sie przewija przez język. 
Wysycenie średnie, goryczka idealna średnio/wysoka.

Pours a very slightly hazy light golden orange. Delicate resinous hop aromas with some herbal character. There is a mildly yeasty edge with damp Earth and bread. The palate is balanced and has a slightly bitter finish. Well balanced and well made. I compare this to an austere but pleasant Bordeaux. Nothing exciting in your face but solid and keeps you coming back. I expected a bit more but not disappointed.
The first IPA I feel in love with! Wish I had more options of Bells where I live.

Naranja ligeramente turbio con pequeña corona de espuma blanca y ligera retención en copa dejando un fino cerco; fruta tropical, hojas de pino, levadura, cítricos, flores y miel; en boca entrada media con amargor moderado, perfectamente equilibrado, notas cítricas, malta y florales, cuerpo y carbónico medios en una compleja y bien equilibrada cerveza, fácil de beber y con el alcohol bien integrado.

Aromat konkretny cytrusowo - tropikalny, z naciskiem na tropiki, do tego lekka karmelowa nuta - bardzo ładny, intensywny zapach. W wyglądzie barwa jasnego bursztynu, piana obfita, zdobiąca szkło. W smaku cytrusowe, wytrawne, goryczka średnia, niezalegająca. Ciało aksamitne, pijalność wysoka. Ułożone, bez wybijających się posmaków. Ogólnie ładnie pachnąca, solidna, bardzo pijalna ipa.
Bottle. Clear amber color with tiny white head. Aroma - Smooth, floral, fruity. Taste - Bitter, orange, malt, cream, pine, mango, grapefruit. Well balanced.

Golden, clear color with a spare white head. Nose is herbal hops and pine resin. Flavour is tons of resin, grass. Light body, lively carbonation level. Crisp finish. Not as good as expected. It would have probably tasted better if fresh.

The highlight of our homemade craft beer advent calendar. Cheers Pix! Pours hazy gold with a nice foamy cream head. Pleasant tropical aroma with grapefruit. The taste is nice and hoppy. slightly floral with grapefruit and peach with light spice and a good bitter finish. Really good, but I was hoping for a little more. This doesnt really compare with a nice fresh Kernel IPA, though it may be a question of freshness as this has done a good bit of travelling.

Bottle from Merci Market, 5th Avenue, NYC. Pours clear amber with a long lasting bubbly white head. Aroma has a good dose of hop, floral and tropical fruit notes. Moderate sweetness, well balanced with medium to heavy bitterness. Medium body, some stickiness to texture. Slightly above average carbonation. Finish is dry, and bitter. A good IPA.

Bottle
Aroma-grapefruit, lemon
Appearance-orange, hazy, frothy white head
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
Leicht trübes goldfarbenes Bier mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, fruchtig, Grapefruit, Orangenschalen, leicht harzig.

Can. Shaker. Orange, medium hazy with medium, off-white, frothy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is moderately to heavy malty (pale malts, but also some flat caramel character), moderately hoppy - mainly grape, orange and grapefruit grape, also slightly soapy and flowery. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately bitter, stable with long duration with some kick in the aftertaste. Medium body, oily texture. soft to average carbonation, finish is bitter, soapy and classical. Summary: IPA mainly based on grapes and oranges aroma with not really friendly malty character - slightly soapy. Beside this everything is on the right place - the bitterness, balance and timing. PODSUMOWANIE (Polish): IPA w głównej mierze bazująca na aromatach winogron, pomarańczy i grejfrutów, czyli reprezentująca trochę odmienny charakter w porównanie do tego co mamy do zaoferowanie na polskiej scenie kraftowej (głównie owoce tropikalne, aroamty kwiatowe). Na plus jest na pewno jej bardzo zbalansowany charakter z wyróżniającą się goryczką. Niestety aroamty winogorogonowo-pomarańczowe spowodowały, że nabrała trochę mdłego charakteru. Finalna ocena jest trochę subiektywna (czytaj. zaniżona), co do stylu na pewno koło 4.0, co do mojego personalnego odbioru to ocena jest taka jak widać.
Fat på Thunder Bay Grill Pewaukee. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Lätt fruktig doft. Ganska besk med viss fruktighet.

Very hoppy with lots of flavor, but not too bitter. Nice consistant feel with a medium lowish carbonation. This one is pretty cloudy too. Supposedly a must try, not a huuge fan, but its really solid. Sort of tastes like what u might call a standard IPA, like a baseline to judge all others in the style. Would buy again.
12 oz bottle pours a nice golden orange with a fluffy white head, pine and pineapple aroma, nice bright pine and citrus flavor.
Cloudy blond, full flavored ale, slight bitter finish. Interesting hop blend.
330 ml can at home. One of my favorite ipas, with grapefruit, orange, pomegranate and a fruity finish. Really enjoyable!

Puszka 0,33l. W aromacie wyczuwalne niestety ultenienie objawiające się miodem. Wyczuwalne owoce cytrusowe, zwłaszcza pomarańcza. W smaku żywiczne nuty, białe owoce i lekki karmel, a przy tym dosyć dobrze zbalansowane.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

12oz can in New York on 7-Nov-2016. Clear pale orange amber colour with a medium sized white head. Aroma off citrus, caramel malt, tropical fruits and spices. Medium body and carbonation. Flavour of grapefruit, malt, caramel and floral hops. Bittersweet fruity finish. A nice smooth and hoppy IPA.
Can.hazy golden orange body, white medium foam. Citric aroma with floral hints. Notes of caramel, grapefruit & mango.Overall an exceptional and recommended IPA.

Pours a golden-orange colour with a two fingers head, good retention, irregular lace. Fresh aroma of resine, pineapple, pine. Palate is rich and creamy. medium to full body and medium carbonation. Taste of pineapple, resine, oranges.

Clean light amber colour, small white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, malt, caramel, piny and spicy hops. Sweet lightly dry taste with bitter hoppy finish and aftertaste. Thin to medium body and good carbocation. Nice fruity IPA.
How: can Appearance: beautiful deep orange with a nice medium fluffy white head. Aroma: grapefruit, grass, lemon juice, caramel, pine, Palate: medium body, average carbonation.

Can. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange with a thick fluffy off white head. Aroma is of pine, orange, grapefruit, caramel, citrus. Taste is of grapefruit, resinous pine, citrus, biscuit, caramel. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle at home, thanks to whoever started that Most Rated Beers thread I realized my super market has more ticks for me. Fine amber orange pour. Nose is pine amd honey. Tastes of earth, honey, pine, grapefruit, some candy. Semi sweet and fairly bitter. If Id had earlier in rating career Id bet this was much higher.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dusty Earthy leather. Floral like a botanical garden. Honey flavours too. Flavours are much more intense than the aromas. Fine. Couldn't find the production date. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Aroma has a lot of citrus and some pine hops. Balanced with a nice malt profile.

Can. Pours clear golden. Citrus, orange, pine, caramel. Medium bodied. Well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I bought this beer in Madrid, Cervezorama. I drank it relax at the hotel, close to the airport. In my opinion, it is a really good ale or we could say IPA. The body is copper and troubled, thin and white foam, middle/high carbonation. The taste is well balanced, a really good mix between the malt, the hop and the sweetness, toffee, the taste is becoming always better after to drink a part of the bottle, grassy, a little soapy due to the hop, nice sensation in the mouth.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Hazy amber, creamy ivory head. Very rounded fruity and malty aroma. A bit perfumey, almost rose water or Turkish delight. Lightest piney notes. Taste: again, kinda Turkish delight kind of sweetness, no proper malts, grapefruit peel, crisp yet smooth zesty bitterness. Very nice, even if 4 months old.
Bottle to glass, dark straw color, average off white head with some lacing. Heavy floral citrus and average bread nose. Medium thin body and thin texture.Sweet bitter taste that lingered.

Dark orange colour, white head. Aroma of flowers, citrus, grapefruit. Taste is light bitter, slightly sweet. A bit flat on the flavours, I guess its an old bottle. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation. I expected a lot more.

Aroma floral y resinoso
Buen aspecto con carbónatacion correcta y espuma persistente
En boca balanceada fruta madura caramelo final seco y floral

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a can. Lots of head. Citrus, floral. Crisp. Tasty beer. Clear. Good carb

This is a great IPA, not overwhelming but strong enough to pack a punch fun beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, floral quite fruity, pine, lemon, summer field. Bitter flavour, hops, apricot, tropical fruits. Bitter finish, hops, floral hops, summer meadow. Nice!(from 35cL can @ my Cologne hideout)

Pours hazy golden to alightly amber with minimum, quickly diminishing off white top. Aroma is very full, yeast and full malty notes, some honey notes hidden in there as well. Very strong carbonation upfront, which quickly gives way to a slight bitter body, not to full, then a nice sweet taste evolving in to a bitter finish takes over. Nice!

Kicsi, nem túl tartós hab, borostyán szín, szűretlen. Enyhe, édeskés, gyümölcsös illat. Déligyümölcsös, fűszeres, enyhén gyantás ízvilág, hajszálnyi karamellel és gyantával, hosszú lecsengéssel. Testes, közepesen szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Nagyon finom, ízletes, jól kiegyensúlyozott, intenzív ízvilágú sör.
via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice cloudy blonde colour and lasting head. Not too carbonated. Massive floral aroma. Some fruit as well. Medium bitterness and light sweetness. Oily texture. Fresh and bitter aftertaste. This is my kind of beer.
Can. Hoppy. Aroma of citrus and pine with floral notes. Malty backbone. The flavours starts light sweet but finish with crisp bitterness. The body is medium and the texture is juicy. A nice one
0,33l bottle. Nose: some spicyness I cant really put a name on, hoppy resiny aromas. Taste: smooth, very balanced sweetness and pleasant floral hoppiness. Superbly balanced ipa and very refreshing!

12oz bottle. Hazy amber color with a fluffy white head. Hops and tangerine aroma. Bitter citrus resin up front with a nice malt/hop balance finish. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Little head with heavy lacing. Citrus piney aroma. Light caramel color. Heavily carbonated but sits nicely on the tongue. Smooth finish. Hoppy crisp taste. Very good IPA that can be found easily in Michigan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Well developed full beer with cunning tastes and quality. Flavor doesnt sit around in your mouth which is nice. I would get again

(backlog) Sampled bottled, near source tripping the UP 2013 and at resampled at Braukunst Live 2015, ta jfb. - Bref: near modernist focus and zeal at work here, squeezing all the hard-worn sprucey, pithy dank goodness out of Centennial hops into the essence of a quenching IPA, tonic like mountain rainwater. Nothing over the top or childishly in your face here - stern and silvery UP liquid at its finest. Hope to revisit fresh again.
Pours and amber body with a thin head. Faint hopp aroma. Refreshing hoppy taste with a nice and subtle bitterness. Very nice for an IPA.

I'm not an IPA drinker at all and I usually don't like the bitterness but this beer I absolutely love. The flavor and the head is phenomenal. I would definitely buy this beer again and this is in my top 10 of best beers I ever had in my life. I recommend this to everyone who wants to try an amazing good tasting beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark golden, almost copper color. Great nose, sticky hop flavor, good balance
Best aroma of citrus, resin and malt sweetness in background. Copper color with small head. Middle hops bitterness, citrus, a bit malty. Middle body with small carbonation.

Bottle. Pours is clear golden with thick white head. Aroma is heavy floral with touch of resin and spruce. Taste is moderate bitter, resiny mouthfeel. Medium body, nice creamy texture, soft carbonation, long, crispy bitter finish. Incredibly well ballanced.

Enjoyed this reputable IPA with a fine view and a cool summer breeze. From the bottle, poured a hazy yellow-orange color, seems to be exceptionally hazy for an IPA, with lots of lacing and foam, which thins to slight white head. Aroma is a delicious variety of malty grain and floral citrus hops, the sweet malt and juicy hops combine to form notes of sweet orange. Flavor is a full-bodied malty smoothness with a solid pacific resin and citrus hoppy bitterness, quite the sensory combination. Finishes with a warm caramel malty accented bitterness, definitely memorable if not quite as stellar as its high reviews suggest. Definitely delicious overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lots of points for balance, but (I cant believe I am saying this) nothing striking me as special here. The nose features juicy citrus hops, a touch of dankness and mild malts. Undertated though. The taste profile follows from the nose with mild fruity hops, classic soft malts, a smooth body and a nice dry finish.
A flawless, thoroughly balanced IPA with a unique flavour profile. Aromas of cherimoya and roses, taste of cherimoya, other tropical fruits and roses. Dry finish.

Can: Served in a shaker:
Creamy head. Cloudy yellow.
Aromas of creamy hop fruits, some floral tones, clear hop tones...
Taste more like a DIPA than an IPA.
Good bitter, some hop tones, herbal and floral, light dry, bit creamy...
Aftertaste is grassy, hoppy, bitter, dry...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Expected more but surely decent.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Pours a hazy yellow with minimal head. Smells of resin, pine, apricot and a biscuity malt. Taste is grapefruit, pine, biscuit, and caramel. Medium bodied, moderately carbonated, and a bitter finish. Very nice, well balanced, extremely drinkable.

Merci à Simon pour celle çi! Un nez qui se rapproche des IPAs anglaises. Mais, en portant un peu plus attention, on se rend compte que le côté fruité typiquement américain se pointe le nez. Le résultat est une IPA assez balancée. Peut-être un peu trop sucrée par contre (ici encore "à la mode" des IPA anglaises), mais toutefois fort goûteuse. La lourdeur de lalcool se fait légèrement sentir mais est au bout du compte bien contenue. Est-ce les houblons utilisés (on semble parler de Centennial dans les critiques précédantes) qui ne sont pas ma tasse de thé? Je ne saurais dire, mais il manque un petit quelque chose pour venir gagner mon coeur. Cest un peu trop lourd, trop sucré.

Bottle. Pale clear orange body, medium head. Citric/resiny aroma with floral hints. Smooth taste of citrus and piney Centennial hops. Good balance, very refreshing. I love IPAs that are made with Centennial hops and this ones a very good showcase of this hop.

On tap at tipsy barrel. Nice malt hop aroma. Cloudy orange gold with lacing tan head. Piney, citrus and floral hops dominate with a good sweet slightly toasted malt back. Spice notes. Full flavored with great balance. Outstanding.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: It has extremely beautiful white and creamy foam and aroma of pine needles and grapefruit. The taste has a little malt sweetness in the form of caramel and sweetness keeps reasonable before the hops sneak into the mouth and contributes with pine needles, grapefruit, mango and orange peel. The finish is dry and lasts long.
Bottle @ The Bishops Arms Marina, Helsingborg 20160815. Hoppy and fruity, sweet, grapefruits, pine needles, oranges, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Tuve suerte de conseguir una caja de seis cervezas (gracias a Kocima, tienda con gran variedad de cervezas en Oviedo) y solo puedo decir que es una de mis IPAs preferidas hasta ahora (y una de las más complejas). Color oro anaranjado, medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de más de un dedo de grosor. Carbonatación media tirando a alta (muy presente también en boca). El aroma es complejo: lúpulos, frutas, pino (y si se agita, más malteado). En boca es una maravilla, pues se nota la malta, lúpulos (solo Centennial), frutas (increíblemente refrescante) y tiene un final amargo (no el amargor habitual de una IPA) suave, placentero y con ligeras reminiscencias de algo alcohólico. A must have.

Burk från Mikkeller webshop. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, persika, mango, citrus, grapefrukt, gräs och blommor. Torr, lagom sötma, rund och krispig, fruktig och frisk, aningen trött humle men ölen är välbalanserad med en fin citrusskalsbeska som avslut. Gott!

Bottled 01/26/2016. Its cloudy orange with a medium big, lasting head. Aroma has a sweet side to it with notes of sponge cake, candied mango, cotton candy, lots of other fruits like passion fruit, pears, lots of pineapple, fresh and from a can. When shaken it develops more malty notes of cake, cake bottom plus some more spicy ginger and resin. Nice. Mouth feel is silky soft, medium thick with delicate carbonation. Good mouth feel for this style. Good balance with juicy malt start and long bitterness that evolves into stronger resin like type. I got also impression of warming alcohol in the end. Also a bit hot like candied ginger. Overall a good IPA.

Canned Dated was 6/29/16: The beer poured very clear but not crystal clear which is to be expected for a beer with as much kettle and dry hop as this beer has. Beautiful, creamy white head formed immediately and lasted. The color is straw to light copper. The aroma is more balanced than one would expect for an IPA hopped with Pacific NW Centennial. Aroma is more malty but the citrus of the Centennial does come through. The first taste is more to the malt bill but the Centennial shines on the back side. Bitterness is well balanced with the malt bill and lingers on the back and sides of the tongue. If their house yeast is the yeast its purported to be, they do a great job with it. The beer is much fruitier than other IPAs and is more malty sweet than most but it fits in well with the mid-west style IPA. This is a great beer that I could drink WAY too many off!

Bottle 0,33l from Stella Beer beer shop in Medulin, Cro. Dark golden hazy, average head. Smell of overripe fruits with a hint of herbs. Medium body and carbonation. Taste of sweet fruits, has some bitterness, citrus peal, wormwood. Long finish. This bottle isnt very fresh, I think.

Hazy golden color, average sized white head that left lots of lacing. Aroma of malt, peach, tangerine, persimmon. Taste of malt, peach, tangerine, tropical fruits. Clearly not the freshest bottle but still better than most IPAs I had recently. I simply must try this fresh.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thick fluffy off white head. The aroma is very floral and grapefruit. The aroma is just amazing. The flavor is once again full of grapefruit and some breadiness. There is a little bit of pine as well. There is some hop kick but rather mild. One of the best ipas I have ever had.
Bottle.Bronze with a small head. Hoppy with floral flavours in background. Slightly bitter finish. An all round decent beer.

Bottle at Põrgu in Tallinn. Bottled March 2016. Pours hazy darkish amber with modest off-white head. Excellent malty caramelly sweet aroma with strong ripe fruitiness. Peach. Grapefruit. Pine. Almost a minty freshness. Tastes fruity bittersweet with an almost aggressive bitter kick yet overall its well balanced by the malts. Citric and resiny. Grassy even. Carbonation somewhat prickly, body medium, oily slick resiny palate. Really nice.
Can. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. creamy palate.
Can. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, malt and has a nice fruity finish.

A little of both piney and floral hops in the nose with some fruit notes and mild malt. Cloudy dark golden, almost orange with quick white foam. Medium body and light fizz. The resiny hops dominate, but the citrus and malt provide good supporting notes. Slightly dry finish. A favorite IPA.

Bottle.

A- Subtle orange, subtle pine.

A- Amber orange color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Mild sweetness, tangerine, subtle bitterness, slightly malty.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Wow this is tasty, especially considering Im not much of an IPA guy. This is definitely a beer to introduce someone to the IPA family. Not too bitter, not too malty, just a nice balance with a touch of citrus sweetness. Very easy to drink.

Bit hazy golden, white frothy head, ok lacing. Ok looks. Sweet and quite malty, dark bread, toasted notes, bit caramel, citric hops and pine, bit nutty. Smooth and round, sweet and roasted slightly, medium body, long bitter finish dries some to wood and grapefruit and pine. Some bit harsh notes disturbing bit. Ok, tasty but some off-notes.
One of my favorites. Charachters of both an Ale and IPA. Powerful flavor but not overwhelming. First experience was out of a mini keg on my birthday camping so very positive memories!

Cloudy orange golden color with a fine white head. Nice lacing. Looks great. Nice intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and a soft carbonation. Semi dry and a nice fresh bitterness. Moderate sweet. Citric, pine, grapefruit hoppy and mellow fruity flavor. Solid stuff.[Bottle at Pudel in Talllinn, Estonia]
a fantastic, hoppy IPA; light amber color; great citrusy hop aroma; really great citrusy hop flavor with light pine and tropical fruit notes on a medium bodied bready malt base

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 Bottle shared. Clear golden with of white head. A bit strange on the nose with old mango and some dusty malts. Passion fruit, quite some caramel, mango, orange, ash, soft wood, light flowery. Medium sweet and almost medium bitter. Medium bodied. Past its prime maybe.  Tap. Bit fresher and fruitier, quite light bitterness here. Nice.
0,33 bottle from a sixpack i bought at walmart, michigan someplace. - Aroma has grapefruit, mango and watermelom. Slight grainy sweet flavor with some caramel and winegums. Very balanced.

Pours a hazy orange color. About two fingers eggshell colored rocky pillowy head. Excellent retention, excellent lacing.Aroma is wet cardboard, tangerine and maybe also orange zest. Theres good piney hops in there.Taste is clean. Very smooth to start, then comes bitter. Its bready, and also sweet. Its resiny and citrusy. Malty and sweet.Mouthfeel is medium full. Its dry. Its smooth and somewhat creamy. Well balanced all around.Overall, its great. I would recommend this, and I would certainly buy this again. Not much to say about it. If you see it buy it!
Pours golden with a citrus/orange aroma, tastes of very mild pine and coriander and sweet citrus. Very smooth with evident carbonation.

Bottle pour from Craft Beer Cellar, Clayton. Appearance is hazy dark yellow/light brown, with 1/2 finger-width white head with poor retention, trace lacing. Aroma is floral, tropical fruit, citrus over malt base. Taste is as aroma with a bit more citrus and fruit than aroma. Palate is medium bodied with creamy, foamy texture, average carbonation with balanced sweet floral hoppy/malt. Overall, a solid beer all around with nice flavors to be sure, but not earth shattering.

On tap at local bar. Cant believe it took me so long to give it a rating since I drink this all the time. Smells semi-sweet with strong floral note and a hint of citrus. Deep gold in color with a thin white head. Mild to strong hop bitterness, mostly floral in flavor but not over powering. Full bodied and a nice long finish. Always amazed at how good, refreshing and well balanced this is.

Aroma: Medium citrus, oranges, , Medium-light malt, bread crusts.
Appearance: Clear, amber, body. Medium, tan head. Fine bubbles, good retention, lacing. 
Flavour: Medium-high bitterness, Medium-high hops, citrus, grapefruit, pith. Medium malt. Dry finish with lingering bitterness, grapefruit, 
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium, smooth, carbonation. Light warming.
Overall: Hop forward, bitter. Malt provides a good backbone.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Esme!
21A. American IPA

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Lata, Regalo de amigo. 12/07/16 
Color amarillo aromas y sabores frutales final seco.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - pkgd 03/01/16, at Pudel, 20160710) The beer poured amber and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass, pine, toffee and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, fruitiness, grass, caramel, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet, hoppy and bitter. Despite the quite strong sweetness I liked this one.

On tap at Mugs Alehouse, Brooklyn on 8th July 2016. Amber with decaying off-white foam and initial lacing. Zesty hoppiness and peel in aroma. Bitter orange peel, and grapefruit citrus in-mouth. A tangy citric finish. Zingy mouthfeel and a fair amount of body.

OK, I generally do not like IPAs and wouldnt have purchased if I had read the label more thoroughly. In this case, I may have found the best IPA for me yet. Doesnt have the overly hoppy aftertaste of many IPAs and a really decent taste. I will try it again another day but I think the one is a keeper (That is nod towards the label).
Canned. Hazy golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, hops, fruit, grapefruit, pine and bitterness.

12oz bottle - Pours orange with thick white head. Good smelling brew, aroma of grapefruit and flowers. Big bitter sip... citrus, and hint of roasted malt, but over-powered by the hops. Im fine with this brew. Its good; decent... but clearly overrated and now forever apart of folklore.

355ml bottle. Semi-hazy golden with quickly fading two finger white head. Aroma is heavy grapefruit, citrus and caramel. Taste is the same with pronnounced grapefruit bitterness, fruitier citrus and sweet malty caramel in the background. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and lasting bitter aftertaste with warming alcohol.

Can. Aroma of grass, pine, over mango, grapefruit, passion fruit on the tongue. Well carbonated, but not fizzy or lively, rather smooth. Thick and full, yet not overpowered. Very good balance despite all the intensity. Clearly a good brew.
Bärnstensfärgad klar med vit skum. Doftar och smakar massor med tropisk frukt. Annanas och grapefrukt. Lagom beska och lättdrucken
Excellent. Really my kind of IPA. Plenty of piney hop but balanced with a real sweet malt. Not quite as good as the about IPA but I did just drink a 4 pack so I definitely like it.
Sample from bottle at Hy-Vee grocery store. Poured hazy golden, off white head. Aroma was pine, citrus. Taste was mild bitter.
Deep yellow and slightly orange color with nice white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Taste is light fruity and hoppy. Nice balanced IPA, very good to drink!
Pours hazy orange-amber, with little head. Smell is fresh hopiness, some overripe fruitiness underneath. Taste is bitter hops up front, smooths out some after. Thin body, but it fits here. Not bad.

Hazy peachy body, small white head. Aroma of peach, fruit and little bit of booze. Medium to heavy bitter with a little bit of sweetness. Dead hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. //bottle at Craft Room

355ml can served in a pint glass.
A: Pours a slightly cloudy orange color forming a medium creamy soapy white head with good retention and lots of lingering soapy lacings left in the glass. 
S: Nose is incredible. Very flowery, fruity and malty. Strong notes of caramel malts, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, resin, pine and hop flowers. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront taste that becomes quickly oily, lingering and bitter. Strong notes of caramel malts, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, resin and pine. Strong and very persistent bitter finish. 
M: Medium body. Average carbonation. Tangerine and resin in the aftertaste. Persistent bitterness. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Perfect IPA.

Lata 33 cl tomada en el momento en el Lupulo 10..06..2016. Lote 15455PKGD hasta 29..12..2016 Color ámbar tostado turbio con espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores frescos algo secos y tonos afrutados con toques herbaceos. Bastante buena. Cuerpo medio algo pastoso.

500ml can @El Lúpulo Feroz Oviedo. 06-06-2016.
In short: nice American IPA.
Pours hazy golen with nice white head. Moderate head retention, poor lacing. Pine, resins, fruity nose. Medium body, averge to high carbonation,crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, pine, earthy, dry aftertaste. Good.

Pours a deep yellow, slightly orange color with a good head. Earthy, piney aroma. Has a strong citrusy hop bite with a good malt backbone. Mouthfeel is a little oily, which coats the tongue with a lingering bitterness. A classic IPA and a good standby, but not completely worth the price and hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Four pack of tallboy cans from Gomers in KCMO. Pours out a murky light golden amber. Frothy off white head. Floral-musty aromas. Flavor is light and smooth with layers of grapefruit, pine and floral notes. Some spice. Long bitter finish. Very good, but not stellar IMO.

Pint can via Beer Gonzo. It pours a mostly clean orange color with a medium white head. Aroma is tangy and sweet fruity, with notes of apricots and tangerine, light grass and lemon leaves. Taste is also lightly sweet fruity and medium crispy, tangy with notes of orange peel, grass, pine cones and apricots. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tasty and drinks smoothly

Big thanks to Richthevillan for the big want, cheers Rich. Slightly hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma is tropical fruit and slightly dusty hops. Taste is lightly stewed fruit, fruit salad, citrus and some grapefruit. Very nice taste, aroma is little muted though. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: US pint can, a bit past its prime, probably. Cotteridge, Brum. Hazy, dark gold. Bubbly, thick, glossy topped, lasting, just off white head. Nose has fusty orange. Orange rind. Some pine needle. Chewy malts. Some leafy, oily herb. Taste is light, citrusy bitter. Some piny sweetness. Lovely mouthfeel. Smooth, and drinks way under the ABV. Bitterness rises and lingers, getting juicy and resinous. Didnt expect too much from this, given its 12 week age, but it was very tasty and drinkable. Need to get a fresh one...
Hazy blond colour. Aroma has light sweet fruits. Very smooth and close texture. Fruity hop and caramel malts.

0.355l bottle. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Aroma of biscuit, grapefruit, honey, grassy hops and pine. Taste of bread, honey, grapefruit, lemon zest, pine and hop resin. The finish is very bitter. Very nice.

1 pint can @ home. Aroma of fresh citrus, lime/lemon grass and floral hops. Clear amber with white head, mostly lasting. Taste is moderate bitter and light+ sweet. Medium+ body, oily feel, bitter floral finish.

03/01/2016 

Aroma floral. Appearance clear, copper, frothy. Taste is light sweetness, very bitter. Palate medium body, average carbonation, long finish, with bitterness and medium dryness. Ipa with out faults, non fruity.

One of my favorites, though one does have to watch the bottle date -- since this beer is distributed widely, it tends to sit on shelves and one can easily pick up a bottle thats over 2 years old if you arent watching. Ive also noticed a lot of variation between batches -- one month, a fresh bottle will taste very fruity, the next, more bitter. Consistency aside, this is a reliably enjoyable beer. Fruity, grassy nose, bitters and fruity finish. Sometimes leaves an aftertaste that reminds me of Fruity Loops cereal, lovely!

30.05.2016, 12 oz can @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is strange fruity, old lawn, rotten leafs, minerals, hay, hops, old moss, bloodlike minerals, very overripe fruits, bark, pine needles, light malts, tiny hints of sulfur. Taste is slightly dry grassy, weeds, leafs, lawn, hops, moss, minerals, light malts, bark, flowers, pine needles, paper. Medium bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 On tap in the Ginger Man NYC. Amber colour, clear, thin foam. Id say a classic style of IPA, some malt sweetness and lots of citrus pint bitterness. I had this along with several other IPAs that week in the US and have to say it didnt stand out other than being a well made version of the style.

From a bottle in Chicago with Gurney and Joel making me basically neck it. Creamy up front, very long bitter pine/grapefruit finish. Not ideal tasting conditions but good beer.
Not at all what I expected...I dont taste the citrus everybody else tastes. Nice smooth bre.
on tap lieve ambrato discreta nota agrumata abbastanza resinisa buona beva discreta secchezza buna intensota piena
0,33l bottle at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Pours copper colour with a small head. Piny, caramelly and fruity aroma. Medium bitterness and body. Well balanced IPA.

Pours amber with small head. Aroma is light, some fruits, oily notes, roses, sweet flowers. Taste is light, some pine, citrus, fruits, hops, grapefruit. ABV well hidden. Quite light and therefore little bit disappointing, nothing special to me. PKGD 03/01/2016.

Can from Mikkeller & Friends bottle shop, Copenhagen. Really looking forward to this legendary IPA, which hasnt been available in Norway yet. However, my previous experiences with American IPAs imported to Europe has been less than impressive, probably due to transportation and storage issues. So this is exciting. :-) Pours a hazy deep orange body with a medium off-white head. Nose is pine, herbs, blood oranges, citrus zest, rose water and hints of bready malts, grapefruit and light syrup. Taste is pine, citrus peel, grapefruit, herbs and hints of caramel, floral notes and resin. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. My verdict: lovely aroma, but the taste, however balanced, is not as amazing as Id hoped for. Still, a super-solid and well brewed classic-tasting American IPA.

Can. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is grapefruit, piney, mango and toasted malts. Taste is quite grapefruity and more mango, quite piney, and a nice residual sweetness. Bitter finish with a toasty malt body. An extremely well-balanced IPA. Medium to high carbonation. Good!
Delicious IPA. Really well balanced, incredibly drinkable. Perfect restraint in the bitterness... no hop bomb here, just a really good beer.

Bottle. Pale amber colour. Orange, pineapple, tangerines, lemon, hints of berries in the aroma. Refreshing and juicy. Oranges and tangerines all the way in the taste. Hints of other fruits. Bitterness in the end. Nice, silky palate. Juicy, rather light bodied, medium carbonated, really drinkable beer.

Can courtesy of Mr. Orla. Hazy ornage with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 240516

Grapefruit, caramel, citric, pineapple, ABV well integrated.
Slightly hazy amber colour, medium off-white head, lacing.
Big resinous bite, mid-sweet, lots of grapefruit and light pineapple in the taste.
Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Longed to try this for years.

Caramel orange clear color with foam ring. Very fresh grassy and forestry nose. Creamy smooth mouth feeling and nice balanced hoppy bitterness. No tartness and a smooth silky finish and light bitter aftertaste.

Bells Two Hearted Ale has a thin-to-medium white head, a somewhat hazy, bubbly, orange-gold appearance, with some stringy lacing left behind. The aroma is of apricot-like hop oils and sweet, white bread. Taste is of those elements, with pronounced, but in now way harsh, bitterness. Mouthfeel is high medium, and Bells Two Hearted Ale finishes dry and highly drinkable. RJT

Bottle @ Gambrinus, Tartu. Pours golden/orange with small white head, doesnt stay. Aroma: citrus, grass, weak pine and resin, caramel, tropical fruits, actually theres a freshly catched and cut fish(like in a bottle), Taste: medium bitter with some sweetness, hay, mango, trpical fruits, grass, weak resin. Easy to drink. Well balanced, maybe too well. Medium body. Smooth bitter finish.Just a good IPA.

35,5cl bottle at Pudel, Tallinn. Pours almost completely clear amber with a small, off-white head. First impression is that its incredibly balanced and fairly smooth. Solid hoppy aroma with fruity and floral notes, light citrus, pale malt and hints of caramel. Medium to moderate sweet with complex and balanced hoppy flavours and a fine bitterness. Tasty, smooth and dangerously drinkable.
Pours hazy light golfen with a white head. Aroma; Malt, pine, citrus, resin, pineapple, bread and orange. Taste, Pineapple, citrus, pine, caramel, bread and grainy malt. Well balanced.
A: Golden coloured with a huge white head. N: Citrus, honeydew, floral T: Pine, forest, papaya notes O: Nice forest flavours! Quite easy drinking.
Has a nice refreshing very well balanced taste with lots of hops together with sweet malts and fruity characters.

50cl can: Hazy orange-golden color. Classic Centennial hop aroma wafting from the glass right away - fruity, sweet sticky tropical pineapple, raspberry, orange and cannabis. This is not a light session IPA, which is clear from the first sip. A sturdy biscuit-caramel malt complexity adds a light sweetness to the dense and abundant resinous hops. Outstanding and well-rounded.

Clear, golden-amber colored, medium frothy off white head, good lasting. Aroma is of malt, caramel, strong tropical fruits, some orange hard candy, pine. Taste is medium+ sweet malt and caramel, some orange candy, tropical fruit and pine hops, medium+ aroma, some grapefruit, moderate bitterness, dry finish, decent lasting aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft+ carbonation, resiny. Quite good but the Atlantic voyage did its part...
(bottle, Vrutak, Zagreb)

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with medium off-white head. Aroma is piney, resiny, citrusy and tropical, with a good malty/bready backbone. Taste follows the aroma, hoppy, citrusy, bready, piney and floral, with a nice bitterness on the aftertaste. Very balanced.

Bottle as an extra in a trade. I cant find any real flaw with this beer -- its clean, hoppy, refreshing, and well-made -- but it also doesnt really stand out in any way from other IPAs on the market. Nothing at all the matter with it, but something like it is probably available in half the bars in America these days.
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is hoppy, pine. Some malt balance. Taste is nicely balanced. Hoppy, with malt slightly roasted.

Can. Light hazy golden with a large off white head with good lace and regeneration. Hoppy nose with citrus, light cheese and onion. Flavour is hop forward: Citrus, flowers, almost soap/perfume, light onion, hay, bread. Meidum body, fine carbonation, mild sweet with pleasant bitterness. Long hoppy and dry finish. Not bad, fair price too.

Tijdens IPA/Sour proeverij in de Vinotake, blik uitgeschonken in een Struise BD proefglas. Goudoranje licht troebel bier met een medium lichtbeige schuimkraag. Geurige en fruitige IPA, met aromas van sinaasappel, grapefruit, ananas, pijnboom, dennennaalden en kruidige groene hoptoetsen. Het smaakpallet is zeer goed gebalanceerd tussen hopbitter en zoetige karamelmout, met fruitige tonen van sinaasappelschil, limoen, grapefruit en groene kruidige tonen van dennenhars en naaldhout. Klassieke IPA, met een medium carbonatie en een bittere droge finish. Een uitstekend bier in de stijl, zeker voor herhaling vatbaar. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Deep golden clear. Citrussy pine, green foresty nose, caramels malty. Med bodied, well bittered. Malty caramels, slight huskyness (as warm..). Clean nice bitter ipa.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Can @hotel room, Copenhagen, post CBC. 
Pours golden color with a thick white head. 
Pine, resin, tropical fruits I aroma. Nice malty backbone. Some balancing sweetness, floral notes, hops, pine. 
Pleasant beer.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear amber beer with a small white head. Floral aroma of hops, citrics and a hint of mint. Taste is bitter with some carbonation and astringency. Medium bodied, dry and with a strong hoppy finish. Very nice character with citrics like grapefruit.

Bottle, 355ml. Clearish golden with a creamy head with nice lacing. Aromas of floral hops, tangerine, caramel, resin. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet with heavy bitterness. Highly astringent. Intense and complex fruity and hoppy flavors into a bitter hoppy finish. Excellent.

330 ml bottle, bottled 03/01/16, from Saveur Bière. Thanks to Werckmeister!
Amber, moderate hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of grapefruit juice, citrus, orange, pine, passion fruit, pineapple, flowers, caramel, biscuit.
Tastes follows this, also quite juicy, with enough bitterness and malt body.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bitter, medium dry, fruity, citric, zesty, floral, piney, with some biscuit.

Tasty. Quaffable and greatly balanced between juicy fruits, bitterness, dryness and a smooth malt body. Not the most extraordinary IPA, but just how I like this style, while not among my favourite examples.

Can from Cotteridge Wines; clear amber pour with a big frothy off white head, aroma has pine and tangerine, taste has tangerine, resinous pine, bitter grapefruit, some mellow well balanced sweet malts, light carbonation.

355 ml. can @ Gollem. Lightly hazy orange with a creamy off-white head. Nose is classical, well-balanced DIPA, orange peel, pine resin, touch less fruity, touch more on the bitter edge, faint herbal but very restrained, balanced & enjoyable, low caramel. Taste is balanced mellow pine, caramel malts, orange peel, balanced, mellow easy, low fruity but in a good way, nothing overly aggressive, great balanced, low herbal touch in finish, finish carries low increase in bitterness; very easy to drink & massively enjoyable. This is a current & future classic, great balance, super easy to drink, very welcoming & it comes in a can. Great exercise in drinkability & balance in my opinion, just very pleasing. At good price & availability I would make this a staple despite not being the biggest DIPA fan (I like but just not a massively as every other beer geek).

Hazy golden orange color. Aroma is dominated by pine, orange, grapefruit with some grassy/herbal notes. Taste follows through. Exceptional mouthfeel; manages to be clean and refreshing in the finish, despite strong flavors. Great American IPA, on the piney and dank (rather than tropical) side. Its a treat to drink.

can from online web order, poured a deep golden colour with a creamy white head. nose is quite malt forward, citrus, tropical fruits, caramel sweet malts, taste is quite sweet, tropical fruits, citrus, malt forward, crisp. bit overrated

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 From Labirratorium. In Teku glass. Watching Cosmopolis. Specially refreshing. Great balance between bitterness and a pleasant fruityness, and very smooth. Only downside is that its great flavor is not long lasting
bottle 4/19/16. Hazy gold pour. Aroma grassy citrus. Tastes bitter, herbs floral. clean. But not exceptional at all. Why is this so well rated?!

Burk från Mikkeller webshop. Drygt två år gammal och kanske lite trött humle. Men kvaliteten lyser ändå igenom. Mycket fin ganska komplex doft som är blommig, gräsig och fruktig. Snyggt välbalanserad smak, blommig, gräsigt och lite citrusfruktigt. Ganska torr och krispig men samtidigt mjuk och rund, maltkropp imponerar. Riktigt bra närmast arketypisk östkust-IPA

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA. APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa turbia y moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco de buena retención, copiosa, de burbujas compactas y abiertas.

AROMA: muy frutal, lúpulos americanos de carácter frutal es lo que predomina, notas a frutos tropicales, mango, duraznos, piña, el dulzor de las maltas se alcanza a percibir.

SABOR: de entrada un amargor medio seguido de notas herbales y resinosas de los lúpulos, algunas notas ligeramente cítricas y dulzor de maltas que no es empalagoso y que se complementa bien; en el retrogusto queda un amargor de intensidad media, el cual es seco.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio con sensación oleosa, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: Excelente cerveza de acuerdo al estilo.

A hazy golden orange color with a nice white head. Aroma is full of citrus and tropical fruit. The malt brings some of the sweetness of the hops out. Bitterness is average but well balanced. Great beer. Medium body. Great mouthfeel

Pours clear amber with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of peach, gooseberry, citrus, grass, pine, resin. Taste is a good balance between fruitiness, floral notes and malty sweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours hazy golden orange with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, tropical fruits, tangerine, citrus fruits, hops, caramel sweetness, grapefruit, pine needles, Smooth mouthfeel. Medium body. Bitter hoppy finish.

Appearance: clear pale amber, one finger of rocky off-white head diminishing rapidly to a thin skim, patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: pine resin, pithy grapefruit, pale malt, light floral/herbal. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderately strong bitter. (8/10) Medium-full body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter and slightly sticky finish. (4/5)

My initial reaction was one of slight disappointment - I mean, come on, this beer is fairly legendary! Perhaps not to the extent of, say, Heady Topper, or Pliny, but its up there. When I uncapped it, though, the initial aroma was not as penetrating as I was expecting or hoping for. However, once I started drinking it, the flavours started to build and assert themselves. Not as citrusy as a lot of current A/IPAs, the resiny pine really dominates this. Finishes strong, with just enough malt sweetness to balance the moderately high bitterness. (And, to be fair, at three months old its entirely possible that the aromas have faded significantly. Might have to try it again if I can find a newer one.) (15/20)

Would like to taste Imperial version of this. Very nice, solid, balanced, but kinda lacks some hit. Decent maltiness, nice hop cocktail with grapefruit and orange prevail, some herbal aspect. Light sweetness with moderate bitterness.
Very solid and enjoyable

July 26, 2015. Bottle at Rattle N hum, bottled June 5. 
Cloudy golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma is sweet malty and fruity with toffee, resin, peach, oranges, some spicy floral notes. Taste is medium sweet, biscuity, resinous, some candied peaches, pine and grass medium bitterness. Finish is slight dry piney bitter with some malty sweetness in the back. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

More malt forward than I expected. Strong chewy toffee, with the fruit providing balance rather than bursting in at the outset. Light copper, with a big white head and lacing. Big body, neither oily nor creamy. When the hops come through they provide grapefruit, mango, resin and herbs. Tastes really good - aroma doesnt stand out quite so much.

Stor vit krona, Ljus bärnsten, små bubblor, kådig frisk humledoft, balanserad fantastisk smak av kåda, karamell, tallbar massa frisk humle & fin beska, en riktig törstsläckare 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fantastic aroma of oranges, citrus, grass and grape fruit. Pours golden with a tall solid head. Taste of blood orange and grape fruit. Feels quite thin and lively. Quite short. Lovely beer.

Can canned 22. 02. 2016. Orange amber body with nice light tan head. Aroma is floral with herbs, citrus and some resin. Taste is also very herbal with some subtle malts in the background. Aftertaste is nice bitter. Very nice one.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Very nice IPA, normally not a big fan of IPA, but this beer changed my mind. Where have you been all my Life?

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur orangée, légère mousse. Nez fort houblonné sapin, fruits exotiques confits, caramel blond. Gout fruité, houblonné floral, herbes sèches, résine, amertume amande, caramel blond, longue amertume en fin de bouche. Très bonne ipa mais un peu surcotée....

Can 50cl, a copper amber beer with good head and nice lace work. Nose is very intense on blond caramel, hop resin, fresh exotic fruits. Aroma is on resin, vanilla, blond caramel, coconut oily, quite round, touch of quince, apples, quite rich body, good complexity,
Pours a nice deep amber color. Aromas of hops/hops/citrus. Strong hop flavors with malts and a dry finish.
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 This IPA is hands down one of the tops that I have ever drank in my life. There is nothing bad about this beer.

16 fl oz can from Beer Gonzo. Pours an orange-gold amber colour with a creamy foam head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango, citrusy, hop resins. Taste is malt caramel balanced with juicy fruits, floral citrus, grapefruit, resiny, pine and spicy hop bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, lingering dry tangy bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Pint can from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Strong citrus, pine, lemon, grapefruit aroma. Taste is leaning towards the herbal side, nice tropical
Background, caramel malt with a decent bitter finish, but not too bitter. Can understand the hype completely.

1 pint can at home in Richmond, as Bells Two Hearted Ale, 7%, under 3 months since canning. Dark brick orange, translucent, lightly sparkling, huge dense foamy cream head leaves very uniform lacing. Aroma is fresh and fruity - some pineapple and tangerine. Body is a little frothy and fizzy. Taste is toffee-sweet, strong piney hops, resin, candyfloss, grassy finish with a touch of spice, mint and booze. A real pine bomb. Good.
Aroma: fruity and hoppy; Appearance: amber with fluffy white head that lingers; Taste: fruity - but was influenced by lemon problem at Flying Saucer; Overall: need to re-rate.
