Pours golden with a medium off-white head. Aroma of pine, citrus & malt. Tastes of citrus, pine, resin, fruits, sweet & malt. Medium body. Good carbonation. Nice balance.

pours a very light orange with a two inch white head with moderate lacing around the my tulip glass. Aroma is floral with hints of tangerines. Flavor is well balanced. medium body. heavy carbonation. creamy mouthfeel and a dry bitter flnish that is outstanding. As it warms, the sweetness of the malt definitly come out and it definitly loses a tad of the bitterness. One of the best IPAs you will find.
Excellent IPA! Light straw color, citrusy hop aroma. Full hop taste that finishes with a slight bitter finish that doesnt linger. Moderate carbonation on tap.

This is my favorite ipa. My first experience was in Ashville Tennessee then when I got home I found a couple of different bars in my area looking for a good ipa now I have 3 places that have it on tap. This ipa has a great flavor and aroma I enjoy drinking this nice and slow to get the full experience.
toast, roasty, herbs, orange, medium bitterness, light body, bitter, A great IPA to try if you havent

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 4 oz pour from draft into sniffer at 48 degrees. Great nose. Strong citrus. Taste is awesome too. Very drinkable. A few layers from start to finish. A few different citrus notes in there.

355ml bottle from Whole Foods - Tribeca, New York. PKGD 03/29/15. Thanks Jesse!


Hazy orange colour with a white smooth head. Floral, fresh, pure, good bitterness. Not too overloaded, very easy going, could be my "daybeer".

1 Pint can, canned 04-13-15. Thanks to Enuratique. Pours cloudy golden with a frothy 1 finger white head. Aroma is citrus, pine and floral. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, creamy texture, fizzy carbonation. Finish is bitterness and light, smooth and easy to drink.

Hazy orange amber with a one finger white head that hangs around and leaves lots of lace. Nose is mostly citrus with orange, grapefruit and lemon and some honey and toffee as well as some floral undertones. Light sweet caramel and fruit supports a medium citrus bitterness that is evident throughout. . Medium silky mouth with slightly soft carbonation and a long dry finish. Excellent balance.

Translucent copper orange with a quickly dissipating white head. Wonderfully pungent aroma containing notes of malt, caramel, citrus, hops, flora, and tropical fruit. Mid bodied, smooth, and silky. Fantastic malt/caramel backbone supplemented with mildly tart citrus, spruce, mango, and a pleasantly hoppy/bitter finish.

Bottle to pilsner glass. Appearance: golden color, medium white head. Aroma: pine, hops, slight apple or pear and peach.  Taste: pine, ash, sweet lime, Feel: less bubbly than sculpin which I just had before this. Very Nice ipa.

Pours a cloudy gold colour with a small frothy white head. Aroma is fresh, floral and fruity: peach, mango, apricot, grapefruit, toffee. Taste is dough, caramel, citrus, bubblegum with subtle bitterness. Medium body, dry, crisp and clean.
Nice hoppy taste with caramel malty base. Soft orange appearance. Fruity aroma. Overall an enjoyable ale.

On tap at RFD (Washington, DC). Hazy amber body with a thin white creamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with mango, orange, and herbal hints. Its sharp hoppy taste carries woody, citrusy, and herbal notes. Ends with a long bitter finish. Very good!
From a can , brought back from a trip to US, very well balanced ipa, not the hoppiest on aroma , or flavour, with a strong malt influence, but very tasty.

Golden color brew poured into an ipa glass and an off white head pillowed up and then retreated to a lasting film across the top. Lacing was steady and constant all the way to the end. Aroma of hops, pine, and a beautiful floral citrus. Taste is simple with a mix of citrus, strong pine, and hop bitterness. Easy drinking and nice bite on the palate. Bells has concocted a real nice IPA here, well done!

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 From the bottle the aroma is citrus hops and a little bit of orange peel, the color is orange and cloudy but a bright orange with a off-white head that stays on top of the beer and is very finely bubbled, the taste is citrus happy aroma stand the taste communicate very well does it taste a little bit of sweetness on the finish is better with lingering sweetness.  I love the balance of the hops and sugars, it makes this beer a very balanced ale.

Appearance was hazy orangish gold with creamy diminishing white 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are orange wedges, lemon, grapefruit, orange marmalade with hints of pale, crystal sweetness, no alcohol. Taste are orange, lemon, grapefruit blast upfront that gives way to honey sweetness midway. Then a slightly woody piney tangy finish. Palate was soft smooth CO2 with medium body, then a lasting balanced fruity finish. Overall a stellar IPA, not overly bitter with just enough flavor hops to keep you coming back for more.

Draught at yard house. Hazy copper, big frothy cap. Aroma of biscuit, citrus, caramel. And a pre-sucked lollipop. You know, when you get near a kid that has just gone to town on a lollipop, and the faint smell of the candy as they speak? That. The taste is, you guessed it, sweet. But as sweet this is, there's still a chunky bitterness that is divine. The mouthfeel is creamy and sticky, and a late coming long dry finish.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 Very good aroma upon pour. A really good beer with great balance of taste and aroma
Pours clear amber with medium head. Nice hop flavor with fruity undertones. Overall good IPA.
Clear orange with thick white head. Piney and grapefruit aroma. Nice grapefruit flavor. Dry hop bitterness. Light body.
Hazy orange pour. Citrus aroma. Crisp taste, good mouthfeel. Enjoyable beer and drinkable.

Bottle to pint glass
Spruce, grapefruit, orange, and molasses. 
Light amber with a very creamy off white head. Taste is strong orange, grapefruit, a little biscuit, and malts.
clear amber color with a thin off-white head that leaves some lacing. grapefruit and pineapple aroma. Flavor is grapefruit hops up front with a lingering sweet caramel malt finish.

Great IPA. Awesome taste one of the Best IPA's try it you will like it.... 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma of tropical fruits. The taste is lighter tropical fruits. Good bitterness that fills the mouth for a long while. Not overly hopped but good nonetheless. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle to glass. Score is low because IPAs are not my thing. This is a good one though. Nice citrus floral aroma. Citrus flavor. Some sweet malt. Bitterness at theend. Not overwhelming bitterness. One of the better IPAs that Ive had.
Medium golden in color with a nice white foam. Big citrus nose is very pleasant. Caramel body supports the hop bitterness nicely. Great flavor and a lingering sweet finish. Very nice.

Poured from a 12 bottle, a very nice cloudy reddish-orange color, nice lasting white head. Very citrusy aroma with the pine and floral notes. An excellent IPA, IMHO, just enough hop flavor, very drinkable.

I have seen this for quite awhile but was reluctant to try it. Thanks Jerry!

Bottle pour into Goblet. Head is not Aroma is deliciously hoppy and citrusy. Color is a light cloudy amber. Taste is lightly sweet and medium bitter. Carbonation is not visible but the feel of it on the tongue is slick and lively. The long finish doesnt really turn, it just carries through clean true to the taste until finally after a few minutes youre left with slight bitters.

On tap at World of Beer Key West. Aroma: grapefruits, citrus, floral, pine resin. App: clear copper with small white head and some lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous, a tad creamy, crisp light to medium bitter finish. Overall: a really fruity IPA with a nice crisp finish. Would have liked it a bit more bitter but this beer is really easy to drink with this high temperature.
Good clean and drinkable. It is also a very pretty beer. A go-to ipa with the right amount of bitter.
One of the best IPAs I have ever had. Very smooth with great hoppy aroma and lightly bitter taste. Do not miss the chance to drink this one!
A well-balanced IPA that is a joy to drink. I cannot wait to pick up a six the next time I am in the U.S.

Cant believe I hadnt checked this one off yet. pours a clear rich gold with a bubbly thick white head. Floral and citrus aroma. Taste is wonderful bright citrus then mellow bitter. Almost bittersweet. Hoppy, but not ridiculous. Nice long pleasantly bitter finish. Great floral nasal linger.  Very easy drinking. Really, really good IPA.

shared at Braukunst Live, Munich by jfb, many thanks. dark orange color, small white head. nice fruity smell, mango, some sweetness. full body, bubbly, mango, light strawberry, fruity sweet taste, some herbal notes, nice light bitter finish. good one, but unfortunatly not totally fresh.

Loads of centennial, grapefruit, faint pine, grassy and floral, quite balanced but the hop level on a fresh can isnt really in your face at all. Decent strong going IPA which is very balanced though.

B
This beer is great. It is a go to if I see it out. It has a fruit finish and it pairs with its aroma. 3/2/15, 4:10 AM

Clear gold with a slight haze, two-finger dense white head and wonderful lace. Big citrus and floral hop aromas, strong grapefruit with a touch of bread dough in the background. Light pale malts and biscuity flavors offset the solid chop bitterness. Medium body, creamy smooth mouthfeel, generous carbonation and a bitter dry finish. Outstanding IPA from back East.

Bottle in Florida. Aroma is floral, with caramel and trop fruit. Medium body, medium carbonation. Light caramel, pine, lemon, grapefruit, light resinous wood stuff, some juicy trop fruit stuff, lovely hoppy bitterness... Tasty, great balance, very nice! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice clear(ish) dark amber color. A slightly fruity and slightly hoppy aroma. A rather fruity taste with not much of a hoppy punch. A mild aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Full nose of hops, citrus and pine. excellent
Appearance- A dark amber color with a small off-white head.
Taste- A real hop delight, with citrus and pine to match the hops. The hop bitterness is balanced against the malt smoothness.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation. great mouthfeel. 
Overall - A world class IPA

Poured from a can showing translucent amber yellow with a finger of clean white foam that fades very quickly. 

The nose shows quite a bit of steel & aluminium with subtle grapefruit notes. 

Palate is medium bodied with high carbonation. Medium to moderately high fruit forwardedness with a lot of grapefruit pith and juicy piineapple. Sharp IPA bitterness on the finish. A slight orange peel zestiness appears on the end. Bitterness is slightly high on the mid-palate but evens it out on the end. Definitely suited for trips. Easy to drink and hardly notice the 7% alcohol. Gets even better as you get used to the bitterness.

The IPA of IPAs... Pint pour, for the millionth time but finally rated, of beautifully perfect straw gold with a white cap of cumulonimbus fluff. Nose of heaven and grapefruit peel and faint resin, dry malt character. Flavor is similar, plenty of grapefruit and centennial hops, resin notes with bitterness back it all up. Seriously, if I made an IPA, this is what my goal would be.

Wispy sediment at bottom, tipped 2x slowly before opening. 12 oz. bottle (dated 2015/02/18) poured into IPA glass. Pours golden amber, clear of sediment, ~1.5-2.0 fingers of foam, carbonated w/ noticeable med.-sized bubbles. Strong floral, muted biscuit-y and resin-y pine hop[py] aroma. Taste is soft, subtly fruity-sweet. Carbonation soon transforms into the tiniest of bubbles; tipped lacing dissolves slowly. Easy, crisp and light mouth-feel for a 7% ABV (with no discernible alcohol bite). Mild hints of semi-sour tangerine, lightly roasted or charred malt, - wet and easily drinkable.

Aromas of orange rind, tangerine, citrus and floral hops. Appearance is a bright gold with a very thin white foam. Taste is very smooth with creamy caramel, buttery hops, orange and citrus upfront. Nice biscuit, tangerine juice,more creamy caramel and definite hops and pines come through mid palate. Finishes very smooth with a residual hop smoothness and more big orange notes. Overall, very smooth and balanced IPA with a nice body and hop presence. A rating.
not a bad ipa but i have had a lot better. the one bonus is that it is pretty easy to get.
Can at Dangerous Bottle Share 6.0. Clear golden pour with a small head. Floral notes, grapefruit, grass, pineapple leading to a light bitter finish. Super refreshing but lacking that wow feeling.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a clear amber with a small, white, long lasting head. Aroma has very tropical hops, peach, malty sweetness, pine, slight grass. Slight hop minty. Taste is very light and drinkable with both sweetness and slight bitterness. Very smooth body and medium high carbonation. Alcohol really well hidden.

Can thanks to bursprak. - Not sure how old this is but I am assuming it is fairly fresh. Pours hazy orange amber with a white head. Aroma is very pine forward with some peach, orange, sweet citrus fruits and lots of floral notes as well. The taste has a nice hoppyu bitterness which almost turns a little bit "minty". Also some peach, pine, floral and citrus notes. Very nice and easy drinkable.
Very smooth. In comparison to Heady Topper. That's a big name to toss isle the ring. Not here yet but close.

Can from Bursprak. Cheersbrah. Pours light hazy with a medium white head. Aromas of peach, citrus, orange, orange peel, malty sweetness. Taste is malty sweet, some hops, peach, ripe orange, orange peel, light citrus.

Clear, amber colored beer with a two finger high head. Lacing stays on the glass. 
Nose: Hops, citrus, honey and pine. 
Taste: Orange, pineapple and grass. 
Body: Light, smooth body. A little bitterness and medium carbonation

I really cant understand the hype about this beer. I my opinion it is highly overrated on ratebeer and beeradvocate.
Maby it is because the bottle I got my hands on at Total Wine & More is not fresh? 
This one was bottled on december 1 - 2014 * Two and a half months ago.
Tap at Ginger Man, New York. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, pine, hops and malts. Pretty basic and nothing special IMO.
Bottle 355 ml from deli in Brooklyn. Pours orange with medium off-white head. Citrus, pine and hops in aroma. Fruity flavor with caramel malty base and long hoppy bitter finish.
Citrus hop flavor with a decent mouth feel for an IPA. I think the first sip is the best with this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 2017 Re-rate: 2 week old bottle from Js. Pours a clear light copper-gold with a finger of foam. Light grapefruit and honey malt. Clean and crisp. Orange notes. Light bitter finish. Feels more and more like a legacy beer in 2017.

Well balanced. Great hop taste with the perfect amount of malt to keep it balanced. Along the line of Victory's Hop Devil but with a little more citrus/pine hop presence. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Perfect...can I say more....great pine aroma that emulated for ever. Great crisp clean dry mouthfeel with a wonderful hop flavor. Michigan brew at its finest. Get it when ever you can!
One of my favorite IPA?s. Love drinking this one from the can. Anytime of day IPA. Bell?s staple!
Excellent beer, good body , nicely hopped...always a pleasure to have a few of these fine brews
Good scents of citrus and hops. Taste as good as any IPA should. Good Beer. Will have again
One of my favorite beers. Nice light orangish color, citrus aroma, light to moderate bitterness, lots of hop flavor and just the right mouth feel.

July 6th, 2013 - Bells Two Hearted Ale has long, long been on my to-drink list. But my geographic limitations kept it out of reach until some blessing brought its distribution boundaries out to San Diego. I dropped my usual basket of local made beers and picked up the Bells that were available for sale at the corner market - a fine place for beers, but still a little surprising to see something so new and exotic at. As for the Two-Hearted Ale itself, it practically bushes with an orange and brown russet color, with a thin white head. The aroma is rich with white wine, and the flavor is likewise acidic, and bursting with fruits: pear, blood orange, grapefruits and all coupled with a sweeter hops, which dries out in the aftertaste. This is a really lovable IPA and like manna from heaven in a part of the country where IPAs tend to maximize the flavor, not the experience.

Light notes of floral grapefruit citrusy aroma, well balanced looking amber orange appeal, medium body bitterness with an excellent hop pop, extremely pleasurable to the lips, and this my friends in my opinion is well deserving of its hierarchy ratings.

Pours a hazy orange with a thin head. Sweet, fruity nose with a nice toasty backbone. Taste is grapefruit and citrus with a long pungent bitterness. Some residual sweetness and slightly boozy. Tasty IPA!
Golden pour, white head. Nose is floral, sweet, a touch of coldcuts from the malts. Taste is mango, cold cuts, sweet malts, bready. Bitter finish. Very well balanced.
An all time great IPA. Perfectly balanced, one of the best in the Midwest.
Bottled. Good for 7% but not 3rd best IPA in the world. standard IPA. Cant tell the difference from any other IPA. Dont know if it is me or the beer.

Homeless: Will scrape hop gunk for Two Hearted. Outstanding every time, it's really phenomenal 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gold...nice white head. Excellent floral nose. Great balance of floral and bittering hop tastes. Mild carbonation, creamy finish. Excellent lacing. A little thin towards the end.

Am I driven to rate this aroma high due to the general public? No, it is sweet and vibrant. Does this appearance fade into the chasm of normality? No, it is golden and translucent. Do I rate this taste high because everyone else does? No, it is a skilled battle between malt and hop, ----- My palate is pleased. My friends favorite beer might become my own.

Finally distributed in so cal. This s everything good I have heard. Perfect flavor and mouthfeel not too dry and definitely not sweet. Great. The aroma kicks you in face of grassy and pine, really a fantastic beer!

Aromas of clove and floral scents. A touch of bread notes. Some fruit, perhaps mango, but not particularly sweet.

Color is an attractive copper with some cloudiness. Very little head what there is is fairly white.

Taste: not much sweetness, a balanced bitterness that works very well.

Medium body, texture is pretty middle-of-the-road. Carbonation is about average. Finish is long and pleasantly bitter.

Overall this is a very good beer - complex and very nicely balanced.

A: Murky orange color with not much head but decent retention and lacing. 
S: Piney and tart hop aroma. Not much malty smell.
T: Pronounced piney/fruity hop flavors. Slight maltiness tries to compete. Not a bad balance of the two. Very good tasting. The tartness is nice and refreshing.
M: A little thick on the mouth with a resinous feel and a lingering hoppyness on the end. 
O: Good overall but not sure I would continue to purchase. Good change of pace for this lagerhead though.

Pours a dark orange with a finger of head. Nose is orange, floral hop, citrus, but of pine. Taste matches nose, lots of citrus, hop taste, citrus peel on the finish. Nice balanced crisp finish, not overly sweet or bitter. Good medium body. A very good easy drinking ipa.
Nose is dank, candied citrus. Flavor is same plus some toasty bread, strawberry, hint of pine and resin, grapefruit rind finish. Everything is balanced, mellow and integrated. Outstanding

Growler fill at GAT Beer, NE Philadelphia. Pours slightly hazy amber with a touch of orange. 2-finger off-white head. Mild aroma of citrus hops, with a touch of caramel. Body is medium, with a touch of oily thickness. There is a light astringent dryness to the finish. Citrusy hops flavor with a bit of a resin note. Biscuit malt note in the backbone.

On tap, 5 Leaves Diner, Brooklyn. Boom! Not usually a fan of the higher ABV brews but this is a belter. Aroma of citrus and pine. Medium head which lasts down to the bottom. Quite a bit of lacing. Lovely amber to red colouring. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Hoppy and citrusy with hints of other slightly sweeter fruits - balance perfect. And then the aftertaste can only be described as something like cognac. Completely unexpected. A wonderful and unique veer.
From a bottle. Pours a cloudy copper with a short lived one finger head. Aroma is of hops and citrus. Taste starts out crust and refreshing; more citrus. Finish is dry and hoppy. One of the best.

From a growler. Pours a copper color with some haze. Little head but I believe this is due to the source. Nose is citrusy, specifically orange and lemon. Taste is bitter throughout, with more citrus, bitter orange peel stands out. Overall a little bitter for me but a good beer.
Good not great ipa. Citrus, earthy, alcohol, floral. Not very smooth. Pours a light and hazy amber, minimal head and aroma

16 oz can from an IP trade with Benzai, thanks René (and happy birthday). Amber color, hazy. Stiff white to off white head, pretty good lacing. Aromas: pine/resin and malty sweetness. Retronasal theres an additional hop acidity. Flavor is moderate to full bitter with a malty sweet backbone. Medium bodied. Good carbo. Lovely, long herbal bitter finish. Even 5 months after canning this did not disappoint.

Aroma is quite nice - not sure of all the smells! Very nice color to the beer. The taste, of course, is what leads me to desire more of this beer. The beer has a long lingering feel on the palate. OverallI give this beer a high ranking and will continue to enjoy it. I first discovered this beer while visiting in Ann Arbor, MI and am pleased to see that it is available in my home state. I was surprised at first as to how much I enjoyed it.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Draft. Pours really nice, gold with a fluffy white head. Light sweetness on the nose, tying together some citrus, floral and pine notes. Theres a soft touch : lightness to this that makes it very drinkable and extremely enjoyable. Not a bomb of any kind, just a balanced, delicious, classic IPA. Well done.
The first IPA I fell in love with. Perfect balance, I like the citrus hops and the finish is smooth and leaves me wanting more.

Pours fairly amber a little hazy. Smells hoppy. Tastes hoppy, slightly piney and slightly fruity. A nice bitter finish. A very enjoyable beer.
Ive had this on tap and in bottle.

Quite possibly the best pouring/presentable beer available. Pours with a nice, rich, thick head. Not foamy. The head remains for the duration of the glass, clinging to the sides of the entire glass. Beer is lightly carbonated, similar in appearance to Blue Moon, but is "hoppier" in taste. Hints of citrus, orange, and a slight hint of walnut. Top-shelf beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft at Rattle and Hum, NYC. A rare find in this area. I would love to try this again and sample more from this brewer.
12 oz bottle pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of pine, citrus and sweet malts. Taste is citrus and malts.

A hazy copper colour with a firm white head. Sampled from a bottle in a great Mexican (Yucatan-style) restaurant just near the BandSource store. Big aromas of citrus, pine needles and tropical fruit. This is a richly-hopped IPA with exceptional flavours. Rich biscuity, malts and really refreshing and complex hop flavours. An excellent IPA. Highly drinkable.
Draft. Orange color with a white head, huge lacing. Aroma is floral, honey, grass, citrus. Grapefruit, orange peel, pine, apricot, a bit of honey sweetness. Bitter finish, slight banana esters.

This beer deserves its high rating. The first time I had it was an IPA tasting that I put on when I lived on the east coast. Everyone picked this beer as the best! Even compared to some imperial IPAs! It has a balance to all of it that is unmatched by most ipas on the market.
Bottle. Pours golden, hazy, nice frothy head. Somewhat faint aroma: grapefruit, spruce, lychee. Taste: biscuit, grapefruit, longan, pine. Very smooth although feels a little watery toward the end.
Bery smooth ipa. Excellent hoppy aroma but not overly powerful hoppy flavor on the palate.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Canned. Pours a dark golden color with a small white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, grapefruit, orange, lemon, little bit of mango. Lots of biscuity malt backbone for balance. Taste is hop forward but not in a way that destroys your palate. Grapefruit, lemon, orange, hops. Malt backbone balances it really well. This is an amazing IPA because its perfectly balanced. 12/2014 rating 

Rerated 03/ 09/17. Bottled 02/07/17. Pours very clear orange, white head. Aroma is citrus, sweet malt, orange. Malt heavy. Aroma is very sweet up front, orange caramel, pine, a little corny, and a moderately bitter finish. Decently balanced and good that its so available.

From a 12 oz bottled poured into tulip. Light orange color with a good amount of head. Very smooth and easy drinking. Cant wait to try more from this brewery. I let my friend who says he doesnt like IPA some of this and he really enjoyed it.

Found at two guys in waycross, GA. Pours light orange with a dense white head. Aroma is mild with malt and clean hops. Flavor is more pronounced than aroma with sweet malt balanced well by citrus and resin. Light, creamy body. Soft co2. Very nice
Tall can produced 10 weeks ago. Nose is hoppy, fruity citrus., mango. Taste has some juicy hops with solid balanced bitterness. Easy drinking and tasty. Would like to try a fresher sample.
There isn't much to say about Two-Hearted, other than it's easily one of my top five IPAs. It's my go to when I encounter someone who hasn't yet seen the light, and thinks IPAs aren't that great.
A decent taste, aroma, and appearance, but the palate is a kind of thin. A decent beer overall, but its not really grabbing me.

Slightly Hazy Orange Color, Huge White Foamy Head, Lasts and Leaves Lots Of Soapy Lacing. Pleasant Fruity and Light Citrus Hop Aroma. Malt, Pine Hop. Sweet, Light Resin and Bitter Finish. Medium Body, Soft Carbonation. Easy To Drink, Hides ABV Real Well. Enjoyed It. Nice. Recommended.

Ive had this beer so many times but have yet to review. 12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Caramel color with a fluffy 2 finger head. Nose is floral and very aromatic. There is a wonderful balance of hoppy pine and fruity citrus. I love this beer. Truly a classic IPA!
One of the best examples of this style, this is definitely my go to IPA. Awesome citrus and floral notes and a pronounced hop character with balanced bitterness

Very nice color and moderately hoppy. Has a great taste not too far off from a regular IPA. Not too much of a head but that could be different when not from the bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

ivorywhite head leaves structured lacing. orangeyellow colour. aroma is citrus, soapy, bit garlic. taste like aroma but with a very pronounced rather unpleasant bitterness. medium body and carbonation .bottle 33cl / bd jul-2014

12 Oz bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aromas are all hops: resiny and piney, with some alcohol. Flavor also is hop dominant, piney, resin and some citrus. Some malt sweetness comes through in middle, then ends with long, dry hop linger. Light body with a creamy mouthfeel and average carbonation. Overall, delicious ops. Great hop flavor and aroma, decently balanced, but could use more malt.
medium body, bitter with very hoppy floral and citrus. A great example of an IPA.

Purchased from Keg Liquors in Clarksville, IN. Poured from a very fresh 16oz can. The nose is bright, resinous, and citrusy - very hop-forward with a supportive sweet malt backing. The appearance is appropriate for an unfiltered IPA, with one finger of a lasting white head. The flavor matches the nose with an initial influx of piney, citrusy hops that fades into a mild, slightly bitter, sweet malt finish. I detect little to no alcohol in the flavor. Smooth and medium-light on the palate with an average to lively carbonation that held up throughout the 20 minutes that I was sipping on it. The only possible detracting characteristic that I can detect is slightly below medium bitterness which is a maybe a little low for the style according to the BJCP guidelines, but this may just be my palate. It doesnt detract from the beer itself at all. I think this is an incredibly well-balanced beer. Id heard good things, and I certainly wasnt disappointed. Highly recommended!

acheter lors d un voyage a nyc on na une excellente ipa léquilibre est parfaite le gout de l agrume avec une touche de caremel lui confis une equilibre tres agréable en bouche jhe trouve sa plate d avoir acheter juste une c ezts sur que j en acheterais d autre c east sur wow

An aggressive pour resulted in a nice 1/4 inch off white head. The aroma is outstanding. The taste is even better. One the best IPA I've had. I'm surprised it took me this long to track down a 6-pack, which I was able to get at The Beer Store in Southampton, PA. I have to track down this in a 1/6th keg.
Top 5 favorite beer. Amazing taste and color. Love the crispness and finish. Great aroma. Pretty hoppy.

Bottle. Clear golden amber beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of oranges, citrus, peaches, pineapple and apricots. Flavor is fruity with notes of caramel, toffee, citrus, peaches and mangos. Well balanced and easy to drink.
Very nice IPA from a top notch brewery. Great hops flavor and a laid back alcohol kick.

Can sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. A bit hazy light copper with small off-white head. The aroma is hoppy, citrus, a bit cheesy, some maltiness. Nice hoppy flavor, grassy, citrus, rosemary, a bit malty, medium bitterness, "green". Light carbonation, medium-bodied.

Pours copper with a beautiful, lazy and foamy white head that clings well.

Sweet aroma with a mild soapy essence, pine and just a hint of citrus.

Very mild effervescence and hoppy bitterness are well in tune with the malted sweetness evident here. This is a brew ahead of the hop craze, with plenty of true hop strength but still very drinkable and well in balance.

Finishes rich on the tongue and lingers. A great brew without the excess of some other IPAs (although there is certainly room in the world for them too :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2014 Really excellent crisp and refreshing IPA. It had been a long time since I had one of these and Im very happy I did. For 7% the alcohol is well hidden.

Aluminum can from SBL: Poured with a thick frothy layer of foam head while a golden brass colored liquid rested below. The aroma is mild with enough earthy hops and bready malts come through to please my nose. The drink is bitter and fruity and taste like a well balanced IPA between the bitter grapefruit and pine flavors combined with a sourdough bread spread with butter which harmonizes the beer. Really happy to any Bells in so cal that I havent seen before.
Bottle poured into pint glass. Such a great beer. Smells, looks and tastes great. A staple in my beer rotation for sure.
One of my favorites. Sharp hoppy flavor with nice depth. Equally good bottled or on draft.
citrus hop aromas. golden and hazy with nice head. very strong hoppy flavor, strong finish.

Bottle from ABC. Pours a medium golden amber with a white head that lasts forever. Mostly floral and piney aromas with a hint of malt character. Hops abound with a sweet finish. Acquire.

Appeance: Little haze. Just a little, like you can see the stars but not the milky way. Light gold brown. Little white head. 

Aroma: Like Im out in the pasture, running around naked, the smells of the farm. Ripe -- beat up 1 day old fruit, a generic fruit.

Tagline: It slows life down, you want it to endure.

Drrjrr: That ones better, it kind of burns the nostrils. Smell neutralized by sniffing babys head.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Very good aroma with floral and sugar cane, medium light golden color, normal bitter for ipa, taste good not too dry, just right texture, great taste for price
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Poured from can thanks Willrunforbeer nice pine and citrus aromas and a nice gold orange color. Taste is smooth with grapefruit tones and a nice hop balance.
Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good. Beer is good.

Smells nice, piney/spicy hops and citrus along with sweet malt in the nose. Nicely balanced, bold aromas. Looks good, clear golden color with streaming effervescence, foamy white long lasting head. Tastes quite nice, upfront get an interesting spicy/citrus mix, finishes piney and very caramel/biscuit flavors. Medium bodied and average carbonation. Definitely on the maltier side for an American IPA but works really well.
12oz bottle pours a yellow amber color with a bit of head. Mild hop bitterness. Smooth at the end.

On tap at world of beer, pensacola, FL. Amber with white head. Smell is hoppy pine and floral with citrus zest. Taste is bitter grapefruit and floral and pine. Dry with high bitterness and medium carbonation.

When drank fairly fresh, this IPA can burst with flavor against the best of them. I've definitely come to appreciate it more and more over time.

DATE REVIEWED: August 8, 2014... GLASSWARE: La Fin du Monde tulip... OCCASION: Happy 38th birthday, myself--with the fam, Jer and Matt...APPEARANCE: orange amber body; filmy and hazy; thick, white three-finger head; lacing extends upward and thickly spreads across the glass--a great start... AROMA: fruity and hoppy; apple and citrus first; some bubblegum yeasts too; lastly, some metallic suggestions... PALATE: fantastic, medium-bodied and arresting--effervescent and alive; an IPA to sip and simmer with--little suggestion of alcohol, but definitely weightier than a pint glass... TASTE: balanced caramel malts underpin a hop festival of Noble and citrus--tangy tangerine and teeth-rattling pine resin, a combo that shakes and soothes in unison--this is the IPA the beer folk warn us about...OVERALL: as IPAs go, a mecca of sorts--the hype is to be believed--and although there are many that rival Two Hearted, it is a beer I will seek out again, even if its only found in a case at a PSU distributor, as this was; the name itself evokes that "slow" short story that nonetheless reveals so much of mans plight and hope, and this is a worthwhile stab at perfection....

Transfer from BA review on 9-10-12-
 Served on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance  Served a light amber color with a tiny white head. The head faded quite fast to leave only a very small amount of lacing.

 Smell  The smell is very light and consists of some sweet caramel, bread, lighter fruit smells and a citrus hop smell.

 Taste  The taste begins on the drier side and is of a light roasted malt with a decent presence of a an citrus hop bitterness. In the middle it sweetness slightly with some flavors of caramel and light fruit coming to the tongue. These flavors are rather short lived however and fade toward the end, where a more sharp bitter earthy and citrus nature come to the tongue. 

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the slightly above higher than average side in terms of creaminess with a medium level of carbonation. Good for the hop flavors as well as for the more bitter and sharp hop flavors.

 Overall  Not much sweetness here but very nice and dry. A flavorful and tasty drier IPA with a nice sharp hop and malty base.

0.355l bottle from Bierkoning. Bottled 13.08.2013. I have to say that it looks really good in the glass this one. Its near glowing blurry honey orange in color and it has a nice medium sized really cloudy off-white head with extremely good retention and lacing capabilities. On the nose its fresh, light tropical sweet and hoppy. I get a sweet snowy peachy mango fruitiness with some pine, marmalade and even a little bit of licorice. Its it punching you in the nose, thats for sure but its so round and elegant. Its exactly the same in the taste. This is not a super hoppy raw American hop bomb, but its extremely balanced with round edges. It has a nice near cloudy mouthfeel and a really conformable average carbonation level. Soft peaches, a little piney bitterness on the top of the palate, I get soft branches and a little bit of whipped cream. Did I mention that this is balanced? Cause it is. Perhaps not as exciting as I had hoped for, but oh my I could drink this all day. A really tasty one! 30.09.2013

Slightly orange, slightly lemon, slightly Norwegian Spruce. Sweet and bitter with a zesty character.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2014 BOD 3/10/14. Slightly hazy light amber pour with a massive head. Excellent lacing and retention. Outstanding nose of citrus and dank hops - mostly tropical with grapefruit in the background. Light medium body which is modestly smooth in texture coupled with an above average carbonation level. The flavor profile is well balanced, but skewed towards citric bitterness, and complex. It begins with hop flavors, grapefruit over tropical, flows into a burst of dank hop flavor that yields itself to grapefruit rind bitterness and ends with a light biscuit sweetness. The finish has a bit of effervescence, is somewhat crisp yet also smooth. A moderate grapefruit rind bitterness lingers.
