Aroma: dry bread, floral, and malty backbone with earthy hints. Appearance: drank out of bottle- didnt properly asses. Color: golden, amber. Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, great floral kick. Palate: medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, good finish.
espuma cremosa, cerveja com um pouco de turbidez, aroma lupulado, pouco retrogosto, não muito amarga

This is the beer that's perfect for literally ALL occasions! Pours a wonderful dark amber color with a nice head. Smell is piney and the taste is to me what a great American IPA should be! Currently my favorite beer in my top beers list

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a growler. Citrus and pine. Light amber in color. Not an overpowering flavor, just well balanced.
Best ipa in my opinion. Great balance and extremely refreshing. Cant wait to go back to the US and drink this again!
16 oz can. One of my favorite iPAs. Strong aromas of pine, citrus, and floral notes. Big flavors of grapefruit, pine, hibiscus, finished by dry malts. 7% ABV gives this IPA an immense flavor profile.
Solid, but not worth a score of 100. Plenty of head from the tap, good taste, just nothing too exciting.

India Pale Ale style well suited for Hemingway-esque trips to the Upper Peninsula. American malts and enormous hop additions give this beer a crisp finish and incredible floral hop aroma. [Note: this beer doesn’t have Bells in front of the name by explicit request from the brewer. Update: Larry has posted in the forums saying Bells should be in front of the name now.]

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy golden with a thick white head. Aroma is slightly metallic from the bottle. Medium mouthfeel with some nice citrus and hops on the tongue. Bitter back end but not unpleasant. Good IPA.

12oz bottle from a Tops store in Hamburg, NY. AMber with a tight white head; rich tropical fruit aroma; full bodied with a tropical fruit taste; and a dry finish with a touch of pine resin. A well balanced and well executed IPA.
Strong citrus and piney nose, significant supporting bready malt. Firm but not biting bitterness, noticeable caramel malt. Dry, but enough body. Delicious and drinkable.
Un classique que je me devais de boire, jai bien apprécier le gout de grain mais jai limpression que si elle était un peu plus fraiche un gout floral de houblon aurait été plus présent

Nez citronné et arômes de grain. On goûte l'alcool en bouche et le houblon. La finale est un peu soutenue et sèche. Très rafraîchissante!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 13, 2015 Tap at Enzo?s BBQ in Oceanside... pours a haze golden orange with a dense pure white head. Aroma is kinda muted compared to west coast(specifically San Diego style) IPAs, but it?s still wonderfully balanced with some citrus and floral hop aromas and some sweet bready malt characters. Flavor is almost perfect... mostly citrus hops with some nice tangerines pith bitterness and balanced by the malt. Thick rings of lacing work all the way down the glass and never dissipate. Palate is a little too sticky for a 7%abv, but overall, this iseasily one of the better IPAs around.

Drink it fresh. Drink it from a can. Had both bottle and can variety of this one and definitely prefer the can. A top notch IPA. Nice hoppy aroma. Nice hoppy taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A cloudy amber boy with a white head that had some retention and a bit of lace. Aroma had mostly a citrus hop profile. There were floral and tropical fruit notes and a bit of pine. Malts seem to have a balance of sweet caramel malts and a bit of biscuit. Flavor was mostly grapefruit hops and the pine notes seem to come through more than the tropical fruit and floral qualities. Finish was nice and dry and had a good mouth feel. Served in a glass from a chilled bottle.

My favorite beer. Ever.... I tend to prefer hoppy beers so ipas are my go to beer, and Bells Two Hearted Ale is the best ipa i have ever had. Perfectly balanced and extremely drinkable for an ipa. Overall just an amazing brew, its the Michael Jordon of ipas.

355 ml bottle at home. Hazy orange color with nice white head. Mostly hoppy aroma with citrus fruits and pine. Some light sweet malty aroma too. Taste begins malty sweet and then it becomes fruity hoppy. Medium body with oily feel, average carbonation and nice bitter hoppy finish.
Consistently my favorite IPA. Pours clear golden yellow with off-white head. Good lacing. Nose is floral and citrus. You can taste the grapefruit and pine. Nice dry finish.

Pour from the new can. Super fresh and very aromatic. Citrusy hops in abundance leading to aromas of orange peel, grapefruit and pine. Taste is more bright hops with a great malt backbones to back it up and keep the flavor in balance. Great stuff and dig the new cans.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 Bottle at Craig?s tasting. Bit soapy, fruity, light, sweet, thin, not for me.  2.9
26/4/16 can at craigs.  Pours clear golden, nose is citrus, sweet toffee, taste is similar, bitter. 3.5

Pours a slightly cloudy amber with a thin white head. Nose is delightful malt, with fruity esters and a nice citrus edge. Taste is very well-balanced sweet malt and hop bite. Medium body, lively carbonation. Excellent IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 On tap at Whole Foods.  Pours a clear orange copper color with lasting white head that concentrates at the rim of the glass.  Aroma is muted hop bitterness with notes of tropical fruit, particularly grapefruit and pineapple.  Flavor is same with hop bitterness present upfront, and a bitter finish of tangerines.  Delicious.

Aroma is super citrusy. Strong orange, pineapple, tropical fruit and mango. Touch of resiny pine and booze. Taste is just as citrusy: orange, grapefruit, pine, malt, slight booze, with a lingering subtle bitterness. Exceptionally balanced. Very strong flavors mixed together almost perfectly.
This is just a great beer. Citrus flavor and simplicity make this great. My go to IPA!!! Great taste and abv for the price.

Couldnt believe that this is a 7% brew. Pours out an orangey amber with typical off whitish head. Aroma and taste follow each other, with tropical fruits of mango abound. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and finishes well. Overall, an excellent IPA without being overly hoppy.
12oz bottle. Pours orangish, white head. Aromas citrus hops, taste is balanced hop bitter with malt, finish is clear. Its a very well crafted IPA.
Amazing! Bitter sweet fruits mango peaches with plenty enough hops! Just a fantastic IPA!

Bells Two Hearted is a true classic IPA. Excellent balance and bouquet of citrus and hops. Not aggressively hoppy for the sake of it, this beer is great from the first drop to the last. A refreshing ale that stands up well anytime of day despite a high ABV.
Draft. Nice head and carbonation. Nice dark golden color. Little citrusy flavor. Nice hoppy aroma and flavor.
Bitter, touch of mango, dankness and dry finish. Good non West coast IPA, if a little old school.

As someone who isnt usually a fan of IPAs, I had a feeling I wouldnt like this beer very much. Its hard to describe the taste as anything other than hoppy and bitter. For someone who does like IPAs, I think this is a great choice, but for someone who doesnt, I would look elsewhere
If you enjoy lots of hops and bitterness, this is the one for you. Nice malt balance. Taste has some notes of citrus and floral. Also high in alcohol content compared to some lagers and ales.

As some one who generally isnt a fan of IPAs, I can say that this one is not too over-powering. It definitely has a hoppy taste to it, but its not the strongest Ive tasted. It has a great aroma to it, very floral.
Oh yeah baby! Bottle, at the BeerMarket, in Pittsburgh. Aroma is floral, hops. Taste is hops, citrus, floral. Subtle and complex. Very good beer.
This beer is excellent with a golden color. It is hoppy with great flavor. This is a great beer to drink all year round!

Dense strong penetrating herbally evergreen nose. Quite a surprising and beautiful perfume. Floral dense and complex violet quality with is complex and not sickly. Some bubble gum in there too must lightly and very restrained.Super density with a core which just pushes out continually. Better than the sum of its parts.

A little too many hops for my taste but if you like IPAs, this is a good beer for you. A nice malt balance in the taste. A piney aroma with fruity undertones. The malt body can balance the hop presence but it still isnt enough for me.
As far as IPAs go, it isnt too overbearing. Dont get me wrong, its still a hoppy beer (hence the IPA) but I feel like even someone who doesnt like a lot of hops could still enjoy this beer.
Not a bad beer...its got a spicy bitterness to it, but its also crisp to the taste. Not a bad afterwork beer. :)
Bottle, thanks Craig. Golden with white head. Aroma has lots of grapefruit, quite floral. Taste has some toffee, floral, citrus. Decent body and quite bitter. Nice.
This is Carolyns most favorite beer in the whole wide world! It is the best IPA ever!

4 ounce draft at ChurchKey poured into a tasting snifter. Pours a clear golden yellow with off-white head and nice lacing. Aromas of citrus and floral notes. Tasting notes of grapefruit and lemon/lime citrus, pine, resin. Medium body with a dry finish. Juicy mouthfeel, medium carbonation Nice hop balance. Also had 4 ounces on cask, color was hazier, less carbonation, taste had a bit of oak and more grapefruit than lemon/lime.
This is not my favorite beer. It is two bitter and the after taste is very strong and doesnt seem well balanced.
Very balanced. No one thing is too over the top. Easy drinker. CA distro soon?

Citrus and floral aroma.Light carbonation, golden color. It doesnt have the bitter bite like other IPAs. The first time I tried it, I loved it. Now that I try it again, Im not so sure. Still, solid beer.

Not exactly my type of beer. Golden color. Has a slight bitter taste good hop and malts balance
UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Draft. Pours a golden bronze. Aroma and taste are a nice balance of floral hops and malts.
This is not good. The aroma and the taste of this beer are not my type of beer.

Citrus and floral aroma.Light carbonation, golden color. It doesnt have the bitter bite like other IPAs. The first time I tried it, I loved it. Now that I try it again, Im not so sure. Still, solid beer.

This is the beer I go to after a long day at work. It's like your t-shirt that never feels wrong. There are better IPAs, but this one is home to me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance is a cloudy straw color with a white head. Aroma is piney and citrus. Taste of citrus with a dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Incredible floral hop aroma. The taste adds grapefruit with a vanilla malt finish to add perfect balance. I'm glad I got to try this. Awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours yellow with a medium head, aroma of honey, orange, lemon, balanced and fresh, flavor is bitter with fruity tones, orange and malt, perfect balance, medium bodied.

Aroma: caramel, toast, floral, leather, woody
Appearance: amber
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness
Palate: medium body, average carbonation, long finish
Overall: 19 out of 20; Simply my favorite IPA... and it doesnt go all IPAish on me. A real beer; unique enough to command the score its given.

Fra fad, på Blind Tiger, New York. Orangegylden, næsten klar. lille hvidt skum. Lækker humlenæse med masser af grønt gran. Blodappelsin og grape. Karamel, let toast. Bitter, mundrensende finish. God balance. Virkelig god IPA

12 oz bottle into a shaker pint. Pale, clear amber with a nice white head that laces the glass perfectly. Pine and citrus on the nose and follows through to the palate. The bitterness is remarkably smooth and the finish is dry. Finishes so clean. One of the best ipas hands down!
On draft at O.H.S.O. Terrific blend of malts and hops. Nice beer, definitely recommend.
Tap at Blue Door Pub. Pineapple	 brown sugar, and caramel. Very sweet upfront with a resiny tropical bitter finish. Medium body with sticky feel. Nice sweet and fruity pale.

Aromas of grapefruit, citrus, plenty of hops, and floral. Light carbonation, golden in color, the head clings, and is slightly off white and well formed. It has citrus flavors, grapefruit, maybe rind, floral hops flavoring. It doesnt have the bitter bite that a lot of IPA;s have, which is different. The ingredients work well together.
Bue à la pression. Parfaitement équilibrée, belle rondeur dans lensemble. Lamertume vient seulement sur la fin. Excellent.

Pours clear amber ( very light ) to blonde , small white foam . 
Less intense smell than expected . 
Taste is nice and intense though . Very floral , soapy in a good way , impressive amount of bitterness, yet very gentle . Aftertaste is bitter, floral hoppy . Carbonation is perfect . 
Appart from the soapy ( in a good way ) character, I find this very average though good beer, just not sure why this is 100 overall 100 style , while many other IPAs Ive had were way better and rated lower .

Tap- pours golden bronze with a white head that settles quick. It's taste perfect balance of floral hops and maltyness that isn't over kill. Delicious ale and it goes great with a chicken sandwich from Frankford Hall!
Just a solid IPA. Not flashy, but extremely well done. About as balanced as a beer can be
Love this beer very good aroma to very nice to look at I would always recommend this to anyone who likes IPA s.

Bottle + tap. Pours a hazy orange with creamy white head. Aroma is pine, caramel, light grass. Flavor is bitter throughout, but really great malt backbone here.. Incredible balance, drinks smooth and creamy. Medium body and mouthfeel, always enjoyable to drink.
De tirador. Color ambar, suficiente espuma, aroma floral y a lupulo.. otra IPA de Michigan que merece la pena

At a tasting, thanks zvikar, small creamy head, a little hazt lightis orange colour, aroma of citrus, peach and apricot, with hints of flowers and malt, flavour of citrus with an empathic herbal bitterness and a malty backbone. Solid balanced IPA, highly enjoyable.

Pours a hazy orange with a thin white head. Very piney and fruity nose that draws you in. Medium bodied, with a perfect balance of malt and bitterness. A great light IPA that I consider a nice session beer.

Pour from a bottle. dark golden color somewhat cloudy. Off-white lacy head. Aroma of lemons, straw, apples, very floral and fruity. Taste; a touch sweet up front then a lightly bitter grapefruity finish with a touch of pine. long creamy finish, well balanced and enjoyable to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2016 On tap poured into a shaker. The aroma is mostly pine with a note of pineapple, citrus, some stone fruit, chalk, and a very floral quality. A fluffy, creamy, cloudy white head sits atop a clear gold orange body. The head retains quite well with a puffy island of head left floating by the end and it leaves a really plentiful sheet-like lace. The taste is a medium sweetness with a medium-high bitterness. The medium-full body that?s a bit thin texture-wise, but rather creamy; aided by an active carbonation. A buttery toffee note starts off the mouth feel, and this gives way to a mellow pineapple flavor, followed by a resin, grassy, and citrus note at the finish. The finish is mostly clean and crisp and leaves behind a heavy resin and chalk aftertaste that lingers.

Several pints from Boonies on the Avenue and a bottle from Hy-Vee Muscatine. Gold and clear appearance with a white head. Aroma of floral hops, citrus zest and tropical fruits. Similar flavor, medium plus bitterness, minimal malt sweetness. Good stuff.
Medium aroma of malt and hops. Found aroma better than taste. Not one of my favorite IPAs of premium crafts.
A top 10 favorite IPA of mine, for its IPA balance of malt & bitterness, and when fresh, great aroma.

Un des IPA les plus faciles à boire que jai eu lhonneur de goûter dans ma vie. Les houblons résineux et terreux sont en vedette dans cette bière, une présence maltée discrète venant sappuyer sur lamertume très douce. Préalablement, des effluves de citron et gazon mouillé nous avaient fait saliver. Une robe limpide de couleur dorée penchant sur lambré est surmontée dun col mousseux moyen esquissant de magnifiques dessins à lintérieur du verre. Jaurais pu en boire une quantité industrielle consécutivement.

Loads and loads of lemon-drop citrus replays make this one all about the well-played C-hops. Sweet solid body and slightly heavy palate, good aromas, very controlled bitterness does not become grassy.

Pours clear golden orange with a fast diminishing white head. Nice fresh hoppy aroma, also caramel, citrus, perfume, malty, quite strong but really nice. Flavor...well...bitter from begining till the end, quite hoppy, fresh, some caramel and flower notes

On tap at Vega in Pompano Beach, FL. Appearance is a hazy bronze with a thin off white head. Aroma is of fresh hops and a hint of malt. Taste is a mellower hop flavor that turns a nice bitter towards the end. Palate is pretty neutral for a IPA, which is why I liked it so much. Overall, a very well done IPA that is no too hoppy like so many of this style.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Pours a cloudy orange. Thick white head that lingers long. Smells of sweet orange and pine. Taste of orange, tangerine, grapefruit and pine. Hints of coconut and vanilla linger on the palate.The flavors combined taste like fruit loops. Has a nice dry resiny finish. This is a great IPA and a must try for any IPA enthusiast.
This pours a hazy amber color with a foamy off-white head. The aroma is mild with hops. The taste is smooth and easy drinking. Overall this is very well made.

Two Hearted Ale - Bell's Brewery 
American IPA
7% ABV 55 IBU 

APPEARANCE: Pours a hazy slightly cloudy golden straw color. Big huge billowy head that dissipated rather quickly leaving some great lacing patterns. 

AROMA: The nose was a bit subdued. Floral notes, summertime dandelions and soft grass. Nice & mellow citrus and pine hops. 

TASTE: I get grain and sweet malts up front. Nice citrus wave crashes and releases some grapefruit and tropical fruits. Slight bitterness on the end. 

MOUTHFEEL: Light and crisp with medium body and medium prickly carbonation. Dry snappy finish. 

OVERALL: Very solid brew. I think of it as a gateway into IPA's. Not a lot of that bitterness that I'm used to but still really enjoyable. 

RATING: 4/5 Zombie Heads! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 Fruity and hoppy beer, with a crispy sensation on the tongue. Not overly hoppy though. Dont know what the fuss is about, this ipa is average and has too much co2.

bread, floral, citrus, spruce, earthy, tangerine,orange, red, golden, hazy, white foam, medium bitterness, lightly sour, umami, medium body, lively, 
spicy
Taste is mostly pine hops, with a slight peach flavor and enough malt sweetness to balance out the hop bitterness. This is a good beer.

Beautiful rich peach golden colour. Aroma is light orange and hops. Taste is extremely sessional for a big IPA - malt and hops in strong balance. Not especially fruity. Definitely prefer Sculpin but this is a very smash able beer.

Slightly cloudy orange with small off white head. Aroma of piney hops, malt, citrus. Medium body. Bit of carbonation. At first, there are pine-like bitter hops, then quite a bit of malty balance that is sweet but not overly so. Then a dry hoppy finish. Background of citrus. Very good IPA on the maltier side, nice balance.
Should be what other IPA's aspire to be. Highly sessionable despite the higher alcohol and assertive hops. Clean flavors and remarkable balance.

This is a good IPA, you want great MI IPA you drink Surly Furious. This is a sin to be rated 100 it simply is not, both imop and in reality. Good hoppy ale. I could think of about 20 ipas I would want ahead of this. A good example of the style, not a standout.

Bells Two Hearted Ale is a great beer. With Hopslam being a front runner for Bells in the IPA world, this offers a less sweet but still just a hoppy option. It pours to a beautiful golden orange color and has a very crisp hoppy flavor. I think it is similar to Pliny the Elder, in many ways, while Pliny still edges ahead.

Pours light orange with a thick foamy white head; excellent head retention. Floral hops aroma, with some fruitiness mixed in there. Taste is hop-first bitterness that is very well balanced with some fruity undertones. Similar in a sense to Ballast Point Sculpin which I felt was more malt forward with some brilliant hoppy undertones. This could become my go-to IPA. Just fantastic.
Nice hop balance, floral notes, grass, perhaps a bit of citrus. Widely available, and a Bells staple.

Keg, On Tap, Whole Foods, Columbus Circle, 19/02/14. Hazed orange with a creamy white top. Muted frozen peach and flowers aroma. Booze and honey-sodden chill; peach, flowers, orange squash, anise and almond with the alcohol showing. Better as it warms with lavender and mint hints. A bit heady and lacking aromatics. OK, but inexplicably highly rated on this evidence.
Catching up on some old ratings from Untappd -- First rated on 30 Dec 2011.
Bottle. Rich hazy yellow wiyh creamy large whitish head, sweetish hops aroma, balanced hoppy taste with light bitterness at the end, medium finish. One of the better IPAs I have tasted.

Pours a hazy a golden orange. The head is defined and laced my glass. The aroma is hop driven. I noticed citrus grapefruit, pine, mild soap, herbel and floral notes. A very pleasant but not over the top aroma. As for the flavor it is moderate to mildly bitter, defined pale malts, sweet crystal malts, with a sugar additive, maybe corn sugar? The finish has a pleasant bitterness, weak dryness, and a sweet grain like flavor but it fades nicely. Overall this beverage balances well and makes it very drinkable. A must try.
Turbid golden brew topped by off-white foamy head & good lace. Floral, herbal nose. Malt backbone leads to piney hop finish. Refreshing IPA.

The quintessential IPA. Great aroma, balanced yet hoppy flavor, and, in my opinion, a perfect ABV for and IPA (7%). Perfect go-to beer due to its wide availability. One of my favorites!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At Sweetwater in Chicago. From bottle. Pours burnt orange with tall foamy head. Slightly hazy. Nice balance of bitterness, citrus, pine, malt. Reminds me of a cross between Union Jack and Dogfish 60.

Bottle and draft - pours a medium gold . Big floral aromas . Taste is mild citrus with soft floral notes and a bit of malt sweetness . Very balanced . Delicious IPA . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hoppy but not overly bitter. Really nice floral notes in the nose and in the taste. Strong malt backbone to boot. Highly drinkable.

Great beer for people who are not IPA enthusiasts. Smells heavily of bready malt, barely even smells like an IPA. Very dark golden color - looks complex. Not a hop bomb like many IPAs, the malt is up front, then subtle hops that become more intense with the aftertaste but still manageable overall. Not overly carbonated. Great beer; I would drink this again and again. Ironic that there is a fish on the bottle, I could drink a few of these while fishing.
Had it on tap at Logan Hardware. A sturdy old favorite. Excellent hop nose classic amber hue and a hop IPA finish.

Bottle. Perfect copper colour, white head that recedes to a thin layer, tons of lace, lots of carb. Fresh aroma of hops , sweet malt. Tastes bitter, but not overpowering. Sweet, caramel malt. Really good.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2014 One of the first beers I tried that really opened my eyes to what a craft brewer can do. Finally getting around to rating it. Tasted from draft. Pours amber with a white head. Strong hop floral and citrus hop aroma. Taste is exceptionally well balanced IPA. Floral and citrus hops flavors with caramel malt sweetness. Medium bodied. Very drinkable and smooth. Just an incredible IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ok. Would not go out of my way for this. So many other decent brews. This is not in their wheelhouse. Not Hopslam and not a Stout.
Non-IPA drinker. A golden pur with thick, white head. Floral hop scents with light fruit. A nice taste that isnt too bitter. Very good for an IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2016 all i can say is that this an absolutely fantastic beer....great flavors citrus and hops...great finish....one of my favorite ipas...i cannot believe 2 ipas are rated higher...looks like time for a trip to vermont to see hills farmstead!....after 300+ beers this year i have now realized that this is my favorite beer...i would rather drink this than water!
Poured from the tap. Clear orangey yellow with white head. Fresh citrusy hop aroma. Taste of caramel malt and citrus hops. Very good balance, not overpowering. Medium body.
A citrusy hop bomb that is so well balanced, dangerously drinkable. A perfect beer in my book. CHEERS!
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 A very good beer that I would really like at anytime! This beer lives up to its rep! Go bells

Courtesy of Armando, thanks!

 Olyan színe van,mint a frissen főzött zöld teának, amibe már tettek egy kis mézet és citromot. Habja sűrű, fehér, kemény, dunyha szerű és kitartó. Illata nagyon kellemes és kiegyensúlyozott, gyümölcsös, virágos, gyantás, borókás, picit mézes, kék sajtos, élesztős. Íze is hozza azokat, amiket az illat alapján elvárnánk, hozzá még van benne egy jó adag frissen kaszált mezei virág és egy igazán kellemes, szinte selymes keserűség. Közepesen testes és szénsavas. Utóíze gyümölcsös, keserédes, a legvége igazán keserű és száraz. Ezt bizony tudnám kortyolgatni reggeltől estig!
This is a great beer for a non IPA lover. Easy on the palate. Very drinkable. Great color. Ordered this from tap at County Grill.
12oz bottle poured into a tumbler..golden,amber color..floral, citrus aroma..good hop profile..finished dry..very good IPA.
Klar orange, fint, hvidt, blivende skum. Aroma: malt, sødme, græs. Og et whiff af hvidløg!? Smagen er humle og malt med en medium bitterhed. Langt fra så humlet som lovet/forventet. Ok.

Draft at Clinton hall NYC for the launch event. Pours a hazy brown color with a head that fades.hoppy grapefruit characters with a great body. Awesome ipa

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice IPA, copper color and white head with grassy noted and a solid hop dry finish.
A mild happiness start, very present citrus taste throughout. Not overpowering in bitterness.
Draft. One of my favorite IPAs. Really nice bitter pine resin and floral flavor. Easy drinking.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 On draft. Pours a hazy golden wheat. Amazingly well balanced. Citrus and hops on the nose. Hints of hemp in the flavor. A+
This beer was rated best IPA for a reason. As an IPA lover, this is one of my favorites. A Michigan classic!

Gold color with white head. 

Not much in the aroma. 

A pleasant garlic hop flavor

Finishes dry

12 oz. bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy, dark gold color with a finger thick white head that settle to a film. Aroma is primarily piney hops with some malt in the background. Medium bodied with a nice balance of malt and hops. Finish is slightly dry. Excellent!!!

Clear golden under a thin white cap of head. Nose is wonderful with earthy grassy hops, and a bit of floral resin, atop a nice caramalty sweetness. Smooth and full balanced flavor, with gentle caramel biscuity sweetness, light bitterness, a touch of grass, a little floral resin, and a kiss of grapefruit rind. A wonderfully balanced and tasty brew thats tantalizingly easy to drink down.
Poured a slight hazy golden color, smelled some hop, pine and citrus but the taste is well balanced. A great readily available IPA.

I have had this on draft at a couple of different places and I thought it was just an average ipa. I recently have been buying this in bottles and it tastes so much better. For me it is usual the other way around. Has anybody else noticed this?
A unique IPA. Tastes mildly spicy with a small, inoffensive onion-like character. I enjoy it but it isn't my favorite of the style.

No mincing words here, if you are in the mood for an IPA, this is the beer you want. Good body and mouthfeel. They did not forget about the malt bill like some IPAs. The hop finish is prominent, but somehow never unbalanced or harsh. Most IPAs (and Im a big fan) have moments where the finish gets to be too much of a one note song that has never happened with this beer. For me, this is the yardstick other IPSs are judged by.
Love the fact that I can grab this beer whenever desired due to its availability in my region. A great solid beer from Bells!

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Golden yellow with very little visible carbonation but a thick head that lingers for quite a while. Smells like fresh hops; big pine and floral notes with some toast and caramel in the back. Flavors I notice are pine, a hint of citrus peel, bitter flowers. Body is a little light in a good way and finishes quite dry. Very well-balanced and drinkable.
May favorite beer discovery of 2013. For me the hoppy-ness is perfect. Great beer with pizza or filet mignon. Works out of the bottle, in a chilled glass or a used glass. Really good overall beer.
When in doubt, grab some two hearted. Always pleasantly surprised by just how good this beer is. Quintessential American IPA

A nice Golden color with big white head. Floral and grapefruit aromas. Nice finish and easy to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden color with small creamy tan-colored head. Floral and resinous hoppy aroma. Citrusy and somewhat grassy hoppy bitter flavor. Mellow and smooth bitter finish. Quite good.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 12 oz bottle poured into nonic. Half a finger of foamy white head quickly settles to a ring and thin center layer over hazy copper liquid. Dots of lace stick to the glass. Aroma is floral hops, caramel malt, citrus hop, slight tropical fruit. Taste is hop forward with grapefruit peel, floral, and earthy pine bitterness. Some biscuit malt sweetness. Medium body, creamy texture, moderate carbonation, bitter drying finish.
From the bottle. Citrus, pine and smooth malts, perfectly balanced, refreshing and super easy to drink. One of the best IPAs Ive had.

Got from a friend at work. Golden color with big white head. Floral hop and grapefruit aromas. Smooth caramel malt start then a really nice floral flavor and finish with oranges and grapefruit. Not a super bitter finish. Really nice and refreshing.

One of my favorite IPA's. Coming from a great brewery like Bell's located in Michigan, by far one of the best IPA's in the Midwest. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Got in a trade from Seth and this was an extra. Thanks again Seth. Poured a soft orange hue, slightly cloudy. Nose was slight grapefruit and lemon. Great mouthfeel slightly spicey, maybe a littel nutmegish flavor. Perfectly balanced.and not too much of any one thing. I love India pale ales and this one is great. I could drink this every day.

Such a simple yet great beer! It flows like water up here in Michigan, but I often take this staple for granted. Pours a nice medium golden with a fluffy 2 finger head, great retention, nice lacing spotted across and coating the glass. Aromas are inviting. Floral hops, some piney sweetness. Taste is incredibly smooth and balanced. Bitter Centennial hop showcase, lay delicately across a sweet malt backbone. They hold each other up well, never wavering in one direction. Very simple profile, yet so few IPAs get this balance. Medium body, medium carbonation, crisp and moderately dry finish and well hidden ABV make this all too easy to drink.

12oz bottle sent in the mail from Doug. Pours a very pale golden with a white head and tons of lacing. Huge hop aroma. Big flowery hop notes and citrus flavors. Probably the best IPA I have tasted that isnt classified as an imperial or DIPA. It definitely seems closer to a Dogfish 90, or a Heady Topper than your regular IPAs yet they somehow manage to pack all this goodness into a reasonable 7% ABV allowing me to safely have more than one. Only problem is the second bottle exploded during shipping and I cant find these anywhere in my area. Doug, I need more...
Great beer! Nice and smooth. Goes down well and has a nice after taste. Could be one of my regular beers.

A- nice citrus, fresh hopps
Ap- golden body, small white head, some nice white lace
T- citrus, hoppy ness is well balanced and refreshing 
P- crisp nice bubbly smooth mouthfeel 
O- very good balanced easy to drink IPA

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2014 Sweet citrus smell and good hoppy taste. Dont get me wrong, this is a very good IPA, but just not as great as everyone else seems to think I guess... in my opinion. It also seems that this is not nearly as good as it was a few years back. In addition, I have had 6 packs that are great and others that taste just so so. This cannot be my imagination. A product of mass production perhaps?
My go to IPA. This is what I compare all others too. Love the smell and great hoppiness. Another to try is founders Centennial.
Such a great beer!! Beautiful blend of pine and citrus up front. Slight malt backbone. This is a go to IPA
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Lives up to the hype. Floral bouquet. Really hop forward with nice malty backbone. Crisp clean get away. Delicious

Pours clear gold with thick white head. Aroma is light balance hops and malt. Flavor is more of the same. No super strong flavor just super balanced. Mouthfeel is extremely smooth with low carbonation. Overall an excellent ipa super tasty super smooth.
Gold pour. Nice floral aroma. Delicious floral hop flavor, not too bitter. Great body, really smooth. A fantastic IPA.
Excellent hoppy flavor. This will defiantly go on my favorites list Wish it available where I live
Very nice, well balanced ale. Extra pale ale comes to mind. Nice citrus, lemon rind, grapefruit hops balance out the medium malt flavors. Great quick sharp citrus burst on the finish. Nice !

I dont know if its the beer or my palate, but the great Two Hearted has not tasted very consistent to me. Ive had it on tap and loved it, and Aldo out of bottles, but Ive also had more than a few that taste downright awful; one of those "no one could possibly enjoy this" awful. I dont get it, so Ill average my love/hate. Supreme tangerine in look, aroma, and taste (when on), and has a great, light, body. Unfortunately the seemingly inconsistent batches normally steer me away, especially in bottles.
Tap at winslows, greenville nc. Clear deep golden color, smooth white head. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, grapefruit, some lemon notes. Medium body, hops, grass, grapefruit. Dry hoppy finish.

Light citrus aroma, beautiful golden orangey-yellow body. Lots of tiny bubbles of carbonation, however the mouthfeel does not seem overly carbonated. Has a smooth, velvety, semi-thick texture. Taste is piney with a bit of grapefruit. Overall it is sweet with a medium bitterness. Excellent IPA, a refreshing example of restraint and sophistication among the hop-bombs.
I love the little hint of citrus on the finish of this beer. Its definitely one of my favorite IPAs.
On tap at OHSO in Phoenix. Crisp citrus hops blended with pine and malty sweetness. Super smooth. Some light spice. Mild bitterness throughout. Nice lingering IPA finish. Tasty.

A wonderful ale with a great hop/malt balance. Tons if flavor in this beer. Crisp finish with floral hop aroma.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Solid pale ale. Nice hop aroma. Deep golden color with a white head. Light and crisp, clean palate. Good carbonation. This beer seems to hover between IPA and pale ale as it is not over the top. Hops are upfront but the grains are earthy and sweet enough for balance. Alcohol is hidden well. Refreshing beer and worth a revisit.

Poured from bottle: pours hazy golden with a frothy white head. Aroma of pine, floral, and grass. Taste is awesome, nice balance of hops and malt, not all citrus, just an awesome IPA. Medium body, clean finish. Great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Outrageously good ale. Two Hearted Ale has a balance that defines perfection. The ratio of hops to malt is sublime. The sweet malt tastes are complimented by the bold hops and vice versa. In terms of bitterness, this IPA isnt a hop bomb. It doesnt claim to be and it doesnt have to be. This is a well-rounded, flavorful IPA that is hoppy without being punishing.

Thanks to Awalk1227 for this one!
Poured to NB globe

A: Hazy golden ale. Nice, fine creamy head dissipates quickly leaving a quilt of bubbles which are patiently assisted with a low carbonation visibly rising to the surface. 

S: cotton candy, sweet peach, pine and hemp are the highlights. Not a citrus bomb like many IPAs these days. Smells fresh, nice and unique among the genre. Quite enjoyable.

T: Again, cotton candy, bubble gum. Not particularly bitter. Im a bit baffled, and intrigued by this beer. Bells seems to have a different take on IPAs than Im used to. Not bad, but different. I am obliged to say I like this.

M: Medium body with higher carbonation that spices the tongue. Leave mouth well moisturized and compels me to take another sip. Fun.

D: This beer is for the faint of heart. If I were having a tasting with a bunch of hopheads that just wanted a slam of hops to the face, I would not bring this. If I were to serve an IPA to oenophile, I would serve this. They have done a great job finding a beautiful combo. And lucky for them, it is a flagship!

Serving type: bottle

01-23-2011
Nice full flavor without being too filling. Nice and drinkable beer. Im a big fan of this
Always a great IPA. Consistently well balanced. Great mouth feel. Always my go to when in doubt.

One of my go to IPAs. Dark hazy orange with big foamy head. Citrus and floral nose that lead to a sweeter taste. Plenty of malt, a touch if bitterness. Lightish mouthfeel for an ipa. Easy drinking stuff.

Very good beer from a very good home brewery here in Michigan. This seems like their flagship beer and is truly one of their most known even though it doesn't make the top 50. If you like IPAs, give this one a try.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Btl pours hazy orange color, massive dense, creamy head,stays around forever leaving tons of lace as its consumed. Big aroma of floral and citrus hops. Faint smell of dank grass. Moderate sweet malty, cookie dough smell. Refreshingly sweet malt flavor followed by big grapefruit and mandarin orange fresh hop taste. Medium body,dry texture, perfect carbonation with a nice,crisp,moderate bitter finish. This IPA is perfectly balanced and so easy to drink. Smooth, fresh,clean flavors leave the tongue wanting more! Definitely one of the top IPAs in my book.

While this beer doesnt have one particular thing that stands way out there and grabs you. It is such a well balanced beer that you can pick up and enjoy anytime. I usually prefer not the stronger tasting hopped iPas. This one still satisfy s me on all levels

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 A totally solid IPA. May not be my favourite ever - but would say it is to IPA what Sierra Nevada is to pale ale. The bar has been set high. Pours a hazy orange color with a decent one finger cream head with staying power. Taste is nicely balanced- citrus, malty, floral, sweet, grapefruit, hint of grass (the good kind). Finishes dry- perhaps a bit more than I would expect. Sort of leaves a puckery feeling after each sip. But, it is an IPA, after all. Well balanced and solid. Not 100 in my book, but if it aint broke.......
1/3/2015   Still delicious.  Floral notes dominate.   Nice slickness to it. Definitely bitter/astrigent in the finish.  Appropriately so for an IPA, just have to be prepared for this one.  
07/05/2015  On tap at Mezzaluna.  Even better than the bottle.  Super crisp finish- somewhat less bitter. Delicious.

Sweet citrus aroma, faint but appealing. Golden honey-like appearance, slightly cloudly. Clean hoppy grapefruit flavor. Light body with strong hop aftertaste. Delicious and drinkable if you enjoy a mild-flavored IPA.
Drank this draw at mavericks on a random Sunday night. I did like it. Kind of a strong fruity taste.
Pouts hazy orange-yellow. Piney, citrusy aroma, loaded with grapefruit. Mouthfeel is crisp, with much high bitterness. Medium sweetness, dry. A stellar IPA. Very drinkable.

Yellowish golden, lightly cloudy, white foam that dosnt last. Aroma of flowers, citrus and fruit. Taste is malty and fruity but followed by big bitterness. The bitter aftertaste magnifies as it goes. A really good beer
best IPA everhas a refreshing pain he happy taste in the beginning in a smooth overall gorgeous put something down your mouth ah feelingnothing will ever be this good I love you balls god bless
Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy amber with off white head. Aroma of grassy hops and citrus. Taste is well balanced hops with nice bitterness. Some malt as well. Great everyday IPA. One of my favorites.
This was a very good beer. Bought a growler to share... Should have bought 10! Thank you for such a great beer!

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2013 Not the first time having this one. Always a go to. Traditional and well executed hop balance. Not necessarily unique house flavor but stands as a good reference flavor to compare variations in other beers. High carbonation and medium bitterness for the style. Finishes a bit nutty. Great go to beer
Copper colored ale with a foamy white head. Has a nice balance of bitter hops and a nice full body feel. Not overly sweet, goes down smooth.
One of my favorite IPAs. Smells like a well balanced IPA should, citrus and pine. Its really smooth, without an overpowering bitterness at any point. If youre a fan of IPAs you need to try this.

Ambrée. Légèrement voilé. Fin collet dense et blanc. Nez: frais. Paille. Houblon. Herbacé. Vert. Bouche: végétale. Un peu malté. Belle amertume. Peu de saveur mais tout de même bonne. Florale. Légère. Peut être un peu vieille mais bon produit quand même.

Bottle at home. Orange pour with a huge, tight, white head. Aroma of citrus and distant sage. Very pungent. This is all about the balance. Just enough malt to let the hops shine unhindered. In the same class as Pliny. Very fruity, bitter finish.
Bottle in The Pub, Orlando, 20th November 13. This is a great IPA and amongst the most floral and perfumed I have had. Delicious taste, so balanced and drinkable. Loved this. Rate # 600

I had this at Global Brew. Pours hazy amber with a off white head. Taste sweet, citrus, crisp. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

on the backend:

I definitely recommend this beer. This beer is the definition of a well balanced ipa.

I definitely enjoyed this beer. The drinkability exceeded my expectations.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy amber with a generous creamy off-white head. Decent but light aroma of caramel and pine. Balanced flavor, but a bit too balanced for my taste. I find the hops profile to be somewhat lacking. While I certainly dont hate this beer, I consider it an average IPA.
The quintessential IPA. Enough malts to battle back against the amazing hop profile. An easy drinker that is staple of many craft beer enthusiasts.

Well put together IPA. Not overly bitter and a great aroma. I prefer the draft over the bottles, it's seems to promote the hops a little better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Enjoyed this at a Scottish Pub in Savannah, GA. Strong floral aroma. My favorite so far.

bottle. Poured hazy amber with a creamy white head. Strong floral hop aroma. Full body, prickly carbonation, mouthfeel is thick with an astringent finish. Very fresh hop flavour, citrus and herbal notes with some bready malt.

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a light beige head. Very fruit forward nose, citrus peel, resinous notes, tropical fruit, and a faint doughy note. As for taste, much lighter bodied than I was expecting, with fruit up front, mostly grapefruit, resinous notes, with more citrus in the finish. Good bitterness that doesnt overwhelm, and really well balanced. Add to that, the alcohol is hidden very well. Hey Ontario, get this in six packs RIGHT NOW!

One of my all time faves. Hazy bronze pour with vanishing off-white head. Big floral and citrus hop nose. Abundant sweet malt backbone. Grapefruit. Pine. Flower bouquet. Wonderfully bitter and perfectly sweet. Slick and smooth, soft carbonation. Absolutely delightful.
Smell is floral hops, citrus. Taste is clean crisp malty pine citrus hops. The 7% abv is hidden well. Almost as good as Sweetwater IPA :-)
One of the best go to ipas around. Bells puts out consistently great quality brews in the US

I guess Ive never rated this although Ive had it a hundred times or so. 12 oz bottle poured into an imperial pint (use a tulip glass if you have one on hand). Pours a slightly hazy light amber with small off white head. Smells of pine, tropical fruits, sweet caramel and biscuit. Tastes begins with a malty caramel sweetness and then transitions to the hops; starts with the tropical fruits, citrus, then heavy pine and grassiness and ends with a drying bitterness. Aftertaste lingers on the tip of the tongue. Medium to light bodied, very flavorful and very sessionable. Delicious beer, alcohol is well hidden.
Incredibly floral nose. So light and crisp. Hoppy and refreshing without a bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 Rerate:  Pour from 12 oz. bottle. Pours a medium orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine tropical fruits, white grapes, caramel, and sweet malts. Taste is  citrus, pine, caramel, tropical fruits, white grapes, and sweet malts. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a very good IPA is probably the best  single IPA brewed in the Midwest.

FROM NOTES: July 10, 12
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass. 

A: Big hop bitterness, citrus and piney aromas, sweet malt in the background. 
A: Pours a slightly hazy & golden in color with a white head & great lacing.
T: Nice bitter hops, complimented well by some citrus and grapefruit. The malt is almost perfect and the finish is smooth. 
P: Great carbonation. Creamy and crisp. Perfect for an IPA. 
O: A top notch American IPA. Not too hop forward and very well balanced for both the aroma and feel.
12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy amber with light head. Aromas of candied grapefruit and tropical fruit. Flavours of toffee, sweet grapefruit and toasted malts. Very nice.

Oct. 31, 2013; 12 oz. bottle fr. sixer purchased @ Nice-n-Easy convenience store, Sangerfield, NY. Sampled in a tumbler glass. Rich, golden pour. Ample head. Sturdy lacing. Floral aroma. How often is it that you find virtually nothing "wrong" with a particular brew - especially in the crowded IPA field? Fabulously well-balanced; the malt has not been forsaken in favor of the hops; not overpowering in any respect. Exquisitely-long, pleasantly-bitter/astringent, slightly-sticky mouthfeel & finish. One of the best IPAs Ive ever sampled - quite a surprise.
One of the best ipas around. As close to perfection as you can get. Looks great, smells great, tastes great.
Caramel colour, short lasting head. Complex aroma, of citrus, clove, and banana. Intriguing taste of bubblegum, spice, bitter, hint of citrus. Bitter palate, hint of citrus.
Poured from a bottle. Cloudy orange color, slight white head. Citrus floral hops smell. Light bodied citrus hops flavor with a nice bread like finish.
On tap at the Bells Eccentric Cafe. Copper color with citrus aroma. Flavor is nice, balanced toward the hops.

On tap at Tommy Condons -  Aroma is floral. Pours a clear amber with a lasting foamy white head and loads of ringed lacing. The taste follows the nose. Nice balance between hops and malts, with the nod going to the hops. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, an enjoyable and well crafted IPA that is extremely enjoyable. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours slightly hazy. Golden and hued with orange. A creamy head of white foam tops this beer and it leaves sheets of lace as you drink. The nose is terrific with hops. First some ripe tropical fruit, mango, apricot and pineapple. Then a nice honey sweetness and a bit of faint spice. The drink has more bread than you expected form the nose. Faint grain and a brisk dryness. The fruity and floral hops fill up the palate with a bouquet of flavors. Tart citrus, stone fruit and tropical sweetness , honey and a light pine. The supple malt is a bready and shy but you can taste the grain on the palate and theres a bit of bitter. The mouthfeel is slick. Silky and creamy. Finishes dry and with a floral aftertaste. 

This is not the usual in your face IPA. This one is subtle and gentle. It has a powerful hop character that presents big fruit but also the delicate floral aspects. In the drink the floral is powerful and reminds me of honeysuckle. It drinks softly like an english IPA. its graceful and flowing.
Bottle. One of my favorites and not hard to get your hands on. Clear copper pour white fluffy white head. Hops, citrus and grapefruit aroma and taste. Delicious.-- rated with Beerbasher

Easily one of the smoothest ipas Ive ever come across. Delicate hop aroma, attractive golden pour w/ a big white head & good lacing, & such a clean/crisp taste. This is an outstanding ipa! While the bitterness is present, this beer is so refreshing & tasty! Great beer!
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2013 Pineapple & citrus aroma, smooth & balanced flavor. Nice orange color with a very thin head. Nice crisp mouthfeel & finish.. After taste is a bit more sour than I would like.

One of my favorite beers not too happy just Wright decent alcohol content of seven percent wonderful aroma very crisp taste I would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes and ipa great representation of a wonderful michigan beer

Great taste . Good for football and a relaxing afternoon at Lake Hartwell, GA.
Pours easily with hoppy aroma. Smooth on the palate with pleasant aftertaste.
Poured in a lovely 23 ounce glass that really enhances the whole experience. Smooth and flavorful, I'm not sure if I'll enjoy this first one the most, or the second one I'm about to have

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2013 Slight floral hop aroma and some citrus aroma. Hop aroma not too strong. Taste is extremely well balanced. Some citrus grapefruit hop flavor and a slight bitter finish. Malt character balance is at just the right level. A very enjoyable ipa, that has nice flavors, but none really dominate. ( rate lower than sculpin as sculpin has more fruity, hops, even almost mango like aroma and flavor that this does not have) ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2014 Aroma of bread, citrus and perfume. Flavor is a perfect balance of malt and hops. Finish is long and dry with a dollop of malty caramel sweetness. Too balanced. I like more hops.

12oz bottle. Gold color, clear, moderate head, and good lacing. Aroma is grapefruit and citrus. Taste is balanced, somewhat bitter, and complex. Palate is medium, and the aftertaste is long. Impressive that a beer of this quality is relatively cheap and easy to find. Definitely recommended, a must-try.

Bottle pour of a slightly hazy honey gold with a nice white frothy head. Aroma of big grapefruit at first with under tones of piney floral hops and some sweet fruits. Taste of sweet apricots, and pineapple that leads into the piney but citrusy hops that ends just a little bitter. Med lively and sticky body that has a bitter finish that does not linger too long. Over all very interesting and well balanced IPA that has depth and layers that make you keep wanting more. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle dated 08/20/13. Bottles two months old. Porn the golden clear pore with a decent whitehead. Smell is cat piss, grapefruit, little citrus and malt. Taste is a little bit better, little bit of grapefruit malty backbone. Carbonation is high with a better finish. Would like to taste this fresh.

On draft at Webers. The pour is a beautiful dark gold with a thick white head, and gorgeous lacing down the glass. The aroma is heavy in grapefruit and orange. Very hoppy. The taste is just as hoppy and citrusy. Just a beautiful dry finish. Great beer

Bottle. Pours a a nice amber with white head. Has an amazing hop aroma. Taste is nice and bitter but goes down so smooth and clean. Leaves no bad after taste like some ipas.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2013 Draft at coles. Golden Amber body with a thin white head. Lacing. Nose is fruity hops with some pine. taste is a balanced sweet tropical fruitiness, grassy hops, malt finish. Long bitter sweet finish.

Nice thick white head, hazy color, amazing aroma...hints of pine, citrus, pineapple. Amazing
A perennial favorite for a not-always-my-preferred-style. A very agreeable IPA with nice hops that dont turn too bitter. Can be quite sessionable too, with the 7% abv fairly manageable.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 Tap: deep amber & copper with a somewhat hazy body and a solid white head that retains like a champ and leaves great lacing on all sides of the glass. Aroma & flavor of Two Hearted are the exact definition of "balance", especially in a style thats largely hop focused. White pepper covered grapefruit peel, large floral notes, flowers, perfume, mild tangerine, slight grassy & leafy back-end with a perfect hint of bitterness. Masterful balance of toasted bread & biscuit-y malt. The key here isnt complexity or adjuncts - its execution. Simple, yet remarkable. Great IPA, benchmark of the style.

12oz bottle, thanks to JulienHuxley. Pours hazy honey with a small frothy white head. Aroma is fresh, floral and fruity. Peach, mango, apricot, grapefruit, toffee and fruity esters. Taste is dough, caramel, citrus, bubblegum with subtle bitterness. Little alcohol warmth. Medium body, dry, crisp and clean. So smooth! Excellent!
This an amazing English ipa. It has a beautiful color and a great citrusy nose. Its a very sessionable beer as well.
If I was to pick only one beer for the rest of my life it would be the Bells Two Hearted Ale.
One word for this beer: Balanced. Aroma, taste, head, carbonation, bitterness, just everything!

From a tap, after having 2 Matilda's from goose island (which I liked). Floral pine weed aroma. Pours golden in color, not much head from this tap. First sip a nice touch of bitter hops, clean. Fresh floral, pine notes. Very nice beer, hoppy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. How is it that I got to nearly 5600 ratings before getting to this? An IPA that, above all, demonstrates a lovely balance. Malts here are just enough to support the incredibly aromatic hop character. Floral and fruity with a bit of pine in the end, this was hugely flavourful while remaining sessionably drinkable. Terrific!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: The beer has a decent light orange, hazy color to it. It has a nice white head, well carbonated, with mild lacing on the glass. The smell is piney, a small note of citrus, and mild earthy scent. The taste is great with a piney flavor up front but not over powering, it gives away to mild citrus but stays hoppy but very well balanced. The mouthfeel sticks with you for a while with the bitterness from the piney, hoppy tastes. Overall, this is a great APA, well balanced but definitely has the hops...definitely recommmended.

On tap @ Park Plaza in Prescott, AZ. Pours a golden yellow with a nice white head. Aroma is fresh grapefruit, pine, citrus, floral and hops. Taste is hops, pine, oranges, lemons and grapefruit with a nice floral hint in the bitter finish. Very balanced, medium bodied with good carbonation. Excellent refreshing brew!

From tap and also from a bottle. A strong hoppiness, but not overly bitter. The hops pair well with the carbonation to give a physical bite along with the bitter bite. Bitterness does not last long. Good! The one negative (at least with the one I poured to a glass from a bottle) is the aroma; a bit of a metallic smell.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 This one is by far one of the best by a great company. Available everywhere and year round. Having this one on tap is one of the best experiences you can have.
this ipa might just b my fav so far. not to crazy on the hopage but just enough. what i think i like most is how it finishes

2 month old bottle poured to my SN IPA glass. 

A- Golden to orange color with brilliant clarity, pours with a two finger white head. Good retention and lacing, which lasts throughout the glass.

S- Smells of grapefruit and pineapple with a slight yeast character also present. A slight caramel sweetness possibly from the malt in the background. 

T- Floral and grassy hop flavors along with some citrus fruit, once again the pineapple and grapefruit from the nose is apparent. A sweet note (possibly caramel malt?) is present on the back end of the sip. Moderate bitterness, but it doesnt overpower or peel your enamel like some in the style. No alcohol taste is present.

M- Medium/high carbonation, low/medium mouthfeel, and a great drying note on the end from the low finishing gravity of this beer really dries things out and makes for a refreshing beer that you want to take another sip of almost immediately.

O- Trying to be as objective as possible with this one, but in all honesty, I just love this beer! It is incredibly drinkable; I could easily drink 3-4 of these in the time it takes me to drink some other IPAs. The flavors of the centennial hops dominate, but there is enough malt to back it up. In addition, the finishing gravity of this beer makes for an easy drinking beer that doesnt fill you up.
Beautifully glowing golden hue, wow! Bursting flavors of licorice, fruit punch, tropical fruits, and the perfect hop bitterness making it a damn near perfect IPA. Cant get enough of this.
Very smooth IPA. I am not a fan of bitter IPA. This one rolls smooth off the palate.

This is one of my all around favorite IPAs, pours a nice dark gold with a white head. Smells floral, citrusy and piny. This ipa tastes amazing, perfectly balanced in my opinion. Looking forward to this being in New York State any day now, been waiting for the day for a while and will be very happy to be enjoying this ipa year round.

Bottled on 08/13/13 so relatively fresh. Pours a nice dark golden with a nice white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is citrusy, piny and floral. Some light dank notes too. Taste is medium bitter with not much sweetness to be found. It isnt over the top, though. Bitterness is really smooth and the hoppy flavors are never harsh. Moderate carbonation, medium bodied. Nice citrusy flavors again. Awesome IPA!
Pours dark golden with off white head. Nose is of stong dank citrus grassy hops. Good bodied with floral hops in taste. Tons of malt in the body...maybe too much.
Trade from Dak, thanks! Pours orange gold with an off white head. Aroma of vanilla and biscuit. Taste is light, citrus,,vanilla and flowers. Alcohol well hidden. Quite nice and delicate.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Pours straw yellow gold into a hazy light orange amber. Head is yellow-white and settles to a coating. Aroma is floral vanilla hops and mild citrus. Taste is smooth and crisp with a floral start, maltiness and an orange citrus bitter hop finish. Aftertaste is a balance of bitterness and flowers. Just the right amount of carbonation. A very tasty, easy-drinking and well-balanced IPA. A classic go-to beer of the style. There is no better-named beer and the fish label is great.

Lovely aroma, fruity and fragrant. Hops and malt intertwine during drinking rather than the malt forward and hop on the backside. God knows how they did that.

pours a beautiful reddish copper with small white head. aroma of citrus and fruit hops. tastes of vibrantly fruity hops with some earthy mineral tones. delicious. palate is medium bodied.

pours an orangish hazy gold color with a frothy off-white head. Slight citrus mixed with the hops. Hoppy but with a malt balance and with a bit of a resin taste at the back. Very good IPA that I come back to many times.

Pour is clear amber/golden with white head and good lacing.Aroma of grassy, light citrus, fruity. Taste is fruity hops, grassy, light citrus, little sweet malts, fairly dry finish. Low body and meidum-low carb. Very honest IPA. not a masterpiece but something i would enjoy regulary.

Pours a very hazy yellow golden with a extraordinarily large, foamy, bumpy off white head with an orangish hue. Sweet citrus fruit flesh and citrus zest bouquet. Wet mouthfeel with a mild burn on the rear of the palate and the inside of the lips. The burn seems attributable to both microscopically fine carbonation and hop heat. Some bread in the flavor. Orange is present, and some table sugar sweetness to balance the bitterness. The bitterness does linger some after the sweetness fades. Great regional example of the style.
For anyone looking to try a good starter IPA, Two Hearted Ale is a great choice.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a beautiful hazy gold with a decent head and good lacing. Smell is awesome, pine, hops, citrus, banana, maybe even a touch of clove. Taste is just as impressive, sweet earthy malt balanced by a perfect hop profile with just the right bitterness, and a nice citrusy spice. A bit of an alcohol presence that fades into the hops. Very smooth mouth feel. One the best single IPAs I've had, if not the very best. I was lucky enough to get a case of this through a friend in Pennsylvania, as they do not distribute anywhere in New England or New York.

text: Ive had this beer on many occasions. Its a quality brew, but not as tasty even as a couple of other Michigan IPAs. Fresh, on-tap, it seems to have more bite. Perhaps Ive had it too often at bars that didnt have fresh brew. On most occasions, it just lacks bite.

12 oz. bottle poured into tulip glass. Appearance is hazy golden orange with a medium eggshell-white head. Aroma is fantastic. Sweet orange and malt on top of floral, pine, and other subtle citrus scents. Taste is more floral and pine, and there is a bitterness following the light malty sweetness. Very smooth, crisp feel. This is a fantastic beer, one of the best Ive had. It even puts other IPAs to shame. The guys at Bells know what theyre doing.

At first thought thia was just another Bells beer, but no!! Two Hearted is hoppy off the nose, with a light malt after taste. Very smooth for an IPA, which is almost unheard of. As with most of Bells beers it it very well balanced with tastes of fruit and spice. This one is FANTASTIC! Bells never ever disappointes!

Two Hearted is bold and beautiful. This is a hop assault and if youre not into that you may be excused! I prefer mine in a tulip but this is one of those rare ales that noses well in almost any glass. The tropical fruits hit me first, mango and pineapple,guava; the deep undertow is earthy herbs and flowers. The nose is STELLAR! The color is of a robust lager really, much lighter that the standard IPA hue. A hazy light orange with a tiny bubbled bright white head. The first sip is an immediate hop assault. Theres some cracker like malt presence in the very way back. but this is about da hops! The carbonation is flat out perfect! I want to rant about how amazingly complex the hop profile in this baby is! There is no friggin doubt this deserves all the accolades heaped upon it. A must rotation ale for all hopheads to which it is available!

Ipas are not my favorite but this is a great refreshing beer.

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Maxime D. De couleur orangée-dorée et claire. Nez de houblon fruité (agrumes, léger de pêches, notes dabricots), moyennement citrique, légèrement floral, résineux et herbeux avec des notes épicées (poivre doux), moyen de céréales fraîches et sucrées avec des notes de pain et de caramel doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse et huileuse. Goût moyennement amer de houblon fruité (agrumes sucrées, léger dabricots et de pêches), moyennement citrique, légèrement floral, herbeux avec des notes épicées (poivre doux) et résineuses (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) accompagné de notes de pain lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de malt frais et légèrement sucré avec des notes de miel et de caramel très doux puis en finale lamertume de houblon prend une tournure plus résineuse, plus herbeuse et légèrement asséchante. Post-goût long-moyen et légèrement sec, moyennement amer de houblon fruité (zeste dagrumes, notes de pelures de pêches), herbeux, moyennement résineux et citrique avec des notes épicées et florales.

Il doit faire 42 degrés à Key West.  On marche sur Duval et nous avons soif.  Que vois-je à lhorizon?  Un World of Beer!  Un petit pit-stop simpose.  Cest ma première bière en fût bue sur cette île certainement quétaine.  La fameuse Two Hearted arrive devant moi comme une oasis après 8 jours de marche dans le désert El Azizia.  Le nez est explosif et cest peu dire.  Mes narines sont complètement assaillies par une horde de fruits aux dents bien acérées : des pêches et des agrumes de toute sorte montrent une sublime puissance.  Impressionnant.  Une fois le choc passé, je trouve, derrière cette expertise fruitée, autre chose de très vert comme la rencontre entre une forêt boréale et une forêt de la côte ouest : jai des conifères et des fleurs qui poussent dans les orifices de mes fosses nasales.  Je suis ravi.  La première gorgée est fantastique.  La seconde et les suivantes sont merveilleuses.  Jai sur les papilles des saveurs maltées mielleuses et des saveurs houblonnées à me faire croire que dieu peut exister linstant de quelques lampées: je me prosterne quelques secondes face à Kalamazoo en louangeant les fleurs, le cèdre et les fruits tropicaux et du verger qui arrivent comme une volonté divine.  En bouche, tout est fait pour me plaire.  Le corps presque huileux et le pétillement calibré de cette bière sont des facteurs qui facilitent grandement sa buvabilité.  Cette bière est tellement facile à boire que je dois me retenir entre chaque gorgée pour faire durer le plaisir.  La finale, comme une ode aromatique, est plutôt sèche et moyennement intense.  Nul doute que cette proposition est extraordinaire.  Extraordinaire car elle est excessivement fraîche et extraordinaire car, pour un moment, je suis Ernest Hemingway et je pars à linstant boire un coup au Sloppy Joes.
Great everyday ipa, blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah its good just drink it

Had this beer many times, both draft and out of the bottle. Always enjoyed as it has never dissapointed. One of the 1st craft beers I was exposed to, so it holds a special place in my heart. Creamy mouthful, very smooth, slight sweet malt backbone with a citrus hop flavor. Good spring, summer, fall, winter beer. Recommend to others.

Bottle at Bella Bacino. Pours deep golden amber with a thick off white head. Aromas and taste of hops, citrus, malts and pine resin. Great balance between all the flavor profiles.Taste is not overly bitter and is incredibly drinakble. Really refreshing. Great IPA.

Really one of my favorite IPAs from the Midwest.  To many of these will leave you with a sour stomach though from it being unfiltered and thick.

Aroma is quite light with peaches and apricot. Flavour has grassy hops, some fruits, floral notes and biscuits. Also some gooseberry bush and honey. A bit of a disappointment.

Slightly hazy golden color with a thin, foamy beige head.  Sweet floral and citrus hops and creamy malt aroma.  Flavor is zesty citrus hops and a creamy malt background.  Medium to full bodied with a lingering creamy malt and citrus finish.  Still serve it cold but let this one warm just slightly and this is just a flat out good beer.

Poured from a bottle.  Golden yellow with one finger of foamy head that recedes to a thin cap with excellent lacing.  The aroma is outstanding - floral, hops, citrus.  Taste follows the aroma, but you also get the balance of the sweet malts and a zesty spice that finishes appropriately bitter.  Two Hearted is crisp, but not overly carbonated.  The body is moderate and it goes down fairly smoothly.  Overall, a solid IPA.

Pours hazy yellow with two finger white head and leaves a few lines of lacing.  The aroma is outstanding with citrus and floral hops.  The taste is extremely balanced for an IPA.  It has a great mix of citrus and floral hops combined with some caramel malt flavors.  It doesnt have much bitterness, but great flavor.

The aroma is of honey, and fruit. It pours a rich color for an IPA. It really balances fruit, sweetness, and hops. Unlike most IPA it really has a clean finish. IPA is not my favorite style but this really is one of the best IPAs.

Good color, light citrus flavor with a little bite at the end of it. It's my everyday IPA that I compare all the rest to.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The basis for comparison. Amazing balance of hoppiness and sweetness is what makes this beer stand out from others. When the sweet malty flavor begins to fade away the hops kick in with an incredible aftertaste without being overbearing.

Pours a clear golden color with a finger length head that leaves good lacing.  Had a strong floral aroma.  Real bitter and hoppy flavors, and had just enough of a malt backbone.  A hop heads delight, nice and easy to guzzle.
A great IPA! Hoppy and refreshing. Has a citrus and and grapefruit element.

The IPA that I use to judge all other IPAs against.  The nose is incredible.  Floral and tropical fruit and of course awesome hop notes.  Sweet clean, balanced.   The best IPA I have had consistently to date.
Pours a golden brown body with a citrus and hoppy aroma. Tastes slightly bitter with a citrus, hops, and malt notes. Great IPA from the midwest

Dense and ever so slightly syrupy. Big hop, sticky goodness. Gold amber body with close to no head. One of the best standard IPAs out there, a favorite for sure!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 Draft at melt in Cleveland, aroma is floral, citrus, pine.. Taste is well balanced with plenty of malt and nice bitterness.. Just the way I like it

Bottle and draft, from notes. Pours a slightly hazy gold with normal white head. Aroma is slightly dank with some lemon and hop. Taste is middle of the road but in a great way. The hops, malt and such all work well. Lemon and some spice here. Great Midwest IPA.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Color: golden yellow. 
Smell: citrus, hopy,  little bitter
Taste: citrus, wheat, hops, bitter notes. 
Aftertaste: medium in length. Crisp
Bells Two-Hearted Ale is a good beer with an impressive alcohol content. Worth at least a few tries.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2013 Over pints at the Great Lost Bear in Portland, ME, recently, two chums and I pondered what ONE beer we would choose if we were limited to drinking just one style the rest of our lives. After hard deliberation, I realized its obvious: Bells Two Hearted Ale is my choice for everyday excellence. Nothing tastes like home quite like this. Two Hearted is the taste of the heart of America!

Tap. Resinny pine aroma
Golden, low head
Nice broad leafy and piney hops
Slightly sticky resin on a medium sweet body..
The color is a bit of a honey color, being golden yellow. The taste is very citrus with a hint of wheat and hops. It is also high in alcohol content. This is a good price and one of bells best.

It is a Golden-yellow, cloudy honey color. 

It is a Citrus, wheat, a bit more alcohol than you might expect from this type, and just a hint of coriander, but maybe Im imagining that. Hops, too. Its all there.
What is there to say. One of the best IPAs in the game. Tons of fruit. Very drinkable..The bomb.
12oz bottle. Pours a deep orange color with a small creamy white head. Aroma is floral, citrus, pine, and bready malt. Taste is orange, lemon, pine, sweet malt, and a bit of bitter grapefruit.

I have had an affinity for this beer ever since it first made its way to Georgia.  The name is a pleasant reminder of the trip to the U.P. I took with my late Grandpa Britt the summer after my 13th birthday.  We fished the river and I remember him taking some brilliant sunset pictures.  This beer does justice to those wonderful memories.   Pours the orange side of amber with perfect head and beautiful lacing.  Mouthfeel is lively without being overbearing.  Flavor is citrus with an ideal level of bitterness.  This beer should be a staple of every IPA lovers diet.  Bottle - Dakota Blue - Atlanta, GA

Had on tap at Bells Eccentric Café. Pours a beautiful amber with a nice foamy head. Aroma is citrusy, with hints of pine and sweet fruitiness. Flavor is hoppy with citrus tones and a lot of caramel maltyness that balances it out excellently. This is my go-to beer for drinking. Its my favorite and its available everywhere. If you havent tried this beer yet you need to.

This is my favorite beer. It tastes marvelous and is just a great beverage to drink anytime. At 7% ABV it packs the right amount of kick so that you only need to drink a few to make you happy. It tastes like joy and is sold everywhere, and for a good reason. This is bells most popular beer because it is amazing, easy to drink, tastes delicous, and is just great. I love this beer.

36cl, American brew, bottled on Jan 17th 2013, thx to Secret Santa!, complex bitter brew, malty/fruity and slightly floral/woody, easy to drink, very balanced, clear, small head, good brew, yet expensive

12 ounce bottle into signature pint glass, bottled on 3/12/2013.  Pours moderately hazy golden amber color with a nice 2 finger dense and fluffy white head with incredible retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass.  Aromas of grapefruit, orange zest, lemon zest, floral, grass, slight pine, bread, light honey, and floral earthiness.  Very nice aromas with good complexity of hop notes; with well balanced malt.  Taste of big grapefruit, lemon zest, orange zest, floral, grass, light pine, bread, light honey, and floral earthiness.  Moderate floral citrus bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, citrus zest, floral, grass, light pine, bread, and light honey on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic complexity and balance of hop flavors; with a great malt balance that still showcases the hops; and zero cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a highly excellent IPA!  Great balance and good complexity of hop and malt flavors; and extremely smooth to drink.  A highly enjoyable offering.

Magnificent! Tried it on a friends recommendation. VERY thankful. It's a must try.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden amber with thick, white head. Wonderful floral aroma with hints of citrus and pine. Great balance between spicy hops and sweet, malty backbone. Dare I say that this ale is the quintessential American IPA? It's certainly my favorite!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle. Pours cloudy amber with thin light head. Tastes like bitter hops, grapefruit. Very clean crisp flavor. Smells like wheat, mild hops, very light citrus. Light body and medium carbonation.

This is my  "go-to" beer.  I live in Kalamazoo and Two Hearted literally flows from the drinking fountains here...OK maybe not "literally," that would be Oberon.  This is everything a good IPA should be, citrusy, maybe a little piney, with a healthy  dose of bitterness toward the end.   Perfect finish!
one of my favorite beers. clean, crisp, refreshing,citrus, nice bitter bite. if i had to choose one beer to drink, this would be it.
I really, really like IPAs and always searching for the best brands but  nothing locally compares to 2 heart ale. It deserves the high rating.
Excellent flavor with a strong, bitter after taste. Not my style of beer. But I would definately have another one.

On tap at Summits Wayside Tavern.  Golden pour with a thin white head.  Very florally aroma. Sweet fruity smell as well. Almost like fruit loops.  Taste is loaded with floral hops, citrus, a bit of a soapy taste, and fresh flowers.  Bitter finish.

Clear golden pour with light honey hue.  Fluffy off-white foam with plenty of lacing.  Nice looking beer.  All the beautiful smells of a well-made IPA come rushing out.  Grapefruit, lemon, floral notes, pine, and pepper all with a strong toasted malt backbone.  Damn, does it taste good.  Sweet biscuity malts with a kiss of honey, plenty of citrus, and a peppery hop that sticks on the tongue without being overpowering, or too oily.  Doesnt assault your tongue with overwhelming bitterness, but builds up slowly and lingers.  After working in a beer store for four years this is one IPA I always recommend customers try first.  I am taking a job in the UP and feel as if this beer is a good omen for my move.
On tap at jk odonnells. pours a hazy orange with white head. Citrus and floral aroma. Grapefruit and caramel tatse

Draft to pint at the Eccentric Cafe (from notes). Looks good; orange with off-white head that dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes solid; some citrus hops with a malty backbone and notes of caramel. Good on the palate. Nice, but a little malty compared to todays IPAs.

Grapefruit he knows pours minimal head. Some nice lacing on the glass and amber light brown in color. Solid IPA nothing spectacular about it but very good

One of my favorite IPAs. Has a nice finish got this one on an IPA sampler board at reds ale house.

Wow. Now this is really close to what I've been looking for. Great full flavor without the crazy over bitterness.

Bottle muled to my by my little brother -- thanks Nathan!  Bottled 11/27/2012, so not super fresh.  Aroma: caramel malts first, citrus, floral aromas follow.  Some pine as well.  Appearance:  Amber color, slightly hazy, small and splotchy white head.  Taste:  Nice floral bitterness throughout.  Sweetness is very muted.  I like the way this comes together quite a bit -- the "sweet/bitter" components seem to form one complete whole rather than existing as two competing elements.  Citrus comes through more on later sips.  Palate:  Medium body, slick texture, average carbonation, long, pleasant bitter finish.  Overall: would love to try this fresher, but even a few months out this is quite nice.
NIce and quite fuzzy. Somewhat golden and nice foam. A little bit hoppy but just enough there.

Bottle in Boca Raton, FL. Pours a hazy, golden orange in an American pint glass. Medium head and medium lace. The aroma is heavenly with heavy citrus, pine and grass and earth. The taste really packs a serious punch. The instant bitterness on the palate is quickly accompanied with pine, grapefruit, passion fruit, and finishes sweet yet bitter. It also leaves floral notes until you go back in for another sip. I love the smooth mouth feel. One of my top 10 IPAs.

Aromas of piney, citrusy, floral hops, and mild, bready, malty tones, and some stone fruit.  Golden-orange with a decently retaining, off-white head.  Juicy, bitter, and very well balanced.  Light-medium bodied with good carbonation and a fruity, hoppy finish.

A very refreshing well balanced IPA. A nice finish without that common after taste. Definitely one of my top 10 IPA's.
