Great full-body, flavored ale; one of my favorites, if not my favorite IPA.

Poured into English pint glass at eccentric cafe. Golden orange pour with a white head about an inch high. Hoppy aroma, hints of lemon as well. Great full body flavor. Unique tastes of floral hops that is perfectly balanced with malt. Spicy hop after taste, a bit like after drinking orange juice, but with hops. My favorite IPA.

Poured into a wide flute glass. Opaque golden colored with two fingers of white head that held well.
Smells of bright citrus, grapefruit and lemon.
The taste was bitter from beginning to end with a malty sweetness always on the edge but never quite breaking through. The hops bitterness lasted long after.
Smooth texture, bubbly and medium bodied.
A robust drink. I really liked this take on the IPA. There is a lot of malt balancing out the hops and they compliment each other well.

Appearance: Orange golden, hazy. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Fruit, hops. Then some more hops. Floral.
Taste: Some fruit, lots and lots of hops. Disappointing. Sorry guys.
Info: Draft, 23/4-2012

This IPA has a nice balance of hops and smoothness and is a fairly mild IPA when it comes to the initial sensation of hops when it first hits your palate but Bells THA has subtle notes that make this an enjoyable brew from start to finish. I plan on adding this to my somewhat regular list of beers that I purchase.
Spicy, fruity, and nicely bitter (but not overwhelmingly so). Pours a medium gold color with a decent head.
About as good as IPAs get.  Great citrus/floral hop taste and aroma that is well balanced with the malts.

Originally reviewed: 1/26/10. Had this on tap today for lunch at Brixx in GSO. Came out a musrk dark gold with a thin white head on top. Retained a bit, but it left great perfect sip rings after every swig. Scents of floral hops, citrus rinds and sweet candy. This smells really inviting. The body is smooth and slightly oily on the tongue. Crisp carbonation backs it up well. Nice sharp bitter hops right away, but nothing that is too harsh or scalding. Finishes sweet like honey biscuits. Wow. Ive had this in bottle form, but much prefer it on tap. Excellent.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 The most well balanced IPA that I have ever had. The right amount of hops, floral and citrus notes in the flavor, nothing too powerful or overbearing. Great out of a bottle, but even better on tap; a must for any IPA lover.
One of my favorite IPAs from Michigan. Delicious and Nutritious. Its very good and you should drink it!
This is one of my favorite IPAs.  When you combine the fruity aroma, the perfect appearance, and refreshing taste it is easy to make this your go to IPA.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2012 Draft at Moriartys. Perfect golden pour with a white lacey head. Good balanced dry hop taste. Crisp and succulent. Good full hop flavor. Too good to argue with, but a bit one note.
Fantastic rich aromas, solid body and great light amber color.  this beer is a real treat if you can get your hands on it.  always leaves my palate dry and looking for another

Tap at quaker steak and lube.  Sweet, spicy centennial aroma.   Malty, balanced hoppiness... The taste is subtle, with a sharp noble hop finish.  Sublime.  Piney grass, floral notes.  An appropriate #500th rating.

Citrus aroma. Good floral note. 

Golden color. 

Excellent balance with a good hop kick. Clean citrus finish tops it off.

Wow, one of the best IPAs Ive had in a long time. Will definitely be picking more of this up. hoppy with a very mild bitterness, some citrus, big taste but easy going down. A very smooth easy to drink IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2014 All things considered this is one of my favorites. Solid bitterness with floral and citrus hops, light grains and caramel. Notes of brown sugar and crisp apples. Perfect carbonation, expertly balanced and easy to drink despite the intense flavors.

A hoppy beer with the perfect amount of malt to give it a full balanced flavor. The balanced taste makes it a perfect choice for eating light and having a few. This Ale has a sharp nose that lets you know from the start that there is no shortage of hops in the brew. The amber color is appealing and give notice to the sturdy body the malt imparts to this ale. Like all Bell products nothing is overdone or out of balance in the well crafted ale.

Very crisp finish.  Nice balance of hops.  Not overpowering but definitely delvers a good distinct flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iSomething

The beer was lightly chilled and served in a pint glass.

Ar- The aroma of the beer is a lightly sweetened floral citrus and pine combination. 

Ap- The body of the beer is slightly hazy with a honey coloration. The beers head is  a thick biege and withstands the mustache test. Thick ropey lacing mark this beers rapid departure from my glass.

T- A nearly perfect deliverery of caramel sweetened citrus and citrus zest with a very light pine prescence. Dam near perfectly balanced. 

P The body of the beer is light with nice complementary carbonation. 

O- This beer is a pleasure to drink. I wonder why it has been so long since I last drank a pint of this beer.

Bottle.  Cloudy golden beer with a medium white head. Aroma is very hoppy, pine and some berries.  Taste is mild-medium sweet, medium bitter. Dry finish. Medium bodied, oily texture, moderate carbonation. Very drinkable.
Bottle. Pours golden with a finger of white head, some lacing.  The aroma is floral with some citrus in the background. Medium bitter with a sticky palate. A little sweetness in the finish.

A: Pours a cloudy amber color with a one finger eggshell color head. Solid retention and good lacing. The bubbles form a nice cascade effect rising to the head, as well.

S: Aside from the usual citric/piny hops, theres some sourdough breadiness alongside it, similar to what I got from Ranger IPA, but this has better execution.

T: Starts off with a very nice maltiness to it with just the right hint of sourdough notes, plus some citric hops; and it finishes with a restrained piny bitterness. I like my IPAs to either have excellent balance, or rape my palate to kingdom come. This is very much the former...in fact, its one of the most nicely balanced IPAs Ive had.

M: A little thick body-wise, with solid carbonation. The finish is only slightly astringent.

O: When I first started drinking beer, I didnt like IPAs. Thankfully, Ive seen the light, and its thanks to beers like this. Highly recommended.
Over all stand by IPA, pours orange with a small white head, aroma of fruity Centennial hops, not bitter, sweetish finish. Bells house yeast flavor. By hopsandvines beer reviews. YouTube.
Pours a clear bubbly golden color with good white head. Aroma of hops and citrus. Tastes of honey, spice, hops. Creamy texture with some real good bite. Finishes crisp and clean. Slightly sour.

Bottle. Nice light orange pale color. Light tan head. Nice subtle citrus aroma. Light bitter to medium bitterness finish. A good solid IPA but the nice thing is its easy availability. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2013 Citrusy and sweet and floral in the scent, but not very strong (I tested this vs. Founders, and everyone preferred Founders). Head and lacing retain wonderfully. Somewhat lighter golden color. Not as sweet as I was expecting from the smell - somewhat at first, then the hops invite themselves. Very smooth despite the VERY notable hop kick at the end. Mouthfeel is less oily and heavy than many IPAs.  Wow the Bells is smooth, especially prior to the hopbomb.  I am noticing the Fruity Pebbles aftertaste more this time around (July 2012) compared to my first rating (Spring 2012), so I will also give it extra points there.  Still, everyone agreed Founders has more of a hop/malt presence and long-lasting aftertaste relative to Bells, and more of a body.  So, good as this beer may be, and much as I am uprating this while downrating my view of Founders slightly, I still personally prefer Founders Centennial.  MAY 2013 RERATE: Downrating slightly.  Fruity Pebbles citrus again, as it usually is.  But I had a Stone Pale Ale prior to this, which was as good as it usually is (malt backbone and all), and I find myself preferring the Stone.  I gave Stone a 3.9.  3.8 seems fair for this.
Probably the quintessential american IPA. Pours a nice, clear hay with a slight head. Nice fruity/flowery aroma. Hits the tongue soft with a perfect hops bite that lingers in the back of the mouth.
Aroma is a fantastic display of what an IPAs aromatic should be.  Pours light golden rod. off white head. Hop forward with orange & grapefruit notes super composed and balanced

The benchmark has been set!  Bells has an everyday IPA with abundant hops and smooth delivery in the Two Hearted.  Ive had it by tap and by bottle, and I found that the smell is more obvious right after you pour it from the bottle: mildly floral and refreshingly crisp. All around, this is a fantastic beverage that isnt too wild, but really nails all the basics of an IPA.  If youre going to introduce someone to this style, Two Hearted is the one to choose because its loaded with flavor but not too loud.
Hands down the greatest IPA i have ever tried. Michigan made for this Michigan guy.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden full white head. Nice aroma of floral, orange, and pine. Nice citrus sweet flavor. Medium body, good balance of hop presence in the finish. Lively carbonation finishing tingly. Overall this is an excellent IPA. Great aroma and flavor and malt/hop balance.

Bright Orange in color with a good amount of haze. Head is about 1 finger in width and leaves behind alot of lacing in its wake. Citrus Hops, Sweet Caramel/Toffee, Biscuits, and Yeasts make up the flavor, added in with a malty backbone that balances out the flavor quite nicely. The overall palate is light bodied, well regulated in terms of carbonation, and comes off as feeling crisp and refreshing as a result. Its a beer that comes off as something extraordinary and yet at the same time it can be perfect for any occasion. I will definitely be picked this up again in the future!

Given that this beer hails from Michigan, obviously takes its name from the famous Hemingway short story Big Two Hearted River about a man returning from World War I who is working through his personal wartime trauma on a camping and fishing trip in the Wolverine state. Exept this being Hemingway, everything is so plainly laid out none of this obvious at first. The story slowly unfolds and the truth is somewhere between the lines. Which makes this beer a lot like Hemingways proseits incredibly crisp, greater than the sum of its parts, and very compelling.

Cloudy amber color with thin lacy head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is heavy on floral notes. Taste is kinda like chewing on a grapefruit rind. Slightly bitter finish. One of my favorite offerings from bells :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2012 Cloudy golden pour with thin foamy head. Nice soft lacing on the glass. Extremely floral, citrus and orange aroma with good amount of malt on the back end. Medium body, smooth transition to long lasting finish. Good balance of hop and malt. Very well crafted.

Easy to drink too much of this one.  It seems lighter than it is, but is just a bit more alcoholic than one would like in a session.  The hops are floral with a bit of citrus.  Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel.

Bottled on 03/05/2012. 12 oz bottle into an over sized pint glass. Big thanks to GRDave for sending this in a trade.

A - Light amber/golden body. Fluffy two finger head with great lacing and retention.

S - Grapefruit heavy hops with a touch of biscuity malts. Bitter yet clean. 

T - Much different from the nose. A perfect balance between grapefruit citrus and bready malt. Low amount of bitterness. Finishes very clean. Medium mouth feel with a great level of carbonation. Highly drinkable.

O - This is perfection. An absolutely stellar IPA. Just really well baalnced and clean with the right amount of hops and malt. This beer is a permanent want now.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2012 Pours golden.  Smells floral.  Tastes citrus and hops.  Smooth on the palate with a slight bitterness at the end of the taste.  Low carbonation.  None of the elements standout from the rest.  All around...it?s just a damn good brew.  Could easily drink several bottles in one session.

[Thanks to MatSciGuy]. 12fl. bottle. Orangish colour with a nice formation of a white head, with a moderate duration and nice lacing. Aroma has pine and orange hints, moderate hoppy and resins. Flavour has a moderate bitterness from the beginning to the end, with resins notes, fruits on palate and moderate dense on palate.. Carbonation is soft to medium. Body is medium to high. Texture is mild oily.

Poured from 12oz bottle into tulip glass.  Bottled on date 10/20/11.  Hope its not past its prime.
Aroma:  Lots of oranges and lemon.  Maybe some lime even.  Tiny bit of pine.
Appearance:  Hazy pour. Perfect golden color.  Pillow of 2 finger head that lingered.  Very light and frothy.  Laces glass well.
Taste:  Perfect balance of sour, sweet, and bitter.  Light to medium of all three and finishes very clean.  Just a twang of bitter is leftover.  
Palate:  crisp, smooth, refreshing.  carbonation is high but feels just right.  Medium body and thin texture.  
Overall:  This is a great IPA.  Would not think this is 7%.  I bought this in a mix a six pack and the bottled on date is 5 months ago.  Really looking forward to trying this again from a fresh batch.  I think i just found my new favorite year round IPA.
Piney, citrusy, tropical fruit from the centennial hops. Super drinkable. Nicely balanced IPA

Little to no head, typical IPA color, little if any lacing. Smell is of malt, biscuit, and fruit sweetness. Nothing fancy but smells nice. The sweetness hits you up front, almost a pineapple flavor. An earthly hop kick follows, with a slight malt presence as it fades away. Light carbonation, nothing really sticks with you. Solid IPA, wish I knew about this a while ago. Could drink these like water.

Mild but appealing aroma and crisp appearance lead into floral tones and an easy drinking ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tannish yellow and a bit hazy, head and lace were pretty good.  Smells and tastes piney, grapefruit, very tasty stuff but perhaps not quite as legendary as hopslam.  This one is fresh and pretty representative of this beer, Ive had it lots of times.  Definitely good and should be tried, a solid example of the style and of Bells generally tasty brews.

Bottle @ Dans place, Denver. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, floral hops, fruity, lots of citrusly hops. Taste is malt, caramel, less sweet than aroma fruity, citrus, grapefruit, piney. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 070312

ive been drinking this beer for years, every ipa is compared to this one and ive only found a couple that are even close.  two hearted has attained a lofty perch and almost legendary status around the great lakes.  if you havent tried it and you are an ipa fan, try it asap.

Bottle. Fresh citrusy hops, caramel malt aroma. Clear deep golden with a moderate off white head, nice lacing. Floral lime hops flavor nicely balanced by buttery malt. Smooth medium body.  Unique hops flavor that doesnt gobsmack you like some IPAs, making it very easy drinking.

India Pale Ale style well suited for Hemingway-esque trips to the Upper Peninsula. American malts and enormous hop additions give this beer a crisp finish and incredible floral hop aroma. [Note: this beer doesnt have Bells in front of the name by explicit request from the brewer.]

12oz bottle 24 days after packaging date...

Appearance: The color is a golden cloud of with moderate head and lacing. Carbonation is moderate.

Aroma: Predominant spicy notes presenting resonate herbs with faint elements of pine and citrus.

Taste: The hops are prevalent with a fruity element that sits on the palate long after each sip similar to a grapefruit without its excessive tartness.

Palate: A smooth medium-heavy body encompasses the palate.

Overall: This beer is a very unique interpretation of an American IPA but very positively so. For anybody who loves a good solid IPA... Give this one a try! Prosit!!!

Serving type: bottle

GREAT taste.  Has a lot of the Smarty (the candy) flavor that I absolutely love in IPAs.  Not too bitter, lots of floral flavor.  Aroma is fine, but not at as noticeable as Id like.  Great overall.
An ideal ale - A blend of blue moon and an IPA, deliciously refreshing. Wonderful on the course!

Honestly, this is one of the best IPAs that I have had in a while... I just cant believe that I didnt buy it when I first saw it. It has a wonderfully strong hop character with some citrus that is balanced by a perfect amount of malts. I havent had the chance to pour it in a glass yet but it produces a nice bit of head after just popping the bottle :)
Still one of the best DIPAs out here.  Well balanced, citrusy with enough floral taste and malty backbone to win the heart of all kinds of beer drinkers.  Great beer, time after time.
Nice citus nose, balanced hop bitterness, great hop flavor.  Little malt to counter the hops.  Well balanced.

Appearance: clear golden orange color, frothy white head. Aroma: all I get is a really sweet citrusy grapefruit smell, very pleasant.  Taste: floral sweet citrus hops up front thru the whole taste with some very minimal piney hop bitterness. Mouthfeel: thin to medium body. Overall: it's a very pleasant taste, but I like my IPAs a little more bitter but this really showcases the more floral side of hops. Nice hot day sipper kind of beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is now a classic American IPA and one of the true originals. Ive drank this for so many years that I am now jaded and always pass on this for something less known. Its still a good one, though.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Pours a very cloudy golden amber with a medium white head. Aroma is pine & candied white grapefruit with a hint of malt in the background. As the beer warms, you can pick up some chocolate or carob-like aromas. Taste is heavy on pine up front followed by malt and hoppy bitterness (strangely reminiscent of the Third Coast Ale Barleywine). The finish is quick with not much, if any, aftertaste. This one has a lot going on - good beer.
One of my favorite beers that started my interest in craft brewing. In my opinion, a nearly perfect IPA. Great Floral hoppy aroma with strong citrous and pine flavors on the tongue.

Bottle. Clear orange color with thin, pale, sudsy head leaving light lacing. Some iridescence in the bubbles. Strong hops scent, some pine & citrus aromas. Hoptastic flavor, nice bitter bite, a little detergent astringency, very little malt profile. Much more bubbly and effervescent than I expected. Clean dry finish. Reminds me a bit of a Lagunitas IPA. Pleasant and smooth-drinking, but not terribly complex.

Balanced caramel and pine aroma w/ citrus. Golden dusky straw w/ slight haze. Fine bubbles rising slowly. Thin head w/ drifting lace. Initial taste is rich malt, and then quickly gives way to the hops in mid palate. Light-medium body and some carbonation on the tongue. Very smooth, bittersweet and slightly metallic finish. A great IPA.  

He looked back. The river just showed through the trees. There were plenty of days coming when he could fish the swamp. - Big Two-Hearted River by Ernest Hemingway

On tap poured into pint glass

A: copperish amber, slight head with good retention, lacing rings around the glass

S: nice citrus hop aroma

T: nice ipa flavor. Citrussy hops, slightly piney

Pours honey-gold with a good , lasting, off-white head.  Roma is Hoppy, citrus, floral...a hint of margarine.  Taste is hops, but nicely restrained. While IPAs arenot my favourite style, this is the smoothest drinking,best tasting one Ive tried.  Extremely good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 Pours golden with about three fingers of white pillowy head. Smell is mild hoppy and almost a bit buttery. Taste is hoppy, floral, sweet, almost tart. Earthy finish. Pretty drinkable. Great IPA, very well balanced. 

Thanks to Sciphish for this wonderful bottle.

12 oz bottle into a tulip. Poured a beautiful golden orange with a nice two finger head, that seems to be lasting pretty long. Nice lacing and smells of citrus, pine, and resin. Taste is very hop-forward with a lasting bitter finish. Mouthfeel is very good, with a sticky-like texture. I am amazed at how long the head on this beer is lasting. It reminds me of a West Coast IPA, and I actually prefer it over Hopslam. I will definitely seek this brew out in a future trade.

Ive never had a Bells I didnt like, except the Oarsman, which was still okay, so lets see:
	-Pours light amber dark yellow traditional pils color with a two finger white head that does not seem to be going anywhere.  Lacing sticks around throughout.  Aroma is citrus hops and flower bouquet with a  faint fishy something going on.  
	Medium in the mouth with a heavy strange floral hop, unique kind of IPA approach.  Atypical in the fact that its hitting you with some hop that is not common, and reminds me of tangy fruit like grapefruit but not, a flowery feel like the tang of a dandelion stem, but not.  Hard to peg.  Flowers and fruit.  Little oily in the finish, resolving to hops on the tip and alcohol in the back.  I like it.  I like Bells.  Bravo, good sirs.

A nice gold color with a white foamy head and lots of lacing. It has an aroma of pine and citrus, with a lot of lemon, grapefruit, and tangerine in the flavor and a subtle hoppy aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice golden orange with a medium sized white head. Aroma is very interesting. Hops are abundant, plus there is a hint of some spice maybe. Taste is very well balanced. I half expected a massive hop hit, but the hops were well constrained by a nice malty base.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 From notes.  Originally reviewed 4/6/2009.  On tap in a pint glass.

The beer is a bit lighter than an amber, the two hearted ale pours a full orange color with a rich, creamy head. Leaves slight, but noticeable lacing down the side of the glass in rings at the level of rest. 

The nose has a strong caramel malt aroma with citrus hints, along with a strong hop character.

A strong malt flavor greets the palette, with the orange and apricot citrus flavors creeping in. The hops bring in the more detailed grapefruit and peach flavors. A nice bitter pinch at the end of the sip is nicely offset by a caramelized sweetness, leaving my mouth with a wonderful taste.

The body is medium to full, somewhat grainy feel. More creamy than carbonated.

Two hearted is a pretty incredible beer with a strong, balanced flavor. Definitely a nice beer to enjoy with a flavorful sandwich. This beer has enough flavor to keep me interested and is balanced enough for me to really savor it.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2012 A great IPA; floral and fruity aroma, sweet up front, with a great orange and floral hoppy taste.  Not too intense by any means, I can see the pleasing a variety of beer drinkers.  Better from the bottle than on tap.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2012 Very drinkable, nice and smooth, fruit and hops dominate the beer, goes down very easy, not too complex, two flavors dominate, with a bit of a sticky quality as well.  Very simple, but very awesome, definitely one of my favorite ipas out there.  Not being able to get it in MA I was very much anticipating trying and it was worth the trouble.  Literally one of the best beers Ive ever had.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2012 Bright golden colour with a white head and nice lacing. Powerful citrusy aroma. More of the citrus in the taste with a perfect amount of bitterness. Medium bodied.

This beer has a special place in my heart, as it was the beer handed to me about 15seconds after I said "i do", but that aside it is delicious!

Appearance: slightly hazy golden, nice white head, pretty good lacing

Aroma: floral and citrusy hops, some nice tart grapefruit smells, very enticing

Taste: delicious. the citrus comes through, a nice bitterness, with a touch of malt sweetness.

Palate: very smooth, perfect carbonation, a great beer that one could drink several of and not get bored.
Classic IPa, signature taste, perfect balanced brew for your hoppy fix. Drink it now, zing
The best beer ever. You wont find more subtle yet powerful hops in an IPA with a nice variety of citrus flavors.  Mouth feel is a bit watery but it works.
Beautiful, gold/amber. Big hoppiness that doesnt overwhelm the rest of the taste profile. Two Hearted is the "gateway beer" to introduce people to craft beers.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2012 On tap at a bar in Pittsburgh.  Orange colored, hazy, with a small ring of off white head.

Floral aroma with some slight citrus.

Pine and floral notes on each sip with a classic, bitter hoppy finish that you would expect from an IPA

Incredible!
One of the best IPAs I have ever tasted. Resisted this one for a awhile (dont know why) will be stocking up on it now!

UPDATED: APR 15, 2012 Absolutely delicious... Will be stocking up on this stuff next time i see it...  strange 2 say but almost a cotton candy arouma with ridiculas smooth apricotish orangepeel taste and finish..
pours golden amber with dense head and good lacing. Citrus honey hoppy earthy aroma and taste.

This beer was my first real introduction into Craft Beers years ago.  Very hoppy, good balance, and crisp taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I dont drink this as much as I should! I think ill get some tonight! Readily available in my area. Good IPA!

Very nice beer.  Hoppy and smooth.   â¦â¦â¦â¦.... .......................... .......................

On tap.
Copper pour with sticky white head.  Aroma is incredibly dank and resinous with some caramel malt.  Near perfect bitterness with a plethora of floral hops.  A nice tea-like charecteristic as well (chamomile?).  A top notch IPA.

A - pours nice deep golden light haze. Low white head with some lacing. S - aromas of tropical fruit and citrus hops. Subtle floral  notes and crisp dried grass. M - medium bodied brew with high lively carbonation. Lingering lightly dry bitter end. T - citrus and tropical fruit hops on the nose. Grassiness and caramel malts on the palate. Simple clean bitter hop ending. O - well balanced ipa. Nice palate. Very good ipa. Slightly sweet. 7

Floral aroma. Murky burnt orange appearance. Good balance of malt and hops. Nice finish

~Honey and orange citrus hop aroma with sweet bready malts in background.
~Pours a hazy light orange color with small white head.
~Orange zesty citrus hop flavor well balanced with bready malts.
~Med full bodied with med CO2,dry with a  subtle bitter finish.
~Enjoyable IPA I could drink a few of these. I like the hop profile and the fact that the bitterness doesnt annihilate your palate.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2012 golden color with nice lacing, very strong floral citrus aroma, flavors are, citrus/pine/floral hops with some caramel sweetness, bubblegum, and dry lingering finish, one of the best IPAs out there
BOTTLE and TAP. Sweet and balanced mild floral and pine hops.
Draft. Like drinking a forest. Its very flowery. Good stuff. Sorry not more detail, I was kinda drunk.

Bottle from my sonfor christmas
The aroma is just awesome big citrus hops
The taste is sweet and hoppy

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2012 Pours slightly hazy golden with a long lasting finger of head. Fresh pine needles on the nose..followed by a  complex palate. Dirt, musk, milkweed, flowers, and of course, hops. Wonderful finish. Smooth and flavorful. Amazing stuff

One of my all-time favorite go-to beers.  The aroma is big citrus hops with just a little pine and grass.  The flavor is boldly malty but not sweet at all.  The hop flavor is delicious and crisp.  The finish on this beer leaves you wanting more.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 The perfect blend of floral and bitter accents make this brew an amazing combination. It pours amber in color and leaves the taste of hibiscus and grapefruit in your mouth.  Very smooth and one of my personal favorites. It is the perfect go to beer on any day!

Vackert orangebrunöl med ett vitt gräddigt skum. Doften är söt, citrus och blommig. Sötma tillsammans med den citrusaktiga humlebeskan. Som flera andra skrivit, kanske mer en APA än en IPA. Men hursomhelst en god öl.

Pours a hazy yellowish orange with a soapy white head that stays around. Aromas of citrusy hops, some pine, and a bit of fruity sweetness. Taste is very well balanced, the grapefruit and orange zest isnt overpowering the hops and vice versa. It is a bit mild in the bitterness for an IPA but I dont mind it, it has so much going on that my inner hop-head in no way disputes how fantastic this beer is. Few beers literally make me salivate and Bells Two Hearted makes it happen. Dont go into this beer expecting a hop explosion and something verging on a borderline religious experience, go into it expecting a complex beer with amazing drinkability. Easily one of my favorite, if not my favorite IPA and beers in general. This beer is a one reason I love being a craft beer enthusiast. CHEERS!!!
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2013 Very citrus forward and only a mild bitterness. One of the classic American IPAs. Excellent
Flaska 33 cl, inköpt i Bradenton, Florida. Stora härliga blommiga och fruktiga dofter, samma i smaken tillsammans med en riktigt fin beska. Mycket bra öl.

Draft. A favorite! Beautiful appearance, cloudy orange/tan fill with nice foamy white head that settled into a light film, great layered lacing. The aroma was straight sweet citrus with a hop floral kick, and the taste followed suit. The floral/citrus comes through immediate, the palate was a medium sticky, and then theres a nice hop kick at the finish. As my buddy Puff put it, "Its not a typical IPA. At the end it just kind of like says, Hey, Im an IPA."
Deep gold with  off white head.  Aroma is spicy citrus and mango.  Creamy body with pleasant bitterness.  More tart citrus in the finish.  One of my favorites.  Even better on cask.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2012 Draft - rerated seeing I now appreciate hoppiness. Citrus hops with caramel. Hides the 7% abv well. Sticky mouthfeel. Still dont see how this beer is so highly rated. 

Bottle - pours pale yellow with just off white head and nice lacing. Nose is a pine forest. Aroma is likewise but not as bitter as the nose would suggest. Medium body and thin texture. Dont believe the hype. Im disappointed 7-3-7-4-13 or 3.4

Ar: Tangerines, marmalade, some grapefruit, and black pepper.
Ap: Hazy gold-orange - large fluffy white head with good retention and a chunky curtain of lacing.
T: Grapefruit and tangerine up front - firm medium-high bitterness, yet fairly clean hopping - slightly sweet - grassy - bitter grapefruit rind finish.
P: Medium-light body with high carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Simply a great American IPA - citrus and clean bitterness throughout - a prototype of the style!

Dirty hazy ruddy gold color with some microscopic "floaties."  Full persistent white head and plenty of lace.  From the start there is a balanced combination of citrus caramel wheat and mild pine hops.  Plenty of taste and plenty of body.  The only weakness would be that once the flavor (as good as it is) begins, there is no change from beginning to finish.  Excellent and extravagent one-note brew.

Pours a rather hazy, golden yellow. Mid-sized head that leaves nice lacing on the glass. Floral, hoppy aromas. Nice grapefruit/citrus hop flavors with a smooth bitterness. A great beer to drink with food.

Hands down my favorite beer. I keep this on tap at my house 24/7. Great citrus aroma. Great golden color. Amazing flavor. If I had to choose one beer to drink for the rest of my life, it would be Bells Two Hearted Ale!!!!!!

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Just didnt live up to the hype. Seems slightly over rated. It certainly is a great beer, but I just expected something more.

Pours a golden yellow, slightly hazy. About 0.5in of frothy white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is predominantly citrus and very floral. Flavor is also heavily citrus and piney hops. Good mouthfeel. Carbonation is just right. Excellent IPA - truly one of the best.
Floral, caramel to the nose, pretty much sweetness. Taste is very sweet with a medium body. Very balanced beer with lots of hops but with the sweetness of the malt that balances it perfectly. Lovely.

I will never rate 25000 beers like some people on here can.  Seriously?  Good God find something to do besides drink/rate beer.  Although drinking beer can be AWESOME, it should not take the place of, oh, say, life.  Anyways, Two-Hearted is my favorite beer.  Smells floral/great, is crisp/refreshing.  Beautiful looking/amazing taste and finish.  Forward slash/over-used.

On tap.  Pours copper with a thick white head and a lot of lacing. Aroma is of citrusy hops, biscuit malt and ripe fruit.   Full, smooth body.  Taste is citrusy hops upfront followed by biscuit malt and ripe fruit.  Long, hoppy finish. Great IPA.

Totally weird I havent rated a beer that Ive drank hundreds of times, oh well. Obviously the nose is loaded with pungent, resiny, citrus filled hops and not much else. Flavor is the same with just the perfect amount of balance and finishing bitter. Definitely one of the best IPAs.
Aroma of everything.  Pine, citrus, and slight grass.  Pours light orange with very little head.  Tastes nice and clean.  Good blend of hops.
Draft. Bright golden color, thin lacy white head. Sweet, citrusy and pine aroma, cereal and malty as it warms. Dry, cereal, grapefruit, lemon, peppery. Alcohol becomes more apparent as it warms.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2016 Bottle at Raglan Road; Downtown Disney. Hazy yellow-orange-copper with a moderate whitish head. Aroma is super fruity: citrus, berry, raisin, you name it, it seems like its in there, floral, and caramel and pale malty. Taste is very well balanced; sweet and fruity, yet nicely bitter as well. Medium bodied.
Amazing balanced beer, which drinks really fast as a result. The hops are multi dimensional and interesting. The Malt is full and a little sweet.

Bottle. Hazy golden color with a small white head that disappears. The nose is assertive and pleasing - honey, grapefruit, peaches, floral hops. The taste is nicely sweet and floral, mild malts with juicy hops. The finish is medium bitter. The palate is medium, wonderful supporting carbonation. Overall, a very strong effort.

Golden.Orange pour, 2 fingers of frothy head.  Citrus fruits and caramel malt in the nose.  This one is all about balance - Big citrus flavors (Grapefruit, orange, mango, lemon, citronella) with pine taking a backseat followed by bready caramel malt.  good lacing down the sides of the glass.  fairly dry in the aftertaise.  Maybe Michigans best IPA and thats saying something.
Growler from the Fridge, Lancaster, PA.  This delicious IPA manages to be incredibly floral and smooth while at the same time imparting an overwhelming hop presence.   One of the best.
Bottle. Pours a nice golden color. Aroma is of big citrus  notes with a small amount of pine. Taste follows the nose. Very crisp and clean. Overall a great beer by Bells.

poured from bottle into an imperial pint glass.  boors a dark honey with a fluffy white head and great lacing.  some pine and citrus notes in the aroma.  Nice malty sweetness at first followed by a mild hop bitterness that lasts for a short period of time.  As it warms the hoppy notes linger on the back of your tongue.  A delicious pale/ipa

Had this last night on tap at The Hungry Monk. Always a great go to IPA. The aroma is full of citrusy hops and a little pine. A beautiful golden color and nice white head about a finger width. Taste is nice and bitter up front with citrus and some tropical fruit. Balanced by some malt sweetness, mouth feel is nice a with a slight drying finish. Overall this is a wonderfull hop forward yet balanced IPA.

On tap. Light amber with a white fluffy head that settles, leaving a nice layer of lacing down the glass. Based on other reviews was expecting more but for whatever reason there just wasnt much there - some hops, a bit of malt, some citrus and pine but mostly crisp and clean. Medium carbonation, smooth and clean, starts a bit sweet but becomes more bitter, nice dry finish, hops on the palate, bit of a soapy feeling and very well balanced.

Hazy, deep golden colour with a thick white head.  Awesome hoppy aroma - primarily grapefruit softened by floral notes.  Taste is amazing - bitterness up front, but not at all overwhelming.  Bitterness is accented perfectly by sweet grapefruit and orange flavors.  Nice bitter finish.  Great IPA!
Hands down, a must try IPA if you havent or if youre just getting started in craft.  This is the beer that launched me into craft beers and has been my go to IPA for 10  years.

pours golden with a thin white head and minimal lacing.  aroma is lemon, caramel, pine, and some tangy fruit.  taste is honey, cantaloupe,  lemon, pine and grapefruit.  floral notes also come through.  finish is hoppy but floral.  This is a truly delightful beer.
Hoppy enough to be respected and admired on the west coast.  This is a fantastic exhibition of hops and good from sight to finish.  Among the best IPAs in the world
UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 Grabbed some of this while in Illinois and its a shame you cant get it in Texas. Citrus and floral aroma. Great beer.
Bottle. I go back and fourth on this one. Decent but generally not hoppy enough for me. Like the piney aroma also has a little grapefruit.
almost clear colour. reduced aroma, from filtration i pressume, some hops, corns and malts. medium bodied, very hoppy flavour but is reduced. overall a good beer nonetheless.

The aroma is not as full as I would have expected for an America IPA.  The notes are mostly resinous pine with some bread.  I would have appreciated more of the grapfruit citrus aromas prevalent in other IPAs. The beer pours a nice golden color with a small fading white head.  Some lacing is left on the glass.  The beer mostly smacks a sharp bitterness, but some light floral and citrus notes are present. Not as much malt balance as I would have preffered. The body is medium and carbonated with a very dry finish.  Overall a decent IPA, but not as complex as I would have expected from a beer rated this high.
This is by far my favorite beer! I have tried many IPAs but Two Hearted is still the best one. The taste is just perfect.
Bottle at home. Very floral, terrific rusty color with a fluffy head.  Terrifically well balanced IPA.  One of my absolute favorites.
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2011 A very good IPA brew. Has a very nice bitter taste and is very drinkable and enjoyable.

Rusty colored IPA, hoppy aroma and very well balanced. Just the right mix of hops and barley to strike the right chord. Short finish, with hints of citrus. Medium bodied, not overly bitter or astringent. Good IPA !!

One of my favorite IPAs. Just enough hops balanced with a hint of smooth sweet end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.... one from FullObs... ;) ..... it pours a bit hazy golden with a off white head.... the aroma is very fruity, peach and pineapple notes i tha nose :).... the flavor is quite complex taste of exotic fruit, peach, mango, pineapple, grape, citrus and piney notes..... full body.... nice mouthfeel.....SO NICE IPA.

Bottle from River City Cellars, Richmond. Golden with a slight white head. Light, satsuma aroma, with sweetish, almost creamy malts. Easy drinking for the ABV, with plenty more orange fruit, a light sweetness and dry, hoppy finish. Very good.

pours a dark golden to amber color, with a white fluffy head.  The aroma is strong in floral, with hints of  citrus, grapefruit.  The flavor is really bitter front to back but not overwhelming.   WIth citrus, pine, grapefruit, and some raisins.   the body is light while supplying a strong body flavor. i get a bit of alcohol warm at the end.  Overall this is really good!
Wow! Floral bitter smooth. The best IPA maybe the perfect beer. Cant wait until February when bells can make enough for all
Nice floral hoppiness. Smooth and easy to drink with a little bitterness in the finish.
A very strong beer from Bells.  One of my favorites of this style.  Im fortunate to live near Chicago and have it readily available.  If you are in the area it is a must try.
While the hops has a strong aroma in this beer it does not overwhelm the taste.  A top IPA in my book.

Totally shocked by the 100 rating, definitely not that great of a beer... Considering I live on the West Coast, Ive had much better IPAs out here a la Russian River, Lagunitas. Bear Republic.... Very malty for an IPA, definitely of the east coast variety, thought this was considered a pale ale initially.... Mine was probably a little old and I probably should have had it sooner and not let the freshness of the hops go, but it was decent at best....

Look I love any thing hoppy and this is a good ipa and very easy drinker my wife Mandy,not a hops girl and she liked this beer so it cant be bad but after seeing the 100 rating I was waiting to be blown away and was not.Pours golden and a little orange with a nice cream colored head full of various size bubbles.aroma is creamy,sweet and lite hops.flavors lite and floral and little fruity and of corse hops.Palate is thin but leaves you with so pear flavors on the finish.

on draft and or bottle have had both. off yellow color with minimal head and decent lacing. the aroma of citrus and piny hops and heavenscent...just a wonderful mixture of hops with malt to create goodness. the flavor is of the same. the citrus hops stand up strong but not over bearing and easily drinkable. this is a go to beer for any hop head.
My first and favorite ipa, wonderfully hoppy with hints of citrus and orange.
Bottle and tap.  PERFECT IPA!  Dry, hoppy, bitter, citrus, pine and grassy.  Try and enjoy.

Bottle thanks to Donovan!  Pours a cloudy orange/amber with a medium white head.  The aromas are grass, grapefruit, citrus, bread.  The mouthfeel is dry, sticky and bitter with a medium body.  Great beer!

This is might be my favorite IPA. Pours an orangish copper with a white head that laces nicely. Nose and taste are of well balanced floral and fruity hops with a nice malt profile. Very balanced, very drinkable. If you have the means, I highly suggest you pick one up!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2015 Okay, I apologize for this rating since Im fairly certain I got a bad bottle here since the rating for this are stellar and this was not very good when I tried it.  There was a strange mucus-looking spiral of what I thought was yeast when I poured this which I dont think Ive ever seen in a beer before.   There was also a strange cotton candy/bubblegum aroma that I dont think fits with this beer style.  Overall, it didnt taste horrible, but it just wasnt that great, so I will endeavor to get another bottle (unfortunately this was from AZ when I traveled there so Ill have to wait to get another one since we dont get this in CA) and then re-rate this then.                                                               

*3/8/2015 - New rating*   Finally found this on tap at Tustin Brewing!   Okay, *now* I see why this is a highly rated beer!  Great bread and biscuit malt flavors with a pine and citrus hop bitterness that all balances excellently.  This seems to be in between an English IPA and an American IPA.  Definitely a well made and balanced beer.

Pours beautifully golden with one fingers worth of foamy white. Aroma is floral and distinctively hoppy with some citrus and a bit of basil-esque herbaceousness. Pleasant amount of carbonation. The slight sweetness compliments the complex citrus and hops flavors. Anise/licorice flavors come forward as the beer warms and oxidizes. Finishes dry and moderately bitter with just the tiniest note of alcohol lingering. One of the finest IPAs Ive tasted to-date.

Pours a a slightly hazy yellow, with white head. Aroma is floral and citrus. Taste is floral and citrus also, very strong floral hop taste, blended perfectly with s strong malty aftertaste that takes away the bitterness. An awesome IPA.

Draught, 7.1%. Good hoppy aroma, mildly piney, hint of orange juice and perhaps flatulence. Cloudy dark golden colour. Small stable frothy white head. The flavour is nicely hoppy, not unlike the aroma. There is a hint of vanilla and some soft fruit, very faint. A well-crafted and subtle beer, and very good.

This has become a go-to beer when i know i want something good.I remember trying this the first time and not digging it,but 2-3 more after another week i was hooked on this near perfect beer.Great hop aroma,great yeast aroma great malt taste aroma great mouthfeel very good flavor of hops/malt,incredible balance nice layer of foam some lacing. Just a great beer i never get tired of drinking.This beer definatly had inspired me.pretty much was my gateway ipa a while ago.
Great balance makes it dangerously sessionable as it hides the 7% nicely.  Very clean hop finish with just a tad of sweetness.  This would be a go-to for me if I could get it in CO.

Bouteille. Couleur orange cuivré munie dun fin col. Arôme florale avec une touche dagrumes. Goût bien malté avec un bon coté sucré me rappelant des oranges confites. Très bien équilibré avec un houblonnage très présent et bien résineux.

Extra given to me by MarkWise, thanks very much for the big package. Pour was a typical light sunlight/amber with tufts of uneven white foams. Small bubbles cackle over the honey tea body. Smell is Hoppy, but its definitely put in a sweet background context. Taste is a hop flavor seasoning more than bitterness with a big sweet tea bread malt character. Light brioche, some sugary bread off set by a hard candy/gummy hop flavor. Really nice balance, and definitely consistent with that malty forward IPA I associate with the midwest.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2015 Tasted bottle from Trader Joes into nucleated pint glass. Poured a nice, clear deep amber color with creamy off-white head. Powerful hops aroma, some sweet, bready notes in the background. Powerful flavors as well: complex blend of malts, I can definitely taste bread, caramel, toast, hints of biscuit, maybe even flaked and roasted barley. India Pale Ale is, by definition, aggressively hopped. So is Two Hearted Ale, of course, but its rich malty-sweetness stands right up to the hops bitterness, a rare balancing feat for IPAs. Very refreshing light-medium body, rounded mouthfeel, and fruity yeast finish. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2011 Bottle, courtesy of Ryan, thanks!. A clear pale amber beer, with an average sized, frothy, mostly lasting white head. The aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, cookie), moderately hoppy (grapefruit, flowers, apricot, hint of pine), with notes of lychee, poppies and tropical fruits. The flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, dry and very long finish, with moderate to heavy bitterness. Quite well balanced, clearly on the hoppy side, but with a clean, firm, not abrasive bitterness. Lots of fruity and flowery notes (I pick up even some poppy hints). One of the best IPAs out there. Also complex, not a feature many IPAs can claim. Consumed very fresh, with less than one month of age.

A great deep golden color, aroma bursting with floral and citrusy hops.  The same floral and citrus notes dominate the flavor, with grapefruit coming to the front nicely, and just a hint of caramel malt at the end.  Finishes pretty clean and bitter, pretty refreshing for a beer this hoppy.  Really really nice IPA, great representation of the style; Im glad I can get a regular supply of this stuff where I live!

The best inexpensive IPA Ive had as of 2011.  Pours an orange color with a nice off-white head.  Great aroma of citrus and floral hops.  Great hoppy flavor (floral and citrus) but well balanced by a malty, slightly sweet counterpart.  Great finish for 7% abv, no alcohol burn and not to bitter or sweet.  A great IPA, and overall beer.
One of my favorite ipas.  tons of hop flavor without being overly bitter.  a great offering from bells

UPDATED: APR 19, 2014 Outstanding IPA from the good folks at Bells. Pours a nice copper color, exceptional head retention. Plenty of floral and citrus hops, good mouth feel. One of my favorite IPAs, and I even like the watercolor artwork on the label.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 Poured from a draft into a pint glass at The Blue Leprechaun in Ann Arbor, Mich. Color was orange amber. Maybe an inch of head. Some lacing on the top. Good looking film on the sides that circled all the way down the glass.

Smelled of citrus and floral hops. Good balance.

Similar to the nose, a citrus and sweet, floral taste led the way. It wasnt as hoppy as I thought, but did end in a lingering bitter finish.

Medium body. Average carbonation. Smooth all the way through.

Definitely the best of the four Bells I had on my trip to Ann Arbor. Id love for it to come out west.

Bells are always great. One of my absolute favorites. Great citrus pine aroma. Drinks with a splash of fruit, then finishes dry an piquant. Light body, medium bubble, amber our. Always a great drinker.

Draught at Maddys, Washington.
Golden with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma moderate malty (caramel), heavy hoppy (citrusy). Flavor moderate sweet, heavy bitter. Medium+ body. Nice and refreshing.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2011 1. Look  A hazy light golden IPA with a big frothy white head.
2. Sniff  A big hoppy aroma with some pine and citrus notes.
3. Sip  This is a light bodied IPA that is loaded with hops.  There is a dry long-lasting citrusy bitter finish that makes this a memorable IPA.
4. Another Look  There is a nice long lasting head and with consistent lacing throughout.
5. Evaluate  Overall, I really enjoy this beer.  It is a very easy drinking IPA with a big kick finish.  I absolutely love the aroma of this IPA.  I would most definitely recommend to IPA lovers.
Pours orange with medium white head, nice citrus and pine aroma and a noticeable caramel as well. Taste is piney with some slight caramel very nice balance and good medium bitter finish, good ipa.

12oz bottle from Picks poured into a shaker. Pours a cloudy orange with 1 finger of white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and grapefruit. Taste is medium bitter. Very piney and citrusy. Medium bodied with a slick yet creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a long bitter finish. Overall, very good. Probably one of my favorite IPAs for everyday drinking.

Date: September 15, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: 8th Street Grill, Minneapolis Appearance: Translucent golden with slight amount of head and some lacing. Aroma: Citrus/piney hops. Flavor: Consistent with aroma, but balanced nicely with sweet malt, medium bodied, and slight carbonation. Other: One of the best IPAs out there, very easy to drink.

Citrus aroma overtakes you upon opening.  This one is sticky in the glass with plenty of lacing.  Nice and sweet up front.  A little bit of caramel.  This gives way to piney hops at the end.  A little high on the alcohol content which affects the mouth feel.  Overall this a good every day drinker though!

A - Pours a clear golden-orange color with a frothy finger of white head atop. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is a mix of sweet caramel malts and citrus and piney hops. There is also just a bit of bready malts in the background.

T - Starts off with a mix of sweet caramel malts and some citrus hops with a bit of bitterness. Through the middle, the bitterness gets a bit stronger and the piney hops start to come through alongside some stronger citrus hops. The finish is a bit stronger on the piney hops and resin with some nice bitterness and some sweet caramel malts that linger.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a nice dry mouthfeel from the bitterness.

D - Very drinkable. Very nice hop malt balance with a solid hop profile. Very smooth and drinkable, even with a slightly high abv.
On tap. Golden in color, hops on the nose. Citrusy hops in flavor, very well balanced with malts. Great everyday beer.
12oz bottleA:citrus/pine/floral hops, bready notesT:pine/resin,floral,bread/grain maltsA great IPA!

I have drank tons of beer in my life and nothing compares to two hearted ale.  For my money, it is the best brew I have ever tried.  No, I havent tasted all IPAs or styles yet, (in the works) but I would love to find something better.  Great floral aroma and appearance with a nice head and lacing to boot.  The flavor and finish are even better than the aroma...I never tire of the taste and it seems to get better the more you drink.  A++ brew...thank you Bells Brewery, you rock.

(bottle, 6/20/10). Cloudy orange/copper color. Large off white head. Light floral hop aroma. Flavor of the same, with light sourness. Avg duration. Light bitter finish. Thin/slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

Always a treat.  Its golden orange color is very close to what I consider perfect for an IPA.  Its got that undoubtable sweet citrus smell of Centennial.  And man, what a well-balanced beer.  From start to finish, its never overwhelming in any direction.  Just smooth and clean.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2012 Pours a golden orange with a very inviting white creamy head.  Aroma is fruity citrus hop. This beer tastes amazing! A lot of fruity citrus hop flavors, grapefruit, tangerine, and candy.  The hop bitterness brings very nice balance to the whole brew.  The centennial hops are really amazing here - tons of orange, grapefruit, and pineapple flavor.  For me, this is a 7% session beer.

Easily one of the most refreshing IPAs. Nose is pine and floral with a hint of grapefruit. Taste is a complexity of floral, malt, hops and, dare In say it, umame. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean and the finish is delightful.

Served on-tap at Als of Hampden into a standard pint.

A - Pours clear golden orange with a small half finger tall white head, dissipating down to a light film, leaving thin sheets of lacing down the glass.

S - Plenty of piney hops up front mix well with a bit of sweet caramel malt and some fresh tropical fruits. Good overall balance of hops and other flavors. A classic and still one of the best.

T - A nice mix of piney and citric hops up front that last thruout the finish. Sweet caramel malt, grapefruit and other citric fruits, and a touch of bready yeast. Finish is quite bitter, lingering for some time. Good overall balance yet still plenty hoppy. Easily one of the best widely available beers out there, regardless of style.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Nice light feel, a bit dry, with lots of lingering bitterness in the finish.

D - I could drink this every day. One of the easiest drinking IPAs on the market. My go to beer when good beer is in short supply.
Deliciously hoppy- - floral, resin, and a little spruce, with a definite kick in the finish

Dans le spectre des IPA, celle là se trouve dans la zone floral avec des puissantes notes de citronnelle. Spectaculaire dans son créneau mais pas nécessairement ce que je recherche dune IPA. Bien conçu tout de même.
A very solid choice for a beer.  A great stand-by beer.  Commonly available.
Delicious IPA.  Bells knows hops.  Great crisp and clean IPA.  Taste is citrus/floral hops with light malts.  The hops are the star and they are very present and delicious.
12 oz bottle pours a orange amber head with a nice white head.  Aromas of citrus, pine, and sweet malt.  Great bitter finish, great beer
UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 On tap....pours an amber orange, nice off white head that sustains. Hoppy citrus aroma and taste, but not overpowering. A great late spring early summer ale. Very good!
Great beer.  Nice bitterness and aroma.  I like the matching citrus in the taste.
im not a hoppy person. so this isnt my style at all, given the rating. if you like the style, this is just about perfect though.
Such a great sipping beer! The taste is just the right amount of hoppiness.

Una ipa muy bebible,con bun toque de lúpulo.Muy limpia y  cremosa.
probada en tirador en Hop Leaf (chicago)

Poured a slightly hazy golden with a fluffy, white head. Citrus and floral notes right away with some sweetness. Nice hops without going overboard like many American IPAs. Great balance and wonderful finish. A truly remarkable beer.

Pours hazy light amber with a 1 finger head and decent retention.  Aroma is candy sweet caramel and citrusy hops.  Taste is toffee, lemon peel, grapefruit, and toast.  Body is medium-heavy with average carbonation and a slightly dry finish.  In my several years of enjoying this brew, I have determined that its signature character is a sort of candy-hop flavor.  Brilliant.  One of the best straightforward IPAs out there!
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 2011 rating. Bottle. Crisp and clean with a very nice bitterness. Quite an excellent beer I must say. 2015: a quality IPA citrus and a nice smooth palate.

A little over a month old bottle so still pretty fresh. 

A- Really nice appearance, one finger off white head, very clear dark golden yellow color, splotching lacing, nice carbonation. 
S- The aroma is really nice, smooth, very refreshing, juicy fruity flavors (peach, grapefruit, citrus) piney hops, nice malt backbone.
T- This is just a quality year round IPA, really balanced, solid fruity flavors, big grapefruit, pine, citrus, nice malt presence to balance it out, this is just a really balanced IPA.
M- Medium/light mouth feel, well carbonated, really smooth, extremely easy drinkability.
O- This is the craft beer that started it all for me; Ive had this so many times and have always forgotten to review it, just a quality beer that I will always fall back on, always reliable.
Hands down my favorite beer.  Have yet to try anything that comes close to its incredibly fresh taste.  I drink it like water.  Cheers.

Pours golden orange with a thick foamy head that slowly dissipates. Nose is a floral hop bouquet. Taste is an all-over refreshing bitter with a hint of sweetness trying to break through. Sizable amount of complexity to the palate, which is fantastic. Im glad this is available year round and seems pretty widely available either on tap or bottled at a lot of restaurants and bars in the "deadzone." Its damn good and my favorite IPA. And if youve ever tipped a canoe over in the Two Hearted River, youll know that its just as refreshing!
Picked up from Conch Island Liquors in Key West.  Aroma of hops, floral, and some grapefruit.  Taste is well balanced with some bitterness.

It pours a clear copper/honey color with a decent sized white head that leaves some good lacing. The aroma is of citrus, floral and piney hops with a little bit of bready malt with a definite grapefruit scent. The taste follows the nose, Id like it to be a little more complex but its quite good the blend of citrus, floral and piney hops come in witha little bit of a grassy taste followed by bready malts. The palate is a medium bodied crisp finsih with no sign of alcohol,
Overall: This is the craft beer I drink the most, its quite tasty and available everywhere.

Things I like...

LL Bean boots.
Canoeing a wilderness river.
Reading Thoreau.
Frontline on PBS.
A wood stove in the winter.
Flyfishing in Autumn.
A long roadtrip driving to Alaska.
Bells Two Hearted Ale.

Ive tried quite a few beers, and this beer deserves its own category, its almost beyond what you can call beer.

This has been one of my whales for awhile, lucky enough to try both on draft and in bottle over the weekend; pours attractive IPA with nice frothy head; aroma is clean but somewhat subdued; taste well balanced with bittering, flavor hops and malty base; very gut

Pours a nice burnt orange with a one finger head that fades after a while but never completely leaves.  Nice webbed lacing.  Grapefruit and grassy hops in the nose.  A very balanced IPA with a clean finish.  Very good.

Nice golden pour and bountiful aroma of citrus, caramels. and grass.  Taste is nice and bitter.   Great palate with a light body,  lively carbonation and  a great dry finish.  Overall, this is a great beer all around.  Not one thing is great but all together its a great beer.
Without a doubt, this is my favorite IPA. This beer is best on tap, and a perfect companion to spicy or barbecued food.

Simply delicious. floral with grapefruit notes and piney aroma. Pours golden orange with a light, quickly dissapearing head. ABV works well in balance with the ingredients. Not overpowering. Sweet fruity finish. Great beer overall.

Floral, citrus (orange, lemon, grapefruit), clover grassy hop with a bitter lingering trace of greenery on the tongue.  Fruit bitter.  Sweet and flowery smell quick after the pour, fading.  Have this with Fish Tacos, and remember that fresh water fish and salt water fish can sometimes live side by side.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2012 Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker pours clear deep golden with one and a half inch white head.  Medium carbonation, some lacing, and medium body.  Taste is spicy floral grapefruit and some piny hop bitterness.  So smooth and balanced for an IPA and very little bite.  Best IPA I have had, but still not one of my favorite styles.

Pours beautifully golden with one fingers worth of foamy white.  Aroma is floral and distinctively hoppy with some citrus and a bit of basil-esque herbaceousness.  Pleasant amount of carbonation. The slight sweetness compliments the complex citrus and hops flavors.  Anise/licorice flavors come forward as the beer warms and oxidizes.  Finishes dry and moderately bitter with just the tiniest note of alcohol lingering.  One of the finest IPAs Ive tasted to-date.
Floral hop notes on the nose.  Flavors of citrus and leafy hops.  Finishes with a mild bitterness.  Overall a pretty decent IPA
Perhaps the most satisfying IPA Ive had. Pine but mainly citrus (grapefruit). Great finish without being too tart,

A: Nice dark gold color and perfect carbonation for an IPA, but this beer has become more and more filtered over the years...

S: Excellent, super piny with some grapefruit that really stimulates the olfactory! The ABV is masked pretty well; no astringent or alcohol odor.

T: Superb. Very crisp and very hoppy but no where near overwhelming. The pine and grapefruit are also visible in the taste. This would be a great "session" or "lawn mower" beer if the ABV wasnt so high.

M: Yet again, great! Thin bodied but not watery. Its everything an IPA should be, IMO.

O: Love it and am happy to have regular/year round access to such a fantastic beer. Bells does beer right.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2015 Hazy gold with lots of sediment. Citrusy hops on the nose. Taste is rich and floral.  Hefty amount of citrusy, piney, floral hops. Good balancing malt makes for a big body. No question this is one of the highest quality ales Iâve ever had. In summary, itâs fresh, fruity, creamy, floral, malty, rich, hoppy and full bodied. One of the finest ales Iâve ever had.

Bottle/12oz - Poured a clear orange amber in color with a medium white head that stuck around to produce some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is hoppy... floral and citrus... with some alcohol.  Flavor was much more pine resin hops than either of the above.  Some sweetness that get quickly replaced by the medium bitterness.  Finish is lingering and bitter with some of the hop flavors tagging along at the end.  A really good IPA...

Nose is a subtle and pleasent citrus and floral with a hint of alcohol.  The taste starts out with a honey like sweentness, graduating into a well balanced bitterness.  Good palate.  Finishes with a dry and lingering sweetness.  Overall, what I like is the balance without the overpowering hops.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2012 floral, citrus, golden, clear, minimal head, medium bitterness, medium body, average carbonation.  loved it, very easy to drink yet wasnt lacking the hops that i love.  deserves this rating.

From a bottle purchased in Grand Marais, MN. Deep gold, thin lacy head.  Citrus and pine aroma.  Dry on the palate with a bit of the alcohol showing through.  Creamy with average carbonation.  Pleasant bitter from beginning to end.  A good brew.
very bitter, medium sourness, soft carbonation, bitter, alcohol, creamy,

Draft at RFD, 16 ounces served in 16 ounce glass. Yellow, slightly couldy, minimal white head, low carbonation. Amazing aroma. Citrus / pine, not overly piney. Cascade / amarillo aroma, very inviting. The beer screams, drink me! This is the type of beer that reminds me Im a hop head. Sweet full bodied nice bitterness. Not overwhelming, but characteristics of great hop flavor. Drinkability high, A truly well formed beer. A slight aftertaste, some bitterness on the back end hold son. not strong. A reasonable amount of lingering flavor. This is one of my favorite IPAs in the country.

Serving type: on-tap
A very tasty American IPA. Has a great citrus aroma. Has a nice amber color. Always pours well. Has a nice white head. The cascade hops are featured well. Not my first choice, but a great back up.
This beer comes o. Tap quite often at this local pub, and I am happy it does. Lovely centenial hops are pronouncedin flavour and odour. All around, this is a good beer.

A rich smell of citrus and hops comes from the bottle which hides a light and hoppy bite on first taste. Theres not as much citrusy taste as I was expecting given the smell, but everything balances out in the end. The pour is a hazy golden hue with a thin white head to it. The body is light to moderate which lingers a bit in the mouth. A great IPA to be sure!

Nice, clear orange-golden color with a decent white head that lingers.  The aroma of hops is strong, with notes of grapefruit and flowers, very good smelling.  The flavor again has the hops forefront with some citrus and malt, finishing with floral flavors.  Amazing flavor without overt bitterness, a truly great IPA.

Stark hopfiger, fast schon beißender Geruch nach typisch amerikanischem Aromahopfen. Voluminöser, wenn auch nicht ganz so stark wie erwarteter Antrunk mit deutlichen Bitternoten. Diese werden im Mittelteil wieder in den Hintergrund gedrängt, der Hopfen erlange abermals, wenn auch deutlich wässriger, den Hauptstatus. Der Hopfen word dann milder, ohne aber an Fülle zu verlieren. Die Gesamtintensität wird geringer, der Hopfen bleibt führend. Semiger Ausklang mit deutlichem Hopfen, ferner einigen dumpfen Bitternoten. 12/11/11/12/11/11

Nice golden straw color, but just a shade or two darker. Initial pour produced a huge white head. After it died down and I poured the rest I got a nice two finger head that lingers for quite awhile. Beautiful lacing left on the glass that stays just as foamy as the head was. Giant hop aroma seems to overpower anything else that may be trying to get out. There is a slight alcohol and sweet, sugary, malt aroma hidden in there. Other than the hops, thats about it.

The taste is something altogether different. There is a hop presence, but it is more on the back end. A bit of a flowery taste comes in up front. But it is mostly watered down malty tannins that are present. There is little body to this one. There is also an alcohol showing up in the taste as well. Along with all of that it leaves a dry feeling after each swallow. And a reminder that there is alcohol in this. I guess it borders on the low end of high ABV for the style, but it seems much higher than it is. Overall, it could be better.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2011 This beer is just as good as it is potent.  Bells Two hearted really has a great full bodied taste and a nice herb infused hoppy aroma. It is a nice dark gold and leans more to the hazy appearance.  the taste is more of a medium-heavy bitterness. again infused with the more earthy or herbal tastes. I am very satisfied with this beer, and drinking ingeniously here in WI is what i love to do. Sconnie beers are some of the best in the world.

Pours amber with a small white head.  Floral hops with some nuts and herbs.  Slight taste of sweetbread up front then a nice rounded wave of hops with a bitter finish that lingers a bit.  Very nice well balanced IPA. Will enjoy again.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2012 A very nice beer.  It is a bit to carbonated ... this adds to the bite.  However, you dont need bite there is enough bite just in the hops.  But the beautiful thing, the beer is not bitter afterword.  It can have a tinge of sweet/bitter after but not pure bitter.  This is excellent for an IPA... it is what people should try before all those bad IPA.  When on draft perfect balance.  Citrus amazing.  What does this have to do with a trout?  Ill never know.

A cloudy amber color with a lacey white head.  Full flavor with a floral hop taste which is light enough for people just getting started on IPAs but enough for those who love IPAs.  The alcohol is completely masked in this beer so drink it slow.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 The aroma is full of all-American hops of a very citrusy character--very nice. Its not chewy, but its creamy enough to sustain that taste and leave a lingering bitterness, with a touch of grapefruit, on the tongue. The first two out of the entire six pack also left an ever-so-slightly skunky feel on my tongue, but the other two I drank were crisp, delicious, and skunk-free. Also, for a 7%-ABV beer, you really dont feel the alcohol in your mouth, but youll feel it in your system after you down one bottle. And, brother, do they go down quickly. If you like this beer as much as I did, you will not be able to just sip it, so be careful if youre operating demolition machinery or something like that after drinking this.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 20 May 2011, bottle at one of cgarvieuks legendary tastings. pale yellow, slight haze. astringent grassy hops. thin body and fizzy. lemon rind hops and some orange pulp. not aggressively bitter but bitter, brisk and crisp. nice.

Enjoyable beer for IPA lovers, not as hoppy I was hoping.  It is a good tasting beer, one of the better IPAs, but there are hoppier IPAs out there.  Worth the try, worth buying a case.  A good beer for those who are not hop heads.

12oz bottle split with mcberko. Pours a cloudy amber/orange. with a thin white lacey head. aroma of pear, citrus, pine hops. Flavour of pine hops. Grapefruit-like palate, reasonably dry. Very smooth for this style, in my experience of these so far.Really light and full bodied. Beautiful.

12 oz. bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours hazy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of potent grapefruit, piney hops and citrus, balanced by caramel malt. Flavour is heavy on the piney hops, grapefruit and citrus, with just enough caramel malt. Most wonderful IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2011 12 oz bottle from Horrocks Farm Market in Lansing, batch #10337. Served in a snifter. Pours clear golden-amber with a tall, dense off white head. The head remains and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. The nose is amazing, with huge aromas of pine and toasted malts, along with flowers, citrus and resin. The flavour is moderately-intensely bitter with lots of pine and flowers, and a complex biscuity malt balance. The finish is long and dry with a resiny hop bitterness. On the palate, it is medium-full in body with a dry texture and lively carbonation. Overall, this is an excellent IPA with a beautiful, complex floral-piney aroma and a resiny finish. Very well constructed. 2011-05-14
Very subtle, not harsh aroma.   Amazingly smooth and crisp.  One of my favorite IPAs thus far.
Cloudy golden color. Nice sweet and hoppy aroma. Really REALLY smooth. My taste and overall rating are on the high end because I am rating it within the style, of which it is awesome!

Tap @ Scottys. Clear orange-gold pour with a short white head leaving minimal lace. Nose has some hoppiness, but otherwise unremarkable (sitting outside, so nose is compromised). Solid, medium body with a smooth, chewy and almost creamy mouth feel: this IPA invites you to swallow it down in one go. Carbonation is moderate and very fine, which likely contributes to the superb palate. Malts are toasty with some almonds, hops are pine and grapefruit. This is a very cogent IPA which deserves more time and pints than I can give it just now. I did note that it doesnt seem to progress well as it warms.
Pours a golden amber with a medium white head that laces the glass nicely. Fruity aroma dominated by citrusy hops. Awesomely balanced hoppy taste. Medium-bodied and very smooth. Amazing IPA.

Citrus grapefruit aroma. Appearance is golden with a nice head. Taste is citrus grassy hops with a pleasant copper taste. Palate is nice and carbonated with a resinous taste to it. Overall I am sad I cant get this in Colorado.

12 oz bottle....pours a beautiful amber....wonderful hoppy nose coupled with a similarly hoppy taste....well balanced / hops are strong but there is more there....wonderful IPA....glad this one is available all year round...

Draft.  This beer for its style will not be beat in my opinion.  Holy bouquet of awesomeness batman. Pours a golden orange color with a nice white head.  Aroma is reeking with fruity and floral hops; from grapefruit to tropical hints. It just smells like the smoothest bowl of fruity pebbles.  Tastes of superbly balanced fruity and resiny hops with a great malt backbone.  Just an unbelievable IPA that I wake up on Saturdays just wanting to do yardwork so I can earn to drink this fantastic brew.

Apr 23, tap @ Excentric Café. Pours clear orange amber with a small off white head. Aroma is fruity, citric, fresh, Medium hoppy mouthfeel. Citric, hoppy, fruity, caramel, apricot and pungent flavor. Hoppy medium palate. Finishes slightly fruity and nicely tart. Sooo nice.

Pours a cloudy gold with small white head.  It looks like it has character and it delivers.  The aroma is hoppy floral pine. The initial taste is bitter but the second is better, as so on as your palate adjusts to a very nice IPA.

12 oz Bottle.  Appearance is very dark orange, almost amber with medium head.  Aroma is primarily citrus with some notes of bread and floral hops.  Taste is lightly citrus, sweet malts, cereals with a stark floral hop flavor.  Despite strong hop notes, bitterness is nicely subdued being balanced by the big malt character.  Brew sits well on the palate, has great balance, and a pleasant, dry aftertaste.  Not the best IPA Ive had, but definitely top notch.
Bottle from Javit from TBS.  Awesome.  Really a great IPA, quickly became one of my favorites.  Taste is very bitter, nice and sharp, with a good pine bite, which I love.

Strong pine and floral aroma.  Nice malty almost cotton candy aroma as well.  Slightly hazy, orange-golden beer. Thick off white head. Very nice bitterness without any harshness.  Very smooth.  Big mouth feel with plenty of carbonation.  Exceptional IPA.
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2013 Aroma is citrus, biscuit malts and a hint of earthiness.  The flavor is citrus, malts, hop resin, light grapefruit and a very bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2011 Looked forward to this one, from a bottle too. Poured into a thick highball glass, the head was white and fairly light. Lacing was nothing special, but the golden color and carbonation was intriguing. Aroma was instant citrus, very bitter - obviously because of the hops, but it smelled rather fresh. First taste was a litter bitter, but then exploded into a mix of ripe dry citrus fruits and hops. The balance of this IPA was perfect - Bells does it again! The finish is very satisfying on the palate, being rather foamy and warming towards the end of every sip. This is one to either be enjoyed by itself or paired with something fresh and spicy :-).

Nose is packed full of floral and fruity hop aromas.  Sweet tropical fruits, citrus, pine, slightly resiny.  Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a billowing white head; good retention and thick lacing.  Flavor is very fruity, lots of citrus, grapefruit in particular, some sticky resiny hops.  Great malt profile as well; toasty and cereal flavors do a great job of balancing the hops, some slight residual sweetness works really well in this beer.  Up-front bitterness fades quickly to pleasant hop character, little lingering bitterness on the tongue.  Medium body with some sweetness, average carbonation.  Absolutely fantastic IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2013 Re-rate 10/17/13: 

Ok, Im finally going to give this beer another shot. Ive shit on it twice now, but Im going to give it the benefit of the doubt due to perhaps old bottles. Bells just started distributing in NY this week, this beer was bottled less than 2 weeks ago. If its not good this time around then its never going to be good. 
Pours a clear gold with a white head. Aromas of bitter pine. Taste is like crushed Tylenol sprinkled with some citrus juice. A little too sweet. A little too thin. A little too boring. Finsihes pretty quickly with a small bit of bitterness and very low hop presence. No real juicy hop expression at all. No tropical fruit.  No new ground being covered here. THIS IS AN INTRODUCTORY IPA. People who are easily impressed score this beer highly. This is a beer for novices. Upgrading my score from 2.0 to 2.9. Never again will I waste my money on this tripe. 



this may be one of the most overrated beers on the planet. I found nothing special about this ipa.  Not nearly as good as hop stoopid or even southern tier ipa. Dissapointing hop profile, this beer is just not very good.  Not a fan at all.  Would not buy again. RERATE:  what a pile of shit this beer is. Am I just getting old bottles or something?  I cant believe how plain and uninspired this beer is. Would rather drink malt liquor.

golden body, settling head, good lacing, fantastic sweet floral aroma. floral, citrus, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish. never disapoints.

Poured out of a 12 oz bottle.  Ive been wanting to try two hearted for some time.  It didnt disapoint.  My only complaint is the aroma.  Other reviews rave about the hoppy aroma.  Didnt come through for me.  The malt overpowered the hops for me.  Everything else was there for a great IPA though.  This is a very, very good beer.

On tap.  Pour is orange, slightly cloudy, with a decent off-white head.  Aroma is huge!  Tons of things going on here.  I get grapefruit and other citruses, plenty of pine, and loads of complex floral/perfumey smells that I cant really identify.  Smells very sweet, too.  Flavor is heavy on the citrus with orange and grapefruit up front.  Aggressively bitter in a very good way.  The citrus quickly gives way to those floral notes with a strong caramel sweetness throughout.  Very, very long lingering bitter finish.  Very complex and enjoyable beer.

12 oz bottle from PA. Golden yellow/light amber color. Really hoppy aroma upfront, like smelling a bag of hops! Nice medium mouth feel. Nice malty aroma with slight sweetness upfront that slowly gives way to a bitter slightly dry finish. By no means is this an aggressive, super resin packed IPA.
