Its absolutely delicious for those who enjoy hops but arent huge into super dry and bitter IPAs. Really amazing IPA, exactly how I like it. Overall: (A)

12 oz. pours pale yellow with a white 1/2" head. Smells of grapefruit, pine, mango and a slight floral note. Wonderful piney, grapfruit, orange peel,  lemon, and there is a great malt undertone to this as well. Mouthfeel is medium oily because of the hop character and very drinkable. The finish is long and bitter but very smooth! Awesome brew!
Light amber color with a big, frothy head.  Nice floral, citrusy aroma.  Palette is great.  The floral and citrus notes carry over into the taste with a nice hop finish.
Golden orange pour with large frothy head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit and lychee fruit. Taste is grapefruit, honey and a nice hoppy finish that is just right and not to harsh. Good beer.
Golden clear pour with frothy white head. Smells wonderfully of hops. Very balanced crisp beer. Absolutly loved it. =)

Pours a brilliant clear gold with a frothy half inch head.  Lots of carbonation.  Hefty hops hit the nose first, with lots of pine and grass characteristics.  Mild cereal malt fills out the rest of the aroma, filling in the cracks left by the hops.  Moderate carbonation, good mouthfeel, nice hop bitterness in the finish.  Taste is hop forward, but theres a nice subtle malt sweetness that helps balance things out.  The body of the beer is lightly syrupy, though the heavy carbonation helps keep it from being over powing or cloying.  Overall its a very solid and very drinkable example of the American IPA style.
well balanced.  big hops with chocolate.  Finishes grassy with thyme and gas.  Light mouth.

Appears a nice orange to amber color with a nice, thick white head that leaves great lacing. The nose is full of citrus and pine scents, and they are very present in the taste as well. Theres also some nice balance to the taste as some malts stand out as well. This is medium bodied and it goes down very easily. Overall a great IPA, and one of my favorites!
Aroma is very floral hops. Taste is floral hops with a hint of spices. Bitterness is pretty heavy. Overall a great IPA with a lot of character, although IPA isnt may favorite style.

The most wonderful thing about Two Hearted is that even when I am drinking a bottle like this one, which is probably close to two months old and thus not nearly at its hoppy peak, is that even with the toned down hop flavors the beer still tastes delicious because of what I assume is crystal malt that is very clean, crisp, lightly sweet, somewhat resembling wheat.  Just a very, very good IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2013 12oz Bottle. Very complex hops flavor. Floral, with spruce taste, maybe some ginger... Plus a lot more things that I cant quite put my finger on. This is the kind of beer that makes me want to keep taking sips just so I can further examine the flavor, its very interesting. 8 / 5 / 9 / 4 / 17 Re-rate, 2/3/12: On tap. No date sticker on the keg. Clear yellow orange color. Thin white head, leaves good lace. Medium body. Smooth, lighter carbonation with a crisp finish, more dry texture. Floral hop character, light spruce tips, light citrus (grapefruit). Moderate bitter, with a lightly zesty sweet finish. The hops havent been as pungent and powerful lately as I remember the from the first couple times, but this is still unique and tasty in that Two Hearted way.
very drinkable, dry finish, piney. somewhat cloudy, no alcohol, gimme mo !
One of my five favorite beers, from perhaps my favorite brewery.  Even the name makes me happy.

First beer during RBSG 2010. This was just before walking to Founders. On tap at the hotel. Drank side by side with my good buddy savvy1982. My pint had a nice orangy amber brew with an good sized off white fluffy head sitting in it for me to slam back... but early pacing made me look like a pussy as Kyle dropped back 2 and could have drank a third in the time I put back one. Great flavour in this thing - no let down for the hype. Soft and very creamy on the way down. Some light spice... man! is this a unique taste! Spearmint, caramel, cookies, apricot, grapefruit and thick herbal qualities. Soft orange aroma with candy, more fruits... tropicalish, resiny hops, caramel... all goodness. On the gassy side. A great beer to sit back with my new drinking partner for the week.

Bottle and draft many times. Wonderful IPA. Full of hop aroma and flavor. Very citrus head/start at first sip. Citrus notes just tickle the taste buds. Finishes hoppy with a touch of malt. What can I say that hasnt been said. A real winner here!
From a tap,citrus, orange, hazy, white foam, medium bitterness, mango and grapefruit,light sweetness, a very good ipa.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2013 Pours a golden straw yellow color.  Aroma is of dark citrus.  Mouthfeel is very smooth, which Im beginning to recognize as a trait of all Bells beer.  Initial flavor is malty with a sharp bite and active carbonation followed by bitter hops and finishing with a residual citrus flavor.

Tap at Bells. Pour golden orange with white head and outstanding lacing. Aroma citrus hops, malty sweetness, and caramel. Taste citrus fruits, grapefruit, mango, touch malty sweet but then is perfectly balanced back by a great non abrasive bitterness. MF medium body good carb. Outstanding beer and a tribute to great IPAs.

This beer pours a slighty cloudy gold with a white head, no real lacing.

It smells very very fruity, citrus dominating, with a slight note of hops.

It tastes wonderful. It is sweet and citrus but has a great bitter taste at the end. The thing that makes it great is that the bitter note is the best IPA end Ive had and allows you to drink a ton of them.

Pours a nice golden orange color with a foamy head.  Head is slightly off white.  Smells like pine needles and dandelions.  Delicious.  Taste is fairly bitter.  Nice dandelion component mixed with pine resin and a WHOLE forest of pine trees.  Weeee
Nice light hop scent and light golden color. Pleasant taste with a slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2011 Floral hops, tons of citrus. Fresh on tap this beer has a ton of floral aromas and is crazy drinkable. In bottles, it looses some of that aroma, but is still retain the citrus hoppy goodness with a good mouth feel and a crisp finish.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2011 Amber, slightly cloudy pour with a clean almost creamy white head. Citrus/floral aroma plus yeast? Aroma could be confused for an unfiltered wheat beer almost. Nice citrusy taste, balanced and refreshing. Slightly bitter aftertaste (there are the hops!) that goes away fairly quickly. 

12oz bottle into SA perfect pour

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2012 From the tap and it is good.  Cant wait to have more.  It outdistances many brews.  Bells gets it right on this one.  Aroma, taste, citrusy, all superb.

Update:  I bought a six pack because I hadnt had a tha in a while, so it was a no brainer to buy some.

There was little lacing and the flavor was lacking the important components.  I wasted 12 dollars on bad brew.  You cant win them all.

A new six pack was purchased and the same great ipa flavors with decent lacing.  Two Hearted has good days and bad days, I spose.

Had to lower the rating due to inconsistent quality.  I will give them a break and the benefit of the doubt.

Tough to beat Crooked Tree IPA from Dark Horse.  Stone IPA is a great brew.  Firehouse Union Jack IPA is one fine brew too.

One Of My favorite Pale Ales.  
From Bottle.
Pours A Beautiful Copper Color With A Creamy Head A Little Over An Inch High,  Very Citrusy Floral Aroma.  Almost Like Being In A Flower Garden That Is Also Growing Hops.  Very Crisp Dry Taste.  Very Smooth And Easy To Drink.  A Hoppy Bitterness Taste Almost Makes My Mouth Pucker.  
Definately Worth Trying

Pours a medium orange, with a avg. sized cream, white, head.  Aroma of piney hops, grapefruit, and some other citrus notes.  Flavor is sweet, and hoppy with an orange note in the backdrop.  Finishes with a nice bitterness.
Pours a slightly opaque orange color.  Aroma of grapefruit, lavender and a hint of pine.  Flavor is grapefruit, citrus, vanilla, floral.  Very refreshing and well balanced.

Bottle (thanks to madvike for trading)...  Batch 10184, packaged January 18 Poured golden with a white head.  Balanced and drinkable and not too much complexity for its strength.  Citrus, pine, orange zest with a nice bouquet of hops.  A leafy, earthy presence, tang juice and a wee bit of malt in the back there.

I am not much of a hop head, but when the mood strikes, this is my go to beer. Pours a rich amber with a nice tight head. The classic aromas of citrus abound, grapefruit, Seville oranges and a light toffee note in the background. Sharply bitter upfront, the the caramel sweetness of the malt body makes this eminently drinkable and not a simple exercise in drinking hop juice.

05-MAR-2011, bottle in Orlando, from Whole Foods Orlando.
Golden with white lasting head.
Some fruity notes on the nose, but mostly this is just a bitter hoppy monster.
Really creamy with fine length makes it a fantastic IPA.
Really fresh, loads of grape fruit, piney and fruity.
I like this. Best IPA in a while.

From the bottle I get a nice pour with a vigorous head and lacing that follows. Appears a golden copper with some haze from the yeast in the bottom of the bottle. The nose gets a citrus juniper blast leaning toward the piney side. The taste is nicely balanced with some grapefruit, pine and a fair malt presence as this brew warms a bit. I love the slightly higher ABV %. Nice medium mouthfeel with a little peppery note in the finish. Mmmm beer!

Bottle from trade with Savvy1982. Thanks Kyle!! Pours orange with a 1 inch foamy head. Head becomes filmy within minutes. Aromas of clean and crisp hops. Lots of floral notes, some underlying pine. Plenty of sweetness in the nose as well. The taste is very similar to the aromas. Lots of refreshing bitterness. Medium bodied and very well balanced. This is one of the best IPAs I have had in a long time.

One of my favorites!  Pours a dark orange with a full off white head. Aroma is spicy hoppy pine, and a touch of citrus. Taste is malt, caramel and a little sweet with citrus.  Nice balance and very clean.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2012 Bottle, 355ml. Wow, one of my personal favorites. The aroma of this ale is full of wildflowers/rose-like accents. Extremely floral. Also, hints of honey and sweetness were found in the scent as well. Poured amber colored with a huge, fluffy, white head. Extremely crisp and refreshing with a subtle aftertaste. Nice balance of hops and floral flavors with a medium amount of carbonation. I should have bought more than one! Great beer.
First tasted this beer in COlumbus ohio two years ago and have been hooked ever since.  Very smooth, wouldnt change anything about it except for a stronger push to bring this beer to Akron

Pours a golden orange with a full off white, almost yellow, head.  Aroma is spicy hoppy pine.  Taste is sweet malt, caramel and grapefruit.  Not too bitter, which is a good thing.  Well balanced and refreshing.
Really has become my favorite and go to beer. Pretty awesome to have such availability for such a regularly fantastic beer.

Bottle pours a goldenrod yellow color with a white head, no lacing.  Floral and citrus aromas.  Taste is similar, very hoppy and bitter, but the tastes are subtle and kind of sneak up on you.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Very happy I finally found this beer.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2011 Picked up at a random gas station in Indiana. Wow, was a I surprised at the hop profile this beer carried. Additional malt is needed for a little more support but this is one amazing beer. Recommended

Its official, I LOVE BELLS!!!! All of Bells beers are fantastic.  I wasnt a big fan of Ales until I drank this.  The color is a very rich deep gold and the aroma is intoxicating.  With all Bells beers, theres no terrible after taste, clearly its made with quality ingredients and lots of focus on the brewing process.

This beer reminds me of a high-altitude wildflower slope in Colorado.  Tons of floral aroma and taste from a lot of hops, it could practically be a wildflower tea.  A little spice gives a nice crispness to it.

Pours easily with a nice head that sticks around better than mpst ales, even at colder temperatures.  Carbonated nicely with a typical IPA golden color.  Little bit of a honey-sweet and sticky aftertaste.

Beautiful hoppiness in the nose. Nice floral notes as well. Pours with about an inch of head. Nice clean finish which means you can enjoy your hops while being able to drink multiples if youre into that sort of thing.
UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 Bottle from Bullit & can from Beer Gonzo. Big sweet hoppy aroma & flavour. Amber brown colour. Dry hoppy aftertaste. This is the daddy of all IPAs. Very easy drinking.

A floral and hoppy aroma. The taste has a hop sweetness that is only comparable to the sweetness that vanilla adds to dishes, more of a floral and less of a sugar sweetness-- the flavor is followed by hop bitterness with a very slight touch of pine bitterness. The beer feels like it fills your mouth, not watery or syrupy, just right with a healthy dose of carbonation. Very good beer.

Good beer with strong alcohol content.  Has pretty good aroma, but not a wonderful as their Hopslam.  Golden / brass color with a decent white head.  Taste pretty bitter, but not too bitter for those non-IPA fans.  Does have some IPA after bite though.  Would recommend.
Clear yellow beer with an off-white head. Very hop-fruity aroma, but not very bitter for an american IPA. Medium body and very easy to drink.

A little dated, had at the Detroit Airport.  Still tasted awesome considering the setting and the layover.  Pours a slightly cloudy dusty brown with a thinning white cap.  Aroma is intense pine hops and light citrus.  Taste is a blast of pine hop with a dry bitterness.  Nice aftertaste of citrus.  Great, great beer.

Light amber pour with a thin ring of white head.  Smell:  Quite fragrant:  hops, floral notes, a little sweetness.  Taste:  Hops, citrus, grapefruit, orange, malt.  Bells two hearted ale has a slightly bubbly mouthfeel with a crisp clean finish that lingers slightly....Plenty of hops throughout!  A pretty good IPA, but not among my favorites.  I was slightly disappointed  with this beer.  For all of the press and accolades Bells has been getting recently I really was expecting more from this beer.  (It was rated #11 in the best american breweries of the decade 2000-2009)  So far with Bells beers Im 0-2, though I have yet to try the stout.  From what Ive seen so far, Id have to say that Bells is as almost as overrated as Dogfish Head.
I havent had this in a while, it was the first IPA I really loved. It is nice and citrusy with a medium to low bitterness.

This is such a great IPA. On my favorites. Its so beautifully balanced. I love taste. The floral and grapefruit is why Im falling more and more in love with hops. The last few beers I drank had such a pine/juniper aroma and this one is so different. Gonna be my go to until I fall in love with a different IPA.

This is probably my favorite "go to" IPA.  There is nothing else that quite satisfies my citrus craving like Two Hearted.  The flavors and aromas imparted by the centennial-only hops in this beer, are unmatched by the majority of IPAs available,  The aroma is very clean and the lemon and grapefruit scents present themselves early and often.  Very good mouth-feel and carbonation (velvety and bottle-conditioned), with just enough malt backbone to compliment the hop characteristics without overpowering them.  My eternal gratitude, Larry Bell.
Absolutely delicious. Excellent taste and aroma, a lot of citrus (grapefruit and orange are very prominent) and great hop flavor. If you like IPAs you will love Two Hearted Ale.
Cloudy orange gold pour from bottle.  Thin white head.  Aroma is hops and pine.  Taste is citrus, mint and mild sweetness.  Dry finish.  Bells scores again.

Bottle- Pours a slightly hazy copper color with a full head that slowly fades to lacing. Has a nice clean herbal and citrus aroma. Has a clean citrus taste with a trace of malt sweetness. Nice bitterness and a fairly dry finish. medium body, crisp and refreshing. Very well balanced. Best American IPA I have had to date. Great beer any time, any place.
Bottle from Cavie.  Amber pour with a white head.  Aroma is a little sweet, floral, and sappy.  Taste is a little fruit, pine, and some caramel.  Great finish.
I love most all the Bells, and this one is near the op of the class. Nice appearance, substantial hops without being over the top, and a very clean "bite" from beginning to end.
12 ounce bottle. Dark gold color, fluffy white head. Big pine aroma. Wonderful balance of hops and malt taste. Delicious! Great hops but not overpowering. Not a bad brew.

Another Bells beer getting extreme praise. I dont get it. This is not good. Period. I think if your not from Michigan than you think this beer is amazing and if you are from Michigan and you love it then you just havent had that many beers to compare against.

Bottle from a trade with HopBurp.  Pours hazy, bright orange, with a small light beige head.  The aromas are lemon zest, floral hops, caramel, funky papaya, and overripe fruit; overall, fruity and floral.  The flavor is sweet papaya, pine and citrus bitterness, and sugary fruit, with citrus rind in the finish.  Full-bodied and creamy, with low carbonation; very smooth and drinkable.  This stuff is fantastic, I wish I had access to more.
absolute gold...great drinkable beer that is good to start the night with.  high enough abv to give you a boost but smooth enough to keep them coming.

Review from notes, sampled 1/31/2008
12 oz bottle received in a trade with Jay23 Thanks for the opportunity.

Pours a slightly cloudy amber color with a fluffy white head that leaves lots of lacing as it drinks. Aroma is all hops. Spicey, piney, grapefruity hops in all their glory. Taste is more hops with a little malt struggling to get through. Medium mouthfeel and ample carbonation round this brew out well. Pretty good IPA. I couldnt drink to many of these, but nice brew just the same.

Wow, the unique hoppy flavor had me confused.  It hit me hard and finished soft. The flavor seemed to be a pine/rose explosion, but never overwhelmed the rich maltyness.  The was one uniquly flavored beer, but oh so enjoyable.
On tap at the American ale house. Gold with a thin white head. Aroma is very floral and faint pine. Flavor is sweet flower, citrus and pine. Very smooth and sessionable. Great IPA.

Clear golden with reddish hues. very little head.
Floral nose. 
Extremely light bodied.  Very well balanced. Sweeter then i was expecting but with a crisp finish. Very nice and would be a great session beer.

Poured into a pint glass.

5.0 A: Hazy straw color. Two fingers of thick creamy head with excellent retention. This bitch is sticky as hell as tons of lacing fills my glass.

4.0 S: Floral and citrus hops dominate the nose. Theres also a healthy bit of pine in there as well. Lots of fruitiness with pineapple up front and hints of mango in the background.

4.0 T: Overall its more balanced than I was expecting. Not too bitter, but hop flavor is plentiful. Pine and citrusy mango are foremost int the taste. Also present is a pleasant caramel maltiness.

4.5 M: Medium body. Very creamy with good carbonation. Well done here.

4.5 D: Because its relatively well-balanced, this is a very drinkable beer. Well done.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-11-2009 04:53:12

Wow.  It doesnt get much better than this.  Ive waited a long time to rate this, usually stick to rating the beers from outside my availability..  Going to rate this super high quality local though  Drinking this reminds me of all the fun times Ive had with friends while drinking this beer over the years.  Nose is so pungent.  Mango, floral, sweet pineapple aroma.  Appears a nice burnt orange color.    the taste is just the ultimate balance and the most tasty flavors of hops ever.  It finishes so Fing smooth its not even funny.  This is dominant and invigorating on the taste buds.

Same bottle as pictured. This beer is fantastic. Almost perfect. I would like to try some on tap as soon as I can. I may have to drive down to Grand rapids and stay in a tall building there to have this beer again.

{thoughts} Classic, classy. Amazingly superior to so many new generation IPAs and all done so effortlessly.

{elements} Hazy amber hue; rocky, white froth. Big, juicy hop nose of grapefruit and fruit loops; subtle biscuit malts; honey and floral undertones. Gentle sweetness upfront gives way to a pointed but clean bitterness with a tingling aftereffect; tastes of honeyed biscuits with a giant punch of grapefruit. Silky texture, soft carbonation, medium bodied. 12 oz bottle, batch 10011.
Great OPA. Yellow-orange color. Very nice giant head. Has tastes of citrus and gips. Some bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall one of the best american beers I had so far.
Great beer, this one is quite amazing. yummm, highly recommend a taste, this has a nice aroma, very well rounded. much less bitter then I was expecting but overall great beer

12 ounce bottle purchased at Sun Devil Liquors in Phoenix.  This is currently the second highest IPA on RateBeer, between my beloved locals Alesmith IPA and Sculpin.  Pours a honey-golden hue with two fingers of white foam which leave some nice lacing.  Aroma of moderate hops (citrus, some tropical fruit, some floral) as well as some dusty malts.  Flavor has some nice tropical fruit notes (overripe pineapple), grapefruit.  It has a good level of bitterness with a nice balancing semi-sweet maltiness.  Light lingering bitterness with a dry finish.  Good, but I recall liking this better when I had it on tap at The Brick Store in Atlanta last summer.  (2130, 438)
fantastic brew, the hops are well balanced with a smooth oaky flavour. the finish was an interesting dry bitterness. i wish Bells was easier to find.

Pour is a a light shade of gold with a white head. Nose is purely of citrus and needles. Taste is very refreshing and rather unique for an IPA, extremely smooth. Palate is light and defines it as a damn fine beer.
The aroma will have you hooked. The ballance of flavor is perfect. The alcahol effect is unique

Had this on tap at Reds Alehouse in North Liberty, IA. Pours a nice orange with a thick white head. Nice lacing around the glass, nice citrus hop aroma. The flavor is nice and hoppy with grapefruit and lemons. Amazing beer! Good stuff!

This was the beer that made me care about beer.  I bought it blindly because it was named after the Hemingway story.  I remember that moment of awakening, where, drinking it out of the bottle, sitting on the floor in my apartment, I tasted beer for the first time. I had the same awakening with coffee drinking a Metropolis Coffee (Chicago) Schweiks blend while driving down Granville.  Thank you Metropolis and thank you Bells.

On tap as usual, pours a very nice yellow-orange color with a nice white cream head. The smell is a strong citrus with a big hop presence. Taste is incredible citrus, lemon zest with a mild pine finish. Great lacing on the glass through the whole beer. The mouth fell is like BANG here are your hops, but yet so easy to drink. This is one of my favorite IPAs if not my number one. I always find myself buying this keg after trying all the rest; this is the go to IPA!!!!!

On draft at Ryan Brauns Lake Geneva.  Pours a crystal clear light amber with virtually no head.  Aroma is grapefruit, citrus, hops.  Medium on the palate with medium carbonation.  Flavor is very hoppy, citrus with a touch of malt.  Well worth the high ratings.
Cloudy yellow, soapy but not spongy head. Low on the bitter scale, nice smooth IPA $1.79/120z @ Total Wine & More

Cloudy orangish/yellow color with brighter yellow highlights around the bottom.  The head is very full and soapy looking.  Its off white with slight orange tinges.  Well endowed head with tremendous retention and adequate lacing.  Strong citrus aroma of orange and grapefruit.  The hops also smell a bit floral.  Smells clean and fresh and very well balanced.  Smells like an orange juice cake or orange punch.  Lovely.  The taste is very similar to the smell with a plentiful amount of orange and grapefruit bitterness.  The orange seems to pull through a bit more.  Only a smidge of alcohol is detected.   Again an orange punch type of flavor.  Very good.  Medium mouthfeel.  Crisp and smooth.  Mostly dry with a nice warming alcohol bite.  As the beer warms, it becomes more watery.  Does go down easy however.  This is another beer that I can understand why people enjoy so much.  It is very good and very easy to drink.  I wish I had another one.  I like how the orange is a bit more dominant over the grapefruit.  Changes things up a bit.  Most definitely worth a try if you havent sample it yet.  Im going to be sure to pick it up again sometime soon.

Bottle. Nice finger of pure white foamy head that leaves some nice residual lacing lines.  Citrus-like hops with a piny finish in the aroma, completely devoid of sweetness, which is awesome.  Not astringent or overkill in any respect, and this continues to the taste as well. Very light grapefruit, but a nice hop burn, and moves on to a sherbert-like finish thats dry and soft at the same time.  The balance thats struck Dry, but not overly so, and soft body comes to mind. Between the aggressive hops, and the delicate finish is really astonishing.  The only other brewer that does this is Shaun Hill.  Squeezing in the hop greatness, but making a wonderfully drinkable and nuanced brew is actually kind of rare in my tasting experience.  Awesome IPA, and certainly worth the hype. Glad to have regular access to it now.

Bottle.
Very nice floral hop aroma along with some citrus and herbal notes. Surprisingly smooth given the strong hop aroma, a light bitterness along with a bit of light spice on the palate. A quality IPA.
Great IPA.  Pours dark golden color and aroma is amazing.  Floral, citrus.  Sweet malt taste perfectly balanced by substantial hoppy bitterness and spicyness.

Whilst this isn’t a hop monster it is lovely balanced and really drinkable. Generous floral/tropical fruit nose. Quite bitter with a long, dry finish. Very well made and a great example of the more balaced mid west IPA. Would drink sixers of this by the gallon if I could! Thank you Skyview!

Bottle from Breeze Thru.  Pours a honey orange with a bit of a foamy head.  Aroma is terrific floral and bitter hoppiness.  One of the best aromas EVER in a brew; opening the bottle brings me home ...  Flavor is tangy fruit, piney-ness, bitter hops.  Long bitter finish.  Alcohol well hidden, but comes through.  Just an excellent hoppy ipa.
Pours to a cloudy golden amber with a nice, one-finger head.  Flavorful, with a nicely balanced level of carbonation.
12oz bottle.  Aroma of lforal hops plus citrus and pine notes.  Flavor very strong of hops with a little caramel malts.  Thicker than normal for an ipa.  Great beer
This is a beautifully balance IPA with tons of citrus hop flavor and the perfect amount of residual malt character. The day they distribute to Southern California will be a good day.

Poured out of a bottle at about 50F into a clear pint glass. Nice orange-honey color. 1" white head that doesnt go away, medium-thick lacing.   Big and wonderful aroma of pine & citrus -- lemon & grapefruit.   Lots of carbonation, slightly malty up front with a wonderful bitter hoppy finish.   I like this beer a lot, its one of my favorite IPAs.

Dear got this stuff is good, I drink it whenever I can.  Huge citrusy nose and great hoppy body, smooth taste and tons of hops thoughout and at the finish.  Really a great great pale ale.  Special note, if you can get some on cask its truly great.

(Batch 10076 I think...) One of my favorite standby IPAs.  A great beer.  Nice aroma of pine and citrus, with a bit of sweetness lingering on the end.  Taste is much the same.  Good malt backbone backed and balanced by a load of hops.  Bitterness lasts without being overwhelming.  Love it.

Pours a clear golden color with a thick head.  Aroma is of hops, grapefruit, a little banana, and bubble gum.  Flavor is of hops, grass, citrus, malts, and bread.  Leaves a grassy hop finish.  Much better than I originally thought it was going to be.

Draft.  Clear golden orange pour, small white head.  Big hop aroma, a little citrus and floral, herbal, spicey, rich dank notes.  Crisp, bright flavor with minimal sweetness, hops match the lovely aroma with a sharp, lingering resinous bite.  Very well crafted and clean with great complexity.  This is the first beer Ivec tried on the east coast that I wish I had in the west.
Best beer Ive ever had.  Very balanced IPA.  Great flavor and incredible aroma.

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of floral hops, citrus, & some malt; Flavor of slight sweet malt, pine hops, citrus (notably grapefruit), and caramel; Finish is bitter; Very nicely balanced; Great IPA.
Slightly hazy deep golden color. Great citrus hop aroma. Nice balance between caramel malt and hops on the palate, very smooth and well-integrated.

The nearly perfect IPA, in the multiple times Ive had this it gets better every time. Grapefruit and citrus, minimal off flavors and none of that sweet malty junk that messes up other IPAs. I can drink it all night long, and in many occasions, I have.

Finally a good beer on tap at "The Elephant and Castle", The Avenue Hotel, Chicago.
Quite light in colour, a beautiful hoparoma. Wonderful taste, maybe a little too much resin in the aftertaste. But this is a beer I could drink all night, except that the alcohol kicked in after beer #2. Very easy-drinking.

G: Poured into a Bells pint glass.

A: A slightly pale orange/apricot color with a good mostly-white head.

S: Hops, hops, and hops. Lots of floral and citrus aromas.

T: Again, bright citrus and floral hops with a pretty good malt backbone.

M: Light-to-medium mouthfeel with a good amount of carbonation.

D: A great night-long IPA. I was so sorely disappointed when this left Chicago, but Im so glad to have it back.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 04-24-2009

A beautiful light pour, see through with the perfect tan hue. Small frothy head. A very distinct taste and aroma of citrus. Great beer for IPA lovers, not as hoppy I was hoping but a great great tasting beer.

Notes from Tuesday, September 7 2010

Ar: Extremely fruity with great grapefruit and guava aromas.  A bit of floral hops as well.  About as good as it gets.
Ap: Pours a light copper with bright orange tinge.  1" head diminishes quickly and leaves nice lace.  A few particles of sediment as well.
F: Follows the suit of the aroma.  Big citrus notes, but more pine and floral take the place of the guava.  Nice and refreshingly bitter finish.  Little to no alcohol burn.  Amazingly sessionable for a pretty big IPA.
P: Medium-thick body compared to other IPAs.
O: Fabulous.

Ive had this enough times to rate - Ive had it on cask, draft, in a glass, in a bottle.

Pours a nice orange/yellow haze. Aroma is hop and citrus, taste about the same. Palate on the cask one was memorable.  A very good beer.
Poured from a 12oz bottle.  Loads of citrus aroma, some pine.  Hoppiness was muted.  Poured a bit flat.  Taste was citrus and pine, medium bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2010 Deep golden clear pour with a thin but frothy white head. Immediate overpowering pine and citrus hop aromas emerge from the glass. It takes a few sniffs to get past the pine and into the underlying grapefruit and eventually the hint of malt sweetness. The sweet citrus settles nicely on the front of my tongue, but the swallow leaves a powerful lasting bitterness. The bitterness seems to lessen slightly with each sip. Tons of hop flavor without being overly bitter. Mouthfeel is medium-light but does not feel watery at all. Overall this is a nice, well-balanced IPA with enormous hop flavor.
This beer is great love the aroma and the aftertaste.It also helps that this is an easy find in Chicago.Great stuff!

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2011 Pale gold with a decent white head.  Aroma is of honey/nectar sweetness and floral hops.  Flavor is more towards the hops, floral with slight citrus and a good, well-integrated bitterness.  The honeyish malt sweetness lies just behind this in the balance.  This is a delicious beer! but Im not sure if its worthy of being considered the best of the best in IPAs in my book.

12 oz poured into a pint glass.  This beer has very nice aroma of pine and citrus with bitter hops.  Appearance us golden with a white head.  Palate is medium to light body with a nice bitter finish.  Taste is very nice as well with a great balance of hop bitteness and malt.  The hops are forefront as they should be for the style.  Could be a west coast IPA.  Overall, a strong IPA effort.

a favorite of mine- zazz, hops, citrus with depth- good body- superb finish...if this were your standard fridge beer you would be living like a King...grows on you quickly and youre hooked from there...always very glad to see it available anywhere anytime
en mycket stabil IPA som doftar härligt, har god balans och smakar friskt av citrus, grape och humle.

This is my favorite IPA.  Great hops citrus aroma, great hops taste and bitterness, but balanced so the hops dont attack you like Stone Ruination.  My favorite beer, really, not just my favorite IPA.  Great with food or on its own.
Huge floral hop aroma. Lots of citrus and grapefruit in the nose. Pours a light gold color with a nice creamy head. Tons of sticky, hop goodness in the body. Awesome hop profile. Dangerously good.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2014 Bottle @ home, courtesy of bushmat1. Thanks Matt! Glowing, light orange appearance with a white head. Orange/grapefruit citrusy, lightly piney hoppy nose thats almost like an orange creamsicle. Mildly bitter, moderate orange and grapefruit citrusy hoppy, floral, moderately, sweet pale malty flavor. Sweet, citrus hoppy aftertaste. Excellent!

12oz bottle courtesy of my buddy, llcooldave--Thanks Bro!!!  Batch 9803.  Pours a hazy, light orange/amber body with a lasting, bubbly off-white head that leaves thick, sticky lacing.   Aromas of bright, fresh citrus (tangerine), melon, caramel and a floral, slightly piney finish.  Flavors are very citrus-based.  Fresh oranges dominate.  Bright floral notes and a nicely balanced, long bitter finish thats refreshing.  Very fine, soft carbonation and a medium to full mouthfeel.  Id love to get my hands on a mini-keg!!

12 oz bottle (batch # 9803) thanks to llcooldave for this great housewarming gift!  Pours golden amber with a foamy white head. Aroma is sweet, fruity and the typical "new carpet" smell of a good IPA. Light, fruity flavor with a hint of floral soap and citrus. Smooth and refreshing. Not as bitter as expected (which is a good thing). One of the better IPAs Ive had.

Had this one numerous times, mostly on tap.  Slightly hazy orange-tan color.  Foamy, off-white head.  Great astringent hop aroma.  Great balance, solid bitter hops and a creamy malt body.  Mild orange tones.  Somewhere between medium and full bodied, despite the big ABV.  Mils soapy tones.  A midwest standard, deservedly so.  Perfect session IPA.

Golden yellow with a hint of orange.  The nose is a complex mix of sweet citrus, tangarine, butter cream and fresh cut grass.  Medium bodied.  I taste lemon zest, orange and pine needle.  The bitterness is not the star here and that in itself is refreshing.  Nice mellow finish.  Just a well crafted beer in every measurable aspect.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Good looking hazy orange. Heavy aroma of hops. pine, grapefruit. The hops stand out as served by the good carbonation. Surprisingly easy drink, making it a recipe for loads of flavour. Highly recommended to see how a great tasting, hop loaded beer can be smooth still. (On tab at The Top.) (Rating re-indexed)

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2013 Very fragrant aroma.  Golden color, slightly cloudy.  Frothy and lacy.  Med bitter taste.  Lighter body.  Creamy texture for an IPA.   It is an easy IPA to drink, yet the hops are bursting in flavor.  Excellant beer.  Have bought cases in the past of this stuff and will buy more in future.  A must try.

1/10/2010 - 355ml bottle @ Klaas place Thanks to Nate for the bottle! 
Pours a clear orange gold beer, white creamy head (finally, I love creamy heads!). Aroma is very fruity and flowery. Taste has alcohol sweetness first, then fruits and hops. Aftertaste again fruits and hop bitters. Ends very dry. Maybe Im just a sucker for hops, but I liked this one very much.
UPDATED: OCT 8, 2010 Smooth with a nice taste without breaking the wallet and is easy to find. All around descent beer. The Fish catches your eye, haha.

Overall a wonderful easy drinking, flavorful ale. Beautiful coppor color with moderate carbonation, and thin white lacing. Nice overall mouthfeel, heavy hop taste and aroma. Be careful of the 7% ABV, it will get you after a while.
Golden with a small white head. Hoppy aroma of pine, citrus and mint, with a hint of caramel. Dry and hoppy flavour with citrus and pine

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a stemmed glass.

The color is a light orange/light gold with a three finger size head and some really nice lacing that stays a long time on the glass. This beer is bottled conditioned and is a slightly hazy as well.

The smell is very hoppy, a really nice floral hop flavor, very strong in the nose at first.A pleasant sweet piny type of flavor.

The taste is a nice hoppy flavor that is quite mellow. It does not present itself out front at first but hides in the background and leaves some hoppiness to be experienced on the second and third sip.There are some orange/citrus flavors with some some pleasant floral hops.

The feel of this beer is pretty light. A great easy drinking ale with a great flavor profile.

Pours light orange brown with a thin white head, kind of bubbly and with very good lacing. The aroma is of citrus, spice, cloves, honey, and some light malts. The taste is of pure hops with a slight citrus backbone and a mellow finish. Oh man is this a smooth beer, and probably the most texture filled IPA Ive ever had.

Had on draft at erbellis in kalamazoo.  Ive drank this a million times, but am finally getting around to rating. This is a fantastic brew with a great hop profile. . . . . The centennials are certainly doing their job.

This is one of the beers of the gods.  Almost too good for human consumption. I cant buy it in my state so I drive north for an hour.  Two bottles, I am in heaven and deserve no more.  Love hops? Love craftfully brewed beer that treats you like the god that you are?  This is it.. Not a paid fan, just a "holy trout, where has this been my whole life" fan.  On second thought, dont buy this beer, leave it for me.

Pours golden orange with small diminishing head. Significant lacing on the glass. Lots of floral  hop in the aroma. Surprised by the balanced taste after the big hop aroma. Medium palate and nice balanced finish.

Bottle. Pours amber/orange, good head retention. Nose is all hops, grapefruit, and a huge floral bouquet. Taste is big on the grapefruit and autumn flowers, with touches of orange and pine. Sweet, good bitterness, and a touch of sour on the finish. Solid.

Pours a hazy honey color. Thin syrupy head. Wonderful hoppy nose with musty citrus accents. Hoppy flavor that is extremely well balanced and rounded. Finishes with sticky hop bitterness on the tongue. Very good, solid IPA.
Could drink this every night.  Great hops.  Lots of citrus.  Dry finish.  Too bad the Hopslam isnt more like this.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark yellow color, with a nice sized frothy white head. Aroma on this one is just amazing. I get Grapefruit, citrus, pine, floral notes, sweet malty notes along with some fruit. Flavor is filled with grapefruit and peach, along with a nice balance of sweet malt. I also get the pine and floral note, but not as much as in the aroma. Body is medium with a dry and crisp mouthfeel. Super refreshing beer. Overall, this is one hell of an IPA!

Im not a huge IPA fan, but in terms of taste, this IPA blows others away. Dogfish may finish cleaner, but this is a much more interesting beer. Great color and aroma to it, if Im drinking an IPA, Ill be drinking this.

There are alot of friends in Richmond, Va that believe this is the best IPS brew.  This brew is great dont get me wrong, but the hops are somewhat lacking.  I consider this my 5th favorite IPA, as It does not quite make it to the finish line.

Bottle. IPAs are not my favorite style, but this is one hell of a beer.  Pours a light amber with a nice creamy head.  Aroma is definitely pine.  Taste of citrus and wonderful hop bitterness.  Full bodied and well balanced.  Bells really knows what they are doing.

Pours from the tap with a golden orange color with a billowy, off-white head. Very fragrant, with the aroma having a complex hop character that is both citrusy and earthy. The flavor amplifies these characteristics, with notes of grapefruit, pine, and grass. There is also at least a bit of balance from an underlying caramel malt sweetness (but the malt aspect is certainly subtle compared to the hops). The mouthfeel is both crisp and resinous somehow, with a refreshing, hoppy bite that morphs into a sticky, lingering bitterness. Overall, its wonderfully bitter, yet quite drinkable, especially considering the 7% alcohol.

500 ml pint, Akkurat, Stockholm
Golden body, white ale. Very strong dark hoppy aroma. Lots of citrus flavour and american piney notes. Very dark IPA, but really well balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 Oh my Gosh!  This was as close to a perfect beer as I have tasted.  I could only deduct on one thing Aroma.  I prefer more of a citrus smell then a piney smell.   This is in the top 5 that Ive had so far.  The finish is so smooth its almost crazy!  Thank you for delivering this close by Bells.  Next step distribute to Nebraska please.  You are a fantastic brewing company!
one of my favorites. loads of hops but not so much that a new IPA drinker couldnt enjoy. would definetly recommend this to anybody
Pours a ever so lightly cloudy dark amber.  Gorgeous pine aroma.  Strong upfront malt notes with a trailing pine &  basil aftertaste.  Overall, what can I say but WOW!  A solid IPA...
Tap @ Smokin Joes, Pittsburgh - clear orange pour, thin white head. arouma of hay, flowers and pure, sweet caramel. Finishes with a nice dry spiciness. I need to re-rate this to do it justice.
Huge hop aroma, huge hop flavor. Centennial is a beautiful hop and they really show case it here. I blew through my traded six pack so fast that I cried a little.

Bottle.

A - Hazy, light golden tangelo color. Fairly full, fluffy, creamy, cloud-like head. Great retention that leaves a full and creamy lace.

S - Great, juicy, strong hop flavor with plenty of grapefruit, orange, apricot and tropical fruits along with a nice touch of floral hops. Somewhat sweet and a great balance of bitterness too. Wonderful smelling beer.

T - Nice balance between the malt and hops. A good backbone of pale malt with a slight caramel, sweetness. On top of that is a good mix of citrus and some tropical fruit hops along with floral and slightly herbal hops. The fruitiness (in particular the tropical fruit) arent quite as strong as the aroma, but are definitely present. Has a nice bitterness that lingers a bit, but it is well balanced with the slightly sweet malt taste. On the finish some more sweet orange hop flavor comes out. Well balanced with all the flavors.

M - Medium body with a good amount of carbonation. Smooth and creamy feel. A little thin but not bad.

D - Very easy to drink and tasty beer. Extremely balanced beer with lots of flavor.

Notes: Very good and easy to drink beer. Extremely balanced between hops and malt and between hop flavors. Very good, and enjoyable IPA, especially for one that is easy to get (in the Midwest at least). Not the best beer in the world, but a very tasty one that I would keep stocked.

12oz bottle pours hazy orange with healthy white head. Aroma is sweet floral and hoppy. Taste is crisp and refreshing, pine, floral, great balance with hops. One of my all time favorites, has a great balance and remains incredibly drinkable.

Nice hazy orange/gold beer with a thin white head. Aromas of grass, spruce, and floral hops. Smells like a typical IPA, but the taste is a bit different. Along with the spruce/pine, herbal taste there is a pleasantly sweet underlying taste here. One of tangy fruit mixed with dough. I found that to be what made this beer special. Tasty beer for the style.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is malt and hops with citrus. The flavor is malt and hops with citrus and orange. The palate is dry with bitterness. Overall a good beer with a good balance.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 This was delicious. One of those beers that you forget how good it is until you have it again.  Hoppy but still so drinkable. Excellent Serving: Bottle, tap, cask

Pours deep straw colored. Excellent head and lacing. Super hoppy, citrusy, floral, fruity aroma. 10 for aroma.  Finishes very smooth, with hints of hops, malt, citrus, and perfumy florals. Great beer.

Amber pour, massive head and lace. Hoppy fruity aroma. Strawberry and hops come on strong with a nice medium carbonation. Some dusty woody malt comes in at the end with a bit of alcohol. A little bitter, but very tasty.
This beer lives up to its score.  There is nothing but refreshment from the first sip to the after taste in this beer.  Bells hit a home run!

Currently #2 IPA around here...but does it live up to that?  The bitterness is a lot stronger than the hop aroma/taste.  Solid malt that is a good support for the hops.  Color is a bit lighter than expected, and a little thin on a the palate for a 7%.  Actually, all in all it is more of a great, weak DIPA than a IPA.  I need a lot more hops in the aroma for this to be a top IPA.  A great beer, but I would disagree with it being #2.  Alesmith, Pizza Port and Russian River all out IPA this.  Still a fantastic beer though, dont get me wrong.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 Botle: Pours Deep Golden, with a decent white head that lasts for a decent duration. Smells of floral hops. Taste is light bitter, Flavors of floral hops, citrus orange. Medium body and a relatively smooth finish. Certainly the best IPA ive had, but I havent had many. Ive finally found another beer staple!
At least I thought I did. At the time; Two Hearted Ale was one of the beers that got my palate and I really excited about craft beer - at this point though - I dont think it compares to some of the other options out there in complexity and flavor profile

Ahhhhh Two Hearted my old friend... why have I waited so long to review you? 

Lovely slightly cloudy reddish/amber pour.  Good amount of foamy head with some spotty lacing left behind.  Aroma has a nice combination of citrus & floral elements -  some grapefruit, orange, tangerine, etc...

Flavor is an intoxicating blend of sweet citrus & bitter hops - supremely drinkable and somehow smooth & sticky at the same time.

Will drink this ANY time.  DELICIOUS.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of Summer Secret Santa. Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold with a 1/2" white head. Aroma is sweet floral hop. Flavor is almost the same with less floral hop and more citrus. Clean, crisp palate with an almost dry finish.

Bottle poured into pint glass. Amber in color...nothing too special. Lots of hoppy/citrus smell but really nothing else to note. Tastes like it smells, hops/floral/citrus with a clean finish. Mouthfeel is okay but really nothing to note...light carbonation and light body. I like this beer, but there are other IPAs I prefer.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt and citrus hop. Medium bitter. Quite nice.

Poured into a goblet. Appearance is a golden hue with a nice medium white head. As you drink the beer, the head dissipates leaving nice lacing down the glass. Aroma is hops and citrus but taste is where the hops come out. Not much citrus is tasted but the finish is a nice yeasty flavor. This makes for a nice summer sipper. I would definitely recommend this to anybody, regardless of their beer style preferences.

Ive been putting off drinking this one for a long time now. I wonder why? Well, its because, as hard as I try, I just cant really enjoy an IPA. Stouts converted me a long time ago. But as far as IPAs go, Two Hearted Ale is high class.

Pours orange with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity but not excessively so. Mouthfeel is medium with mild carbonation. Taste of grapefruit with fairly big hops up front. Not as hoppy as I remember or as some other IPAs. Seems pretty balanced. I was so exited to be able to get this in Illinois a year or so ago and still am, however, I think I remember liking it a bit more then. Still a great beer and one that Ill continue to go back to. BTW, I was surprised and happy to find this in our local Kroger store, although they had it tagged as a amber lager.  WTF?
From bottle.  Nice caramel color.  Citrus, hops, floral amora.  Tastes of  grapefruit, citrus-y, hops.  Delicious!  My personal favorite IPA.
Great golden color with slight head, freshly brewed aroma, moderate to heavy hop sensation and pleasant floral notes.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass.

Appearance: Pours a light golden caramel with a 1-2 finger frothy white head. Minimal lacing.

Smell: Hoppy citrus and pine mixed with sweet hints of caramel.

Taste: Grapefruit-like hops flavor blended nicely with just a hint of malt. Nice bitter finish which gives way to a sweetness in the aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with just the right amount of carbonation. Quite smooth.

Drinkability: Very good drinkability. The 7.1% ABV is masked nicely so this one could end up sneaking up on you if you drink a few.

Overall: Very solid IPA. I would definitely recommend this one.
Bottle thanks to drowland. Pours copper amber with white head. Nose is floral hops and tons of citrus. Taste is hops, citrus and caramel malt balance. Nice crisp dryish finish. Good IPA.

The beer pours a light golden color with a thick, creamy, off-white head that has alot of staying power and also leaves a nice lacing.  The aroma is very nice resin-y and citrusy.  The malt sweetness does come through but the balance leans towards the US hops.  The flavor has plenty of hop complexity, flowery, resiny, citrusy with plenty of bitterness to go around and some low malt sweetness.  A dry finish.  This is a very good beer that I re-enjoy every time I open a bottle.
Very citrus-y, centennial comes through nicely.  Well-balanced beer that is extremely drinkable - a session IPA for sure.

I have had this several times but this was exceptionally fresh for around here (PA) - 2 weeks after bottling according to the batch number.  Why cant every brewery do something like this?  It REALLY matters! Beer pours a golden amber with a large head which settles to a coating only at the last couple of sips.  Lacing is thin but lasting.  A whiff of this beer is a pretty perfect IPA-lovers dream - citrus (esp. grapefruit orange), pine and flowery.  Not the strongest nose but pleasant.  Taste is grapefruit, lemon, pine resin but pretty nicely balanced with tastes of orange and sweet malts. The finish moves toward bitter but without assault - just notes that put a nice end on a good performance.  Bravo.  Mouthfeel is creamy, a little slick and medium-bodied.  Great beer, and one even those who would not describe themselves as hopheads would enjoy.  Just make sure to get it FRESH.

Pours a slightly hazed golden color with a white head and lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is citrus, hops, grass, malt. Flavor is a good dose of floral citrusy hops balanced out by just the right amount of malt. Everything is in balance and nothing is overdone. Simply a great go to IPA.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2013 Good table IPA with a dorky label.  A great beer for an easy evening with friends.  Old trusty pours a hazy orangish yellow hue.  The aroma is bold and filled with hops and citrus.  Two hearted is light and refreshing with a good balance of hops and malt.  The taste is floral and citrus hops with a hint of orange and grapefruit.  Not overpowering, just simple clean and well put together..

An excellent IPA.  The pour is a golden amber with a  nice white head.  The aroma has abundant citrus characteristics.  A nice hoppy bitterness but well balanced.  The finish as the description states is quite clean and crisp.

Poured into Sam Adams Sensory Glass.

As I started to open the bottle I could already smell a big amount of hops that this beer had to offer! I was so excited to get that first taste! It poured a nice layer of head that was a little off white and as I drank it, it laced a little bit. The color was a orange bronze.

The aroma was of floral earthy hops. Taste was a massive amount of hops, just like the smell.

Mouth feel was bitter but left a crisp taste in the mouth. Very dry aftertaste as well.

Overall, this is one staple of an IPA. I really enjoy the style and Bells has a very nice version of it. I highly recommend!

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-29-2008 17:43:55

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Reviewed from notes (2007).

A: Hazy orange-yellow body with a moderate sized tan head that sticks around for a good amount of time

S: The aroma is sufficiently complex for my liking... floral and citrus hops are the hallmark and a touch of yeast and malts come through

T: The hops certainly come through first leaving a citrus and floral mark easing into light malts before finishing strong with citrus hops once again... the transitions are smooth and have a nice balance

M: Light with a healthy blast of carbonation which stays behind briefly after each swig

O: Easily a staple in any hop lovers fridge... keep plenty around as you can through them quickly

Not a great beer at all, not terrible, I wouldnt buy it again. I was expecting substantially more. 
Nose was off, not sure if i got one of the infected beers, flavor was awkward, dry, had a slight mold funk to it. sucked.

Appearance- This beer poured a nice amber color with a huge, fluffy, white head. Lacing was present throughout life of beer.

Smell- Great piney smell with hints of citrus.

Taste- WOW. Great balance of malt and hops. I expected a huge hop bomb that would turn me off but it is surprisingly not. it has some malty sweetness which balances nicely with the hoppiness. The citrus flavors come through in the taste as well. Nice orange peel and a sour grapefruit as well.

Mouthfeel- Medium body with medium carbonation.

Overall- Overall a fantastic beer that I would love to try again. Should have bought more than one in Orlando. Oh well Ill get mroe when I go back.
An insanely good beer. Very strong floral nose with a rich mildly malty taste. Wonderful.

Draught at Akkurat. Poured a clear golden liquid with a medium sized white foam. Lots of fresh hops in both the smell and the taste, mostly fruity. I noticed lots of red berries from the hops, strawberries and wild strawberries, but also a noticable parfumey taste. Nice mouthfeel. A very easy to drink beer that should work well during the summer. My 33 cl glass was empty way to fast.

12 oz bottle. Bottled 2 weeks before consumption. Light amber pour with medium white bubbly head. Aroma is citrus, light soap, floral, bread, and a nice sweet malt note. Flavor is soap, floral, super hoppy with a nice bitter finish. Somewhat dry mouthfeel.Great IPA!

12 oz. bottle at the Brick Store Pub. Pours a nice transparent gold with a medium off-white head. Extensive lacing on the glass. Not much aroma, just some light floral hops. The palate is light, but active, carbonated, and crisp. The flavor is very bitter, but amazingly well balanced. The malts are not strong, but counter the hops perfectly for a pleasant drink. Overall, this is very drinkable, yet complex and interesting IPA. I highly recommend it.

Great floral aroma with a sweet citrus smell. Dark orange color that looks great. Although, it is there is sediment in the beer that doesnt make it look clean (is that orange peel?). Not much head. Nice better taste at the end. Its a bit confusing to my palate.

Nice little IPA.  Aroma is grass, flowers, and maybe a little pine.  Appearance is an amber orange two fingers of fluffy white head.  Taste is very bitter with hints of citrus and floral, but an nice little malt backbone.  The brew is crisp and dry.

Very, very floral hops, without being bitter. Medium bodied. Not too strong. Theres something cool about drinking something that tastes and smells like a flower arrangement. Lots of orange peel. Thick head. Topaz color.

Pours golden amber, decent head... solid lacing.  Ok hop presence with, citrus notes and a piney bite.  Little if any malt backbone.  I love bells and love IPAs, but am confused with the unmitigated lovefest with this brew.  A solid american IPA for sure.... but not on par with the CCB Jai Lais and Alesmiths of the world.

12 oz bottle. Pours gold with a small but lasting head.  Ahhh!!!!  Bursting forth from that small foamy head are the wonderfully heavy scents of a citrus and pine rue. At first swallow the tongue is peppered with ample drops of bitter then washed over by a blanket of sweet candy. The fizzy body scrubs the tongue in preperation for a long dry bitter finish with a tangy end. Wonderful wonderful wonderful. Not sure about two hearts, but two thumbs up for sure.
What an ale!  Pours a nice amber hue with a bright white head.  Aromas of malts and slight hop notes.  Malt attack which fades to a slightly hoppy finish, very nice!

Rapidly becoming my favorite beer.  Very flavorful, in perfect balance, and light, crisp and refreshing.  Perfect for throwing beanbags on a warm summer afternoon.  7% alcohol will warm you up on a cold winter day of icefishing as well!
Tap at Iron Abbey. A great session type IPA for the summer. Orange tinted goodness in a glass with a respectable hop note. Piney, slightly chewy aroma and taste.

Tasted from 12oz bottle, batch number 9637, purchased from the W Grocer.  Pours a clear, bright burnt orange with a thick frothy white head that takes a long time to recede, but never truly disappears.  The nose is beautiful blend of citrus/pine/resin hops and some caramel malt.  On the palate this beer is extremely balanced showcasing the grapefruit hops and bread malts perfectly.  The alcohol is also very well integrated.  The body is medium with average carbonation and a nice long finish that is both citrus and bitter.  It is easy to see why this is regarded as one of the best IPAs in America.

12 oz bottle from warehouse wines. Aroma has a really sweet, citruisy, grapefruit, hoppy aroma. Really pleasing. The appearance would be the weakest attribute. Light brown pour with a medium white head. Its ok, but nothing to get excited about. Taste is most important and it doesnt disapoint. Amazing, every drop is like your eating a grapefruit. just citrus filled with a slight bitterness at the end. wouldnt  have it any other way. Palate is good. Medium mouthfeel with a decent warming ability. An excellent IPA!
This is your overall balanced great IPA. This is the beer that i can give too non IPA drinkers and they will drink / love it. Great hoppy citrusness slightly piney. Overall tasty good IPA.

Pours a perfect gold with a large billowy head that takes its time before fading. Nose is grapefruit, flowers, and simply beautiful.  Thinner mouthfeel, not very apparent carbonation, and wonderfully smooth and creamy.  Nice amount of malt and subtle sweetness up front gives way to a pleasant but moderate bitter finish.  Simply a fantastic IPA.
wow, great beer. I was visiting my hometown of Mobile, AL, a beer waste-land, and was surprised and delighted to find this at Mellow Mushroom...truly fantastic.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2010 Golden orange in the glass with a thin head.  Medium hops aroma.  Unique spicy twist (cannot pin it down) in the taste.  

As I slowly work my way through a six pack Ive realized that I really enjoy this beer.  Its an apples/oranges thing to compare/contrast with the hoppier SD beers I love - theres a subtle spice mellowness in the Two Hearted that seems to make it the perfect "after work" beer.  Good stuff.
just an awsome taste. Ive been drinking this for about 3 years, and its earned a spot in my top 10

A really well done ale. Pours a nice resilient orange with a smooth creme head. Lively carbonation makes this beer look fantastic and mouthfeel is near perfect. Aroma of citrus and hops. Very well balanced taste with some light hints of fruits and a lovely malt, countered by a nice hoppy finish. Awesome beer!

On tap at Mad Mex. Golden-orange pour with tight off-white head. Resinous and orange hop aroma. Great hop bitterness balanced perfectly by malt. Clean bitter finish that keeps it drinkable. Perfect mouthfeel - not too thick, not too thin with nice carbonation. Great beer.

Just had Bells at Boulders on Broadway. One of the many new beers on tap. I am excited to see Bells in Arizona finally, and the quality hasnt really diminished with larger distribution. The beer tasted just like the other times I have had it. There is a nice, medium sized, white head that slowly cascades down the glass. The Hops up front have a sweet taste that really cuts into the bitterness of this beer. At 7% I think it is one of the more drinkable beers of its style being distributed nationwide.

Served from tap into a SweetWater standard pint.  Poured a hazy golden yellow with a one-finger white head with rainbow effects when held in the light.  Lacing was excellent throughout.  The aroma was comprised of hops and mild malt.  The flavor was a smooth hoppy note with nice mellow malt notes.  It had a medium feel on the palate with medium carbonation.  It has been quite awhile since I have had this brew and I had forgotten how good it was.  Nothing short of excellent for sure.  Believe the hype on this one...  I will definitely be picking up more at the store next time Im there.
Pours burnt orange with white head.  Aroma is citrus and florals.  Taste is sweet with a bitter finish that sticks around.

One of the sweetest smelling floral IPAs I have ever had. Very interesting palate, the dryness comes late. It is bitter but not overly hoppy, an extremely well balanced ale, probably one of the best balanced IPAs Ive ever had. Bitterness lingers so long, that it builds and builds on the hop flavours, each layer something new. Exceptional.

Tasty IPA - varies from batch to batch - I lived down the street from Bells in my college years and although I like this beer, it is not their best.  As far as IPAs wait for Bells to release their Hopslam IPA in the winter, a much better beer.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2010 Awesome brew I had on tap at St. Stevens green. Enjoyed with Katie and her brother. Pour was a hazy yellow with medium head that laced well.  Aroma was full of citrus hops and floral scents.  Flavor was an amazing balance of hops, citrus fruits, and something else Im forgetting right now.

On tap.  Pours golden orange with minimal white head.  Aroma is highly citrus-like with orange and grapefruit present.  Pine, and some fruitiness, too.  Flavor starts off with sweet malt followed by some spicy hop flavors.  Finish is mildly bitter.  All in all this is a well balanced beer.  It has been my go to for a few years, and will likely remain that way for a while.  Cant wait to try one of the contaminated batches, too!

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2011 This is my 3rd time rating this. Pours a deeper orange and bright clear with a pillow like head.  When it fades it leaves a distinct looking pattern of bubbles which seems to be unique to this beer.  Nose is evident centennial but not really as intense as it could be.  There is an abundance of fermentation esters in this beer which really makes it stand out.  Has a big hop and ester flavor profile with elements of slight biscuity malts and not really any caramel but some bread character.  Light body and pretty dry.  Medium bitterness for the style.  Wonderful beer.

Truly a world class example of the IPA style. Northwesrt hops lend a huge fruity estery nose replete with piny sharpness and some pineapple notes. A slight note of sweetness in the malt profile tempers what would otherwise be a full-on hop assault. Shows off its west coast style while still allowing the malt backbone to take a turn. A drawn out sharply bitter finish ends things.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2010 12oz bottle thanks to a local beer geek who isnt on this site. Thanks Terry! Really been looking forward to this one, and its not disappointing me. Pours a pale gold with a medium white head and minor haze. The aroma is an amazing bouquet of hops, resinous sharp pine, pineapple, hoppy amazingness. Flavour is a borderline perfect matching of bitter and sweet. Amazing hop presence, slightly prickly which is a really nice sensation, but matched just so well with really nice biscuity pale malt body that finishes strong and delicious. Some pleasant honeycomb as well, which I also noticed in Hopslam. Grainy lingering malt flavours. One of the best balanced beers Ive ever had. This is so damn drinkable, such an awesome beer. Id drink it everyday if I could, I need a mini-keg in my fridge at all times.
Sample. Amber with off-white head. Flavour is malt, caramel, and well hopped.
i dont know how to fucking rate IPAs. maybe im just biased about this one. either way, it has some nice bite and nice aroma.
Fantastic. I could drink this all day and every day. So balanced, so tasty, so refreshing.

12 oz bottle thanks to NRMan.  Pours orangey amber in colour, slightly hazy, nice frothy white head.  Little bit of lacing.  Huge aroma and taste, dominated by hops, piney, grassy, floral, little earthy.  This is a great IPA!

The beer that got me into Bells.  Incredible foamy head, outstanding balance and a unique flavor that separates it from the pack.  A must try for anyone who likes IPAs.  When I head to northern minnesota its the only descent non-import available, and i dont mind.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2011 Jaune dorée, légerement trouble et effervescente. Aromes frais de houblon floral. Croustillante et désaltérante, elle laisse une moyenne sécheresse au palais, de meme quun moyen gout de houblon. 100? Un peu trop surestimée, mais pas mauvaise. 29-10-11: Arômes de citron et saveurs prononcés de citron lorsque dégustée avec dautre ipa. Très bonne ipa avec son niveau de complexité.
Nothing more to say about this beer than a really, really good IPA. Really good. Its one of my favorites. Great malt backbone with the perfect balance of hops.

Appearance: A touch on the yellow side for an IPA but nice oily foam head that retains well and exhibits nice lacing.

Smell: Some centennial hops but a touch faded. Im starting to think that this bottle is a bit dated.

Taste: A bit bitter which is what holds me back from giving it a 4.5 in the taste category. Sweet pale malt works with the carbonation to create a buttery element.

Mouthfeel: Lots of carbonation makes this one nice and creamy. Medium body.

Drinkability: Carbonation and a medium body make this fairly easy to drink for an IPA. The hops being a touch bitter works against the drinkability.

Again I dont think I got the freshest bottle so I will sample another bottle in the future and review it again. I know that JohnTravolta21 sent me the bottle straight off of the shelf but perhaps the retail store had it sitting around for a while or perhaps Bells skimped a bit on this batch due to a hop shortage....

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-10-2008

a really nice ipa with more of a citrus zest to it than i am used to ir expected. most ipas now are heavy on the grapefruit/floral notes, and was pleasant to have one that stands out. finally got a hold of one, thanks drew.

Bottle into a tulip. Pours caramel-golden with a one finger, off-white head and thin, sticky lacing. Very floral nose with some citrus. Taste of apricot, grapefruit, pine and resin. Bitter finish. A staple IPA.

12oz bottle at Chappys Taproom in Dayton, OH.  Just a great beer.  Nothing much more can be said.   Poured a hazy yellow/orange.  Citrus/floral aroma abounds.  Hops aroma also.Crisp finish.Huge hop flavors.  Great great great beer.
This beer was somewhat of an acquired taste for me; my first impression was that it was way too carbonated. However when served properly- decanted, this is now one of my favorite beers.
Big creamy head. Look orange but has a hint of grapefruit taste. Solid IPA with the usual hops but more flavor and complexity than most.

Oarngish in color with an adequate head on top. Smells of hops, citrus, and sugary malts. Leaves a smooth but bitter aftertaste that is not overwhelming. A very refreshing beer. All in all a good IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2010 Poured a near opaque straw with 2 finger head. Aroma: citrus, fruits, mild hops, floral. Taste: grapefruit, citrus, sweet malts, hops. Medium body, decent depth, very good balance, mild bitter finish. Overall a very good IPA.

Moto - Tangy; Mustache - Tastes like wet Mexican ass -- diareaha; Wiggles - taste liek the brown trout on the cover shit on in it.;  Keith stone - Terrible beer; Kool-Aid - Puke;  Drex - My first thought is whos moms vagina is in my face or who brought the stinky vagina...

33cl bottle thanks to julienhuxley batch 9607 (bottled March 15, 2010)
Appearance :Clear yellow with a small head. Extensive lacing.

Aroma : Resinous and fruity hops. Notes of passion fruits. Notes of honey. A bit spicy with small notes of alcohol.

Taste : Hoppy. Notes of passion fruits. Floral and quite resinous. Finish is sharp bitter with light hints of caramel. Finish is leafy floral. Hints of honey. Some alcohol on the finish as it warms up.

Overall : To me Hopslam is better than this one by a good stretch. Its already 3 months old so maybe a fresher bottle would do it more justice. Still an awesome brew. Well balanced, not too bitter. Quite drinkable. Gets more malty near the end. I love Bells Brewery !
Moderate floral and citrus aroma. Cloudy orange color with a small white head. Bitter throughout fades at the end of the finish.

On draft at redlight redlight
Wow
This brew has alot going on
I have never had an ipa with so many dif. flavor elements happening at once. 
fruit, pine, a slight hint of smoke
the floral notes are crazy
This is one complex momma

12 fl. Oz bottle via GRM, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. Lot 9539. 
App.:  Clear deep-golden/light amber with a so-so white head.
  
Aroma:  Lots of pine, resin, peppery, green, spicy hops, nice biscuit and toast malts as backing, lighter citrus, a touch savoury/brothy, nice.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, smooth, restrained effervescence.
  
Flav.:  More malt-forward than the nose with some slightly darker-roasted notes to round out the biscuit and toast flavours, still a good deal of the same hop notes as the nose, with slightly more orange peel/citrus; dry with nice bitterness and a slightly alcoholic finish that is split between hops and malt...nice balance.

Lived up to my expectations from this brewer.  Nicely done.

12 oz bottle from Erie PA. Medium orange/yellow cloudy hues. Big aromas of citrus/floral/herbal hops, apricot, grapefruit, with a little caramel poking through. Wow the flavors are enormous. Huge citrus/fruity/herbal flavors upfront, orange peel, apricot, with a caramel backbone. This stuff is great! My favorite "IPA" to date. Semi sweet, slightly tart, bitter, decently balanced. Im going to have to buy more of these, WOW.

Brown bottle, 355 ml, via Jean Hamilton (thanks!), savoured on May 4 2010; eye: polished copper, extra clear, no effervescence, nice creamy white head that turns into a tiny sheet, good lacing; nose: resinous hops, light malt, light coriander; mouth: resinous hops, light malt, light caramel, grapefruit, light orange, light pepper, finale in resinous hops, medium body, good carbonation, lightly bitter, slick, light astringency, a bit thin; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 355 ml, via Jean Hamilton (merci!), savourée le 4 mai 2010; il : cuivre poli, claire, pas deffervescence, belle mousse blanche crémeuse qui se transforme en une petite couverture, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, léger malt, léger coriandre; bouche : houblon résineux, léger malt, léger caramel, pamplemousse, léger orange, léger poivre, finale en houblon résineux, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, légèrement amère, coulante, légère astringence, un peu mince; en résumé : bien bon

Pours typical IPA orange-blonde with a rather large, foamy white head. Nose is lighter than many IPAs, with the usual hoppiness and faint notes of what smells like spearmint and bitter lemon peel. Extremely smooth flavor with relatively tame hops and a sweet, malty background. The noted spices accentuating the nose are present in the flavor as well, especially in the finish. Could use a longer finish but this turned out to be a pleasantly and surprisingly good IPA. I will definitely get it again.

Smells of dried hops, herbal, and apricot. Taste is florally, perfume and of saffron. 
Smooth and oily texture and pretty heavy body for the style. The finish lacks bite, so Im guessing the bottle was a bit old?

bottle..Hazy deep golden pour , huge white head , excellent lace .  Aroma of grapefruit and caramel malt sweetness . Flavor is malty sweet with balanced hop bitterness . Notes of grapefruit , oranges and flowers .  Medium body and carbonation . Finish is clean with a lingering bitterness .
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2010 Pours up a bit cloudy light golden brown with a good head.  The mild hoppy flavor makes this one of the smoothest IPAs around.
Bells Two Hearted is my favorite IPA, without a doubt. Try it - you wont be disappointed.

The aroma is sweet, flowery hops. Sweet citrus, lime and lemon. Really nice perfume; spicy. Biscuity malts fade into the background. Pops with some agitation.

Pours a hazy sunny yellow. Nice white head. Looks like a Belgian white; cloudy.

Toasted pale malts first. Flowery, citrusy hops (though a little soft). Serious orange peel and coriander. Dynamite citrus with a nice bite.

Feels creamy, chewy, thick. Maybe a tad musty, but really good. A very flowery IPA, sweet and very drinkable.

(Similar to Stone Ruination.)

Wow, cant believe I havent rated this yet.  Been crazy about it for awhile now.  Super balanced IPA.  Its not your usual hop bomb, albeit hops are used in a very efficient manner.  Not crazy bitter, this one is smooth.  Aroma packs a Centennial punch as does flavor.  A world class example although it may come across as an APA rather than an IPA.  Bells NEVER disappoints.

Bottle. Hazy gold. Fantastic aroma of peach, tangerine and grassy hops. Flavor is well balanced between citrus, hops and pepper. Lovely dry and slightly bitter finish. Light palate, a little bit crispy. Very enjoyable. As good as it gets for an IPA
Ive had it on tap and in the bottle. This is my favorite beer right now. Very clean on the palate with excellent grapefruit notes.

Kalamazoo Brewing Company--Bells Beer--Two Hearted Ale--2004 12 oz. Bottle.  6.00% ABV.  50 IBUs?  (4.5 / 5.0)  IPA.  Mild lacy head.  Clear rich golden color hazes rich golden orange.  Rich floral hop front.  Sweet mild ester rich crisp caramel malty hoppy body.  Clean balanced mild earthy citrus rich hoppy end.  Sampled 7/23/2004.

Kalamazoo Brewing Company--Bells--Bells Two Hearted Ale--2005 12 oz. Bottle.  6.00% ABV.  60 IBUs?  (4.0 / 5.0)  IPA--Mild lace head.  Cloudy bright amber orange color.  Rich earthy hop front.  Dry sweet crisp caramel citrus body.  Clean balanced rich hop citrus end.  Hoppy!  Sampled 12/20/2005.

Bells Brewery--Two Hearted Ale--2009 12 oz. Bottle.  7.00% ABV.  75 IBUs?  (4.5 / 5.0)  Reformulated IPA.  Lacy white head.  Clear bright orange gold color hazes orange juice with light sediment.  Rich floral Cascade hop front.  Crisp grapefruit citrus hop infused body.  Mild sweet with fruit ester hints.  Tangy refreshing rich balanced hop spice end.  WOW!  Sampled 8/25/2009.  6-Pack $9.99.

A- Well this is quite a beautiful IPA. Semi-translucent Rusty-orange-amber body that pours with an impressive 3 finger foamy off-white head. Head fades slowly to one finger and has great retention. Plenty of lacing is left behind in the glass.

S- Quite promising. A beautiful bouquet of hops with a citrus aroma upfront and pine, floral, and grassy mixing well in the background.

T- Initial flavor is mild and highlights a balance of citrus and grassy hop flavor. Floral and pine hop flavor seem to mix well for the finish-with the floral hop flavor being semi-dominant. A blast of hop bitterness also enters for the finish. All that lingers is a medium strength resonance of hop bitterness. All the beautiful hop flavors are gone.

P- Medium to high carbonation and mildly oily body.

O- After having great IPAs like Alesmith, Racer 5, Centennial, and SN Anniversary this one doesnt even compare to me. Its not bad-and I can certainly drink it but is only an average IPA to me. I was somewhat disappointed because it could not compare.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-03-2007 18:29:00

Bottle. Had this nice and fresh in a mini-keg not that long ago, too, which was wonderful. Pours light hazy orange with a big fluffy head. Good retention thanks to the hops, too. Nose is bright and citrusy, with some pine and resin alongside. Flavor starts out sweet with liberal amounts of citrus hops, following into pine and floral notes and finishing off slightly more bitter. Medium palate and a pleasant level of carbonation. This is really an exceptional beer - I could see myself drinking a lot of it, if only it were available locally. This is definitely on the same tier as the other amazing IPAs - Stone IPA and SN Torpedo come to mind, in particular, and Id have a tough time choosing a favorite among the three.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2010 Draft at St. Stephens with James. Pours a cloudy, pure orange with a thick, frothy white head. Aroma of honey, nectar, lemon zest, resniy hops, lavender, funk, earth, and hints of vanilla and grapes. Medium, yet satisfyingly rich body with a mildly tart, bitter, loose palate. Creamy, robust finish. Excellent IPA with tremendous staying power.
12 ounce bottle-orangish pour-off white head-aroma and taste of-floral, citrus, fruit-a great crisp finish

Pours an amber orange haze with a white soapy head.  Aroma of grapefruit and some pine.   Very delicious.  Grapefruit sweet up front with bitters on the backend.  Dry finish.  Thin to medium mouthfeel.  Resiny towards the end.  Very enjoyable.
