12 oz. bottle; batch 9437 (11/20/09), so pushing two months; pours crystal clear light orange with huge foamy white head; doughy, sweet citrus hops, lemon, grapefruit, leafy malts, white sugar; drinks silky smooth with creamy citrus fruits, dry pine and peaches; quite light with much more sweetness in the finish than bitterness; hops here give off lots of fruity as opposed to sticky, pine resins; much more yeasty and textured than the average IPA; nice mouthfeel and creamy finish; yummy

Original Rating 3/9/08: 12 oz. bottle; thanks hank!! pours hazy orange with quickly fading white head; lots of lacing; malt aromas with a nice hop kick; more piny hops than citrus; drinks smooth with no bitterness; creamy texture and chewy flavors of sweet fruit and candy; just a few sips and this one was gone

One of those IPAs that was instant love for me. Poured a deep orange with a 1.5 finger head. Aroma of crisp citrus hop and hige floral notes. Taste is very well balanced. The hops lead and the finish is crisp and bitter, but there is a definite malt presence mid way through. Awesome brew.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2015 re-rate 2/15....raised from 2.1 ha; I wasnt kind to ipas in my early rates; still dont care for them but that was a little cruel.  some citrus notes in this and nice palate. hint of grapefruit that I dislike and bitterness at end wasnt as bad as I remember but bottle is 6 months old...........................extra  in traade with foppa78.   admittedly IPAs are not my favorite, but how is this beer rated so high.  maybe I had a bad one, but
no aroma
no taste (no reason to drink it)
no hops at endd???
Great floral/citrus aroma.  Pours paler than I expected.  Pale amber.  Bitter, but well balanced with the malt.  Thin head, gentle lacing.  Cant believe its 7%...  Great, great IPA

12 oz to pint glass. Clear amber with thin but lacing head. Bright hops and floral on the noise. Great balanced malt to taste. Incredibly well balanced ale. So much that you might not pin it for an ipa.

Had read rave reviews and was glad to see Bells now carried in AZ.  Tried it three times over the week.  Very clear (no haze), moderate carbonation, crisp non-lingering finish and had nice floral, grassy nose.  Nice balance of malt giving a more subdued bite.  I think it is somewhat overrated compared to a Racer 5 probably due to a different hop type.

12oz Bottle  Trade  Foppa78
Aroma  Big IPA hops nose. Some malt with fruity/floral aromas.   
Appearance  Amber in color, Clear with a thin head.   
Flavor  Good hop flavor (floral)and a good malt flavoring to boot.   
Palate    Dry finish with a Nice Mouthfeel. 
Overall  A very nice IPA.

Excellent IPA with a huge hop profile.  Its a slightly hazy golden liquid with a stiff, foamy head. The aroma is full of citric hops. The flavor has an excellent malt backbone that lies beneath a bouquet of hop notes that tend toward the bitter citric end of the spectrum. The smell is a bit more floral than the flavor. The beer is well-balanced and the alcohol is nicely hidden. It tastes very American but still quite different than an aggressive San Diego style. I enjoyed this beer very much.

Wow! Wonderful balance of hops and malts make this one of the most drinkable ipas out there. My biggest wish is that they would ship it to Colorado. Be careful to check the dates on the box when you buy it. I have often found cases that are a few months old which absolutely kills the flavor. Track this one down and drink a few. Youll be pleased.

If I could choose one beer to have in my fridge at all times, it would be 2 Hearted. Incredible flavors - hoppy, crisp, fruity, just delicious. Perfect at any time of year & excellent paired with most foods.  Youve heard of it - now go out and try it.  An exemplary IPA.

Growler from Whole Foods in Fairfax, VA.  Pours a pale, translucent amber.  Aroma dominated by floral and piney hops, with a touch of citrus.  Taste is initially full of pinecones with a touch of sweetness, citrus and malt, fading cleanly into the strong but not overwhelming hoppy bitterness in the finish. Full mouthfeel.  Awesome IPA, only fresh Alesmith IPA competes.

355ml Bottle, brought to Adam by GodOfThunder, thanks! Slightly hazy yellow orange colour, dense white head. Aroma of citric hops, mandarines, oranges, a bit of grapefruit, blossom, malts and some caramel. Flavour is slightly sweet, malty, fruity, oranges and a bit of pine, good hoppy bitter finish. Medium bodied. Very balanced IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2010 Just the right amount of bitterness and malt. Both (as with the abv) are on the high side for an IPA, but neither is overwhelming. This is certainly not an imperial IPA, but neither is it truly comparable to your garden variety IPA. Perhaps its a ducal IPA. Whatever it is, it is one of the best beers I have had the pleasure of pouring from a 12 oz bottle into my DFH chalice. EDIT: I re-rated this for my own benefit rather than yours because, well, why should you care about one review among thousands? For my own purposes, I want to be consistent. This is as good as beer from a 6-pack (ie., neither from a bomber nor a 4-pack) gets. Kenny Rogers and those little kids driving that race car would be proud.

This is a cloudy blond to golden color with no particles, a white head, and some lacing. A complex hop flavor on nose with a scents of recently bloomed flowers, green vegetables, and toasted bread. This is a balanced, easy drinking IPA with adequate hops and a wonderful finish that is crisp yet buttery and leaving you wanting more.
draft.  light amber, slightly cloudy.  citrus and floral hop aroma, somewhat creamy.  a decent IPA...i think its a tad overrated.
Among the best IPAs Ive had.  Very well balanced, not too hoppy.  This is a beer that both hop-heads, and non hop-heads can enjoy.

This beer pour a hazy golden color with a respectable head and lacing as it subsides.  The smell is very fragant reminding me of tropical flowers with strong citrus fruits and hops immediately evident.  It had a very crisp and clean taste with refreshing flavors of the fruit and hops.  I found this beer to be nice, light and very drinkable, the kind that would be great on a summers evening on the patio.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2010 Pours very clear copper color with a thin white head.  Smells of sweet grapefruits, the caramel really seems to balance the beer nicely.  A nice floral aroma accompanies an almost delicate piney  character.  Im really enjoying the aroma.  Tastes of grapefruits upfront followed with a bit of earth and pine.  The finish is just bitter enough to be an IPA.  Excellent beer!

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2011 Re-rated 1/13/11.  I always said I wouldnt give any beer a 5.0 until Id had a chance to try a Westy 12 or some of the other rare Belgians that always make the "best of" list.  Id had Two Hearted on several occasions, but never really fresh (I dont live in a Bells distribution state).  But, after being able to try some really fresh Two Hearted on a recent business trip, I finally decided that I simply cannot think of a way to improve this beer and it is truly worthy of my first (and, to date, only) 5.0 rating.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color.  Thick pillowy white head with great retention and lacing.  Gorgeous beer.  Aroma is lots of floral and grapefruit hops.  Flavor is huge amounts of of piney, grassy and citrus hops and a hint of caramel malt.  Plenty of hops to let you know its an IPA, but just enough caramel sweetness to balance things out without being cloying.  A nice smooth, creamy mouthfeel and a surprisingly clean finish. This is one beer that finally lives up to the hype.
Brilliant example of USA IPA-style beer. Full blown citrus mouth-feel with long hoppy finish.

Poured cloudy, deep golden with half-finger, fluffy white head.  Citrus hop aroma.  Flavor is succulent, bitter citrus hops.  Remarkably smooth for an IPA.  Delicious.  Perfect for a hot summers day.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden. Aroma is strong with floral and citrus hops. Taste is very strong with hops, but not overly bitter or oily. Super well balanced. A great brew, especially if youre trying to introduce people REAL beers/IPAs because it gives a great hop flavor without being too bitter.

People always ask me why I love the India Pale Ale style of beer as much as I do. To truly answer that question Id simply give them a beer like Bells Two Hearted Ale to try for themselves. How can you not like a beer thats this tasty and highly drinkable? Sure, some beers are for acquired tastes, but this is the kind of beer anyone could enjoy.APPEARANCE AND AROMAI poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. Upon my initial pour I found the color of bright orange to be really attractive. It formed a generous, thick, frothy head and the lacing was equally impressive. The aroma was quite strong with a clean citrusy scent with subtle floral notes as well. This is exactly the kind of IPA I can "drink with my eyes."TASTEThis is the tale of two beers in one (well, sorta). Since my 10oz tulip glass doesnt hold the entire bottles contents I experienced two slightly different flavors from Bells Two Hearted Ale. The initial pour was clear, crisp, clean-smelling and quite tropical. The flavor was refreshing with a strong, tart palette of grapefruit . The finish seemed a bit richer, stickier and piney. The aftertaste, interestingly enough, reverted back to the crisp citrus notes. In fact, it was rather sweet like candy.After I poured the remaining contents into the glass I noticed the body suddenly became extremely hazy due to yeast settling to the bottom of the bottle. I was curious to see if this would affect the flavor. What was crisp and tart was now a little duller, although the sweetness remained. The flavor seemed a little more dry and the hops seemed less citrusy and more pine-like. It left a slightly dry aftertaste as the hops begin to loiter on my tongue a bit longer than they used to. Overall, the flavor is really satisfying, but perhaps a tad milder than Id prefer. DRINKABILITYMany of the highly-acclaimed American IPAs tend to be so robust theyre for hopheads only. I wouldnt say thats true of Bells Two Hearted Ale. The mouthfeel is surprisingly lighter and thinner than youd expect, and the finish is certainly cleaner. While there is a hop bite, the beer still goes down extremely smooth and is so tasty its difficult not to quaff it all down.At 7% ABV this is what I would consider average potency for an IPA. I drank a bottle on a fairly empty stomach and felt only a slight buzz. The body didnt seem to weigh me down at all. Therefore, Im inclined to believe this beer would pair well with dinner or function as a session beer since it tastes just as good at the end as it does at the beginning, therefore, temperature changes over time is not an issue.FINAL THOUGHTSWhile not the best IPA Ive ever had, Id definitely say Bells Two Hearted Ale was one of the most impressive. I really enjoyed how it combines aspects of the West and East Coast styles to make for one tasty, drinkable beer. This would be a mainstay in my fridge if it were available here.(note: Bells beers are not distributed where I live in upstate New York. This bottle was sent to me from a friend in Michigan so I cannot comment on the price. However, Id say this would be well worth a purchasing price of upwards of $12 a six-pack.)NOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RyjMo1j5AEk
Amber pour with a thin white head. Aroma-floral, fruity. Taste- grape juice, fruit juice, nelson sauvin? Very fruity.

Poured a light golden slightly hazy color with a great foamy head and the lace was outstanding. Smells of am American Style beer. Taste is blended well with a great malt finish. The hops are blended very very well with the malt character. This is one of my favorites and I will love this beer forever.

Possibly one of the most aromatic brews that Ive tried.  Citrus and evergreen nose with a slight hint of malt.  Orange, grapefruit, grass and a smattering of malts are tasted.  A very nice honey gold colour with a frothy head that leaves decent lacing on the pint.  The finish is crisp and long begging me to take another sip.  Bells should proudly put their name on the label of this fine beer!

Drank from a pint glass out of a bottle.  Aroma is a light floral blend, slight amount of pine as well.  Taste is very complex.  The aroma and taste are identical, and it has a dry, crisp, refreshing finish.

12oz bottle shared by Tim, thanks. 
Appearance: Golden with a nice white head leaving some lacing in the glass 
Aroma: Floral, citrus 
Taste: Citrus, malts 
A very nice IPA, the hype was right on! Enjoyable, not over the top hoppy.
Probably the best IPA on the planet. Sooo drinkable and smooth, I wish it would linger on my palate forever!

Pours an orange color with a slight haze. Solid white head that retains well and clings to the glass. Strong and pleasing citrus hops aroma. The palate is smooth, not overly carbonated with a clean, dry, and lasting finish. The hops in the flavor are not as strong as other American IPAs, making the beer well-balanced and easy to drink. The 7% ABV is well masked. A great find.

An orange color beer with a nice foamy head. The aroma was pleasantly citrusy, & slight pine. The taste was a very wonderful citrus taste(orange, grapefruit) with a very mild bitterness for an American IPA. This is not a overly hopped IPA but is very balanced and possibly the smoothest one.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a pretty orange/gold color with a two finger off white head with moderate lacing.  Wonderful floral hop aroma with some grapefruity citrus in there as well.  Nice, strong grassy, floral hop flavor with a light malt background and some citrus up front.  Flavor lingers deliciously.  One of my favorite IPAs, strong all around.

Wow- that is about all I can say. Love the floral and citrus on the very first smell and taste. Has to be one of the best beers ever created.  I wish the hop  character was a but rounder or thoughout the the entire taste but mad, is this amazing.

Six Pack from Wegmans in Collegevillle. Pours a clear golden yellow with nice head that leaves some sticky lacing. The nose is not over powering, slight floral presence. First sip is close to balanced but hops are just a bigger part. The malt is delicious and the crisp clear flavor is very drinkable. Just a very nice beer.

Bottle.  A peachy golden coloured ale with a half inch white head, poured in a snifter.  The aroma is floral with fresh cut grass, plenty of oak, dandelion, orange zest, caramel.  Mouthfeel is oily, medium bodied.  More oak in the flavour: plenty of malt, white grapefruit, a hint of alcohol leading to a medium and hoppy finish.

Two Hearted Ale is my all time favorite beer. There is absolutly nothing better. Ive tried many IPAs and i still have not found one that stands up to Two Hearted Ale.Its perfact from the label, to whats inside.

Pours a golden yellow with a white head about a cm in thickness. Aroma has a mix of citrus fruits, hops, and sweet malts. Taste was a mix of citrus "juice", alcohol, and hops. However, the taste wasnt that strong, a bit watery. Thickness was good, not too much excess carbonation. For a 7%, isnt too strong, could drink anytime.
Golden brown color. Piney, citrusy hops, with a dollop of caramel in the nose. Beautifully balanced, solid caramel malt backbone. Moderately bitter finished. Fairly dry. Simple, but outstanding IPA.

Pours golden orange with nice well formed head. Pine and grapefruit aroma. Could have some more hops in my opinion, but my palate may just be used to beers with higher IBUs. Well balanced and deserving of the praise its received.

This along with Sweetwater IPA is my benchmark for IPAs.The fact this is a year round offering is outstanding.The first time I drank this beer was ice cold straight out of my cooler on the beach years ago!!Cool story I know...This  brew pours an amber/orange color with a decent sized white head.Nose is grapefruit and pine.Taste is spectacular with hops and malts so in sync you find yourself treating this as a session beer!Once again this and Sweetwater IPA are the BENCHMARKS for everyday available IPAs!!
Tap at Clarks St. Ale House.  Pours a light yellow.  Crisp smell of hops and grass.  Citrusy and fruity with a hint of lemon. Good and bitter.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2011 Plusieurs bouteilles de 12 oz, vieilles de moins dun mois. Arômes très intenses et complexes de fleurs et de pamplemousse frais. Robe orangée, légèrement trouble et effervescence active. En bouche, les céréales légèrement sucrées sont très croustillantes et supportent parfaitement le houblon aromatique (agrumes et fleurs). Finale relativement sèche et amertume très fine de houblon. Le Centennial nest probablement pas mon houblon préféré, mais cette IPA est parfaitement exécutée et très bien équilibrée.

Bells hits another homerun with this one! Nice orange/yellow finish with a little haze to it. Amazing balance of malt and citrusy hops. Starts with a great malt flavor, a little splash of the hops on the palate and then a nice malty aftertaste. Really great brew!
Aroma is of generous malt with the hops bitterness floating in the background.  It tastes of fresh hops with back yard malt.  Well balanced and an excellent example of the style.

Bottle - Pours pale orangish-yellow with a 2 finger white head.  Nice piney nose.  Taste is absolutely superb.  Such a well balanced brew.  If anything stands out its malt, very malty all the way though.  Aftertaste hits hard with hops, then back to malt and lingers very nice.  What an IPA, fantastic.

Hazy golden orange pour off white head ... aroma of citrusy hops and sweet malts ...... extremely balanced taste of sweet malts and citrusy hops .... evenly bittered on your whole tongue with just the right amount of bittering hops .... not an overly hopped beer but smooth and sessionable ...... definitely one of the top IPAs out there

Pours a golden honey orange with a nice white head.  The nose is sweet malt with floral and citrus notes.  It rolls across your tongue bitter in all the right places, excellent mouth feel with the hops fading after about 1/2 a minute or so. Awesome with a good mild cigar.

A: It pours a hazy burnt orange color with a small white head. Some sticky looking lacing as I drink this one.

S: The aroma really blew me away. Loads of citrus hop aroma, sweet tropical fruits, and not much malt--very nice.

T: The taste is very similar to the aroma. A great grapefruit and orange flavor, along with sweet pineapple. The finish is nice and piney, giving a bitterness to balance out the fruit.

M: The beer is medium bodied and has moderate carbonation.

D: I can see why people go nuts over this beer. Such a solid IPA, much more similar to the California IPAs than most other Midwest and East Coast offerings.

12 oz bottle
Hazy orangy gold, thin white head and patchy lace.
Subtle aromas of fruit, biscut and grapefruit are layered within.
Flavor is similar to the aroma. Lightly sweet up front with a spicy citrusy hop finish.
Nicely balanced.
Crisp, sharp and a little bitter-- a near-perfect IPA for the winter.
The very definition of IPA for me. My go-to beer which never ever fails to disappoint me
Love the floral aroma. Even though the hops are stronger than Bells Amber Ale, the floral aroma seems to me stronger in the Amber Ale.

12 oz. -> Shaker.  Pours a hazy peach, with an eggshell head - nice mix of pillowy head and fisheyes, such that if this head were a face, itd have localized, blotchy acne: unfortunate when its red, fine when its head, unless, you know, its the other head.  Then, red is still bad.  Nice lacing.  Smells of citrus-y, sour grapefruit, dried apricot, fresh-cut grass, with floral and evergreen aromatics.  Tastes of sweet grapefruit, grass, with a sour, soda water-like note, and... yeah, the dried apricot is there too.  Ive been enjoying this beers cousins for several years now.  If I lived 40 minutes to the east, Id have this stuff in my beer fridge often.

Had a 5L keg of this with some firends at home, what a great IPA!
  Well balanced with wonderful flavors of citrus hops and caramel malts. 
  Plenty of character with an off white head that had some good retention and left some broken lacing.
  Smooth and creamy was an unexpected expieience from this IPA, as well as the blended finish that relied as much on the malt character as it did the bittering hops.
  A great IPA, even for someone who calls himself a malt lover.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2014 Rerate on 2/11/2014.  Nice aroma of bread, caramel, fruit, peach, citrus.  The appearance is clear amber/orange, white head. The flavor is bread dough, caramel, citrus, fruit, flowers. The finish is a nice floral hop bittering, some citrus.  The mouthfeel is slightly sticky.  Medium in body.  Very nice IPA. Right down the middle between hoopy and malty.

Bottle. Outstanding IPA. Rich, dark-amber pour with a firm, off-white head. Aroma of pine and floral hops. Flavor has huge bitterness and yet still strikes the drinker as well-balanced, what with the hearty doses of malts. Mildly resiny mouthfeel and a crisp, sticky, lip-smacking finish.

On tap at the eccentric cafe.  Nose is sweet citrus.  Pours a golden orange with a fragrant white pale to white head.  Has some bright citrus and sweetness, but the bitterness comes across almost earthy.  A little different from your average IPA.

HOPPY!  Burns the nostrils in a good way.  Generous use of bittering and finishing (and dry-hopping) hops gives this ale a HUGE nose.  Pours coppery-clear with large tan head and good retention.  Lots of lacing.  Medium light and caramel malt goodness, but tilts decidedly toward the bitter end of the scale.  Lingering piney hops bitterness and just a tiny bit of heat.  Did I mention hops?  For beer drinkers who want to know theyre drinking beer.  A great IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2011 Bottle.  Impressive grapefruit and floral taste, much too easy to drink beer...   It became gradually one of my favorite IPAs with its barely sweet malt base and its sharp fruity hoppiness. Delightfuly refreshing and pleasant.  I could drink gallons of this through a year but I would still have my days where I look as grinchy as the fish on the label does.
Pours a clear golden with white head. Very resin hops taste, sweet, malty, citrus, fruity, very rich.  Similar taste, everything balanced.  Another fantastic offering from Bells.

Clear and transparent Smells like crisp, fresh, citrus, light, tropical delight. Mango, pineapple, and coconut. Tastes outstanding. Clean and fresh yet oh so full bodied. So balanced. Harmonious lovely beer.

On tap at Mad Mex, served in a shaker (unfortunately). This hazy orange-bronze brew sports a nice foamy white head which, as it dissipates, yields a sweet floral hop aroma with added dimensions of coriander, citrus fruit, spruce, and subdued malts. The flavor follows the aroma, but the fruitiness is accentuated with soft stonefruits (peaches and apricots). The hops and malts are nicely balanced. Quite good.

Bottle. Light amber/golden orange color. Floral, citrusy (grapefruit), hoppy aroma and flavor. Bitter, but not over the top harsh. Well balanced between malts and hops. An easy to drink and enjoyable IPA!

Poured from 12 oz. bottle into snifter. Aroma is floral sweet. Appearance is golden orange in color with slight haze and frothy head that deminishes as you drink. Taste is floral little honey grapfruit and finishes dry fruit. Palate grapfruit thin slick minimal bitterness, solid. I love this beer, when you cant decide look no futher pick it up.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy Golden Amber with about 3/4 of a finger worth of white head.  Piney Hops aroma at first, which fades into a more floral hop aroma as the head dissappates.  Carbonated Hoppy bitter flavor up front, followed by a mild but noticeable floral hop flavor, with a balanced hoppy bitter finish.  Bitterness fades away and leaves you with a nice floral taste that lingers till your next sip.  I feel that this is a well balanced IPA, not too much or too little of any one thing.  Very drinkable.

Pours a hazy orange amber with white head and incredible lacing. Decent aroma of pine and maybe a bit of coriander. Flavor is spicy hops and a subtle maltiness just to allow the hops to shine. Real nice. Thanks for all the bells beers Craig! (CBkshubert)
a super-nice i.p.a. from the lauded kalamazoo brewery. i wish it were hoppier, but it is pretty yummy just the way it is.

Bottle. Man I love this beer! Brought a full sixer back from North Dakota. SO glad I did! Pours mildly hazy red-amber, with good head and wonderful lacing. Nose is citrus, primarily grapefruit, plus spruce, juniper, mild malt, florals, and mandarin orange. Flavor is perfectly bitter and juicy, quite possibly the most refreshing beer Ive ever had. Flavor is peach/apricot, plus grapefruit, spruce, pine bough, sap, mild malt. A textbook lesson in balance. Extraordinarily gorgeous.
Nice copper color with a generous head and good lacing.  Big grapefruit and floral aroma hops throughout with a sharp dry finish.

Draft.  Hazy golden orange with a medium orangey-white head.  Aroma and flavor are all about the hops:  citrus (orange and grapefruit?), floral, piney.  Hops are big, but the bitterness is tolerable (Im, generally speaking, a malt-head rather than a hopper).  Not a very balanced beer -- I guess thats probably the point.  A very good IPA, but didnt live up to what I expected from the ratings.

Pours a nice orange that is closer on the spectrum to brown than anything else -- cloudy but not completely opaque. Decent lacing and a nice, off-white/white-orange frothy head. Smells of citrus and floral hops -- definitely get an orange peel scent, too. Some spices are there, too, but its winter so my nose isnt up to peak performance and I cant draw out exactly what they are. Taste is floral hops with a healthy dose of citrus (grapefruit and some orange) hops, too. The malts dont balance it enough -- there is a hop bitterness that lingers that turns almost metallic as time goes on. A bit over-carbonated, too, but still quite decent. Better than a number of IPAs Ive tried, but certainly nothing to write home about.

Thanks to Savvy 1982 for the share! Pours a golden orange with a nice head with spotty lacing. The aroma is packed with citrus, soft fruit and honey. The flavor is big and citric as well. Loads of grapefruit, lemon, spruce, peach, and spice. You find something new each sip. Very good.

Medium amber color with nice lacing. You dont see too much of this from an ipa or ale from the bottle. Aroma isnt too pungent for an ipa, some hoppy citrus notes but mellow.  Crisp, hoppy some pale malts liven up the palate.  Acidic and bitter but has a metallic aftertaste. Sorry had better ipas. I guess hopslam is next.

(12oz. bottle). light golden color-almost resembles a pilsner, but flavor is definitely an IPA. Nice balance of sweetness and bitterness.  The bitterness does not linger too much as do some of the IPAs today.  Overall, a nice solid beer.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2010 Draft at redlight redlight.  Pours a golden yellow.  Strong pine hop aroma.  Very hoppy yet smooth flavor.  Lots of orange juice in the finish.  Potent yet crisp and refreshing.  This beer is exactly what it means to be and nothing else, and I like it.

I believe MrChopin hooked me up with this beauty(No pun intended). Ill have to try to get this one again.  It was great, but not 100 percentile.  Copper amber with solid head.  Nose super sweet with hops.  Floral and citrus.  Taste is big floral sweet, with light sugar sweet stickiness to it.  Good sharpness flowed through.  Some citrus lightness, but was kinda overpowered by the floral.  Again, I simply need to revisit this brew with a more focused attention.

pours light amber with a very tall foamy white head. AmaZing aroma tons of cascade on the nose it has a strong perfume smell just beautiful. Fresh flavour very deep, cascade, very creamy soapy finish. Thisbis zoo complex and
its all
hops! What an IPA!

pours a fiery orange with medium white had. aroma is citrus and pine hops with a little malt sweetness showing through. drinks crisp and bitter with earthy floral hops with citrus coming in quick. all balanced over a solid malty body. fantastic

Good beer. I had it at the Green Leafe, here in Williamsburg, during Trivia Night. Maybe the atmosphere got in the way of me getting a lot of flavor out of the beer. I found that the aroma was one of floral, light hops. It pours a copper gold. Good beer to look at. The taste? Slightly sweet and decently bitter (not a huge hop bomb). The beer lingers. Its got a nice long finish, not dry at all. Theres a pleasant carbonation to it that I thing makes the sweetness seem not too offensive. Its nothing outstanding but then, this isnt my style. But its a very drinkable beer (I dont mean that condescendingly either) and its something Id gladly keep in my fridge.

12oz bottle split with a friend. The color was a light orange-yellow with a fluffy white head. The smell was oddly sweet. The taste reminded me of candy and nothing else. Grape candy to be specific. Maybe I will try this again but I was not too impressed.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-04-2007 15:46:46

Draught @ World of Beer, Tampa, FL: A light brown pour, awesome clingy white head. Lots of soap in the aroma, some white pepper. The initial taste is just a giant, but pleasant, soapy hop bomb and it doesnt tire much after that. I enjoyed it for what it was, but how on earth is this rated a 100? There are better IPAs, friends, including this brewerys own Hopslam.
very bitter, but the aroma and the floweriness make up for that for the most part, but just not enough to make this a really good beer for me

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2011 12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass produced an thick, foamy white head and amber body.  Gorgeous looking beer!  Aroma of citrus and flower notes.  Flavor dominated by citrus, especially ruby red grapefruit.  Creamy and well-balanced, not as bitter as you would expect from an IPA.  Pleasant, mildly hoppy finish which lingered on the tongue.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2011 Pours a nice orange color with a thick white head, lots of lacing and tons of carbonation. Aromas are citrus and floral. The taste is CREAMY, followed by some well balanced floral hops and malts. Super easy to drink. This is one of the best beers Ive ever had. A great session beer and possibly the best Pale ale Ive ever tasted

Pours cloudy golden orange color with nice tan head and good lacing. Strong aroma of floral hops and grapefruit, hints at whats to come. Flavor follows aroma, slightly sweet toasted malt with very strong, almost overpowering hop bitter. Nice carbonation. Quite long lingering bitter aftertaste. I found too hoppy to drink alone, but quite nice when paired with food. Good beer, but probably over-rated at 100

UPDATED: APR 15, 2010 Pours an amber color with a white head. Nose is full of citrus and floral scents. Great hops and a nice floral and citrus flavor to it. Some fruit flavor to it as well. Good IPA and one I can drink all the time.

Pours yellow-orange and cloudy with a thick white head. Light-to-medium aromas of citrus with notes of toast. Pronounced grapefruit flavor with lots of acidity. Creamy on palate with lots of bitterness and fizz. I was surprised to see this beer rated in the 100th percentile? Its a very good IPA, but I dont think theres anything "Stand-out" about it.
Pours a hazy yellow with a few fingers of stark white head, floral hoppy odor.  Nice hoppy punch to it with a sweet bitter finish.
It was pretty good, but to me it felt a little thin, and I was expecting a little bit more. It had some floral and citrus notes, but like I said, a little thin.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2010 -Date Tasted: 1-7-10
-Rating : 4.2
-Brew Date/Batch# : 9499
-Mode : 12oz. bottle
-Source : St. Louis area grocery store
-Appearance : Pours clear light golden nectar
-Aroma : Excellent  flora/piney smell right of the bat
-Flavor : Nice balance of flowers and pine with nice citrus tones in-between
-Overall : I would like to see this IPA bottle conditioned, oh the potential. One of the finest IPAs Ive been privileged to drink. Why dont they distribute this nectar where I live. I think this IPA beats any IPA brewed in Colorado. I dont like the Midwest but I do love this beer!

Pours a pretty pinkish amber color with a nice firm white head that leaves a thin lacing for a while. It pours a cloudier look when it is a little more shook up that I think looks more appealing. The aroma is a whole lot of good things put together all up in it. You got a little citrus along with hella floral hoops with a few notes of caramel. And hops, hops, hops, hops. The taste you actually dont get hop overkill, which is a good call by all means. Perfect amount and perfect taste. Got a lot of bitterness and tiny bits of sweetness thrown into it. Palate is wonderfully smooth... exact right amount of carbonation and a nice medium body. Nothing, and I mean nothing, is wrong with this beer.

Thanks to hudsonphotog for bringing this one back from Pittsburgh.

Pours a slightly cloudy yellow with a large white head, which stays around throughout the drinking process. The aroma is lots of citrus with both orange and apricot notes. You also get some floral and pine aromas. The flavor is relatively bitter with a strong orange/citrus aftertaste. Very tasty. Thin-medium mouthfeel and lots of carbonation. A great IPA that lives up to the hype.
UPDATED: JAN 16, 2010 Perfect IPA; Strong but not over the top; excellent aroma, taste and finish.  Good for every day and special events

Whoa. I took a sip, fell back through the window and landed on a cloud of hoppiness. This beer is extremely fruity and balanced. I felt like I was drinking the air in a mexican fruit market. Beautiful beer but....what is with the label? Hemmingway symbolism or what? May I suggest... a big castle, surrounded by knights and giant hops growing out of the mote with the "lady of the beer" somewhere in there. Its time to display a great American beer with some round table honor! Alright Im done.
Fruity aroma with a golden pour. Taste has strong hints of american malts and is distinctly centennial. Hoppy mouthfeel that doesnt berate the palate, very sweet citrus-floral flavor.

Mini keg shared by DuffmanSW at Hangar 24. Appearance was a clear golden color with nice head. Aroma was very floral and fruity. Taste was malty and hoppy, very well balanced. Pallet was low to medium.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2010 Enjoyed in a glass from a 1.32 gallon corny.  Aroma is of a hop garden, if Bells came out with Two Hearted perfume I would gladly wear it.  Copper color with a thick white head that clings to the glass.  Very soothing taste thats mainly hoppy but contains a toasty/caramel malt finish.  The most soothing IPA out there, Im happy to live in the midwest where Two Hearted and Three Floyds Alpha King are readily available.
Bottle. Nice hop aroma with a light fruit note. Nice golden color with a white head. Very nice full, light fruit body with a pleasant bitter and light hop flower palate. Very nice.

i didnt know what kind of ale this was when I ordered it, I would have guessed it to be an EPA or pub ale...pours clear straw-gold with a thick white head-good head retention and lacing. aroma is heavy with citrus- lemon peel, tangerine, and some others. maybe a little ruby red grapefruit. also some wheat and a slight sweet floral hoppiness. flavor is sweet, lots of sticky sweet, spicy floral hops, caramel malt. aftertaste is pungent hops, spiciness, and a long, dry finish. pretty good.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 Re-rated due to suspected bad bottle / 12oz bottle - 
Ahhh...much better!  My last review--about a year ago--did not accurately capture how good this IPA is due to unknown reasons (i.e. age, light damage, whatever).  Beautifully balanced IPA with just enough citrus and just enough caramel malt.  Extremely smooth with no bitter aftertaste.  Very solid overall.  **Re-rated / revisited again - This has become one of my favorite beers of all time.  I find myself reaching for this 6er so often because it delivers so much flavor and freshness.   Perfectly balanced!

bottled. The beer has a light, white fluffy head. There is a great floral aroma with some hints of citrus.  There is a big burst of flavor from the hops in the beginning to a nice crisp finish. unbelievable beer
Huge hoppy, floral aroma. Crisp taste, dries out your entire mouth. Quite bitter. An excellent IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2010 12oz bottle, batch 9754, bottled May 27, 2010, reviewed June 14, 2010.  Pours lightly hazy golden amber with a large foamy & rocky head that leaves nice rings of lacing.  Unbelievable aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, orange, tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, cantaloupe, incredibly complex and powerful aroma.  Flavor is mostly fruit and citrus, a lot of orange/tangerine, somewhat sweet in the middle, medium bitterness on the finish, a hint of alcohol.  A touch watery and a bit of a letdown after the potent aroma.  Still excellent and better than many IPAs.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied, slick, medium carbonation.  

Original Review:
5L mini keg.  Pours orange with a big fluffy white head that leaves clumps of sticky lacing.  Aroma is very nice with a lot of floral and citrus hops.  Flavor is hoppy and sweet, some caramel malt backbone.  Bitterness is on the low end for the style, making this a little different for an IPA but still very enjoyable.  Some bitterness at the end with lingering bitterness in the finish.  Medium carbonation, smooth mouthfeel.  Incredibly drinkable, great session IPA.
Ar 7/10, Ap 4/5, T 8/10, P 4/5, O 18/20: 4.1 Score

Poured orange/off yellow with a nice white head from 12 oz bottle.  Aroma thick of flowery and resiny hops.  Full palate of flower, resin, and pine with a nice caramel sweetness to balance it with a great lasting bitter finish.  Measure this up to the best of IPAs, awesome beer and so glad its always around!

Strong floral hoppy aroma. Goldenrod appearance, minimal off white head. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. A well-balanced IPA. Delicious and refreshing!
light orange pour  with a small 1 finger dense white  head. big floral hops aroma. the taste is not over the top, not hoppy just to be.

Aroma is a doughy fruitness with a strong hops presence.  Color is a nice golden amber with a one-finger white head.  Plenty of carbonation present.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Flavor is a great fruit flavor.  Almost like sour strawberries.  Great taste. Bitter aftertaste.  This is a very tasty beer.  Highly recommended.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2010 (br-btl gr-lbl or-txt w/fish, many 6 packs & a keglet, 7%)

[opq-or/cpr, thin-wh-head, full-body, ^co2, great creamy texture.

^citrus-hop crml-malt aroma.

tangerine §pale-malt T1 tangerine T2 §bitter-resin-hop T3 bitter-hop Tf.
overall ^fresh-unripe-tangerine.
great afternoon beer, ^quaffable session-beer.
seems like mostly cascade or centennial to me.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2010 So smooth for an IPA, not as potent as the hop slam. Still a sweet hoppiness which is subtle but nice in the aroma and full flavored in taste. With a golden orange color this brew is another of the fine ales that Larry Bell has released.
BELLS NEVER FAILS!! completely inlove with this beer.strong floral smells is almost like spring and the taste of sweet and sour hops over comes anyones thoughts of this being a week ale.

Had this many times and finally rated it.  Awesome IPA.  Big hop profile up front with citrus tartness and subtle malt character.  Aroma of more malt and hop.  Floral and citrus hops dominate aroma and tastes.  Great brew.

Another old love returns: "You move through my dreams like a trout moves through a pool." This beer was, for several years, my favorite beer. It remains  the best  made beers that you can walk in off the street and buy a six of in most any liquor store.  Pours a clear yellow orange under a  half-inch head of white. Nose is big citrus and grape-NeHi hops with a little malt sweetness. First taste is piney resin hops and a quick hop-bitter bite. The citrus hop flavor jumps in quickly with a bitter bite modulated with malty sweetness. This beer works really well. Finish is dry with just a little lingering sweetness and the big pine hops lingering just long enough. Very solid beer.

On tap @ Papago for the Bells launch party.  Pour is orange-gold with an off-white head.  Aroma shows freshly baked bread, pink grapefruit, peach, pine, and an amazing amount of perfume.  Flavor shows the same with a touch of caramel.  The guy who recently rated this a 1 and proceeded to bash others for their use of the word "balanced", really needs to reevaluate his own palate.  An IPA doesnt need to strip the enamel off your teeth in order to be successful.  This one is obviously geared more into the floral hops rather than bittering.  Still a killer, nicely balanced IPA.  Overall body is moderate and oily, with a moderate finish.

This ale poured a clear yellow colour with a creamy, off white head. To the nose there are scents of bread, grain, dough, hopps, juniper, spruce and butter??? First taste is smooth as silk with a nice creamy mouthfeel. By the smell I figured a hopp-heads dream but not so. Flavours of hopps, citrus, grass and butter. Finish is slightly bitter with hopps lingering through the palate.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2011 On tap.  Golden orange with creamy off-white head.  Fruity aroma with mild hoppiness.  Taste nice and citrus with a little spicy hoppiness.  Bitterness extremely smooth and complements the malt very well.  About as good and drinkable as it gets!  Rating: 4.1

Re-rate (2/17/2010): 12 oz bottle. Opinion remains the same.  Yes there are some more impressively hopped IPAs, but this stands out as being extremely well-paired (hops to malt). Rating: 4.0
Nose is hoppy with grapefruit, lemon slightly metallic.  Taste of citrusy hops.  Nice bitter long finish.

Bakery fresh aroma and a lovely dark amber pour. The massive hops die a bit in the aftertaste making this actually refreshing. Malty and bitter with a bit of a watery backdrop. Bells is one of my favorite American brewers. Quite nice.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2010 Fresh bottle. Citrus, mango, salty aroma. Tangy, hoppy, nice malt flavor with tropical fruit cocktail. Earthy, great stuff with great balance. Much better fresh. 

Old rate 7/3/8/3/15 Medium to deep gold color with a thick, nice head. Rich malt and fruit nose, a bit metallic. Very fruity flavor with cherry and big citrus hops. Very piney and peppery. Bitter finish. Nice stuff, but maybe not in its best condition. At least 6 months old.
The beer pours a medium dark amber color. This is a very good IPA. The taste is a spirited citrus. There is mild carbonation present and a very subtle malt base. It is a very smooth IPA.

Pours a deep, clear, golden color with an ambitious white head that leaves behing a sticky lacing.  Aroma is dominated by citrus (lemon and orange notes)  as well as pine, with a slight caramel aroma underneath it.  Taste features a prominent hop bitterness to begin, but is balanced a slight caramel sweetness and a short finish.  In all honesty, it seemed a bit watery, and the short finish, which makes it drinkable, undermines it.

Come on guys!! You really need to get out and try more IPAs This beer is a fraud. It tastes like Fruit Loops! Seriously? They have to be using hop extracts to get this flavor! That and hair spray? This is so artificial, nauseating and and ......... $#%^%. Sorry I just puked. Where is the flavor caramel? The grains? The malt? The yeast? The Bitter? One rater said this was balanced. Obviously he was UNbalanced. If you like this beer you must try Hop Stoopid.  Aptly named. Hop extracts should be banned in brewing!!!  This beer really pissed me off!   Its absolutely disgusting.

If you hated this beer.   Please try El Toro Brewing Deuce Double IPA to have a world class IPA.

A: Beautiful straw yellow/orange in color with a head that settles down nicely to one finger. This one is very effervescent with bubbles chasing each other to the top and it has nice lacing for an IPA. 

S: The wonderful aroma of hops. Earthy with a beautiful smell of citrus and pine. 

T: I really like this one. I have probably drank over a case of it in the past month or so and I have finally gotten around to reviewing it. This one has the taste of wonderful pink grapefruit. The taste is long lasting and finishes with a sting on the tongue from the bitterness of the hops. Nice! 

M: Very effervescent, and refreshing 

D: This is one of the most sessionable around. I session with Alpha king until I run out and then switch over to Two Hearted for the hot Florida summers.

Pours a hazy orange with a thick head and lots of lingering lacing.  Strong floral hops and pine aroma.  Taste is very balanced.  Not as bitter as I was expecting...in a good way.  This is a very drinkable beer and one of my favorite IPAs.  The long dry bitter finish is worth savoring with each sip.
I love the IPA! This stuff is very good. In a word balance. I love the hop bombs but sometimes I seek the balance. Very impressed.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2009 hops are floral aroma with hints of grapefruit, color of medium amber, opaque and hazy, nice off-white head, foamy with great lacing, lightly sour taste and a medium bitterness, nice malty flavor with perfect hops balance, medium body, soft carbonation, a long dry bitter finish

Bottle pours a golden amber  with thick tan white head. Aroma is big and hoppy lots of floral and citrus with a soft mellow malty sweetness. Taste is Hops hops hops with just a little soft malty sweetness. Very dry bitter pucker finish. Good solid daily drinker.

Aroma is pungent, fresh and intoxicating. The hops are beautifully bright and well balanced by the malt. Theres no sweet, heavy overtones in the malt. This beer is perfectly balanced. Heavy on the hops and smooth on the tongue. The aftertaste makes you crave another. Best beer in America-Id love to find something more perfect... If anythings better than this, bring it on.

hazy gold/orange with a massive fluffy head.  intense hop aroma... plenty of pine and citrus.  flavor is less intense than expected judging by the nose, but very tasty.  nice amount of bitterness against the pale malt background.

Bottled. Orange with medium white head. Aroma is  fresh hoppy mostly citrusy with some pine and floral notes also. Citrus is predominately grapefruit but with light lemon. Flavor is dry biting throughout, with sweet hoppy citrus of grapefruit and variety floral notes. Grapefruit finish dry not sweet and biting. Beer starts with light to medium sweetness but slowly diminishes to no sweetness by finish. Crisp and clean mouthful. I dig!
Just not my thing.  Im not an IPA fan and I guess if this is a great one then Im not going to bother with others!

On draft at Mothers Pub in Gainesville, FL. Probably the easiest to find, reasonably priced, and best tasting beer I can think of. Pours orange with lots of lacing. Citrus, floral, herbs, and hoppiness. Better on draft IMO.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Bottle from The Party Source. Ive seen this so often, Ive been putting it off for other things that have been harder to find, and now find myself finally trying it. No disappointment here. Pours a nice orange-cold color with a small off-white head. Nice aroma of citrus fruits- especially orange, but grapefruit and lemon, too- floral hops, malt, and just a hint of caramel. The flavor is similar, and just as good, with more of the caramel sweetness present to smooth it out. Light bodied, and a nice blend of hop bitterness and sweetness from citrus and caramel. Medium to high carbonation. Bitter, toasty, and sweet on the finish. Awesome year-round beer. Re-Rate: Went a wee bit overboard last time. I like Two Hearted a lot and still think of it as one of the classic American IPAs that can be enjoyed whenever and wherever. Just not as crazy about it as I originally was, and was reminded of this at dinner last night.
bottled. Rich orange colored ale w/ a bold hop nose.  Sweetened hop acids in every sip. Citric. Taste is spot on. A favorite & a hero to lesser IPAs.

slightly hazy, dark golden in color, nice white head with lots of lacing,
med-light carbonation.  Flavors are mostly of floral grapefruity hops that are fairly sharp but not over the top.  mouthfeel is moderate to full.  Somehow this beer also has a fair crisp quality to it that is lighter than most other strong hopped beers.  (note that Im not an IPA kinda guy)  Overall I like this, its probobly the best IPA Ive had, I would drink it again, but not buy it.
Great beer.  Full of flavor, nice bite.  A great combination of bitter, sweet and hoppy.  Definite must try.
Good Golden Brew.  Love the Hops.  Thank you Bells.  Wonderful lacing on the glass. Wonderful aroma and full taste of hops.  I love this brew.

Not a bad ipa, some floral and citrus hints,Nice hazy orange coloring.  Quite a nice suprise, did not expect to be quite this good but have had plenty of ipas that were better, most notable Victory Hopdevil. But I would not pass this beer up and I am glad I tried it.

Batch 9396. Pours amber orange, translucent body, fluffy white head. Grassy aroma of pine hops, orange juice, and grapefruit. Ooh, thats lovely! Smooth blend of pine hops, perfume, and lemon. Quite smooth, minimal carbonation and a buttery feel thats a perfect complement to the flavor profile. Only a subtle rush of bitter hoppiness. One of the finer IPAs Ive experienced. This was my first venture beyond Bells stouts, and Im definitely impressed.

Great IPA. One that Im getting to know reasonably well since moving to the midwest. Pretty straightforward, big flavor with lots of booze for a standard IPA. It has some citrus and pine character, but far from overwhelming. Like the Hopslam its a bit of a gut bomb but not to the same degree. Highly sessionable, although you may not want to have much to do the next day, as it will break you off. The one Im drinking now is not the freshest, so the review may not even be giving it a fair shake, but it is excellent nonetheless.
Had in a sampler. An all around good IPA. Honey, cirtus, floral, herbs, spruce, and hoppy spice.

Bottle courtesy of jdskinns.  dark golden color with one of the most beautiful floral hop aromas ive ever whiffed. perfectly balanced malt to hops. Finish lasts on your palate just long enough to entice you to take another sip. Alcohol is well hidden which makes this dangerous @ 7%!
I dont review a lot of beers but felt it a moral imperative to review this.
Worst part is i cant get it in Jersey!

( 12oz bottle from batch 8888 (brewed December 11, 2008) and sampled on June 9, 2009) While not super fresh, this was still a really good beer.

Pours slightly opaque rusty orange color, nice 1 finger head that sticks around a decent while, excellent lacing. Smells like caramel malt fading on the back side, some floral hops that have most definitely faded over time. Pretty simple here, nothing too complex but nice. Taste follows the smell, but more hoppy than I expected after 6 months of time on it. It still has a decent amount of bitter that doesnt linger which for me personally is nice. Reminiscent of an American Barleywine, sweet and malty, bitter hops, and some citrus qualities too. Some bitter tangerine peel or oils. Finishes creamy and perfectly carbonated. Body is just right, but could use just a touch more oiliness and it would be absolutely perfect.
Pour is golden brown with nice thick white foam. The nose is straight up floral onslaught. Palate is citrus, grass, floral, and a host of other unique flavors. Incredibly smooth.
Somewhat dark amber for an IPA with an offwhite head. Lots of pleasing floral and fruit notes ride along with the pressing hops. Spot on bitterness. Awesome drinkability.

A nice, hoppy beer. A reliable bottled beer. An orange/gold coloration in the glass. Personally I prefer this in the bottle to on tap...I just get a better bouquet from it. I made the mistake of having this after the Hopslam, however. Next to that, this paled. It is a solid IPA, however and Id recommend it.
UPDATED: JAN 23, 2010 (12 ounce bottle) I love the hops in this beer.  Citrusy and hoppy taste.  Nice head and lacing, $10 a 6 pack.  Geat IPA.

Bottle.  Pours a large, off-white, foamy head.  Slightly hazy, golden body.  Thick citrus and fruity hop aroma.  Some clementine.  More of the same in the flavor profile, but with an increased intensity.  Slight bread crust to go with the orange marmalade.  Well-hidden alcohol.  Medium body, average carbonation, with a bitter, slightly sticky finish.  Overall a tasty, straightforward, no-nonsense IPA.

Pours a nice orange with a medium white head. You get a very nice aroma of citrus fruits. Tastes of citrus, grapefruit, and oranges, with a nice bitter kick at the end. Very good beer that hit the spot!
Very floral aroma, with some citrus.  Nicely bitter, however lacking in body.
Nice IPA.  Bitter but leaves a nice dry taste in the mouth with the need for a malty sweet finish of some strong IPAs.  I really love this beer.
Poured hazy orange amber, citrus, floral, hoppy, caramel malts, little apricot.
Darker than most IPAs, big white head...tons of resin, hoppy, balanced with nice citrus flavors

12 oz bottle - pours a slightly hazy light orange with minimal head that leaves a little bit of lacing - Citrus hops in the aroma and taste - At 7% abv the alcohol is hidden very well and this beer goes down dangerously smooth with a slight bitterness on the palate - As of 11-9-09 the commercial description here says "this beer doesnt have Bells in front of the name by explicit request from the brewer" - well if I was the brewer I would definitely put my name in front of this beer as it is delicious and easy to drink - Mega kudos to the brewer!

Thanks to Ucusty!  Pours orange-gold with a moderate white head.  Aroma is lovely, with orange, grapefruit, lemon, strawberries, cotton candy, toffee and breadcrust.  Smells like hop candy.  Flavor is a similar, drier mix of earth, bread, brown sugar, orange, grapefruit, strawberries and pine.  Finishes like citrus fruits dipped in brown sugar mixed with a toasty bitterness that is more flavorful than strong.  Medium bodied, creamy, fairly high carbonation, and easy to drink.  I can see why so many people are addicted to this beer.  It really DOES make me wish I had more in the fridge!
Sampled @ the Moss Rock Festival.  Pours a deep golden color with a crisp, hoppy, florarl nose.  Taste it deep and complex, with late hop action.

Bottle. Golden with a thick offwhite head with good lacing. Aromas of piney hops and chalk. Balanced malts and a fruity, almost strawberry taste.  Some grapefruit bitterness and also evergreen hops. Nice finish.

Pours light golden, like an English Pale Ale, from the 12oz. bottle: Nose is an overall (and I cant stop whiffing!) earthy effervesence with resin, grass and grapefruit peel amplifying a delicate euphoria of floral hops. Balanced and light and normally I dont appresh light IPAs, but Im not feeling like Im missing out on hops here. Starts out medium and goes into a fuller body. Oily palatte. Drinkability: BOMBER- A good quality IPA. Crisp, clean and refreshing. Rebuy: Right away. #185 on 04112009, DG.

12-oz bottle. Slightly hazy golden color. Stiff ample white head that persisted for 15 minutes. Strong pleasant citrus aroma. Medium body with a creamier texture than I expected. Mild sweetness blending quickly into orange and then orange peel. Hoppy without being overpowering. Immensely drinkable. I continue to be impressed with the offerings from Bells! Good job.
Hoppy and floral. Smooth to drink with proper bitterness and suds. Nice in bottle and draft.

Pours a thin, white, diminishing head atop a clear light amber body.  Good carbonation.   Very hoppy, sweet aroma.  Bitter, hoppy taste, long aftertaste; medium bodied.  A very satisfying, ultra-hoppy ale thats drinkable with a lower abv (of beers in this class).  A must-try for all beer conniseurs.

12oz. This is one of the best beers Ive ever drank without a doubt.  Pours a dark gold with a nice head.  The aroma of this brew is off the chain and I want to just stick my nose in the bottle after opening it and inhale for hours.  The hops are out of control, but not too overpowering.  Awesome.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2011 Poured from bottle into water glass at work. 

Semi-hazy amber orange, with small head retention.

Aroma of grapefruit and pine, with some mild malt undercurrents.

Ah, the centennial hop! Mostly grapefruit bitterness, but the bitterness is not overpowering in any way. Maybe some slight lemon or orange flavors to round out the overall citrus taste. The malts are there and provide backbone, but really are not sweet at all, maybe almost slightly sour.

Medium bodied but fairly light for the style. Medium carbonation, with a bone dry finish.

As far as I am concerned, this is the most drinkable IPA ever brewed. It is neither too bitter as some IPAs are, nor too light so I get bored of the flavor.

Appearance is a cloudy, golden dreamboat. White head with good lacing. Smell is sweet and citrusy, full of hops. Taste followed the smell and I could have sworn I tasted Fruity Pebbles in there somewhere. Mouthfeel and body are full, definitely not lacking a backbone here. Very drinkable, a great beer for a day of grilling outside.

Aroma: very floral hoppyness, some malts.  Appearance: Clear dark golden color with nice head that leaves a nice lacing when it dissipates a few mins later.  Flavor: floral, hoppy, pine, malts. Palate: medium body, average carbonation, bitter.
Overall: this beer is good but not as good as the 60min or Stone IPA in my opinion. It seems like its lacking in complexity and finish. its mainly relying on its awesome aroma to win peoples vote.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 Very very floral aroma.  Quite a bite on the tongue, but still able to drink quite a few.  Favorite part of the beer might be the label.  Best IPA available.

Amaing, Wow!  This is a hell of an ale.  Very floral and fuc&%n Hoppy> Bam This is the shi#!!!>>>  Amazon whamo flavor and the smell is so nice of a floral beauty like a floral shop.  Sweet, bitter, dry, perfect almost and a smiling face maker.  This is a beer I would take if I stranded on a island and SHIZIT!!!
Floral, hoppy and just plain good stuff. Flavor is wonderful, not to overwhelming. Very easy to drink many in  one sitting. Always have a couple in the fridge.
Bottle. Yep, floral, grassy, citrusy. Smell of cherry candy. Bright flavor, great balance, not too sweet, not too bitter. I havent appreciated this beer enough.
Bottle.  Nice Clear Orange pour.  Very smooth.  White Head.  Floral Aroma.  nice Hoppy flavor.  Super IPA.

Pours a light amber color with a thinly laced head.  Aroma is dominated by floral hops with some honey and grass.  Taste is again dominated by floral hops with some honey and citrus.  Good, well balanced IPA.

On tap at sharper edge in E Sliberty. Clear golden with thick white head. a little flat. Tasty hop aroma with solid malt background. Taste comes out a little thin, though well-crafted and balanced. Clean finish.
Extremely fresh and piney/citrus nose. Golden with orange hue and light lacey white head. Flavor mirrors the aroma with a nice malt finish.  One of the best standard IPAs Ive had.
Draft:  Poured a golden orange with a nice white head.  The aroma was sweet hops and pine.  The flavor was hops, citrus and bitters.  Overall, one of the best Ive ever had.

From a 12oz bottle into a pint glass.  Pours with about 3 fingers of super fluffy white head which disappears within a couple minutes.  Fluffy lacing remains throughout.  Pours a dark golden, almost copper color with a little bit of haze from the yeast at the bottom of the bottle.  There were also a few dark floaties in there.  They didnt look like yeast and I kinda doubt they were supposed to be there.  Taste was of sweet and spicy hops.  Its hoppy but I thought it would be super hoppy.  But thats a good thing as I dont like hop bombs.  Its surprisingly balanced for a higher rated IPA but the hops dominate.  A very good IPA but whats up with the floaties?
Smells great, sweet floral hop aroma. Taste is more subtle than your typical west coast IPA, and I was a bit surprised by how pale this beer is. Taste is crisp citrus hops. Body is good. Solid beer.

12oz bottle 10/3/09 ($.99 at Sams Wine & Spirits)-Pours a slightly hazy golden color. Aroma of hops and citrus. Taste of bitterness, citurs, hops, and some sweetness. This medium bodied brew is very well balanced and it finishes with a nice dryness. Great balance and taste. Awesome.

Bottle at Akkurat in August 2009. Lovely golden color, large and fine foam.

A lot of citrus, hops and pine. 

The first thing I noticed in the taste was the delicious bitterness. But fortunately the beer was not only bitter, there was a nice balance and a certain sweetness.

Undeniably a great beer!

Bottle at Akkurat, shared by plovmand. 
Pours golden with a dense off white head. 
Aroma is sweet fruit, hops, apricot, peach and malt. 
Flavour is fruity as well with hops, hay, peach, pineapple and citrus notes. 
Its well balanced but with a bit of a "sharp" bitter after taste.
Bottle.  A hazy amber with large foamy head.  Huge aroma of citrus, pine and floral hops, and the flavor follows.  Nice body, great feel.

draft - a very flavorful IPA with a bigger nalt profile than many. This adds balance and gives a great interplay of flavors. The hopping keeps strong fruit, but not just citrus, also apple and maybe some other fleshy fruits. crisp finish. Also slightly resiny and has a bit of herbal funk. nice looking to boot.

12 oz bottle. Slightly hazy amber/orange with a big bubbly off white head. Big aroma of citrus, pine, flowers and ganja, you can tell this one was dry hopped liberally. The flavor is a meld of sweet and bitter from start to finish, no alcohol taste at all. Medium body with a frothy mouth feel and a slightly watery finish. This is a great IPA, wish it was available locally.
The best beer I have ever had. Dumb looking fish on the front of the bottle, but who cares, its just flat out awesome
Bottle. Golden/orange pour with medium off white head. Floral/hoppy aroma. Hoppy, slight malt, citrus, quite crisp. This would make a good session IPA. A quality brew.
Pours reddish amber with two fingers of head and nice lacing. Nice bouqet of malt and floral hops. Full bodied. Flavor is grapefruit and caramel sweetness. Solid beer, but Im no hop head.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2011 Pours a slightly hazy golden amber with a foamy white head, heavy lacing.  Aroma is citrus and floral hops with a nutty undertone.  Taste is bitter sweet and lively on the tongue.  Palate is very hoppy bitter and full bodied, mouthfeel is sticky and a little orange zest on the finish.  Will never grow tired of this.

[12 oz] Readers of my previous reviews will know that IPAs from this country rarely strike my fancy -- often way too unidimensional and unoriginal.  This one is different. 
Nice sized head, golden color.  A good deal of piney resin and a little floral on the nose. Its very concentrated. 
The taste here is fantastic, hoppy and full-bodied without being overwhelmingly skewed one way.  Theres citrus here too, but its restrained and complementary. 
If you can get you hands on this, try it.

I first had this in Atlantic City after a No Doubt concert in early May with Adrian910ss but it was before my discovery of ratebeer. Pours a copper colour with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and hops. Flavour is the same as the aroma. One of the better IPAs.

Bottle at Akkurat. Finally I had this. It has been on my want list for years and I was not disappointed at all. Clear golden body with a longlasting off white head. Very fruity aroma with peachy and pineapple notes. A solid malt base delivers a fine caramel background. The flavour is quite complex delivering loads of exotic fruit notes such as peach, mango, pineapple, citrus and pine. It has a creamy texture and is very drinkable and you just enjoy every zip hoping its not the last. Fantastic IPA.

One of the smoothest IPAs that Ive ever had.  Although I thought this was a APA.  No kick from the hops.   I guess Ive almost come to expect a bit of a bite from the hops.  This beer has been around a while so have IPAs been getting more hoppy?  Would be interesting to know how they got such a smooth hop taste.  This beer is mostly about the hops, although the malt support is there to make this a very balanced beer
An outstanding beer! One of my favorites of all time. Lots of citrusy hops and some spice. Cant say enough good things about this one!

Dans Bachelor Party Extended Weekend Rating #40 of 90. On tap at the Eccentric Cafe in Kalamazoo. Pours clear orange with a very nice citrus hop nose. Taste is moderately dry with a good citrus body and finish. I like this.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2010 spicy hoppy aroma. Nice golden colour with lots of lacing. Spicy hoppy flavour at first with a nice nutty, crisp finish. a really nice beer.

Color: Orangish gold
Aroma: Fresh-cut grass, floral and resinous hop
Flavor: Some ripe orange, orange rind and fruity malt wrapped ina floral grassy hop bitterness.
Comments: Great mouthfeel.  More carbonation than British styles keep this lively on the tongue. Unexpectedly, the bitterness appeared more on the middle of the tongue rather than on the back. I wonder why?  An outstanding ale.
One of my favorite beers.  On tap @ Caliente.   Smooth with big floral/citrus hops.  Bet you cant drink just one!

This is a super beer.  Maybe my standard for an easy drinking clean IPA. Appearance amber and cloudy. Head chewy white.  Aroma all flowery hops and citrus.  Balanced, leaning toward bitter with no obvious sweetness.
I really enjoyed this beer, it had a unique flowery/ sweet taste to it that i have never had in an IPA. It was smoother than most and highly enjoyable, good spin on the IPA

Bottle an extra in trade with changeup45. Thanks Garry!

Aroma: Beautiful. Excellent combination of floral and citrus hops with some malt notes.

Appearance: Golden/orange color, perfectly clear with 1-2 fingers of white head.

Flavor: Malt body and sweetness, orange hops, and a nice bitterness to balance. Enjoyable.

Palate: Medium to lively carbonation works well with this one. Clean finish leaves me wanting more.

Overall: Really nice IPA. Well-balanced with simple yet very enjoyable flavors.

Hazy orange color. Strong floral hops and big citrus aroma, a lot of orange in this one. Taste of caramel malt and finishing with with the spicy bitterness of the hops, the orange flavors make it an interesting and enjoyable IPA. I had a lot of IPAs rated above this one, but this is my favorite

I would consider this an APA, given the floral/citrusy hops.  Spot on for the style - dark straw color, thin white head, fruity/floral/resinous hop aroma and flavor, bitterness lingers.  Some malt flavor.  If I start with this beer, I dont get how good it is.  If this is my second beer style of the night, wow, it really stands out.
12oz bottle. dark gold color, fluffy white head. big pine aroma. wonderful balance of hops and malt taste. delicious! great hops but not overpowering.
It doesnt get much better than this. By far the best IPA Ive ever had and IPA is my fav style. A great floral hop aroma and bitterness balance.
Great aroma.  HIgh ABV, which is nice.  Plus, the sticker talks about Hemingwayesque trips to the U.P.  Cant beat it.

The pour was a nice hazy orange, much like that of the sun of a late afternoon. There was about two fingers of head on this one, with some nice and somewhat long lasting lacing on the glass. The initial flavor is hoppy, and definitely on the floral side. The citrus is quite prevalent but not quite strong enough to overpower the more floral tastes.There is also a fair amount of a sweet malty backbone. All of these come together to produce a superb and extremely well balanced ipa.

Hazy orange pour, full white head with moderate retention and some spotty lacing. Huge floral hop aroma with plenty of citrus and hints of grapes and grass clippings. Lots of spicy and citrusy hop flavors with a bit of malt sweetness and a long, peppery finish. Very pleasant, easygoing, sessionable mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Really, really good stuff.
12oz bottle: appearance is medium brown with small white head, aroma filled with citrus style hops, flavor is again filled iwth citrus hops and also has a good malty backbone. Pretty good IPA.

Bells batch # 9233. I first tried this last year when actually in the U.P., and thought perhaps that my strongly positive first impression was tinged by relief at finding this solitary variety of Bells beer in the cooler floating in a sea of macros. While stocking up last week for my next trip north I purchased the above batch number and had to try some for quality control purposes. ... It is better even than I remembered. The color is nice, the aroma promising. Poured into a Bells pint glass there is about 2 1/2 inches of foam that subsides in about 2 minutes. An initial explosion of floral hops, but not at all out of balance the way some "extreme" hopped beers can taste. It finishes well, with some almost psychotropic tingling aftereffects on the tongue, and I had to immediately reproduce the experiment, just to make sure...

Hazy after the pour, this IPA smells fantastic.  Nose candy for a hop head.  The mouth feel is creamy and the finish smooth with a slight hop bitterness.  Very well balanced, it can stand up in flavor to some double IPAs and is as refreshing as an american pale ale.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2010 Have had from the bottle and on tap.  A great balance shows as it warms... oh boy this is a wonderful IPA that everyone should look for when it comes around.  Love this stuff - my favorite IPA.  GET IT!

This beer wowed me.Not what I expected.After my first drink I thought of that region of Michigan because,The first thing you smell as you roll into north Michigan is the pine forests.Ive always looked forward to and lingered on the first real Smell of the pine forest on every Vacation My family and I take there.This beer does kind of grow on you as you drink it.bitter and citrusy.Give it a try I believe you will grow to like it.

Pours a nice, slightly hazy golden amber with a fairly thick off-white head. Aroma is fairly strong and quite hoppy, promising a good IPA. Flavor is strongly hoppy but only slightly bitter and has just a whisper of sweetness. Texture is smooth and fizzy, quite lively on the tongue.

Amazing brew.  Although Oberon is king amongst alot of my friends, this is the best Bells brew Ive had.    Can drink these again and again and still feels new and exciting.

Perfectly hoppy befitting its IPA style.   Love the packaging.

Pours about half-finger head, great lacing and mouthfeel.   Floral accents and a great bite to it.   One of my favorites.

This has been and will remain one of the best IPA I have ever had. The balance between floral hops and bitters is just point on. One of the better examples of what can happen when hops are done right. The flavor of the beer leave you with little to no alch feel. If you are new to IPAs and want to start at the top this is one of them

This stuff runs out of the taps in my neck of the woods at the local downtown pubs like water. Though im not a huge fan of this ipa it is a good go to when your trying to figure out what to drink next. Has a bitter hop bite that im not fond of but does leave a semi pleasant aftertaste. Put it on your to try list!

The first time I had this I was unexcited. Perhaps it was the unappealing packaging. On tap, I had an epiphany. This is a great beer! Intensely hoppy but not overpowering by any means. Floral hops are there for flavor, not for hops sake. Full, yet refreshing. Very complex, yet balanced for its style. Absolutely a "go to" beer. An IPA by which to judge others.

12 oz. bottle on 8/10/09. Pours hazy golden orange decent head.  Beautiful lavender floral hops with a hint of lemon.  Very refreshing lemon honey sweetness on the tongu.  Then, and slow very mild bitter finish.  Leaves a great sweet floral honey aftertaste on the tongue.  Nice amount of activity on the tongue and a smooth medium body. Absolutely amazing for the ABV and so incredibly refreshing.

Appearance: Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white frothy head. Lots of carbonation streaming from the bottom.

Smell: Citrus with a wonderful floral and pine hop smell. Not overpowering but just right.

Taste: Malty and sweet at the beginning and then the hop flavors take over. The citrus taste is pleasant and not overpowering and the floral and pine hops blend well together. There is a semi-bitter hop finish at the end which leaves a smooth aftertaste.

Mouthfeel/drinkability: Actually has a light but sticky mouth feel. Carbonation is just right. The hop finish and aftertaste is really good.

Tap @ Dexters Pub - Had this one a million times, but finally getting around to rating it. Pour clear amber with a big white head. Smells great, with crisp, citrusy hops and some biscuity malt. It just smells really fresh and clean. Tastes sweet and hoppy, starting with the citrus hops up front, then transitioning to the dry, bitter hops on the finish. No matter how many times I come back to this one, I find it never disappoints.

Apperance: Golden copper with a big, white, head.

Aroma: Citric notes, Hops, Caramel, Pine.

Flavor: Toffee, Caramel, Pine, Citric Notes, Hops.

Palate: Very balanced IPA with nice initial sweetness and some refreshing bitterness at the end making this an easy drink. 

Damn good IPA. Period.
Bottle. I drank this at a crappy fish shack in Mackinaw, MI. SENSATIONAL IPA! Lemon-citrus odor explodes and wakes up the olfactory. Thick, syrupy body. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

Like drinking something made from Pine Sol, or maybe a pine tree air freshener. Nice color though.
Can this be right? Number 2 IPA on the charts? Are you all insane? What do you think an IPA is? It should make you cringe, not something to refresh your sensitive palates. I can name at least a dozen better and cheaper IPA brewers.
Your all sheep.

Well here it goes. Poured into my pint glass the beer is a nice shade of gold/orange. The head is enormus. Bits of sticky lace remain after it settles down. The cap stays put on top of my glass holding in all the flavor. The smell is awesome. So piney. It has a strong grapefruit/ citrus smell as well. Theres also a lovely floral boquet that wafts up to my nose. The first sip is a punch inthe mouth. It tastes like the most floral christmas tree Ive ever smelled. In a good way. So tart and bitter it makes me pucker. I love it. The feel seems very sticky and dry. It just sort of sets up shop in my mouth and stays there. I am really starting to appreciate hops. This beer does nothing but feed the fire that has been started. Bring on the big boys.

This is a world class beer and I thank Hopscotch profusily for the bottle!  Pours a straw / orange thick brew with a robust cream head.  Very aromatic:  florals, pine a fresh citrus.   Tart, balanced, creamy, drinkable with a huge hop aftertaste!  Even get a taste of a little honey up front!  A classic!
Have had it bottled and draft, easily one of the best IPAs I have ever had. Bitter with a slightly sweet ending. Delicious. A 7.0% abv and so delicious = perfection.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2009 Pours with a nice orangish/brown color, foamy white head.  Aroma is incredible, sweet citrus smell, lemon zest almost.  Taste isnt so sweet, bitter and hoppy and very good.  Smooth finish, the lemon tinge seems to linger on the tongue.  Excellent beer.
Incredible beverage. Very tasty, and quite delicious. Amazing for the abv% considering..i wish we could get this beer in Canada. So refreshing. Where can I sign up for american citzenship?
Draft. Pours clear copper with a foamy one finger head. Aroma is straight hops, grapefruit and grass. Flavor is huge hops, smooth and not too bitter, but hops with almost no mention of malt.

12 oz bottle.  Unfiltered/hazy appearance.

2 finger white head.  Light, refreshing mouthfeel.  Strong citrus and pine hop flavor with a long, dry finish.

Have had from tap and bottle.  This review is after pouring from a bottle into a pint glass.  I really enjoy this beer!  Tough to decide whether I enjoy this or Dark Horses Crooked Tree more.  Its neck and neck.  Aroma is wonderful, very fruity and hoppy.  Appearance is dark yellow/copper, and not quite as cloudy as you might expect; my fingers are clearly visible on the other side of the glass.  Only other complaint is that its a little bit more carbonated than Id like.  But Im picking nits.  It is full of flavor and quite refreshing.  I find myself coming back to this beer again and again!

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2009 Location: Not my first tasting, but the rating comes from a 12 oz bottle from Norms, 7/25/09


Aroma: Hoppy fruits, citrus (orange, grapefruit), bit flowery

Appearance: Hazy golden-orange, about 2 inches of foamy white head, decent amount lacing

Flavor: Well mixed sweet citrus and malts, hoppy, balanced

Palate: Medium body, oily, and long duration

Overall Impression: 
Nice, tasty, and good IPA.  I really like this one a lot.  Every time I drink this beer, I like it a little more.  Its a wonderful beer, one of the top IPAs that I have tried.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2011 Firkin at Ashleys. Poured a cloudy amber gold with an off-white head. Aroma was full of hops bring out a pleasant pine note, while there is an undertone of fruit, a bit of apple perhaps. The flavor was deliciously balance with pine notes as well the slightest sweetness under the bitterness.
Great amount of hops. I really like this beer. One of my favorite IPAs. I cannot wait to have some more.
I love this beer...This is the beer that started my obsession with hops...Still tastes as good today as it did all those years ago...............................................

Pours a cloudy orange colour under a huge foamy white head; fairly fruity hoppy nose (mango and apricots) with notes of fresh cream; quite soft mouthfeel and full-bodied; a robust but never aggressive bitterness takes control of the taste; moderately dry bitter and long fruity finish - balanced and robust; very well-made. Savory taste.

very hard to go wrong here; LOTS of flavor, great smell; only issue is that Bells (or their distributors) knows what they have, so you WILL pay to buy this beer; however saying that, i regularly buy the case of this because Id rather buy good expensive beer than cheaper stuff that, while Im drinking it, wish I would have bought Two Hearted.

Pours a hazy light copper with nice big off white head aromas are of hops,hops ,pine and citrus notes with the taste being brutal off hops, grapefruits, and pine very astringent, with a long dry bitter lasting forever on your tounge
From the bottle. Further evidence why I do not possess much appreciation for hoppy IPAs. This is one strong IPA with a powerful floral odor and sharp finish.
