just had a glass of st bernadus 12 followed by the two hearted....does bells make some freakin sweet beer..this ipa is great i cant wait to have the hopslam.
Pours a cloudy orange.  full head off white head.  Has a bit of a floral taste, but not too strong.  Great beer with dinner (burger or steak) :-)
Powerful, aromatic hop nose.  Decent head, not much lacing.  Great piney, hoppy taste with some clear notes of grapefruit.  Hop are amazingreally fantastic IPA.  Tastes like an angels tears.

I expected a somewhat overpowering IPA from this one,but it was rather relaxing and enjoyable. Earthy with some hints of fruit, very faint though. Sits very nice in the mouth and goes down very smooth. A very great IPA. Would definitly try again.

courtesy of Chris Beers - pours a cloudy orange colour under a huge foamy white head; fairly fruity hoppy nose (mango and apricots) with notes of fresh cream; quite soft mouthfeel and full-bodied; a robust but never aggressive bitterness takes control of the taste; moderately dry bitter and long fruity finish - balanced and robust; very well-made

Batch #8409, Bottled April 1, 2008. Poured a haxy amber orange with a tall creamy off-white head. There was a good sweet malt aroma. There was a light caramel scent and some citrus in the aroma too. There was a mellow sweetness initially then some citrus and a bite from the hops and good flavor on the finish. This bottle was over a year old and the hops had probably mellowed out somewhat, so Ill have to get a fresher bottle and rerate. It was still rather good
On tap at Chatham Tap, Indianapolis.  Beautiful copper coloured beer with a floral hop nose.  Wonderful hop flavour and bitterness.  Why oh why cant we have this in Canada?

bottle, pours a light copper with a medium white head.  Strong aroma of grapefruit and hops.  Light candied malt body that remains lightly sweet until a hop bitterness shows up and builds into a nice dry and bitter finish.  Very refreshing and easy to drink.

Cascade hits nose quick, complex texture allows hops to break in to every bit of rich but light malt palate.  the bitterness holds long, head is well laced and fizz distributed widely on the palate. As it warms in the glass, more fruitty details come forth.  Purity of malt, base bitter and finish taste makes this a fine example; exceptional and obtainable.

batch 9097, bottle courtesy of coyotehunter. nice deep gold pour with a mild haze to it. nice retention on a creamy spongy head. moderate hop notes in the smell with some sweet maltyness to balance it out. notes of lavender and caramel start at the end of the smell and wind up with a nice reappearance through the mid and back of the mouth. nice heavy hop front that is lightly smoothed and complimented by the sweetness so as to never be offensive. very pleasant harmony of bitterness and sweet oily goodness in the aftertaste. im sold.

Batch 8986.  Strong perfumed aroma, some strawberry and wildflower pollen.  Light hazy gold, white sticky head.  Lovely blend of hops dance over the soft buscuity malt.  Only hops remain in the finish, clean and beautiful.

Copper pour with small off white head. Aroma is very floral, grassy, and loaded with sweet caramel malt. Hop character is multi-faceted and powerful. Flavor is perfume, herbaceous, and floral with some sweeter balancing malt flavors up front. Palate is smooth and quite rich for the style, finishing with a slight dryness. No diacetyl. Incredible brew for sure.
hazy golden pour, slight offwhite head.  Citrus hops are Huge, Floral hops as well, flavor is perfumey, floral , very subtle.  very drinkable, crisp finish.  great ipa

Pours a cloudy dark gold with small white head. Aroma is robust, with lots of citrus (orange, grapefruit) and floral notes- really nice. Flavor is extremely floral to me, not nearly as resinous or citrusy as the aroma. Even ideas of perfume persist. Absurdly drinkable, alcohol is masked quite well. Not what I was expecting, not a powerful IPA, but extremely well crafted and very tasty.
gracias aleman y ramenenen su b-day party.  creo que esta fuela que mas me gusto, por ser hoppy y mas maltosa que las ipa normales

Bottle.  Robust golden yellow, big, tight head leaving behind significant lacing. Decent carbonation. Aroma of floral hops, grapefruit, citrus. Nice flavor - grapefruit, citrus, lots of hops. decent malt backbone keeps the bitterness at a moderate & manageable level. Overall very well-balanced IPA.

Copper colored translucent hue with a thick frothy beige head and very active carbonation. A good looking beer in the glass. A deep malty aroma with the essence of corn giving way to a citrus like orange and cranberry smell. The beer has a hearty all around ale flavor. A medium grassy hops sits ahead of a buttery malt on the drinkers tongue. Palate is a medium level just right for a full bodied ale. This is a choice American Red Ale.

Pours an orange color with a thin, off-white head. Aroma is of hops, citrus, and fruits. Flavor is floral hops, sweet malts and fruits, citrus, pine, and some earthy and grassy notes. Very good IPA. What seems to set this one apart is the sweetness which it boasts.

Nicely done, Bells! Orange color with an off-white head. Great hops on the nose along with some caramel. Good hoppy hit the whole way through, but it reminds me a bit of an amber because of the sweeter malt finish. Overall well rounded and a delightful drinker.

My favorite IPA, bar none, be it from the bottle, or on tap; orange w/ a generous off-white mousse that leaves some rich lacing; aroma heavy in aroma hops w/ pine needles, grapefruit and sweet on the whole; flavor is hoppy as hell (more so than the Hopslam even, in my view) and adds orange blossom and caramel to the mix; medium-full bodied and slightly sticky, which I peg to the richness; beautiful beer and one of my all-time faves.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2011 Golden orange color with a white sticky lace. Tantalizing grapefruit and orange aroma. Quite perfumey. Lots of fresh Centennial hops. Love the smell. The flavor is also very hops forward, citrus, resinous, much more Centennial and Cascade. Grapefruit bitterness throughout lends to a sweet malt backing. Strong fruit aspects like orange/apricot/ or even pear. Moderatly bitter in finish. Very sessionable although 7%. One of my favorite American IPAs.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2009 Cloudy orange pour with a frothy white head. Aroma is sweet pine, citrus, and maple. A superb balance of intense hop and sweet malt but leaning towards the sweet side until a resinous finish. Cant find one thing wrong with this beer and I love the label.

Bottle: Thanks to Ramenen, the highlight of the Father´s Day dinner sample series! The only thing I can critique is the label, you wouldn´t know you´re drinking a 100% IPA by looking at it! Full, potent, well balanced overall great.

Drank it last nite for fathers day.  My first Bells and I was truly impressed.  First of all, the aroma is just so full of layers, wow.  The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, multiple layer of citrus, well balanced with the sweetness of the malts, and a quick dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2010 Bottle. Amazing beer and my top IPA thus far. Pours an amber colour with decent white head. Great citrus and spicy hops. Is very well balanced beer with a nice long bitter finish that is quite enjoyable.

This is one of my favorite beers ever.  In fact, I think Ive yet to find an IPA I like more than this one.  Have had it many times on tap at Stray Dog in New Buffalo, MI as well as in the bottle.

I want to put on my bathing suit, drive to Comstock, and go swimming in this beer.
Wow I drove from NY to Virginia to get this one. Well worth the drive. I love this one it is one the best IPAs I have ever tried. The hops are explosive well worth the ride and wait.
My favorite IPA to date. Great composition, with floral notes and bitter flavor. Best of all, its floral characteristics are present to the last drop (unlike many other IPAs Ive tried). Awesome!!

Pours a beautiful golden color with a nice white head. Almost looks like a pilsner; fairly light color compared to alot of American IPAs. Citrusy hops on the nose with a bit of spice. Taste of piny hops with a nice honey malt balance. Fantstic biter finish that makes you want more. An excellent IPA from an excellent brewery.
Great IPA, pours a nice golden amber, perfect amount of head, strong hops flavor.  Smells of Orange and Pine, great in the bottle or on draft
Great IPA. Possibly my favorite. It has a great golden amber color with a nice white head. Very tasty hops as well.
Medium amber color with scant white head.  Aroma of orange and coriander.  Medium full palate with strong bitter finish.  Decent enough.

I had this beer with BeerBaron617 today.  Its not the first time I have had it, but really the first time I really enjoyed it.  I only recently have gotten into craft beer, let alone beers in general, and the first time I had this beer it was just a bit too strong, too much flavor going on, and I wasnt a fan.  After having had some decent beer I have developed the taste for not only for beers in general, but for IPAs which sometimes seem a bit strong to my palate.  It poured a bit of a yellow/amber color with a white head that seems to be lasting for a while.  It tastes really orangy and hoppy, but its very balanced.  Pretty sweet and quite tasty!  I really really like this beer!

Big thanks to MrChopin for including this one in a recent box. Pours a transparent light orange with a thick head. Sweet citrus hops and some herbal notes in the aroma, with a big honey malt counter. Almost a bit of bubble-gum sweetness. Vibrant carbonation and a mild flavor. Refreshing... not fantastic at first, but it has a wonderful aftertaste that brings you right back into it.
On tap at Sheffields.  Pours golden amber with a nice white head.  Aroma is funky grapefruit hops.  Citrus hops and caramel malt in the taste.  Nice and smooth with a lasting citrus hop finish.

Oh, thats amazing. Like the maharaja, this has way more going for it than just hops. I taste honey, rosewater, cookies, nutmeg. Its like a winter spice beer mixed with an IPA. I now can say that Im a fan of the style. Gorgeous head with the darkest body Ive seen on an IPA. BUY THIS!. Bottle at quick stop in South Miami.

12 oz bottle, many times.  I honestly think this is the most overrated beer Ive ever tried, along with Rogues Shakespeare Stout.  I go back and retry it every couple months to see if theres something Im missing, but always with the same results.  Its not bad, but I just dont think theres much going on here to bring it above the average IPA.  The aroma is striking, but the flavor just lacks something big.  Again, not bad, just kind of boring.

Aroma: citrus. orange. slightly hoppy.  slightly sweet.  Appearence: deep golden.  slight carbonation.  white, thin head.  Flavor: bright, hoppy, orange or tangerine.  nice balance of hops and hops.  Palate: a bit more bitey then I prefer and more of an edge than the IPAs I typically drink (Centennial, Double Trouble, Crooked Tree, even Dogfish head 90-minute).  Overall impression: Very good, quality IPA - not amazing, but a solid, safe bet.

Bottle from a couple 6s courtesy of theisti. beautiful in the glass, smells like oranges and honey. Tastes citrusy with a little grapefruit and a close to perfect amount of bitterness. High drinkability. Would be in a solidrotation if we could get it in CO. Thanks, Tim!
Thanks to Rciesla for sharing this bottle(while ago),  cant really recall to much besides was nicely flavor and had a good aroma.

May 25. Bottle. pours a hazy gold and orange color. Nice head and plenty of lacing. Great hop aroma and taste. really good IPA. One of the best I have had. Not much of a hop head. But this is exceptional. Enjoy!!!!
12 oz bottle. Very strong aroma of hops and malts. Flavor is also very strong of hops. Hints of citrus, with a small bitter aftertaste.

Consumed May 23, 2009.  From bottle to tulip.  Pours a hazy dark golden/orange with moderate white head.  Lacing lingers throughout.  Classic IPA aroma of citrus/pine/grass hops and hints of caramel malt.  Very well-balanced beer with good bitter finish that does not linger.  Excellent beer IMO and up at the top of American IPAs for me - Cheers to Bells!

Ive had this beer a few times before and really enjoy it but never on tap before going to The Brew Kettle. Lace but little head with a transparent light honey colored body with a steady stream of light carbonation.  Aroma is like lemongrass/rosemary/pine.  Little bubbly on the lips, very crisp but not overpowering mouthfeel.  Taste is same as aroma with the refreshing pine quality.  A great beer from Bells.

Bottle at Akkurat.
Pours golden orange, some yeast floats in the beer, the head is big and yellowish.
Smells of flowers, citrus, pineapples and candy. 
Fruity taste of pinapple and citrus some bitterness in the aftertaste.
Refreshing and well balanced!

Bottle. Ap: Yellow. Lots of yeast. Ar: Candy hops with a distinct darker touch in the background. Pineapple. Fla: Very fruity. Tropical fruits. Pineapple. Extremely fresh hops with a perfect little bitterness in the finish. Ov: One of the best IPA:s ever. No doubt.

Sweet aroma with beautiful hop notes . Hints of grassyness and summer.  Pours a brilliant  golden hue with a well developed lasting head. Belgian lace with bearded structures form as I drink this ale. Sweet forward flavors with a lingering bitter, but not walloped, finish.  Very clean palate. Pine forests?  Clean flavors.  Excellent IPA.  Top of class.  Excellent accompaniment to foods that need some cleansing bitter notes, yet perfect to sip on the porch after a long day at work.

Sample @ Bock&Rock.Very citrusy aroma with hints of flowers.Color was a hazy orange color with a decent white head.Flavor was citrus and and hops with hints of malt.Easy to drink,certainly a summer brew.Good brew.
12oz bottle from shawnm213, thanks man. Gold/yellow, hazy pour with a white head. Grassy, piney aroma. Nice little hop bite, very smooth with a touch of sweetness in the finish, pretty good.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle. Pours an amber, orange color with a little head. Smell is pines and hops. Taste is well balanced with the hop flavors coming though...it is what it is...
This is the perfect IPA; the bitterness is perfectly balanced with a creamy malt, and the 7% ABV is just right for an IPA.

One of my favorite IPAs, this brew has it all for this style. Great looks, a pleasantly hoppy aroma, and a balanced body that shows how good an IPA can be when given a healthy dose of hops and strong backbone of malts to display them on. LC

Batch 8998.
Appearance  Poured into my Sam Adams glass, a bright yellow with a cloudy orange center. A 1 and a half finger fluffy white head with amazingly beautiful lacing and retention. This beer is beautiful, absolutely beautiful. The bubbles flow endlessly from the laser-etching at the bottom; that never gets old!

Smell  This smells like summer. Sweet citrusy notes dominate the nose: tangerines, lemons, mangos, and grapefruits! Has a nice hint of floral hops as well.

Taste  The hop zing from this IPA is absolutely perfect. It hits my tongue the way it wants to be hit, not too hard, but it sure lets you know it is there. The grapefruit and tangerines come through beautifully after the hops do their job. I love this beer.

Mouthfeel  Nice and light, but not too light. It sticks around for a second to let you get the full spectrum of taste that this has to offer, then goes away with a cooling feeling that is refreshing to say the least.

Drinkability  I could drink this all morning, all day, all evening, and all night. Now if only I had a case There is absolutely nothing wrong with this beer, it is amazing, and deserves all the praise in the world. Cheers to Bells for creating the perfect IPA!
Sample at the EBF Boston. Pours amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus and floral hops.  Overall a nice IPA . Glad I tasted it before the hop slam
Not a bad IPA at all. A little harsh at first, but once youve got one in you the next go down easy. If you enjoy this try Stone IPA or Founders Centennial IPA. Both are much better than 2<3
Pours a slightly hazy amber with one finger of white head. Nice lacing.   Aroma is mostly floral hops and some citrus. Flavor is the same the smell.  Glad there was not a hop bite at the end.
UPDATED: JUL 23, 2009 (bottle) medium amber colour, large but quickly disappearing head, strong longan nose, flavour is hops with medium long dry, bitter finish
Beer pours a slightly cloudy golden/orange color with a medium white head. Aromas are hops, pine, and more hops! Flavor is delicious.
Pours a cloudy golden-orange color.  Medium head.  Aroma is lemon pineapple with slight alcohol.  Taste is definitely citrus with malt finishing.   Good aftertaste.  A nice dry hoppy IPA.  Good.

Pours clear yellow with a small quickly diminishing off-white head.  Nose is faint floral hops.  Flavor is initial citrus hops segueing into a middle cookie maltiness and then switching back to a strong pine/floral hops backbone.  Crisp palate, long lingering hops aftertaste.  Good.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2009 Smells of lilac, lime peel, orange peel.  Taste is on tilt toward heavy citrus, the most citrus that Ive ever tasted in a regular IPA.  The flavor overall is very smooth and without having to cope with an over the top bitter hop presence, this sucker is drinkable sumptin fierce.  Palate is a crafty mix of medium bodied heft and careful light caronation, definately fills your mouth.  I think what seperates this is the pronounced softness of the finish as compared to other IPAs, really supple and buttery especially at higher temps.  I wouldnt walk through glass for this but it is a great addition to the style and Im glad to have it.  The date on the case said March 10 2009 for bottling,  I wonder how this would be super fresh, maybe even better.  Thanks Bells.  2009 12oz.
Pours a deep orange. So much citrus aromatics and pine. Flavor is malty and hopped up. Excellent balance. I can drink this beer forever. A staple in my fridge.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2011 overall a decent ipa.  flowery hoppiness with citrus on the nose and a decent dose of hops in the flavour.  Some grapefruit seems to come through in the flavour also. PAlate is decent.  IOverall a good ipa amoungst my top 5 in the class
This is a great IPA. Very drinkable with a nice combo of citrus and bitter hops. I could drink a ton of these. Great Flavor and Aroma. One of my favorite IPAs so far
Fantastic beer.  A wonderfully crafted, gold-orange pour with dense, white head and some lacing.  Finishes dry, with the help of a grapefruit citrus hop profile.

Without a doubt my favorite IPA.  A cloudy orange pour with a robust white head.  Nose of grapefruit, hops.  Taste a complex balance of hops & malt (with hops coming out on top).  Never get tired of this one (which can be dangerous).  Unfortunately, not available in NJ, but always worth the drive to PA.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2009 Bottle.  This has been a favorite for quite some time now, but Ive finally gotten around to rating it.  Pour is a hazy, golden/orange with a fairly large white head that recedes with a huge amount of lacing.  Aroma is strongly floral, pine and citrus with tiny bit of malt character.  Flavor is juicy citrus, grapefruit, and finishes with a smooth hoppiness.  All around delicious and refreshing.  This beer fresh is hard to beat.  I had it on draft at my wedding and it was a big hit, even with non-craft beer drinkers.  Now that I can buy this anytime I want, Im in heaven.
first way better then hopslam. poured nice golden color smelled of citrus, peaches and hops. tastes of citrus peach and hops. nice clean aftertaste. fantastic beer

Bottle purchased at Olive or Twist.  Strong aroma of hops and a citrus honey mix.  Bright, clear orange-gold color with a great, lacy white head.

This beer has a strong kick of hops up front and in the finish and a good amount of bitterness, as expected.  Excellent IPA!
Bottle @ Oslo, Detroit. Orange colour, small white head. Aroma has pine hops and orange. Aroma is sharp. Flavour has pine hops, grapefruit, some sweet malts. Dry and bitter finish. Balanced

A big thanks to Kegatron for this in trade as an extra!

A - golden slightly hazed. the head dissipated quickly.

S-Orange peel, tangerines, fruit, maybe some honey

T- hoppy, floral, citrusy, slight malty

MF - the mouthfeel on this is great. nice even balance of hops and malt. I can see why this is a highly rated beer.

D- I could easily make this my session beer. Makes me want to drive back a keg of this goodness.

Another fine example of beer from bells

Serving type: bottle

Pours slightly hazy off-gold color with contrasting white head that retains fairly well.

Nose is predominately grapefruit, maybe with some apricot. Very FOCUSED and clean.

Palate is pleasantly sharp with the hops up front, just like a real grapefruit is in sharpness. This is a very assertive beer. The malt is doughy-bready, with a good amount of salt & consequent mouth puckering sensation. Finish leans more towards the dry side of things, with the dry grapefruit bitterness having the final say.

Some may say this beer is one dimensional and lacks complexity, but like fine single malts the nice focus & concentration of this beer on the Centennial hops is a pure delight.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine.  Batch 9017 (bottled March 10, 2009).  Pours golden orange with a thick (at least) one inch white head.  Bright piney hop aroma.  Aroma does not fade quickly.  Flavor is just what you would expect; piney hops, citrus balance, light sweetness.  Probably the most balanced IPA I have found.  What a fantastic beer.
Pours golden orange with a nice white head piney and citrusy like hops that finishes with a piney dry taste very good ipa

Pours golden amber/orange with a nice off white head.  Aroma is big citrusy grapefruit like hop with some nice floral notes as well.  Flavor is big with lots of citrusy hop coming through as well as a little bit of malt sweetness to balance it out as well as a big bitter finish.  Great.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2011 bottle 12 oz. Almost clear golden color with ample white head. Nice fresh malt and hop aromas with traces of bubble gum. This beer tasted keg fresh. Only moderately into medium bodied but the freshness, quality, and flavors were excellent. Noticeable malt sweetness but well balanced with the hops.  I was surprised how good it was and that it was a 7%er.

what could this be stumac? ... what an insanely good smell .. . fruits and floral runners .. . full bitterness, a fuckin tasty burger .. . sugar coated hop nuggets! .. an amazing brew to have in my presence ..

Pours a clear, pale golden with a hefty, effervescent head. Has a big, bright, and fragrant hop aroma of pine and especially citrus. Smells a bit sweet as well. A very pleasant smelling IPA, unlike some which seem determined to overwhelm. Flavor is, of course, bitter and hoppy. Something like mint comes through. The fragrant, flowery aroma does not abate upon tasting. Its unique and extraordinary but, unfortunately, not for me. Mouthfeel is a bit thick and sticky. Good, worthy of its reputation, but Id go a different direction with my own IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2009 Poured from bottle into glass.  Small white head with pine or floral aroma.  First impression was dry, with a pine taste.  There was citrus taste but not as much hops as expected. Overall good IPA.

Bottle thanks to tjthresh.  Nicely balanced IPA, but not as fresh and hoppy as Im used to.  Caramel malt, biscuits, citrus, floral hops, toffee, and moderately bitter.  Nice and easy to drink, well done IPA.

Pours a soft amber into the glass with a healthy white head.  Aroma is very floral with a touch of citrus.  Very clean malt flavor to this beer and none of the up front big hops that I usually expect from IPAs.  This beer gives you all the hops you need on the back end of the beer.  Very smooth and hard to believe that it carries a 7% abv.

Draft. Pour is a wonderful amber with a small white head.  Aroma is full of great classic ipa scents...Pine needles, grapefruit, fall leaves and mild sweetness.  Flavor is grapefruit, citrus, and a mildy bitter finish.  Classic and delicious.  Not the biggest or most outlandish of the style, just a good ipa. If you can get it, try it at least once.

Bottle as shown. Pours a cloudy orange golden with a medium frothy white head. The aroma is a strong hop with floral notes and pine. Good sticky lacing on the glass. The taste is a smooth grapefruit with a sweet hop and pine with a nice bitter finish. Easy to drink great flavor, not overpowering in hops all around a very well done IPA from Bells.

Pours a golden color with a thick white, foamy head and lots of carbonation. Aroma is very strong of citrus hop bitterness, slight pine bitterness in the background and some hidden sweet malt aromas as well.. Flavor starts off with a strong smack of grapefruit which lasts through the whole tasting. A slight piny flavor kicks in about mid way through and melds with a solid two row malt sweetness ending with a nice dryness and taste bud puckering feeling.  Carbonation is perfect for delivering the flavors, great lacing on the glass and the density is much heavier than it looks all the while not emphasizing the alcohol content at all.  Overall, I wasnt expecting something this good. This is a very solid IPA and one I could drink a whole six pack of in one night, its just that good.

The best IPA I have ever had.  Of course, I am biased being from Michigan and growing up on this one.  Still, the citrus and the smoothness make me completely happy.  Even the damn fish on the bottle brings me joy.
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 draft.  cloudy golden orange pour.  Floral aroma, citrusy hops.  nice sweet malty backgroup.  I love drinking this beer

Bottled(355ml). -Courtesy of heavy ( thanks!), shared with Doggythedog.
Murky orange coloured, medium sized white head, strong floral fruity nose (a bit unpleasant). Aromatic hoppy and fruity taste with notes of orange peel and touch of grapefruit in the finish.

Pours slightly hazy amber with a 3 finger chunky off white heat that has great retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is huge on fresh citrus and pine hops, there are some floral notes in there but citrus dominates. Theres also melon, strawberry taffey, light caramel, toast, straw, a tiny bit of sour malt. Flavor is really hard to beat. Starts off with light caramel, berries and grapefruit. Then hints of apple, mandarin orange, citrus and pine hops, fresh honeydew melon and starfruit. Finish is bitter grapefruit, burnt sugar, melon and hints of pine. Palate is perfect for the style starts out slightly creamy medium to light thickness and lively but not overbearing carbonation, juicy and refreshing in the middle and slightly drying but still a little sweetness for the finish. Overall I have to say this is one of the best IPAs I have had I just wish it were more readily available in my area since I hadnt seen it for 3 years or so before today.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2010 Pours a slightly hazy orange with a solid white head. Awesome lacing. The aroma is mostly citrusy and floral hops, with an unusual honey malt backbone. Sweet malty start with a nice hop bite at the end. The flavor of the malt is similar to Hopslam. Perfectly balanced. Medium bodied and lightly carbonated. Great beer
A great IPA.  Bells has great beer across the board.  Nice hop aroma, great hop palate.

Golden body with a thick beige head that leaves nice lacing.  Wonderful aroma of sweet grapefruit and pine.  Crisp palate with medium-high carbonation.  The flavor, much like the aroma, is remarkably sweet for an IPA.  Sugared grapefruit and sweet malt fade to a bright pine hops finish.  A nice lingering hoppy aftertaste.  A fine IPA.
Not bad for an IPA.  Yellow pour with thinner white head.  Slightly bitter hoppiness on the finish.

It pours a hazy golden color. A frothy white head.  The aroma of the hops is evident from the beginning, I can smell a little pine in it as well. It has a nice sweet hoppy taste with a tart-bitter finish. It is a very flavorable IPA.

Bottle courtesy of heavy (huge thanks!), shared with ogivlado.  Poured a completely murky orange body witha a slightly off white thick head that went away slowly. Lovely fruity hoppy nose, gummi bears, some clemon. The taste is dominated by the aromatic hopiness, again some gummi bears, agrumes from grapefruit to lemon, note all that complex but oh so tasty. Lovely hopiness, long bitter aftertaste. Batch no. 8865.

Fantastic example of the IPA style here.  Floral hop scent.  Nice and crisp.  Hides the alcohol perfectly.  Definitely a hop lovers beer.  Most balanced IPA I have had to date.  Had this beer many times before but figured that I should take the time this evening to rate the beer.  Nice lacing on the glass for an IPA.  Bit of citrus but being that this IPA is so balanced it does not overpower anything else.  Nice amount of head that sticks around just like it should.  Hard to drink this one slow.  Aftertaste stays on the palate just like it should, but does not leave for awhile afterwords.

Bottle from daknole (thanks!).  Pours a hazy orange gold with a large beiged white head, leaving lots of nice lacing as the head settles out.  Loads of floral and citrus hops on the nose, and a little bit of toast.  Medium to thick creamy body, with lots of sweet malt.  Nice grapefruit finish, but it takes a little while to come to the forefront, developing rather slowly.  This one was from batch 8678, packaged on August 13, 2008, so about half a year of age on this, so I may have to see if I can lay hands on a less than one month old one at some point and re-rate it, as I thoroughly enjoyed it, but would love to taste it even fresher.

Draft.  Pours a nice golden color with a touch of haze.  Big off white head that is slow to fade and has great lacing.  Strong hop aroma.  Definite floral, pine, and grass notes.  Medium low carbonation with a rich mouthfeel.  The hops continue on the palate.  A mix of floral and pine on the tongue from the hops with some bread from the malt.  The hops and malt are in perfect balance for the style.  Finishes with a lingering bitterness.  I have to say, this is a great example of the style and a must try.  I am going to keep a few of these in the fridge!

12 oz bottle. Heard great things, wanted to try this for a while, finally found it. Pours a golden copper with a finger high white head. Really a gorgeous color to it. Smells of hops, a little malt, lemony citrus, and some floral arrangement to it. The only thing Ive had compare in smell was Hopslam, also by Bells. Surprisingly though, the taste was mediocre. Weak and watery, with similar flavors to the smell, except much less hops and malt. Somewhat smooth going down, but quite disappointing. Wish it had more to the taste.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2012 (Draft at The Local in Charlottesville, VA) Huge, stiff off-white head and hazy, carbonaceous orange-gold body. Aroma is  sweet grapefruit-fruity and floral-piney hops. Nice body: medium to full, chewy. Not as sweet as I would have thought from the aroma, but mild sweetness up front. Turns into a medium but smooth bitterness. Orange, grapefruit and floral notes. Very smooth, highly drinkable; good flavor but not overpowering.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2009 12oz - Random find at the Winn Dixie in Fort Walton Beach, FL.  Hazy copper and tan head,  Solid malt throughout supporting a good amount of hops.  Bright floral nose and a seltzerlike finish from the bottle conditioning.  I enjoyed this.

Bottle in FL.  Pours hazy apricot with a medium sized head. Aroma is piney, soapy, with some esters.  Palate is medium-thick, with nice soft carbonation and a long finish.  Flavor starts soapy with some back-palate caramel malt.  Mid-palate transitions with flowers and light grapefruit.  Finishes hop-bitter, with a nice lasting bitter bite.  Overall, a very well balanced ale with firm flavor and a refreshing finish.

It pours a hazy golden color.  The aroma of the hops is evident from the beginning.  It has a nice sweet hoppy taste.  It is a very flavorable beer, but a little lighter than the standard IPA.  Great beer to drink!
My favorite beer in the whole world.  Could be offensive to anyone who hates flowery brews.  The perfect balance of all possible flavors in my opinion. I love it.
Perfect balance of full flavor from beginning of front to back of the mouth - and top to bottom of the bottle.  As everyone else says - drinkable.  But especially fulfilling.

The bright fresh aroma of wet hops and light citrus and banana accompany this cloudy, bright orange-amber beer. The white head has some fast lace as it lingers in a thin layer. Citrus and pepper hit your  tongue in a creamy cascade that runs straight into the bitter-world. Ripe grapefruit with a tiny bit of Pez. All this complexity turns to faint hop bitterness in the finish without ever becoming harsh.
Hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is bitter, citrusy hops. Tastes sweet and citrusy, not as bitter as some IPAs can be. Very enjoyable and drinkable.

Pours a hazy, deep golden orange with a creamy white head. Strong hoppy aroma with grapefruit and flowery notes. Light malts in the flavor, but mostly sweet hops. Wonderfully crisp finish and easy to drink.

Light amber pour with a nice white head. The hoppy aroma hits you during the pour and continous doing do for the duration of the drink, and until you wash the glass. Citrus is also noticeable. The flavor is well balanced between the hops, malt, and alcohol, which isnt really noticeable. The taste of the hops stick with you. Yeah. Id be drinking this by my firepit right now if it wasnt raining.
Bottle: Hazy orange yellow color with a creamy off white head. Aroma is light citrus fruit added with hops. Taste is citrus but not crazy and hops. Not harsh and very drinkable.

Pint served at Lunar Brewing. A hazy golden/amber pour with a medium foamy head and good lacing. The aroma was not over powering but subtle notes of pine, and a combo of citrus and apricot, which gave off a touch of sweetness. The flavor offered the same notes along with a nice, steady bitterness. Carried a medium balance of malt and hop through to the finish. A flavorfull, but lighter IPA than many.
On tap at Old Chicago.   Hazy orange pour with nice carbonation and lacing.  Hoppy and citrus aroma.  Flavor was rich on the hops, grapefruit, bitter herbs.  Excellent brew, one of my favorite IPAs.

Tried this about a year ago, and was very impressed. I purchased this at Bruisin Ales in North Carolina. I was veyr pleased to see that they had this beer in stock. Nice fluffy head that sticks around for awhile. Nice rich dark orange color that looks great. Very nice citrus and grapefruit hop. Very pungent aroma that is amazing. For an IPA, this is great. This is the second IPA I have had this evening that has come close to tasting/smelling like an Imperial/Double IPA. More of the citrus hop than anything. This is just a lovely smelling beer. Wow, nice smooth palate with a nice citrus/pine hop finish to follow the aroma. One of the best IPAs I have ever had. An awesome IPA.
Pours a cloudy orange with enough of a head.  Citrus and floral hops evident.  Drinks very easy and gives a wonderful mouthfeel after.  Would easily consider this my staple IPA.

The beer is welcomes with a citrussy tangy smell.  The beer is smooth throughout.  Personally, I would describe beer as jaunty...  I dont even know what that means.

The color is like the color of your piss after waking up after a long night of drinking.  Brings back good memories of fun nights!

The beer ends with a bit of astringency - maybe sanitizer?

2008 Bottle - Got 3 of these at once, so thanks to everyone! - Pours a cloudy orange with a large, lasting off-white head...aroma is standard IPA fare, hop florals, strong grapefruit, with a bit of grass and a bit of malt...flavour is bold, citrusy and clean, heavily carbonated...very hoppy and good alcohol, not too much else going on...very fun!

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2009 bottle thanks to GMCC2181.  poured a clear gold with a white head and lacing.  aroma of citrus, floral notes, sweet caramel, and slight toffee.  flavor was grapefruit, caramel, some spice and pine.  light body and high carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2010 Strong smell of hops. Taste reflects this as well. Good example of an IPA, I just dont care for them as much. 3.0
RE-RATE courtesy of drowland.  Glad to try this guy again. Clear orange color with a foamy white head. Aroma is nice and subtle with hops, sweet spice, and floral notes. Taste is hoppy with the right amount of piney sap.  Great taste and finish.  Fantastic.

12 oz bottle.  Pours coppery orange with a large soapy head.  Smells of citrusy pine.  Tastes lightly malted, but heavily hopped.  Not overly hopped, but just a good amount of piney, earthy hops.  Goes well with the mild malt flavor.  Nice aftertaste and real good drinkability.
Bottle.  Poured a hazy orange color.  Strong aroma of citrus and pine.  The flavor is quite hoppy but not over-powering.  Rather drink a Hopslam but still good.

12 oz. bottle at Union Jack, Arlington VA.  Dark and hazy.  Taste is very sharp.  The hops are very citrusy, and almost pine-like in its sharpness.  Overall, not bad.  I appreciate the bold flavors of this IPA although I would prefer a bit more bitterness to go along with the high citrusy-pine cone notes.

Enjoyed via draft in a pilsner glass.  This classic does not disappoint.  While the aroma could have been a bit more prevalent, the flavor if this mid-western IPA is nearly unmatched.  Hops up front are set in tandem with a finishing sweetness of malt and a dry finish that leaves the drinker reaching for the glass again.

355ml Bottle shared with Pyrozoid.  Hay golden apperance with a thick foamy off white head and nice lacing.  Aroma: pine ginger, orange zest and light arome of grapefruit.  Flavor: peppery, pine, citrus, hops, anise and mint.  Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation with a peppery hoppy finish.
Bouteille. Dégusté avec french tickler et Agaguk. Bière de couleur miel brumeux avec un bon collet très collant. Odeur de pin, citron, cerises et raisins vert. Gout dépices, clou de girofle e sel.

pours a hazy honey color with a huge white head.  nice retention and lacing.  aroma is very citrusy and floral...lots of pineapple!  flavor is pinapple up front and loads of grapefruit which lingers in the dry finish.  very nice ipa!

Super belle bouteille qui me donne vraiment le gout daller a la peche meme si on est en Février.  Apparence Orange qui tire un peu du cuivré un peu brumeuse avec un collet encore tres mousseux et qui colle tres bien au verre... Aromes beaucoup plus fruité et floral que la Stone IPA, peches, oranges, apricots, un peu les poires, caramel et miel.  Gout tres cremeux en bouche, IBU beaucoup moin elevé que je laurais pensé... jestime environ 50-55 IBU.  Amertume tout de meme tres respectable, tres belle rondeur en bouche.  Biere tres balancé.   Zest de pamplemousse et un petit coté resineux me chatouille les papilles gustatives.  IPA tres impressionante... quoiquun peu différente de la STONE IPA elle ne decoit pas.

Correction au degré dIBU... jestime 60-65

Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours a very nice looking gold with nice off-hite head. Aroma is great, fruit, pine, and malt, stands out nicely. Flavor is fruity, citrus, some pine, nice balanced bitter. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, high carbonation. Overall, not bad...
Pours a slighty hazy amber with one finger of white head. Aroma is mostly floral hops and some citrus. Flavor is the same the smell. Great beer.

Poured amber with a four-fingered head.  The aroma was nice floral hoppy, the flavor was a nice blend of citrus, floral hops and malt, very well balanced.  A slight bitterness throughout the drink but never overwhelming.  An excellent IPA that did not disappoint.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 Appearance:  reddish, orange, copper, light haze; above average head with decent retention

Aroma:  lots of fruit, floral, and citrus, as expected from the centennial hops; very easy to enjoy

Flavor:  wow, centennial is quite different than simcoe; all floral and fruit; very easy to like; refreshing; also a noticeable grainy, yeasty presence which adds, rather than subtracts, from the overall experience; medium to medium-high bitterness, and it is kept in check nicely

Palate:  pretty smooth; medium bodied; quite high carbonation--probably too high;

(tasted twice)
This is the best regular ipa that I have had. Tasty but not beat you in the face bitter. Frothy white head, murky golden pour. Great hoppy scent. Excellent beer.
Bright orange in color with a good sized cream colored head. Aroma is of bold hops, grass, citrus, and pine. Taste is of pine and grapefruit.

I look at this like a strong APA not an IPA ...that being said.....a fucking great apa very balanced and complex...but drinkable...not as overtly hoppy as west coast ipa/apas but I think I can get use to this one...:)

355 mL bottle.  (#8813 on the back).  Copper with a small white head.  Sweetish aroma of thin malt and light floral hops.  Not overpowering.  Kinda like Belgian blonde meets IPA.  Malt profile steps up as it warms.  Bitterness from start to finish.  Incredibly full for an IPA.  Medium to high carbonation.

Pint at Bottoms Up Pizza. Upfront floral/citrusy aroma. Slightly hazy orange golden with small white head. Flavor is grassy floral hops in front with a light caramel maltyness and citrusy grape fruitiness. Medium bitterness and well balanced. Very good. Makes you wonder is this Hop Slam without the honey?

Bottle from Chevy Chase Wine & Liquors in DC.  Excellent IPA. Nice amber color with a thick off-white head.  Floral hoppy aroma, east coast style hops and slightly sweet malt on the flavor, slightly bitter finish. Well balanced. Im starting to like these Bells guys and wish they were available out west.

Gorgeous thick-foamed big-bubble head, slow carbonation, perfect hazy amber color. no lace to speak of. Flowery aroma overpowers any residual citrus. Creamy mouthfeel, full-bodied. Some sweetness to semi-balance the strong bitterness. More bitterness than the 09 Hopslam because of less malts.
Pours a golden amber. Citrusy nose. Excellent disbursement of hops, malt, and citrus. My favorite IPA to date.

Bottle.  Pours hazy orange amber with suspended particulate and good offwhite head and lacing.  Nose of clean floral and citrus hops.  Flavor has a balanced malty component at first, but is actually quite unbalanced, with a decided hop bitterness finishes this strong.  Resiny hops affect the mouthfeel.  Good for style.  But not exactly what I look for in an IPA

On tap at Gallos Tap Room.  Pours a cloudy orange copper with a medium white head.  Hoppy nose with grapefruit, orange and some malty sweetness.  Bitter hop flavor with lots of citrus, some alcohol and a bitter finish.  This was the beer that first got me interested in IPAs and it remains one of the best of the style.
beautiful hoppy/floral aroma. some hoppy grapefruit flavor. light on the palate, nice aftertaste. semi bitter finish

Bottle thanks to daknole.  Batch 8409.  Light caramel honey orange with two fingers of puffy white head.  Great hop aroma, pine floral, light citrus.  Taste is solid caramel malt backbone and a good citric bitter finish.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 TAP: at Bulldog Lowertown (St. Paul, MN) on 1.25.09. Gold, translucent pour, light head. Slightly lighter in color than Bells HopSlam. Floral hop aroma that was mild. Taste was sweet, very well-balanced hop that comes on late, and pine. A little less edgy than HopSlam.

0.355 l bottle my uncle brought from Milwaukee. It poured very nice, murky amber body with big white head. Wonderful aroma, citrus fruits, specially oranges, some grapes, lot of spices, some of which being quite strange and new to me. Slightly yeasty as well. Flavor was very strange to me...this was my first true IPA. Straightforwardly bitter, all hoppy, with some oranges and some other fruits mixed with pepper and many other spices Also soapy, which I disliked for sure. Medium bodied, with alcohol not felt at all. Finish had some finer bitterness, again of orange peel and some spices, nice and long. Damn strange and had its special kind of beauty, which I liked to some degree.

Bottled 355ml. Courtesy of nearbeer. Appearance: It pours a deep copper beer with an beautiful creamy, nicely lasting off-white head. Darker in color and hazier than Stone india pale ale for example. Beautiful lacework. Aroma: Fruity, citrusy, hoppy (Centennial hops) with hints of raisins, apples, caramel and figs. Flavor and palate: A lot of oranges, apples, figs, rasins and caramel in the taste. Moderate bitterness. Indeed, quite a lot of reminiscent raisin in the malt profile. Medium bodied. Rather sweet. Licorice emerging in the finish which is slightly bitter. Overall impression: Less bitter than expected with a decent, but not overly interesting malty background. Overrated in my opinion. Thanks a lot nearbeer!
UPDATED: JUN 12, 2011 Beautiful pale, creamy head. Nose is crisp balanced hops. Juicy, wet body with rush of citrus bitters. Quintessential, very very good.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2014 Finally picked up a four pack of pint cans; canned on 9/29/14. Aroma: Light-moderate grapefruit zest in the nose with semi sweet caramel; simple and clean. Appearance: Orange tinted copper pour with a foamy white head that settles into a sticky skin, ideally supported by active carbonation. Flavor: Grapefruit zest up front and throughout, yielding a bit to semi-sweet malts in the middle; the finish is moderately bitter with plenty of grapefruit character intact. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: A bit old school at this point, but still a great beer. Batch 10128 from Kroger Liquor Store in Maysville, KY. Aroma of floral hops, honey, grapefruit and some white sugar. Appearance is golden with frothy white head that stayed until the end. Flavor started out with more of the sweet and estery flavors, but progressed to medium-high hoppiness in the middle; the finish was a considerable backing down on the hop character, just leaving a bit of sweet and bitter in the back of my mouth. Palate was slightly bubbly and terminated somewhat creamy. Just a really well crafted IPA.
Wow!  Lots of hops bitterness.  Can drink one or two before it overwhelms the senses.  Its certainly not Blatz, lets face it.
Copper color, clear in look.  The aromas are alcohol, hops, malts, citrus, caramel, and flowers.  Medium body and low to medium bitterness.  Taste is floral, malts, pine, citrus, and caramel.

One of the best pale ales out there if not the very best. One is first struck by the Baroque copper hue and light foamy head then the odiferous but not overwhelming scent of fresh earthy flowers and grains exquisitely balanced between sweet and acid. A masterpiece of brewing with a high hop rate that plays  remarkably well off the other qualities of alcohol and malt.

Bottle.  Pours a nice transparent amber body with fluffy pure white head.  Sweet and spicy aromas like fresh baked bread and oranges and cloves fill the nose.  The pallate is delicate and multilayered.  The bitter hops fill the front of the mouth with a dry bitter sensation and the sweet chewy malts dance with creamy smooth sensations on the roof of my mouth.  The bitterness holds out just long enough to finish dry and leave me craving another drink.  The flavor is full of dry grassy hops, clove spices, grapefruit and a sweet thin honey residue.  Really a nice treat.
12 oz bottle bought on a whim.  Pours with a medium white head, and produces slightly floral aromas, and smooth floral and sweet tastes.
A great ipa. This beer could serve as the baseline for the category. It pours with great white head and goes down so easy. Decent balance with a great rounded hop character. Well done to the Bell.

Bottle from Trinity Liquors in Spring Hill, FL. Aroma is nice floral notes, sweet nectar, pepper, citrus, pine, honey...best ive ever smelled. Pours cloudy creamsicle orange color with medium head a some lacing. Flavor is spices, grass, honey...not as bitter as typical IPAs....Very pleasant. A bit of an aftertaste but its nice...grassy and hoppy. Man...this is fantastic...and im not an IPA guy in any way shape or form...I LOVE IT!

Appearance: Pours a dark gold with a big fluffy white head. It is very cloudy with visible rising bubbles.  The fluffy head never really subsided, and added to the overall appearance.

Aroma:  Caramel malt and orange zest right off the bat.

Taste:  Grapefruit, pine, brown sugar and lemon. Ends with a bitter spicy hop note.

Mouthfeel:  Juicy and astringent. Not really heavy or thick, but not watery by any means.

Overall:  For an IPA not made on the west coast, this beer has a great level of citrus aroma and flavor, and has a nice level of malt to compliment it.  I look forward to brewing my first extract batch of beer, based off of this recipe.

Bottle 355ml.Clear light to medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, moderate to heavy hoppy, perfume, grapefruit, orange shell, soap. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [250908]
how have i not rated this jewel.  it has everything that is missing from every mediocre ipa i have ever drank.  it smells better than fresh hops on the bine and tastes better than beer.
What an IPA aroma. Very citrusy. This is a nice beer. A good hop bite, a lot of flavor. A bit thin finish but mostly just fantastic.
My favorite IPA I have tried. I love the hop flavor and bitterness.  It has a good head and nice gold color as well.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2010 12oz bottle.  Pours an off-white head and has a deep honey colored body.  Smells of honeyed fruit, mango and hops.  Tastes of apricots, mango, and pine.  Big body that is slick.  Bitter finish.  Smooth beer.

12oz bottle, thanks argo0!   Bright orange with an oily head that leaves some nice lace.   Big citrus candy aroma: grapefruit, orange peel, and some slight mango for good measure.   Pure hops, with a good supporting malt sweetness that doesnt provide assertive character.   Very citrusy flavor with lots of orange, light grapefruit, and a soft bitterness.   Good balance, with a bitter, yet soft finish.   Medium bodied with smooth carbonation.   Very well done, though the hops are quite one-dimensional.
A favorite. Very tasty, not too thick, not too light. Love the northwoods style fish design!
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 (bottle) For me this is the perfect IPA - lovely floral hoppy aroma and crisp, slighly bitter hops in the taste.  As good as any IPA I have tasted from a bottle.

On tap at CIty Beverage in Durham NC this beer is organge tinted golden in color with a white head and decent lacing.  Nice citrus and floral hops in the aroma.  First sip I picked up the grapefruit, perfect amount of hops, and subtle malt.  This is a very smooth beer and extremely drinkable.  Carbonation was perfect.

Nice HUGE fluffy head pops out of this beer to settle into a small fluffy covering of the brew. Lots of citrus, and floral rise up out of the glass to start your taste buds a tingling. 

Nice flavor and smooth resin flavors. Nice beer, ever judged by a Pacific North Westerner. Very drinkable and up there with many of the other top notch IPAs from round these parts.

Tulip glass.
Bitter flora aroma, hints of ruby grapefruit and some clementine.  Pale caramel pour color, with a fluffy white head.  Head is resilient.  Great hopped IPA, with flavors matching the aroma.

Bottle at Akkurat 081227. Pours pale golden with thick white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon and floral perfume. Amazing mouthfeel, very pearly and velvety. Clean bitterness with a very dry finish. Slightly herbal hoppiness and some perfume. Clean and simple and very drinkable.

Copper color with a thick shaving cream head. Nice piney hop bitterness swats at the nose. Flavor is crisp and characterized by a strong bitterness, probably healthy doses of Chinook. Some floral notes, but mostly a bitter monster. A tasty, bitter IPA brew.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2010 Sweet pine aroma, with some resin.  Nice, simple label with a fish on it.  Dark tan, greenish pour.  Good flavor of pine, grass, and herbs.  A good IPA, but a little overrated i.m.o.  This is my cousins "go to" brew.

incredibly strong hop bouquet yet not brutally bitter. an excellent IPA, maybe the best I’ve had. orange color, off white abundant head that is fizzy rather than heavy or creamy (yet remains a surprisingly long time for such a head) and releases abundant hop.

Bottle. Pours a bubbling golden hue with a pretty full white head. Sweeter grapefruit, orange zest, but a lightly intense bitterness. Mouth has a slight effervescence  with a long dry bitter finish. Overall really pleasant IPA. It is well hopped but not hop-head intensely hopped.

This beer was definitely a good change of pace for the hardened IPA drinker. It pours a cloudy amber with a generous white head. Wonderful floral aroma to it. Nice intital hoppy bite to it that catches your attention immediately with a malty backbone shining through with the finish. What a complex brew! Anyways, I was a fan and I highly recommend it.
"Well suited for Hemingway-esque trips to the Upper Peninsula" indeed. A complex flavor balanced between floral hops, pine, and citrus; a nice bitter finish. A fantastically intellectual beer.

This was from a 12oz bottle.Poured a cloudy golden color, with a large off white head.Aromas were of heavy pine and citrus.The taste also had pine, citrus,and nice malt for a balnce.Well done and nice effort,from my first taste of a Bells brew!

Bottle.  Fragrant moderately sweet citrus aroma.  Hazy orange golden body, huge thick creamy white head.  Flavor a delicious citrus blend, mostly orange grapefruit, with a lengthy bitter finish.  Excellent.
Probably the best IPA I ever tasted.  Sweetness added to the hoppy citrus pine characteristics.  Wow and its 7percent  so drink it early before driving to work.

Delicious!
copper bordering on amber.  beautiful hoppy floral scent.  nice lacing.  complex flavor.  Nice hoppy bitter IPA finish.  Lingers on the tongue

Bottle. Pours an amber, orange color with a little head. Smell is pines and hops. Taste is well balanced with the hop flavors coming though. A little bitter finish. One of the better beers in it’s style

On tap/bottle?I think it was on tap? From Jose Pistolas, Philadelphia 17-11-08 Pours light amber with a really stunning fresh hoppy nose and a great terrapin like snappy bite to it, but there are enough malts to carry this through to make it enormously tasty. There is a nice drying appleyness on the roof of the mouth, its good stuff. A7 A4 F7 P4 OV15

My favorite beer. Introduced to this a few years back by my porch loving hippie friends. Excellent hop level, nothing too extreme, but obviously noticeable. High ABV can lead to some great nights. Take this rating with a grain of salt however, as a fisheries biologist, I may or may not be biased by the label.
Growler. Poured a murky deep amber. Big floral hop nose. Flavor very similar to nose, with sweet, fruity, and floral hops. Medium bitter finish.

Golden yellow pour with a big fluffy head that settles down to a lingering quarter inch.  Aroma of floral hops, grapefruit, cream.  Super easy to drink, but full of character.  Not too much bitterness, but plenty of hops, from floral to fruity to grassy.  Some soapy flavor.  Maybe a little to light.  All-around, a very enjoyable IPA.

Sixer at the Wegmans by my folks for Turkey day.  I am underwhelmed with this puppy.. Yeah yeah lots of hops. Yeah yeah it smells like a hop silo.  yes it is a nice pale yellow gold with a respectable ammnt of carb. with at thin continuous head. It has a bit (this much) body which reduces itself to a thin watery body.  I found this brew lacking for all the hype.  It aint hop devil.  B.L.A.H.

I’ve had this via bottle and tap. Will now only go the bottle route. This is hands down the best IPA I have ever gotten my hands on. I have tried many, but I always go back to the old stand by, Two Hearted.

Cloudy, lightened copper pour.  Huge, pillowy white head.  Very frothy and sticky.  Super flowery nose.  Fresh floral and grapefruit.  Mellow flavor, very fresh and crisp, lightened citrus and fleeting pine.  Sweet, toasty malt backbone.  Medium to medium-thick body.  Finishes with a touch of resin...just to let you know its there.  Im not sure about Hemingway-esque trips to the upper penninsula, but this is an easy drinking IPA.  Flowing flavors with the right amount of bitterness and body without having that over-the-top, tongue blistering assault.  Great for a session in front of the fire.

Two Hearted pours a thoroughly opal gamboge, an almost mustard yellow color. The head is thick but lacy, straw-colored, and lasts quite a while, forming a mushroom in the center. The hop aroma is strong enough that you dont even need to lean in. Supremely floral, strong rose and orange blossoms predominate. Some grapefruit shines through as well.

While the flavor is unmistakably bitter, it is not as intense as many American IPAs. Floral hop flavor, light citric fruitiness, and a faint tartness make up the immediate impression. The bitterness comes afterward with the liveliness of the carbonation and a slight sweetness to balance.

I’ve been drinking this beer for years, and it is one of my favorites.  Hops and citrus (grapefruit) are what you remember about the taste.  I’ve poured so many of these, I just smile thinking about pouring another.  Good with all kinds of foods, but lamb chops coated in peanut oil with kosher salt, crushed rosemary and green peppercorns is a must.

On tap at OTH.
Pours hazy blonde, thick white head.
Aroma is hoppy, fruity and floral.
Taste, hoppy with nice grapefruit / citrus notes.
Light bitter finish, but overall remains a lot sweeter than the West coast ipa’s.
Floral, Piney, Citrusy, and not too much of any... Amazingly balanced... Definitely in the top 10 ive ever had...
thanks Daknole. Smells of grapefruit mixed with floral aromas. Flavor os piney with strong citrus and grapeffruit notes. Among the top 5 IPA’s I have ever had

Aroma is of floral and citrus hops. Pours a nice vibrant orange gold with a lingering foamy head. Initially floral hop flavor followed by grapefruit and lemon notes. Malt is light and toasty and adds just enough balance. Highly quaff-able, enjoyable brew.
12oz. From the bottle. Flavor is piney, floral, and citrus hops. Nice wet finish and crisp hops. One of the best IPA’s i’ve had in a while.
user_location: back in NJ!, New Jersey, USA

text: Super dry and crisp flavors of grapefruit, hops, flowers, pine and malt.  Went awesome with a french dip sandwich.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2012 Bottle.  Pours a brassy, opaque golden color.  Aroma of grass cuttings, pine, and citrus - very hop forward.  Flavor is bitter and salty, somehow reminding me of the taste of the ocean.   Finish is dry as can be -  very little sweetness.  The mouthfeel is thick, and the alcohol undetectable.  Not as complex as I would like, but straightforward and very well made.
Yum!  Pine, citrus, and hops all slammed into one delicious bottle.  It’s the next best thing to Hopslam.  Bells makes a damn good IPA.  Go get yourself some!

12 oz bottle courtesy of Michigan native Shaun Hughey. Contrary to what the prior posters decreed, this is super sexy label art. As a matter of fact, everything about this beer is set up to turn a man on. If only it were available out here in Ahregone!

Something about the packaging or label kept me from trying this for a long time. I finally picked up a 6 Pack at the Paradise, MI, IGA while on vacation last summer. Its been a favorite ever since. A coppery light amber pour with a perfect off-white head. Aroma is dominated by hops. Flavor is full bodies malty with a bit of fruit, incredible hops finish. A fabulous IPA.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2010 Very solid IPA. Aroma is sweet and citrusy. Lots of grapefruit with an initial hoppy bite that quickly fades. Medium palate. Very smooth and balanced. incredible lacing and an overall extremely creamy body and mouthfeel. An excellent IPA where you can never go wrong.

Aroma is dominated by Pacific north west hops, and some citrus grapefruit esters.  It’s appearance is a medium dark golden with a full white head that is high in retention.  The flavor is a perfect balance of malts and aggressive hops.  The balance is masterful, with a nice warming feel.  Not entirely sexy label, but whatever, it’s what inside right.
Simply a great beer.  Great initial bitterness followed by a flood of pleasing warmth.  Enjoy a pitcher on a nice sunny day.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2008 (On draft at Magnolia with Dad in Purcelville, Virginia on October 17, 2008) Just had it a few hours ago, but have had a few since then. Seriously hoppy, but not uncomfortably so.  Easy going down, easy on the palate, yet spunky and reviving after a long day in transit. I would not suggest this to a non-hop head, however.
Feel blessed to have easy access to this beer.  Great IPA.  Not much else to say, everyone else has classified the flavors well.  Just drink and enjoy with a good cigar.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2009 Bright orange hue with gold highlights, slight haze, thin layer of off-white foam sustains, thick lacing. Moderate hop aroma of sweet citrus (orange/lemon), most bread malts, light chalk and grass. Hop bitterness bites initially and transitions to citrus and light pine hops, grassy tones, bread and light caramel malts, finishes dry and bitter. Palate is medium-bodied, smooth texture, medium carbonation. Overall, and easy drinking IPA with nice hop flavor and strong hop bitterness that lingers, very solid.

An IPA staple for a good reason.  Unmistakable.  Light Amber in color and just make me think it would be the best sea fairing bear for the summer.  Plenty of hops and the right kinds for me.   Maybe Simcoe/Cascade and I dont know what else.  I know it’s 3 kinds though.  Grapefruit, Orange and a slight citrus tinge is in their.

12 oz bottle poured medium golden color with a fluffy white head.  Floral and citrus hop aroma.  Slightly smokey body.  Some honey and biscuit in the body with a medium citrus hop bitterness.  The body was slightly thin,.  Don’t get me wrong, a great IPA, but from all the hype, it was not what I was expecting.
HOPS... mmmm... great earthy flavor with a touch of citrus...orange perhaps... hoppier then most, but not as hoppy as Unearthly... which might be a plus for some

Mini keg shared by Robert at Stateline. Thanks for this one. Poured a nice clear amber color with decent head. Strong aroma of citrus fruits, orange, honey, and very nice sweet hop. Flavor is well balanced with pine, fruits, orange, and malt. Finish is very smooth, crisp, and flows right down. Delicious.  Thanks Robert!
Sweet citrus notes: lemon, orange, grapefruit.  Some sugar cookie, toast, and flowers.  Body is fairly full for an IPA.  End is dry, with light alcohol aftertaste.

12 oz. bottle and on tap.  Pour is a clear amber orange with a medium head.  Bursts of fresh hops and citrus!  Nice malty backbone with enough sweetness to carry along the hop presence. Never overbearing or random tasting, very focused, simple, and nearly perfect.  Freshness is a key here, but not as much as with some IPA.  Just extremely drinkable and enjoyable.
Great IPA!  Very flavorful.  Great hop taste without being too bitter. Slightly sweet to impart a full flavor.  A great beer!
Bottle. Pours golden with white head.  Aroma is citrus and hops. Flavor is not over hopped, finishes dry and light with balanced hop flavor.

Draught @ Cole’s. Clear golden with lots of lacing. Mellow hoppy aroma. Very leafy but not a lot of pine. Some citrus rind. Nice level of carbonation. Super dry and really mellow finish. Super smooth with an exceptionally delicious hop kiss. Really rindy. My kind of IPA.

Beautiful pour with solid white head and faintly copper body. Aroma is enticing with hints of citrus. Can definitely taste the hops but they are not overwhelming. Crisp flavor with subtle sweetness always leaves me wanting more. This is an outstanding beer.
bottle. sweet lemony aroma. was a little too bitter for my tastes, but worth trying again.

From bottle.  Part of April Dayton Beertasting event.
Pours dense but clear copper. 
Aroma of floral and piney hops.
Nice body and strong hoppy finish.  One of my go-to IPA’s.

Hazy and off white with an attractive and intricate blanket of carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma is heavy and complex, like a warm and humid pine forest. Carmel maltiness and loads of sharp hops. More body than expected. There’s much to appreciate in this malt-driven IPA.
A great IPA.  Great mouthfeel, nice head and retention.  great floral hopping and bittering on the back end

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2011 On tap. Pours golden orange with a large white foamy head. Some nice lacing too. Aroma is subtle citrus with big pine and floral notes. Amazing flavor of floral hops with pine, hints of citrus, and a solid malt backing. Finish is smooth with a nice hop bite. Extremely drinkable and addictive. Essential.
Mostly clean copper color, heavy effervescent head, strong fruity hopped aroma, thick lacing evenly-fruited and hopped head and body with pleasant quickly-receding hop finish

Pours an orange color with a white head. Aroma is hoppy, with hints of citrus and floral notes. Taste is very hoppy, with notes of sharp malts. Lingering hop bitterness after each sip. Finishes bitter. Very drinkable and worth buying again.
Bottle. Very floral aroma and taste. Almost a floral perfume taste. Well balanced between the malt sweetness and hop bitterness. Top notch IIPA.
On tap at Redlight.  Has a nice amber color.  Really sweet fruity, flowery smell.  Malty, big and hoppy. Nice burn at the end.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2008 12 oz bottle, Tampa. Amazing beer. Pours a golden honey-like color with moderate carbonation that persists throughout the drink. Aroma is rather hoppy but also smells of fresh fruit and pine. The most obvious taste is bitter but the citrus character also balances it out with sweetness along with a good malt flavor. Palate is smooth and aftertaste is fresh. Very good beer.
Nice IPA.  It has plenty of hops and a good malt backbone to back it up.  It is a refreshing crisp IPA.

Bottle. Pours a murky peachy-amber with a white fluffy head. Big hops aroma, floral and a little herbal, with a hint of citrus. Taste is sharp and clean, of bitter hops, yeast, and a floral hint. Lingering crisp bitterness. Refreshing and very tasty IPA.

Bottle courtesy of colemgm8 pours hazy copper with thin white head. Aroma is strong pine and light malt. First taste is bitter pine hops and this carries through the beer. Finish is dry with nice hops burn. Nice carbonation.

12 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a 3 cm off white foamy head that is slowly diminishing. Aroma of pine and citrus. Initial flavor of smooth bread malt and a spike of piney hops. Flavor becomes overwhelmed and dry with hops and has a lasting aftertaste. Moderate carbonation, medium body, alcohol noted as it warms and in the aftertaste. Overall one of the better IPAs I have had, no shock it does well in tasting comps.

Bottle from D&J Liquor in St. Louis, MO. Hazy amber color with a vigorous beige head. Nice aroma of resin and floral hop. Medium body with frothy carbonation. Flavor is very hoppy, piney with a hint of grapefruit. Finishes smooth and tasty. There’s enough malt to give the illusion of balance. Why can’t we get this in California?

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2009 this is the beer God gives you in Heaven. does it require more input than this?
I rated this as my first beer, completely biased as I had drank nothing but this for the last two years. re rated to a more acceptable level. still, Im pretty sure this is what God will give me to drink when I get there.

I really love this beer!  They have it on tap about 100 yds from my condo in Green Bay, WI (St. Brendans) which is rare for these parts.  Only bad part about this beer is after I drank the Hop Slam it tasted a little blah... I guess you shouldn’t drink them the same time!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2009 Bottle, pilsner glass.  Floral and piney hops aromas are sublime.  Hazy gold color, generous cream-colored foam, leaves abundant lace.  Initial flavor is all floral and coniferous hops, with a definite bitter bite.  Creamy, caramel, worty malt.  Hops turn more towards grapefruit as it warms up.  Smooth warming mouthfeel.

Bottle.  Actually a bit disappointing as I typically love Bell’s beers and had heard many great things regarding Two Hearted.  Large and frothy head with a yellow color.  Aromas of herbs, pine, and grapefruit.  Moderately bitter with a short duration of flavor.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2009 Bottle.Pours a hazy cloudy orange with a creamy offwhite head that laces well. Aroma is beautiful very floral and hoppy ,some notes of grass and pine. The flavor is much of the same with some malt background, citrus, hops and a hint of spice. This is amazingly smooth and drinkable for an IPA. It finishes quite crisp and delicious on the palate. It manages to not get you with that harsh bitterness. This is a great beer .Delicious!
great refreshing beer you could say nothing bad about it just taste really damn good
Had out of the bottle. Creamy head that sticks around. Quite honestly the best IPA I’ve had yet

Pours a nice copper with an off-white head. Has a floral hop aroma, but it has a great balance of malts, making this IPA taste fantastic. The bitter hops are present throughout the tasting experience, yet the malts smooth it out perfectly. It has a delicious bitter finish that leaves you wanting more. I highly recommend this beer.

This beer pours a dark coppery hazy color with a full off-white head that lingers for quite a while.  The aroma is strong for sweet grapefruit and pine with a underlying sweet caramel quality.  In the flavor, one finds pine, lemon, dark dried fruits, and sourdough bread.  The beer finishes with a bitter tang.  The palate is medium-large.  Great IPA!

Cloudy copper pour, off cream head.  Floral with some malty aromas.  Citrus, biscuit, raisin, malt a good mix of flavors going on here, real good for an IPA.  Bitter hop finish lingers just enough.  Better on draft if you can get it IMO.  Another good potent Bell’s offering.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text: HOPS! Bitter! YAY! definitely one of my faves. super easy to drink which is amazing considering the mix of strong flavors.

Pours a beautiful orange/golden color with big fluffy dense head with a big floral hop aroma.  Im waiting for a big hop bite based on the aroma from this IPA which it delivers but extremely smoothly.  The hop bitterness is there but then it slips away to leave a very nice hop flavor that is so well balanced with the malt that I forget this is an pretty potent IPA.   This is one of the best American beers Ive had in a very long time, not over the top but super flavorful and well crafted.  Cheers to Bells.

This fish clad bottle is a giant. If the beer was a fish, it would be the one that always gets away, the one you fantasize over and once you finally get it, you then give up fishing altogether. 
I can’t say it is the most even taste. I can’t even say that it is consistent even in one glass. This, however, is the beauty of it.  On tap isn’t that much better than in the bottle in comparison to other beers. It fights with your mouth all the way down, but in a fun way like the punch in the arm from the girl you like, and it hurts for real, but you enjoy it too much to ask her to stop.

believe the hype people; this is not a joke.  maybe my mouth is in perfect conditions to enjoy this, but the fall off of flavor after each sip is liable to break the speed of light.  this is the cleanest, crispest beer ive ever drank.  typically those adjectives are used in reference to mellow pilsners and their ilk.  well frankly, id rather drink a 7% beer that reeks of hops and tastes wonderous then those dirty old beers.  my point is that this is so well executed that it is suitable for many versatile situations: hot summers day.....or a cold winters morn.  this is not just for hop heads, this is what drinking beer is all about.  a few sips of this put me truly at peace with the world, to think that something as simple and overdone as a regular IPA can still be pulled off at nearly a perfect 10.
A floral, citrusy extravaganza. The malt is there, but the hops shine through. Very drinkable, very crisp and very dry. A winner!

pure and simple, no debate or discussion or long drawn out review from me needed: this is the most beautiful, most perfect, most divinely inspired ale ever made. were you to tell me i had one hour to live, and i could only drink one beer in that hour, i ask for a bucket full of bell’s two hearted ale. this is the brow sweat of the Almighty in a glass.
UPDATED: SEP 13, 2008 12 oz. bottle poured a light brown with a small white head.  Has a good hoppy aroma and taste.  Would drink this beer again and again.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2010 hazy orange/gold under a small white head.  sweet hoppy aroma with peach and strawberry.  bitter lemony, peach, strawberry hop flavors.  not really that malty and the result is an unbalanced soapy astringency.  8-3-6-3-13....  re-rate....aroma is very fruity, floral.  a clear orange beer under a large foamy white head.  i must have missed something the first time.  the palate in the this beer is amazing.  creamy, smooth,  hoppy as hell(but not astringently bitter).  drinkable perfume.  great blend of hops and malt.  reminds me of a toned-down, regular ipa hop stoopid.

12 oz. bottle: Pours an amber orange with a one finger off-white head that is mostly lasting while leaving nice lacing. Hoppy aroma has a very good citrusy aroma with hints of pine. Flavor is intially sweet finishinig with a grapefruit bitterness that is very refreshing. Well balance and smooth.

Maybe it was because I was really looking for a refreshing swig or maybe it’s because it’s not a good lunchtime brew, but BOY is this strong for what I expected.  But, as usually happens, I got used to the taste and strength and it was great to wash down some garlic crackers with.  Too skunky for me in the aftertaste, though, and doubt I will purchase again.

Very nice, very powerful aroma of pine, very much a fresh hops smell.  Also a bit of fresh baked bread was in the air.  Oily mouthfeel, plus you could taste the pine and there was lots of malt in the palate.  Wasn’t overly hoppy, was extremely well balanced and done.   Don’t know if I can rate a straight IPA over 4 though, but it is going towards the IIPA in alcohol % and all.  Had wall on a visit to MSU.

A nice looking beer with an amber orange hue.  Some flourescence.  Two finger tan head with good retention.  Pine and grapefruit aroma.  Very well hopped with grapefruit dominant.  Malt is a distant second.  As it warms some peppery spice shows up.  Very nice feel.  It is creamy, smooth and fizzy.  Bitter, too.  Quite good but a 99%?

Enormously enjoyable.  Dark amber or orange, almost clear, big light head.  Hops and hops in the nose, but balanced taste of hops, malts, caramel sweetness, citrus, and a bitter finish.  Among the best bottled IPAs, and the most better ones have been special edition cask IPAs that I have sampled at brewers.

Bottle thanks to mar.  Nice golden pour, not too much head.  Aroma of honey, hops and esters.  Flavor is by in a flash, all hops, not much of a malt balance.  Finish is dry and bitter, but this is a smooth drinking IPA with hint of creaminess.  Nice label and hemingway reference... good IPA but I think I was expecting a little more based on the hype.  Still a good beer though.
Had this in a bottle at Monks in Philly.  Not a big IPA like many of its competitors, this beer is very easy to drink.  Bitterness dominates the hop ballance, it is a very complex malt profile.

12oz. bottle.  Served in bottle.  Swirling the bottle produces a creamy non-persistent head.  Aroma of toasted malt, floral hops and a touch of orange.  Taste is more of the same, yet I think a bit light on the hops for an IPA.  Silky smooth light-medium body, nicely bitter, very drinkable.
Love this one. I got a mixed 6 and liked third coast ale, a similar one,  even better.
bottle thanks to kosko20.  nice light amber color with a white head that dissipates into floaties.  very easy on the palate on the palate with a very smooth  hop flavor that is quite nice.

Bottle, aroma of pure christmas tree goodness, pours a nice cloudy golden color with a fluffy head. First tried this beer while camping drinking from a bottle and thought it was amazing now that I can properly drink it, its even better. Such a rich strong palate, a burst of hops its a really nice brew, alcohol is well hidden, substantial complexity. Very,very nice brew. Bells is just an amazing brewery.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2009 I had this on draft from Charlies pub in Munster, Indiana. The pub pour came with no head or lacing so I cannot rate that. Very powerful head of citrus hops and pine.  Medium mouthfeel but very smooth. Flavor is dominated by the hops. Bitter finish. Remarkably easy to drink. An outstanding beer.  Recently had a bottle from a trade.  Just as good at the draft.
nice copper pour with decent head.  Poured on tap at George’s Bar and Restaurant.  Very hoppy taste, nice surprise from the tap.  very good, I will enjoy this brew again!

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2009 12 oz bottle from a six pack smuggled across the border from a little place in Dyer, IN. I guess the days of doing this are over, though. Pours a hazy amber with a huge billowy white head that shows no signs of dying. Aromas are largely medium citrusy hops and sweet malts. Initial taste is bitter hoppiness up front, pine and citrus mixed with a touch of spice, leading up to a delicate yet assertive malt balance. Finishes with a smooth body but nice bitter taste. Medium to lighter bodied finish. The hops steal the show in this brew and I personally really enjoy the more one dimensional hop feel. Assertive and non-messy. Rerate pending with fresh bottles returning to Illinois shortly. Cheers

Rerate: 12 oz bottle: lost a couple points. The wow factored was tamed.

12 oz Bottle. Bells Two Hearted Ale pours a crisp golden orange with an overflowing two-finger head. A very strong aroma of citrus hops and pine. Two Hearted Ale has a fruity hop flavour suitable for any hop-head. I found the finish to be quite bitter and salty ,but the feeling of dehydration ended up just making me want more.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange-copper color with a fluffy whtie head.  Explodes with a very heavy floral aroma mixed with orange citurs and pine.  Wonderfully bitter hops flavor.  Hits you mid-palate with a nice bitter finish.  Excellent beer.
