UPDATED: SEP 12, 2008 Golden orange color with a nice 1 inch white head that hangs around forever.  Strong citrus hops aroma.  Lots of hops flavor, medium body with lasting sharp hops bitterness.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stcokholm)On August 9, 2008Clear copper color, whipped cream like creamy lasting white head. Fruity, bitter, pine, spruce taste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness. Spruce, pine, resin, sweet, sticky, green hoppy scent.

Good, bitter brew with a fresh scent of hops which goes hand and hand to make this a very smooth beverage. Didn’t sell by the single bottles, but a 6 pk is well worth it. Not too strong and for the taste of a good ale, this one can’t be beat.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2009 A nice IPA not over the top hoppy, just a mellow fragrant solid IPA.  Pour is medium golden with a large fluffy head.  Aroma is citrus and pine with some sweetness.  Mouthfeel is medium light carbonation that you dont feel until it hits your throat.  Smooth slightly bitter finish that is much more refreshing than some othe others Ive had.  1/31/09 had it again and I have to add its one of the best IPAs out there.  Top notch hops, top notch quality.

12oz bottle poured a deep hazy orange with an initially large peaky white head that leaves some great lacing.  Aromas of pine and grapefruit follow the blast of hops.  Flavors are very much the same.  Creamy, bitter goodness!

THOUGHTS: Nice but not as great as some of the ratings make it seem. A little harsh for me. I like a little balance in my IPAs.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a light to medium orange with a small, slightly off-white head that mostly diminished, but left good lacing. The aroma was light caramel malt and moderate to heavy pine and citrus (grapefruit and more orange) hops. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and bitter, and moderately acidic; while the finish was moderately sweet and heavy to almost harshly bitter with a long duration. There was orange, grapefruit and pine hops with a little caramel malt. The medium body was sorta creamy with fizzy carbonation and a moderate astringent finish.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2009 Re-rate: bottle from Stan at Lone Hill.  Hops were mildly cheesy, green and fairly fresh.  Texture was refreshing.  This is both mildly orangey and mildly planty and really quite good.  Fresh must be a joke, cask a revelation.  First rate: My thanks to 2nd Lieutennant nbutler11 (retired) for the use of his bottle.  Had this (not immediately, but soon) after Founders Harvest.  Overall, I found this sharper and shallower.  Aroma is sharp and hoppy.  Standard amber color with persistant white head.  Flavor is breadcrust, alcohol, dark melon rind, black pepper and an inhale of vanishing vanilla.  After following the recent thread "Only 1 Beer for the Rest of Your Life" and seeing 6+ responses for this guy, I will admit to being disappointed at the outcome.

The aroma is hoppy, citrus, a little pine. The appearance is a golden orange, cloudy with a big white head with excellent lacing. The initial flavor is bitter, hitting the back of the tongue, the flavor is a little pine, grass, herbs, outdoors. The finish is long bitter creeping to the middle of the tongue. Very good IPA.

Better than I expected.  Aged in cellar for 3 months before trying.  Aroma was great hoppy citrus and spice.  Pours orange with a decent foam head.  Great first taste, citrus really comes through.  Not overly hoppy for this style either.  The finish is a good mild bitter that isn’t over the top either.  For someone who isn’t a big hophead, I could drink one of these a day and be happy.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2008 Poured a golden color from the bottle with a large fluffy head of white foam.  Brimming with hops, pepper, and perhaps even green apple.  Mild lacing.  Awfully bitter finish.  Very average (if not disappointing for its rank)

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2009 Grapefruit, grass with mild sweet malt aroma.  Golden-amber, clear, with lasting-frothy off-white head.  Grapefruit, floral, biscuit and caramel flavour notes.  Refreshing, dry, with medium bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 I got a 1/2 gallon growler of the Two Hearted Ale.  The pour was a clouded orange color with a 1/2 inch white head.  The fragrance is strong with citrus fruits (oranges tend to stick out with a hint of grapefruit).  Also, the glorious hop has a strong presence in the aroma. The taste is very balanced for a beer this hoppy.  The citrus fruits really come out and it has a nice refreshing bitter finish that I love in an IPA.  A great beer worthy of drinking daily.

I keep reading/hearing about this hop shortage...with no sign of an IPA stoppage anywhere in sight. Of course, I am not going to complain when I can still get me hands on some good IPA...but I don’t expect the good fortune to last forever.

I can sum up Bells Two Hearted Ale in three words: soft. Floral. Smooth.

Maybe not what one would initially think when thinking IPA, but that is taking into consideration Two Hearted is an IPA. I love my 90 Minute, but Two Hearted has nudge her into second place. This is, quite finely, the best IPA I have drunk to date.

Bright orange and amber, citrusy herbal hop perfume caresses my nose. A very powerful oily hop presence makes itself known before taking even one sip. And then the surprise. Bright crisp citrus and flowery hops fill my taste buds, but softly and with a very smooth body (creamy). The oils coat my mouth, rounding out into a bitter burst on the very center of my tongue. Amazing. Such a strong head, and yet such a delicate balance of hoppy IPA character - flowers, citrus, and pepper. Its like Two Hearted is trying to say to me "hey. Im here. Im hoppy. Im delicious and complex, more than just a hop bomb being dropped blindly on your senses. Take note of the subtle characters and flavors that make me such a delicious IPA. One sip, and I know you will understand."

And so I say to Two Hearted, I do understand. Fish theme included, a great summer refresher.
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2008 Firm foam that is thick enough to eat with fork and knife. Light amber. Loads of fresh hops aroma. Totaly hop dominated taste with just hints om caramell taste.
12oz botlle.   Wow, what a fantastic IPA.   Pours an golden amber color with nice head and great lacing.   Amazing balance of malt and hops, awesome aroma and taste.   Wonderful hop bitterness too.
12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear gold color with 1.5 fingers of head.  Aroma is of floral hops.  Moderate lacing.  Taste is very well balanced.  Great beer.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC (Thank you Pawola).  Floral bouquet, massive, some citrus, all hop, but love it.  Minor head on this pour, stays very well though, great lacing, burnt orange gold.  Brilliant balance, citrus hop and pale malt just flow together so effortlessly, Id be doing this beer an injustice to try to describe further, very smooth but I love the little sting on the tongue, great hoppy lingering.  Heaven!

12oz bottle. Thanks to TheEpeeist. Pours hazy golden with a fine stable creamy white head & handsome lacings. Nose is hoppy - lots of fruity citrus & floral notes. Overall a hoppy IPA with just a touch of bready malts. Pine, grapefruit & citrus. Very fresh & crisp. Long lasting bitter end! This is quality! Very nice!

Bottle thanks to Alobar!  Probably the best IPA I’ve ever head.  Aroma of grapefruits and pine.  Beautiful combination of sweet malts, citrusy and earlthy pines.  Has good, lasting bitterness but not over the top.  An exceptionally well made beer.
A top notch ipa with a slight citrusy finish and lingering hops at the end. A thoroughly   tasteful example of the style.
Thought I had rated this one.  Similar in some ways to Hopslam, just not as beautiful as it.  Definitely an easy beer to drink, has great hoppy flavor and good bitterness.

On draft, had a simply breathtaking aroma - tons of pine, some citrus, just a real breath of fresh air and was a good introduction for the flavors soon to come.  Appearance was pretty good, a nice dark ipa burnt amber.  Flavor is quite bitter, too bitter, but pleasant - 12 oz. took me a while to finish.    Palate was great as usual with Bell’s.  Overall, just a great beer when you’re in the mood for something extra hoppy and powerfully bitter.  Perfect for summertime sipping.

I’m fortunate that I can get this beer here in Florida.  This beer is a light amber color with an excellent head that leaves plenty of lace.  The taste is well balanced with cake like pale malts underneath the strong hop flavors.  The hops are very fresh tasting and floral and fruity in the best way.  The mouth feel is medium thick and almost perfect for an IPA.  A very enjoyable beer that is in my refrigerator most of the time.
Pours a clear amber with a medium off white head. Very hoppy aroma yet the flavor is a little creamy with just the right bite from the hops. Really good stuff.

This IPA actually does remind me of times spent at the lake house in Garden Bay.  It has a subtle yet well defined hoppy feel that is very enjoyable.  Great cloudy light amber color with a small but suitable head.  A great beer for late afternoons and/or early evenings around the campfire on a lake house beach.

12oz Bottle: Pours cloudy golden w/ a small biege head. Aroma is delightfully hoppy w/ some sweet malts peeking through. Flavor is of piney hops w/ a hint of sweet malts fading into a light bitter finish. Body is rich & creamy. Quite enjoyable, nice beer.

Cask conditioned at Graydon’s Crossing. Creamy head with perfect balance of malt and hops. The two hearts must come from two different beer enthusiasts: hop/malt, because it cares a very even tone throughout yet encompasses everything a beer ought to be. Drink it!

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2009 Pours beautiful burnt orange color with a huge white head.  Aroma is of fantastic floral and pine hops, and the taste is perfectly hoppy.  An incredibly great drinking beer, probably the favorite that I have tried so far.
Off white mostly diminishing head.  Cloudy golden color.  Suspended particiles.  Aroma of pine.  Very hoppy with slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2009 On tap at the flying saucer in KC. Pours a see-through burnt orange body with an enormous, pure-white head that dissipates slowly and remains nicely laced throughout the session. Aroma is an abundance of flowery hops. Lots of citrus with a sweet pine quality to it. Flavor is loaded with flowery hops as well. Almost sharp bitterness throughout, but never excessively bitter. Mildly sweet in the finish with a good amount of lingering hop tang. The palate is easily my favorite part of the beer. Extraordinary balance. Full bodied and chewy with an abundance of malty thickness. Overall, my favorite IPA of all time. The best balance out of any beer I have ever had with an exceptional hop taste. Fantastic IPA that only gets better on tap. A must sample.

An IPA that all other IPA should model themselves after.  Great beer.  Large rocky head with great lacing.  Cloudy amber body with large floaties.  Aroma of pine/floral hops.  Oily texture and long lasting hoppy finsh.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2009 Pours light brown with a very light tan head. This beer is very hoppy with a very hoppy aftertaste. Tastes like a double IPA. Me not being a fan of IPAs did not particulary care for it but if you love hop infused beer you will like this.
Bottle pours amber with large off white head. Aromas of hops, pine, sweet malts. Flavor of hops (not overly hopped), citrus, pine, and caramel. Starts sweet with a bitter hoppy finish.

The aroma hits you as you pop the bottle cap. Wonderful floral and pine. Amber with a big fluffy head that laces nicely. Flavor mimics the aroma with some sweet malt and caramel. The hops last long after the beer is gone. Excellent.

Damn, this is good. Extremely drinkable. Could be a perfect session beer. Just the right amount of flowery hops with a decent malty backbone. Looks killer in the glass and lacing the whole way down the glass. Glad I picked up more than one since it’s not in Texas.
Sorry, I had to give my favorite beer a perfect rating!  I dare someone to show me a better IPA (sorry, Hopslam and Centennial)

Poured from a 7.75gal keg into my nice, trusty 20oz glass.  aroma of freshly cut flowers, light fruit, probably due to the hops.  Appearance is very hazy; the keg was actually keg-conditioned, but this is probably 1/3rd of the way thru the keg.   Lacing better than most Belgians!  Good balance of hops, bitterness and malt.  MUCH better than DFH 60.  A very good beer that I would buy again and again.  For 7%, I don’t get much warming.  Larry rules!
12 oz bottle thanks to fordest for giving this one to me. Very good IPA. Very enjoyable. Nice finish.
This beer has an amazing finish, very balanced but has a good hop content, definately one of the best IPAs Ive had.
12 oz bottle, pours deep golden with a good head and nice lacing.  Lively in the mouth with citrus flavor.

Pours orange-copper witha nice off-white head.  Smells of spicey hops with a hint of pine.  Tastes of sweet well-balanced hoppiness.  I actually was expecting a more intense hop flavor but it is really well-balanced.  A good IPA, but not the best I have had.

12oz bottle...Light copper body--beige head....malty aromas(nice ones)....fresh hops coming through the malts...it smells wonderful--a perfect mingle of the two for my two nostrils...palate is creamy and light, very easy to drink....mild piney flavors, mixed with creamy citrus and just the right amount of malts--distinct grapefruit finish with a hint of orange peel...could drink this all day

This is without a doubt the go to beer. not too hoppy for those who enjoy the more commercially available brews, and yet distinct in personality for the epicurian drinker. 3 cheers to these beers...

Bottle from the trusty original Foodery in Philly.  Hazy deep amber with orange highlites under a tall light tan head.  A little bit of the West Coast in the bright citrusy aroma.  Plenty of grapefruit, miild caramel and a touch of vanilla with a great malt balance.  Medium to long cirtusy finish.  A realy nice IPA.

Bottle served in a Duvel snifter. Now that is one pretty IPA. Pours a lightly hazed orange-gold color with a huge off-white head. Big citrusy grapefruit nose. At first sip you are greeted by malt sweetness that gets pushed aside by a complex earthy, citrus hop flavor. Finish is a long bitter citrus flavor. Quite a good IPA.

Just about the perfect American IPA.  The aroma alone is enough to buy this beer.  Id almost be just happy enough smelling this beer, but to taste it too is a treat.  My favourite drinking beer...could buy it pint by pint if I lived closer to where its served.  Snap this one up if you see it, and drink it fresh.

Bottle from Foodery.  Light amber with good head, retention and some lacings.  Grapefruit/pine hops and caramel malt in the aroma.  Fruity taste that is complex without being ovberdone or everly bitter.  Real easy to drink, great session beer althoug the ABV is a little high.

Im not usually a hophead, but I loved this beer.  It has a delicious hoppy aroma and an enticing golden orange color.  The flavor is rich, malty and hoppy in perfect balance, even for those who dont love the crushing bitterness of some hopped offerings.  I will definitely buy a six pack of this when I am able.
Bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, batch 8427. Cloudy orangeish amber color with a medium head and decent lacing. Sweet and citrusy hop aroma. Bitter and piney hops are nicely balanced.

Pours tan-orange w/ light-tan head. Bitter-sweet-tart flavor. Lots of hops and malt. Powerful flavor abounds. Creamy finish. Boquet is floral.  Glad my sis left half a 6-pack in the fridge for us last wknd. YES!
Orange and hazy in the glass with a moderate head which sticks around for a while.  Citrusy hops (grapefruit and orange).  Leaves very clean and refreshing.  Will drink again.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2009 Bottle:  My favorite non-imperial IPA.  Amazing strong floral hoppy aroma and looks great too with a huge white head.  Sweet initial flavor followed by a bitter finish.  Awesome hops.  Always does the trick and never lets me down.  Amazing IPA, and better than most of those "imperials" out there. Excellent on tap and in bottle.

Bottle from Margaret on a recent trip to North Carolina--Poured a light hazy orange body with a fluffy white head.  Nose of sweet, floral hops.  Lots of brightness in the nose.  Great smell!  Flavor is sweet, rich, and semi-bitter, but more piquant and a bouquet of refreshment.  Citrus, fruity, and mildly piny grapefruitiness.  Awesome!

Pours a hazy orange, with a sturdy white head.  Aroma is floral hops, with a lot of hop freshness to it.  Flavor is subdued malt, with hops on the front and finish of this one.  It could be very refreshing, not as harsh as some overhopped IPAs can be.  The hops in this one seem "fresher" with less bitter bite, and more bitter flavor.  Mostly floral hops, but there are some piny and citrus flavors as well.  Ends with a woodsy cedar note that is pretty easy for me to pick out, and my tastings arent very detailed as such.  I would love it if Bells began distributing in my area.

bottle, perfect champagne head dissipates to a soapy 1/4" ring, pure golden color with some haziness to it, light nose of graham crackers and malty, flavors are excellent wth apricot, grapefruit and peppery hops, finish is bitter but not overly so, a very nice IPA

12 oz. bottle thanks to Secret Santa.  Pours a cloudy golden amber with a moderate off-white head that lasted beyond the halfway point and left a layer of lace with each sip.  Very pleasant aroma of malt and orange zest.  The flavor is equally nice with a solid caramel malt backbone supporting grapefruit and orange hops bitterness.  Some light bitterness lingers for a bit after the swallow.  A little sticky on the palate, which I liked.  Very good.
Draft.  Glad I stumbled upon this.  Very hoppy and strong.  Like this one alot.  Great IPA, maybe best Ive had.

This is one damn fine IPA.  Lacey white head stuck to the glass until the last swallow.  Remarkably crisp and refreshing.  I usually dont go ga-ga over this style of beer, but this is one worth remembering.  A wicked summer session beer.  Cheers.

12oz pour to a huge white head that laced nicely. Wow! Huge nose of citrus, hops, and more citrus. Nice, slightly cloudy orange/pale color that looks light and weak but is nothing but the opposite. Nice balance  considering all you smell is hops and the 1st thing on your palate is hops. It smooths out nicely and finishes with a floral, hoppy, fruity taste that reminds me of Manderin oranges. Very complex, yet quite simple because it is wonderful and all dovetails together into one awesome beer.

Poured from a 12-oz bottle into a pint glass a cloudy golden color, sort of a shade of orange. Smell of citrus hops and sweet malt just get you ready for the first taste. Excellent balance in the taste as the citrus/lemon hops balance perfectly with the biscuit-like malt. One of the best pale ales Ive had.

So I can see why everyone loves this beer...Midas like in color with a 1/2 inch white head.  Aroma is like walking through an orange grove...citrus, floral, and grassy.  Flavor follows with incredible balance of those characteristics.  Not a lot of sugary sweetness but the hops are delicate enough to not need it.  WHY CANT THIS STUFF BE AVAILABLE IN AZ!!!

One of the better/best IPAs Ive had.  Superbly crafted.  Pours an average appearance- pale light straw color, decent size smooth head.  Smells of sticky chunks of bitter oranges.  Flavor has a lemon citrus bitterness, tangerines and bittersweet fruit. Light on any malt sweetness, very much hops forward.  Awesome ipa.

On Tap - The Big Hunt, DC.
Good IPA. Pours a nice golden color - fruity taste - almost like fruity pebbles. Nice finish, didnt taste very bitter to me, but I had a few before. Still a nice IPA, would rather have a Stone.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Hoppy aroma, floral, citric and a hint of pine. Medium body. Flavor is again citric, floral and pine, and has a very nice bitter finish. Very well balanced, never comes off as too hoppy or bitter. Very good.
Amber pour from the bottle with a thick white head. Very hoppy aroma. Slightly fruity taste and bitter finish.

all i can say is wow! this is the best IPA ive ever head. It is amazingly smooth, full of that wonderful IPA flavor, full of grapefruit like florals and taste. To date this is the best ive had. go out and buy one right now!!
One of my favorite beers from one of my favorite breweries.  Great flowery aroma, good bite on the bitterness.  Good balance and drinkability.

Yeah this is a top notch IPA...Bells does it AGAIN.  Beer pours a slightly cloudy golden/orange color with a medium white head.  Aromas are hops, pine, and more hops!  Flavor is delicious.  Hoppy, faint hints on honey, light malt notes, perfect carbonation.  Best IPA I have ever had I do believe.
Why, I ask you, do I have to go to Wisconsin to get this beer?  Bring this back to Iowa now!!  Let me drink this beer more freely!  Did you hear me?!  OK, yea, its one of my favorites...

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2008 Pours golden color, foamy head, long solid bitter flavor. Hoppy goodness for all you hopheads. This is an excellent American IPA because of the IBU as well as a good stable fruity flavor.

12 oz. bottle into pint glass.  It pours a hazy honey color with a big long lasting white head that makes for exceptional lacing.  Though not very complex, the aroma is very pleasant and fresh - all floral hops.  The flavor is not very unique - a hard to achieve characteristic with pales IMO - but very sturdy and delicious; it exhibits a very nice balance between floral/citrus hop flavors and the underlying hop bitterness.  It is medium bodied on the palate with light carbonation,  Overall: I used to think this was overrated (when I used to drink it from the bottle) but it is pretty damn good stuff... a bit overrated, but good.

A touch of haze through a deep golden hue. Thick, sudsy white head gives off huge wafts of cut grass and hints of bubblegum. Nice malt character gives way to spicy hops and a tangy finish of grapefruit and light fruit.
Amazing!  This beer deserves the high percentile is currently has.  Might be the best IPA Ive had.  So smooth and a perfect example of the style.
Man oh man, this was one amazing IPA. Aroma, taste, palate, everything. Amazing, Beautiful representation of an IPA.
Had this at a local bar. Very smooth IPA. One of my favorites so far. The bitter taste is regulated properly but definately there. Also good citrus hints.  Quality finish, highly impressed.

Bottle.  Pour a ruby orange body with a thin lacing of a head.  Aroma is sweet citrus hops with grapefruit, pine and sweet friendly hop character.  A serious SERIOUS standard single IPA, a must in your cellar for its availability.  Fantastic!

In my opinion, this is the single greatest beer ever brewed.

Bells Two Hearted Ale is the color of my wifes skin; a satin kind of brown.

Initially, I taste the bitter in the hops.  This is followed quickly by a smooth slide to a malted garden.

Drinking this beer  is a transcendental experience for me.

Pours out with a golden orange color and small frothy white head.  Amazing sent of hops and slight citrus notes as well.  Taste is amazing.  Huge amounts of hoppy flavoring, yet very drinkable.  Finishes clean with a nice lasting hoppy aftertastes.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2008 Pours a nice orange/amber color with a short-lived white head.  HUGE hop aroma.  A little citrus, a little pine, just great hop smells coming off of this beer.  With all that hop aroma, I was expecting a strong bitter hop flavor, but was pleasantly surprised to find that the hops dont overwhelm the flavor at all.  They are certainly present, but the malt backbone of this beer is so solid that the hops and the malt play very nicely together.  Smooth drinker, near perfect finish.  Great beer.
Simpely the Best...........If you dont like Two Hearted Ale......Your Wrong.

Lately Ive gotten away from these more everyday-type craft beers, but after a day of yardwork, this tasted great.  Pours the color of a well-polished dooknob with some grapefruity hoppiness.  Pillowy head.  The flavor is clean, mildly bitter hops over a faint but unmistakable backtatse of Bazooka bubble gum and some lingering grapefruit.  Sweet finish, but still clean.  A very good example of the style.

Pours a thick white head. Cloudy orange color. As it is drank, it leaves a lace along the glass. Smells great. Kinda grapefruit w/ hops ground in. Tastes amazing. Too good. I will buy for holidays and long weekends or I will be constantly intoxicated.

Aroma is orange blossom and treated lumber.Foggy orange-amber color with lots of fine particles. The big foamy head left wet lace in the glass but it all dissipates rather quickly. Fruity orange and peach flavor. Wet palate and superdry chalky bitter finish.

Pours orange tinted, clear amber. 1.5 inch foamy, white head. Very floral nose. Hoppy, mild, balanced, citrus. Slightly sweet hoppy flavor. This ones delicious. Its strong, but not overbearing. The palate is medium to thin. There are some yeast flavors present even though the beer looks largely filtered. It finishes with a floral accent, a small bite, and an invitation for the next sip.

Bottle, batch 8359.  Pours a slightly cloudy orange-amber body with yellowish white head.  Aroma of orange peel, candy, floral hops, pineapple, and a hint of grass.  Smooth, medium body with a light fizziness on the tongue.  Taste is mainly hops and grapefruit citrus, but it is well-balanced with malts so the hops arent overpowering.  Smooth, crisp, bitter hop finish.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2008 In short: A very tasty thirst quencher grapefruity IPA. 
How: Tap at Surly Girl Saloon (Columbus Ohio)
The look: Clear golden blonde body with a small white head
In long: Nose of grapefruits and pineapples.  Taste is rather intense with more of the same as the aroma (grapefruits and pineapples).  The beer is well balanced but the malt-related flavours/sweetness stay in the back.  A light-medium tartness/acidity.  Aggressive carbonation.  This beer is as tasty as it is refreshing, dangerously drinkable.  I cannot think of a way to make time fly more quickly than drinking that beer, except maybe for being in a coma.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2008 Nice golden body with a lacing white head. Nice floral hop aroma, a little soap. Taste is very balanced with a great palate. A little chew. Malt to hop ratio is great. Very good recipe and execution. Best IPA Ive had yet.  2nd  entry..Yeah... I have convinced my mother  to drink Bells Two Hearts not Sierra Nevada Pale Ale...good  for everyone. Especially her...

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Bottle.  Bought a 6 pack and completely impressed with it.  A great IPA that is incredibly smooth and well put together.  Cant wait to have this again!

update - got on tap at home - amazing beer recommend everyone try this amazing IPA

4/19/12 - after trying many many IPAs this still is one of the best.  

9/11/16 - still my go-to - love this beer so much.

Pours a clear amber color with a thick ivory head, the head maintains well and laces to the sides of the glass.

The aroma is very hop heavy, my nose actually got a little frightened over the expected bitterness.

The taste revealed a much more balanced hop-malt tasste, and a pleasant underlying floral influence. Much better than I expected from the scent (not that the scent was bad, mind you; I was just expecting something far more bitter)

Great mouthfeel, well carbonated but not overdone. No negative aftertaste or dryness of the mouth.

Definately a solid IPA

Serving type: bottle

Bottle. Didnt realize I was going to rate this quite so high when I put numbers to it, but theres just so little left to be desired. The most amazingly perfect smelling beer Ive put my nose to, amazing floral and citrus hoppiness, just the right amount of malt to form the base for the hops to work their magic. Perfect head with tight bubbles. Flavor maybe could be a 10 as well with all those luscious tangy hops dancing across the tongue, just didnt quite live up to that aroma for me, but I dont think anything could have. An absolute joy to quaff, not too bitter or dry, but nowhere near sweet. Magnificent.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2011 One of my favorite IPAs. Beautiful hop aroma. Nice cloudy deep orange appareance. The flavor matches the aroma. Not a letdown through the finish. Stong piney hop flavor, with a nice malt undertone. Smooth finish. All around great IPA

Very much reminds me of Bells Hopslam with a little less kick to it.

Floral hoppy aroma, with a nice smooth finish. This is very well balanced and a very enjoyable beer. I will be buying it again.

This beer pours coppery with an inch of foam.  The aroma is quite hoppy, which smells yummy!  The flavor is dominated by hops, but a great malty finish.  This beer is well balanced.  The body is medium with medium carbonation.  This is a great beer and will remain in my drinking rotation!!!

Nice lighter IPA (i consider this more of a good pale ale).  Reviewing this as a hoppy pale ale (not an IPA), I like the dryness of this beer and how that helps highlight the citric/floral notes of the hops in the beer.  Ive had the beer in bottle and on tap and prefer the tap as the cleaness and crisp hops come through better.  This is a very nice pale ale!

Having brewed this beer as a homebrewer, I think it would improve with alittle more variety of hops (though love cents).

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2009 Update 6/16/09: Bottle, batch 9059 (3/31/09).  Wow, awesome IPA!  Super citrusy with lots of tropical fruits too.  I think I somehow underrated this beer the first time around. 10/4/9/5/17 (4.5/5)

Originally rated on 5/10/08.  Bottle.  Pours a light orange/amber with a thick white head.  Aroma of floral, citrus hops (orange, grapefruit, lemon), and a slight hint of pine.  Awesome, awesome aroma...it just beckons to you! Flavor of hops upfront, followed by sweet malt with some wheat notes at the finish.  Also got some lemon zest.  Perfectly balanced- the hops do not overdominate as they do in other IPAs.  Mellow, super-drinkable, well-crafted.  No bitter finish.  Simply superb. 10/4/9/4/16 (4.3/5)

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 Bottle at home ... bright golden orange ... very american piney hop nose ... bit over fizzy ... tart juicy resiny hops... ok but not great ... 3.5 golden yellow ... thin white head ... soft sweet pine hop ... light lemon nose ... sweet fruit s...pssion fruit ...  juicy hop ... light bitterness ... 3.5

<brr> bottlle at home ... deep thin white lacing ... soft fruits ... massive viiolet nose ... soft oily fruits ... soft crsyat;l meths ... sweet soft orange ... soft floral fruits ... light fruits ... nice 3.7

 Can at home ... packaged 01/12 drunk 27/4 ... golden amber ... small off white head ... soft sweet peach fruit nose ...oily fruit .. soft peppery peach ... oily fruits .. and that long caramel tofffee finish with a little bitter toffee finish... 3.4

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2008 pours a nice copper gold with a thick solid head.
Floral hop aroma (as advertised...though I wont go so far as to say incredible)
Grapefruit-citrus flavour and floral tones in the flavour backed by a subtle malt presence.
Excellent IPA.

Draft @ Barleys:  This is an IPA staple.  Pours a beautiful and jubilant orange.  Smells of fresh-squeezed citrus, and dried flowers.  Perfect balance of hop character. Grapefruit rind, welcome acidity of fresh-squeezed orange juice, and a small budding floral bouquet.  Purity in a glass.
user_location: I F&ckin hate those guys from, Ohio, USA

text: Thanks emacgee.  Pretty good brew.  Great floral hop aroma.  Pours a nice yellow amber color with fluffy off-white head. Taste isnt nearly as hoppy as aroma, but it has a nice malt balance to it.  Finish is very bitter and crisp.

The aroma of this beer is awesome.  It pours an amber/copper color with ahealthy head.  The initial taste, though is a bit weak.  Not nearly as malty and hoppy as some other IPAs I have enjoyed.  It has a great aroma and a great finish, but the taste in between them is not nearly as impresive.

Cloudy light caramel orange color with nice one finger sticky foam.

Spicy floral hops dominate, bit of pine resin and touch of alcohol.

Light, but not too light, sweet malt (biscuity, hint of caramel) underscored by floral bittering throughout.  Bit of woodsy spice builds at the finish to give it a little bite.

Pretty soft feeling, despite a bit of tingling from the moderate carbonation. Medium bodied. PrettyDamnDrinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2010 9/6/2008 - Pine, citrus hops, slight malt in nose. Orangish-yellow body with long lasting white head, little sediment. Dominating hops and hints of malt in flavor. Another winner from Bells, but after another bottle, I dont find this as complex or enjoyable as before. It was even a little watery. 847315

6/14/2010 - Hadnt had this forever, then on a really fresh tap a few times. Definitely better than remembered, the exquisite balance reminiscent of Nugget Nectar except a lot more fresh tropical fruits and less caramel malt. Carbonation allows it to walk lightly despite hop-heavy profile, and it finishes rather long with some grapefruit and melon. 848516

Pours amber-copper color with white head.  Aroma is sharp and citrusy, balanced with some caramel and toffee malts.  Flavor is balanced unlike any other IPA Ive tasted to this date- citrus and herbal hoppiness slowly emerges rather than hitting you in the face and is accompanied by mellow caramel, dried fruit, and some tartness.  Finish is nicely bitter, but certainly not one of the more bitter beers I have sampled.  A finely crafted IPA that proves that quality is more important that quantity.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2008 My favorite IPA.  Smooth and crisp with a great citrus bitterness in the finish.  Absolutely top notch.
Nice aroma of hops and fruit, flavor is slightly sour, reminds me of grapefruit juice.  Goes down very smooth and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2008 Pours dark orange with a large frothy off-white head.  Citrus hoppy aroma, grapefruit,  very herbal.  Very soft flavors.  Some grapefruit, orange, mellow caramel malt, sweet and piney.  Seems like the malts doesnt add enough backbone.  Light/med body with smooth but larger carbonation, slightly watery.  An excellent made IPA very well balanced and drinkable, juicy.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2010 The hop aroma is very strong on this beer, but this isnt without some floral, citrus and cherry and yeast notes. The beer is very pretty with a large lasting fluffy white head, that leaves a good lace, the color is dark gold to light orange. Taste is a fantasic blend of hops with a little carmel sweetness at the back of the tongue. The beer is strongly bitter without too much citrus.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2008 Poured a bright orange with a dense 2-finger foamy head that lingered for ages and left very good lacing.  The slightest swirl sends the head back up to a finger.  Nice.  The fruits leapt out of the bottle at me - oranges, grapefruits, lemons, etc. A slight piny, grassy scent could be detected under the floral fruits, as well as a slightly sweet malt base.  Clean, crisp taste that was dominated by the floral and citrus side of things. Quite a zing on the taste buds. I caught a little bit of the malt in the background, but not much. Zesty.  Medium bodied with a decent clean finish with only the slightest bitterness in the aftertaste.  This is a great example of an IPA, though it was probably a litle bit on the fruity side to be in my top few IPAs.  Nonetheless, a well crafted brew from Bells.

A ton of 12oz bottles.  Pours orangish gold in color with a off-white medium sized head with great lacing. Aroma is very floral with notes of grapefruit and citrus hops.  Taste is of the same with a nice body, and a mild sweetness.  Crisp finish and this is certainly very very drinkable. This is one of my favorite session IPAs.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 Bright golden color.  Beautiful.  Close foam head.  Grapefruit and cream soda aroma with a slight, sharp smell of hops.  Flavor complements great aroma, crisp with a nice balance of bitter and sweet, very compelling, drinkable beer.  Aftertaste actually adds to the experience, providing a great finish.

A- Pours a golden yellow hue with a 1.5 finger eggshell head which leaves a good amount of lacing when it fades. Not to much carbonation is visible.

S- Smells is prodomenately grapefruit and citrus hops, also there is a bready, malty backbone

T- Much more tame than I was expecting but in a good way. Exquisitely balanced grapefruit hops that end sweet and malty. I like this one because even though it has a defined hop presence, it really doesnt overpower anything.

M- Medium bodied, with carbonation a little on the low side for my tastes but this doesnt detract from the brew overall.

D- This is a hugely drinkable IPA. I love IPAs and DIPAs with the grapefruit/citrus hops and this one has that in spades. Its well balanced but my only beef with it is theres nothing that really jumps out and grabs me about it. Would be great (and deadly) to session.

Bottle from batch 8271, bought @ Knightly Spirits in Orlando and brought back to UK by good friend. Poured a lovely golden colour, with a good head and lively body. Lovely hoppy taste with a touch of sweetness. Not quite as  in your face as some of the very heavily hopped USA beers Ive tasted but none the worse for that. An excellent beer.
From mini keg! Poured yellow gold with medium white head. Aroma a beautiful hoppy citrus. Flavor was citrus and mild hops with a bit of a nice bite. Great beer.

Poured into a pint glass. 

Light amber, golden color. Great head with excellent sticky lacing all the way down the glass. 

Citrusy, with aromas of ruby red grapefruit, and a hint of malt sweetness in the background and maybe some cut grass. This smells very fresh and springlike. 

What a perfectly balanced beer. Lovely hops and fruit flavors perfectly balanced with a slightly sweet maltiness that perfectly compliments the hops. This is exceptional! 

Smooth, refreshing, light on the palate yet full bodies. Clean aftertaste leaves you wanting more. 

This is an exceptional beer, and one of the best American IPAs Ive had. Delicious!
A very nice surprise in that it had a clean crisp bite that i found refreshing. It is a good standard IPA.
lots of hops with citrus flavor and copper color texture... aroma is strong

Hallelujah! This beer is awesome. Love to open a couple of these up every now and again. Pours a bright hazey orange colour with a large white head. Aroma is quite aromatic, floral and spice- citrus fruit and slight grapefruit. Clean noticeable hops throughout the beer. well carbonated, well balanced, just a fantastic brew all around.

Citus hoppy aroma and color is a cloudy copper.  Initially I didnt think there was enough hops.  The more I drank, the hops became more noticeable.  They leave a nice lingering aftertaste.  But for IPAs I feel like the hops should smack you in the face while still being balanced.  The beer was balanced but without the smack in the face.

[bottle] Poured clear copper with medium, rocky, off white head. Huge aroma of citrusy, floral hops. Flavor is citrus balanced by plenty of malts. Nice, fairly bitter finish. The rating on this is well deserved.

Bottle (Batch #8335) poured into tulip- poured slighty cloudy dull copper color, light carbonation, parts of a white head formed a ring around the glass with some lacing.  Aroma of pine and floral hops.  Hits the mouth with a defined medium body, malt has a sweet quality to it, hops come in lightly in the middle and are solid on the finish.  Very well balanced and, overall, very enjoyable to drink.

Bottle pours a light haze light amber color.  Has a thick head that laces the glass as you drink it.  Smells of pine and citrus waft in the air as my nose comes in close proximity to the glass.  Has a medium mouthfeel and tastes like pine, sweet caramel, and some mild grapefruit.  Very tasty.
Great IPA.  Nice hazy yellow.  Piny Hoppy smell.  The taste....oh the taste.  Best beer ive had in a long time A+
Pours a cloudy yellow color with a small white head. Aroma is very floral hops. Taste is floral and piney with a nice fruity finish. My favorite IPA

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 So, I went to my local sports bar, and much to my surprise, they had this on tap! So of course, it deserves a re-rate. It was just as hoppy, and citrusy, and heavenly as all the other times Id had it from a bottle, but i think even a bit more so on tap. I think this will always be on my top 5 list, as it is THE most perfectly crafted beer I have ever had.

Poured a golden orange color with a very thin head. Head retention was minimal and patchy. Aroma was not as strong as expected but good hints of citrus were present. Flavor was commanding with a great strong hoppy finish. Clean, keeps you wanting more...

Pours hazy gold with a 1 finger head.  Nose is of rasins and spruce and then spruce and raisins  .... and hops.  Taste is a fruity (almost grapefruit but not quite)  folowed malty sweetness and then by hoppy bitterness.  I am not a pale ale guy but I can appreciate the work that went into this.  It is extremely well thought out in its complexities.  It is hard for me to get over the spruce nose when I take a sip.  That being said, if you are of the IPA loving community, this beer would be the cats ass.
Golden in color.  Very hoppy aroma.  The flavor is full of sweetness up front, and tons of citrus in the back.  Very full body.  Great IPA.  I really wish I could get this at home.

Bottle. Orange color. Malt, grapefruit, pineapple and red berries in the aroma. Initial malt character blown away by a firm fruity hoppiness. Red berries and grapefruit. grassy. Pineapple. Medium to full bodied. Very fruity and tasty IPA

Another winner from Bells, Hoppy like an IPA should be, great cascade, cling and longevity of head just like it should be, the smell of the hops is out of this world, the taste unfogetable and lasting, Bells has once again brewed a winner. From start to finish, this brew is top of the line, bitter yet malty with a nice blend of both, this beer didnt get this rating for no reason, the aroma, color, taste from start, middle and finsh are quality.

I keep hearing a lot about this beer, but I was underwhelmed. Maybe it was built up a bit much. Amber pour with a light tan head. Citrus and hops in the nose. Flavor is hoppy with a nice enough malt backbone, but it just seems like a one-note beer to me. It was just ok.

bottle poured a fairly hazed amber color with steady carbonation and a thick light tan head that coated the glass as it fell. aroma is nice sweet fruity hops, pepper bite, and thick caramel malt. flavor is all about the luscious hops but plenty of malted body to thicken it. such a well balanced flavor. finishes with hops resin coating the tongue and bitterness that lingers. really good drinking stuff that i wish were readily available near me.
12 oz. bottle.  Damn good IPA, strong hops aroma and flavor.  I cant get enough of this stuff...
Good earthy aroma, reminds me of fishing in the UP. Appeasing Michigan thick ale. mild after taste due to high alcohol and hop content, but would absolutely drink again.

I was first introduced to IPAs with this beer, and my appreciates and done nothing but grown for it. 

Its full of hops both smell and taste-wise. Its only slightly bitter on the palette making it very drinkable. 

It poured a dark orange with a solid head.

One of my favorite IPAs, and for the price, definitely one I like keeping always stocked.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2010 Re-rate 5/1/08. Pours a cloudy, orange color with a moderate sized off-white head. Aroma is very floral hoppy with citrus fruits. The hops are definitely citrusy sweet with some orange, grapefruit and lemon and a soft finish. Slight bitterness and rather easy drinking. Id definitely get it again, thanks kissmybass for the sample! Re-rate 11/2/2008. Orange color, nice thick frothy head, lots of lacing. Floral hoppy aroma, subtle but nice. Citrus hoppy flavor, lemons, oranges, and a real tropical taste to this. Slightly bitter and dry. Not massively hopped but I like it, enough flavor and one of those beers you can drink just about anytime.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2010 12 oz bottle courtesy of Linus stick. Pours an unfiltered hazy 18k gold color with an ample white head. The aroma is ripe with citrus fruits; lemon in the forefront with oranges and some grapefruit filling-in. The flavor is loaded with biter grapefruits, walnuts, caramel and cotton candy. The Mouthfeel was malty but just a bit thinner than i would have preferred. The finish was long with lingering cotton candy. Overall: This is a very drinkable IPA, one that goes down very easy, I love it. Thanks Linus.
This beer is incredible. Different from IPAs with biting hop bitterness as it has a citrusy and fruity flavor that blends very well with the hops. Balance is the key for this one.

Bottle from Ughsmash.  Pours a deep golden sunset with thick head. I love the biscuity malt and centennial hops aroma that perfectly matches the taste. I wish they would distribute farther east because this would be my goto beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a thick white head.  Intense floral aroma with notes of citrus.  Flavor is initally sweet but ends with a clean, hop finish.  Great balance in this beer.  Another winner from Bells.

Double Dead Guy Ale
Look - Beautiful amber/orange color. Nice off white head. Looks thick.
Smell - malty sweetness, hoppy, grapefruit hop notes, citrusy/fruity and a hint of floral/pine hop.
Taste - oh...my...god! This is amazing! Alcohol is present, hoppy and sweet maltyness to it. Hop taste is just like the smell.

Yuengling Chesterfield Ale
Look - Yellowy, crappy. Looks like piss
Smell - horrible, like a dead skunk.
Taste - corona, but suckier. Horrible. Carbonated water/apple cider. Thats it.

Bells 2 Hearted IPA/Ale is a very hoppy yet well balanced IPA. Dont get me wrong, its hoppy, but Im a hophead so well balanced in an IPA means theres a lot of bitterness but an uder laying tone of malty sweetness. The look of this beer is an orange amber color with a nice head off white head. It smells of floral, and piny hops but is still very inviting. The taste is piny, and floral just like the smell. Really smooth. Maltyness is subtle.

Bottle, whenever it was i had it at home. Aroma is really appealing citrus and great american hop. Taste is soo drinkable, like i did the bottle in a matter of minutes, the malt is bold but its just soo tasty an the hops dominate soo much. Amazing beer.

Amber body with a thick white head.  Very fresh hoppy aroma along with the typical citrus profile but mostly floral.  The flavor is lightly bitter, and pleasantly sweet.  Pineapple fruitiness is evident.  The flavor is well rounded and nothing is too overpowering.  The common sticky hop palate is noticeably absent.  This is a highly enjoyable IPA.
one of the best ipas made in the country.  this beer is crisp and delicious. notes of coriander citrus, and beautifully floral hops.  i reach for it often.

on tap at Acadia cafe, Minneapolis. big hops aroma. light amber color with nice white head. crisp mouth feel. lots of hops but the bitterness is mild, honey, grapefruit. this is a bold beer. I like it a lot.

Brown 12oz. bottle into a pint glass.

A dull and hazy amber beer with an off-white head that sticks around.

A great hop and orange rind on the nose. The hops dominate and leave little room for the faint bread malt lurking. Bells nailed the style with this one.

Citrus and hops again. Slight malts towards the finish. Hop oils remain through the finish and into the aftertaste. This is a bitter one but inline with the style.

Medium body and carbonation, this one goes down fine.

Its loaded with hops and bitter. A thirst quencher and probably a good one. Good for several rounds but not all night.

A tasting at Three Cellars Milwaukee. One of the best beers I have ever had !  So hoppy that you easily get the citrus flavor. And at the same time smooth as can be. This beer is a must for any taster !!!

At Three Cellars tasting Bells Brewery night.  Cloudy orange beer with a very strong grapefruit & citrus nose.  Very hoppy tasting throughout with a nice finish.  This is a solid IPA, but you knew that already.

Pours a misty golden amber with very small head. Minimal lacing. Extremely floral hop bouquet - about as good to the nose as it gets! Very bitter tones of citrus hops assault your tongue and never really let up. A bitter, almost brassy after taste - nearly too much, Id like it a bit more balanced to the sweet side - excellent beer nonetheless. Very warming alcohol content.
This is pretty much the best single IPA around in my opinion.  It has great balance and a very clean finish.

12 oz bottle. Man this is a good beer.  Pours a nice dark gold/amber color with a 1 finger fizzy white head.  Aroma is wonderful.  Fresh, piney and citrusy aromatic hopswow!  Nice malt backbone also present in the aroma.  The taste is nice and balanced.  First you get the piney and citrusy taste (a lot likely due to the aroma) and then a nice dose of a solid malt backbone.  Hops come back in for the finish with a nice bitter (but still fresh) finish.  While the malt backbone does a great job balancing all the hops this beer is all about the hops.  Great fresh hops (wait did I say they were fresh yet).  It really doesnt get any better for any IPA.  Medium bodied with a decent dose of carbonation.  Mouth feel is a little thicker than expected but it really keeps things interesting.  Its a great and very drinkable IPA.  If I could get it easily the fridge would almost always be stocked with a 6 pack or two.

This is what an IPA should be- floral nose, hops upon hops that are slightly mediated by a carmel malt, and a full mouth feel.... I am addicted to the spiced hop finish that lingers, and this beer was one of the high points of previously living in Michigan.

This wonderfully aromatic ale is nearly all things to all people.  Its amazingly powerful floral bouquet is unparalleled.  Its strong hop presence satisfies those who worship at the hop alter and its rich balance with the hops and malt character satisfies many of the rest of us.  This might be Bells best beer.

Mini Keg. Pours a nice warm honey color with a thick 2finger egg shell head that sticks around and leaves heavy lacing. Aroma is wonderful, it smells like tulips and hops. Taste is very clean, starts out malty and then quickly moves to the tart wonderful flavor of hops. Not near as sticky as their Hopslam with a much better smell. This is definitely my favorite Bells brew of the ones that I have tried so far.

On tap.  This poured a deep golden with a white head.  The nose shows off the hops with citric and also a bit of piney hops along with a touch of caramel malt.  The palate was well-balanced with the hops beginning and ending with the dry/bitter finish and the malts picking up the body in the middle.

beer pours golden in color with a creamy white head.  small bubbles and good lacing.  aroma was like crushing a hop in your hand.  fresh, bitter, spicy, and very very floral.  Flavor was quite a refined hop flavor.  lots of citrus, but not grapefruit really.  some spicy hops.  well balanced and not over the top with hop flavor.  good clean palate with the feeling of some hops scrubbing the tongue.  A delightful IPA

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2008 Draught @ Flying Saucer, Charlotte. Pours golden with medium white head, dissipates quickly - solid lacing. Nose is clean sweet citrus. Very vibrant. Flavor is well balanced - nice caramel malt body counterbalances the big citrus hops that assert themselves early and often. Fairly straightforwrad beer, but executed with deftness. Nice body, sticky mouthfeel. Moderately bitter, hoppy finish. Great balance, great beer.

o my it is good to be home. smells like nectarine and peaches and looks as good to match. some aromas of earth and cat pee but in a good wholesome way. tastes lush with a sharp sweetness and sticky syrupy mouthfeel. extremely good stuff. thank you dad for this very welcoming home present!

On tap at the Oldsmar Tap House (FL) on 3/15/08. Pours clear golden with a thin whitish head. Smells of flowers, hops. Flavor: hoppy-bitterness, slightly sweet, hints of citrus. Slightly bitter lingering finish.
The best most, drinkable IPA I know. Floral nose, full mouthfeel, butterscotch malt backbone that I have learned to crave, well balanced by a slam of hops. Fit for the Gods!

Bottled. Poured clear and amber with a nice, off-white head. Citrusy nose. Flavor is grapefruit, malt, and caramel, with a nicely hoppy finish. Refershing. Ive also had it on tap at Vinos in Louisville, and its even better on draught.

Bottle. Amber beer with an off-white head. Grapefruit/summer fruit aroma. Grapefruit, pine, caramel flavor. Nice hoppiness, but could tone down the malt just a bit. Medium bodied. Lingering grapefruit and caramel.

12 oz bottle...Poured a caramel color w/ an offwhite head. Great citrusy hop nose, followed by some caramel, and sweet malts. The flavor was perfectly meshed between the malt and the hops. A little caramel, and a little pine and citrus followed by some bite. Not too heavy to too watery. This beer is very easy to drink because of its great balance. Wonderful IPA!

20 oz. cask draft at Beer Engine in Lakewood, Ohio.  This is a quintessential IPA that measures up against just about any other one that I can think of.  Wonderful, creamy off white head that sticks around for about half the pint.  The floral bouquet is just classic and the flavor is perfectly balanced.  What a wonderful introduction to Bells if you havent tried on already!
Bottled.  Phenomenal IPA.  Clear golden colour with a medium white head.  Sweet piney hops aroma.  Very drinkable with hints of bubblegum and a well-rounded bitterness.

Got this bottled at RFD in D.C.  Wow!  This is an amazing brew.  Hoppy chewy smell.  Looks light golden and delicious, with a perfect head.  The taste... oh wow, the taste.  Perfect balance is the first thing that comes to mind.  Decent malt presence is blended so smoothly with the perfect balance of hops.  No lingering bitterness to ruin it.  The beer finishes much smoother than most IPAs... excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2010 Pours a nice amber color with thick white head.  Citrusy aroma, very hoppy and bitter taste.  Nice beer.

Update:  Need to revisit this one now and again, as its now my favorite beer.  The most perfectly balanced beer Ive ever had.  Incredible balance of hop bitterness and malt sweetness.  So crisp and refreshing, its a session beer to me even though its 7%.  Citrusy and sweet, not too heavy - just perfection.

Bottle courtesy of Colemgm8.  Pours a cloudy golden amber color with a  smallish white head and nice lacing.  Nose is fruity citrus hops. Palate is a malty background with citric hops like grapefruit  and orange peel.   Nice smooth finish with a lingering hoppy aftertaste.  A very nice IPA.

Bottle.   Nice rusty color and off-white head.  Aroma is sweet with notes of bubblegum.  Taste is very hoppy with definite centennial bitterness.  Aftertaste is a little harsh with slight alcohol warming.  A nice beer.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2009 My "go to" IPA. 

Clear, brass amber color with a white head. Nice fingers. Hoppy, floral aroma. Bitter but mild hopy flavor, with a hoppy bite at the end. Tastes like weed, really. Nice carbonation. I really enjoyed this IPA.
Pours a golden color with a thick white head.  Sweet and fruity aroma of peaches and apricots some floral essence coming through.  Nice bitter flavor with the fruit notes accompanying it.  Very Good

Pours a mottled golden color...good frothy head that keeps going like the energizer bunny.  Aroma is very pleasant...fruity, citrusy, hoppy with some caramel malts mixed in.  Flavor is wonderful...lots of bitter hops up front and in the rear with a lot of orangey/lemony hops...just beautiful!  Strong caramel malt backbone gives this brew a lot of dimension.  Very sweet rendition of an IPA, which is probably why Im a big fan.  Very easy to drink and sessionable as it is light on the palate without being watery.  Usually I prefer the IIPAs to the IPAs due to the increased malt content, but whereas the Hopslam didnt do it for me, the Two Hearted is a gem...great job Bells!
great IPA, but its better on tap.  Strong citrus balanced with the bitter flavor.

12 oz bottle from a trade with thecheeseman. pours light orange/golden with a small white head that shinks never really goes away. aromas are hoppy with some sweet caramel behind the hops. flavours are nice hoppiness which is well balanced by the malts. the hops are more prodominate but this is an IPA afterall. this is the most drinkable IPA ive ever had and if i could get it in my area it would be my choice for house IPA. very nice beverage!

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2009 Bottle from Tyler! Nice amber color, good lacing and nice head. Taste is floral hops with a nice citrus touch.  Smooth, easy to drink. One of the better IPAs out there. A must buy and a great beer.*****UPDATE***** Just had a "fresh" mini keg of this. WOW! Really good IPA, much better then the bottled version. Nice hop bite in the taste but texture was smooth but light. Really easy to drink. Great beer. Thanks robert for sharing the mini-keg!*****Last update*** Just had some fresh bottles.... Great IPA. Perfectly smooth, light texture. Great floral and citrus hops on the nose and taste. Awesome beer....

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 VERY NICE. Great appearance, pours orange with a perfect head. Aroma is all hops, very inviting. Big flavor, with little bitterness on the backend. So many hops that it tastes like an IIPA, without the alcoholic punch. Creamy and smooth on the palate, with a great finish. All around great IPA, and my favorite of the non Double IPAs.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2008 Rerate 10/16/08 to update the text of my review, rearrange the numbers, and finally bump it up a point.  Pours hazy golden orange with a bubbly off-white head.  Heavy floral aroma, some grapefruit and spices.  Nicely bitter floral and citrus hop flavor and a tiny biscuity pale malt background.  Slightly bubbly palate and good lacing.  This is a great IPA and so drinkable; I can go (and have gone) through a six pack in one night.

pours a golden orange color.  great white head with excellent retention and lacing down the entire glass.  strong citrus and floral nose.  The bitterness is just right.  The balance is perfect.  It is a great example of an IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2008 Bottle pours a rich golden copper hue with a thick foamy off-white head.  Great aroma of floral hops and citrus.  Good hoppy flavor with just the right amount of bitterness in the finish.  Very tasty, drinkable IPA.
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2008 After drinking a pint of Evan Williams after a tough Friday at work (which can  kill anybodys tastebuds).. upon further inspection My score still stands.
Bottle.  Pours golden yellow with a thick white foam head.  Great fresh hops and grapefruit aroma and taste.  I like this beer.  Very drinkable.

Bottle. Pours a golden copper color with a white head. Smells of refreshing floral hops with citrus undertones. Tastes of intense piney hops flavor. Not overpowering though. The sweet malty backbone stands up well to the intense hoping. Long clean finish. A very refreshing brew. One of the best IPAs I have ever had. Would definitely recommend this brew!

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2008 I love this beer.  Sometimes I dont want to drink anything else.  Nice golden amber pour--hazy with generous white head.  Wonderful fruity hop aroma and taste of fresh grapefruit juice and a nice floral and slightly bitter finish... I know no better IPA.

One of the best examples of a well balanced IPA.  Pours a hazy golden orange with a foamy white head.  Beautiful aroma of floral and citrus hops with a solid malt backbone.  One of the smoothes easieest drinking IPAs Ive ever had.  A nice balance of maltiness and citrus and floral hops.  Awesome!

What a beer. I cant get this in Chicago, so whenever I get up to Michigan I always buy a six-pack. Color is gorgeous, aroma is incredible, and the taste is all hops with a good malt backbone. If you like IPAs, this is the king.
Bottle. Pours golden w/ opaque clarity and little head. Plenty of hops taste but goes down smooth, bitter citrus-y finish.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2008 Poured into a pint glass. Hazy apple juice color with a big eggshell head that leaves a ton of lacing, all the way to the bottom of the glass.

Aroma is very tropical, with orange and pineapple hoppiness.

Flavors echo the fruity hops of the aroma, with fresh pineapple followed by a decent dose of bitterness. Not too much malt, maybe a bit of yeasty dough.

Medium-light body, a little undercarbonated, dry, not particularly clean finish. Supremely drinkable.

Had on draft at Peachs in Yellow Springs, OH.  IPAs are my favorite beer style and Lord knows, Ive had aplenty.  But, somehow, I just cannot see how 2 Hearted warrants a #2 rating.  I mean, it is a great beer, but the 2nd best IPA?  So, I put it to a small test.  Tonight in a blind taste test, it whipped Victory Hop Devil and previously it beat 60 Min. IPA, Goose Island IPA, Commodore Perry IPA and Avery IPA.  2 Hearted is big, complex and full of citrusy hop flavor from beginning to end.  A very solid, crisp easy drinking yet satisfying beer.

Bottle. Poured clear copper. Great hoppy nose with an off-white head. This is my favorite IPA so far. Hops are there in full force, but extremely well balanced by a subtle caramel malt finish. This is a great beer.

Floral hops indeed. Some earth and grapefruit too. Its nice to have an IPA that leans towards floral hops as opposed to citrusy ones. Got a spicy kick in there as well. Malts are sweet, but only a little too much so for my tastes.
12oz bottle.  A fantastic IPA!  Grapefruit, pine, and other citrus fruits dominated the aroma.  Flavor was an awesome combo of both hop bitterness, and sweet malts.

Aye my illegitimate bastard of a baby.  This is one brew that I always come back to.  This a classic American IPA with all that goes along with that.  Two hearted also happens to bitter and aroma their beer with one of my personal favorite hops Centennial.   The beer pours a perfect clear darker golden color.  The head is thick white and lacy that seems to linger on the glass as much as the aroma does.  The aroma is all hops, hops, and more fantastic hops.  The taste is definitely that signature centennial hops palate: earthy, spicy, and piney all in one.  TOP NOTCH!

Finally had a chance to give this a try, living in Illinois has its disadvantages.  I was a little worried that I would be let down by this, but I wasnt - a very well made and balanced IPA with a fuzzy hoppy backbone.  On tap IPAs seem to settle down a bit, and I think thats what made this even better.  I would drink this all the time if i could.

One of the best IPAs that I have ever had.  Smells of hops and fruit and flowers.  Taste is the same and leaves a very pleasent after taste in the mouth.  I will certainly purchase this again and again.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2011 12 oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy, murky amber.  Significant off-white head, sticks with it.  Aroma is a fruity, very floral hop aroma.  Smells a bit like banana or pineapple.  Wow.    Flavor is also dominated by intense fruit and hops.  A bit of a pine note to it, which isnt unpleasant at all.  Very crisp.  One of the best IPAs Ive had.  - 2/18/08

Its been a long time, old friend.  Just had a Two-Hearted Ale, special delivery.  Wow again.  What an amazing beer. -12/10/11

Pours a delectable amber gold with retained bubbly white head and some minor spotty lacing.  Every stage of the beer is dominated by hops: from the pungent, musky aroma (strangely, or subliminally, reminiscent of fish scales), to the citrusy, well-attenuated palate, to the final resiny quinine-bitter finish, all steps of the way point to hops.  Which is not to say that this beer is a hop bomb- it is well balanced without resorting to being overly bitter.  A lovely IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2008 Hazy yellow-golden color with a medium head. Very strong floral hoppy aroma. Taste is slightly bitter, with evident grapefruit and the powerful taste of hops. Very well balanced, great beer.
Bells Two Hearted Ale is an amber orange colored beer with a pronounced off-white head. With a serious hop aroma, intense flavor and lighter finish, this is a great IPA.

Citrusy aroma with a bit of a floral note. The pour is a golden amber with a one finger head.  Flavor is great with a nice complexity in the relation of the floral hops with the sweet malts that in no way overpower the hops.  Nice lively mouthfeel.  Really good beer.

Pours a light orange/gold with a decent lingering white head. The aroma is stunning - a huge nose of floral hops with maybe a bit of underlying citrus. Great balance in the flavor. Lots of sweet malt backbone that blends really nicely with the floral/citrus hop bitterness. Nice smooth mouthfeel with a very clean, bitter, refreshing finish. Very nice IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2008 12 ounce bottle from illini08. Thanks! Pours a brilliant cloudy orange with quite a bit of carbonation and a one finger width white frothy head. The aroma is a blast of hops and citrus. Tastes very hoppy with hints of orange. It has a light mouthfeel. Left a pleasing bitter taste in the back of my mouth. This was an extremely refreshing and tasty beer! An excellent brew!

One of the best Bells creations. Superbly well balanced.   Add some Guiness to it for a Black-Heart.  If you are hesitating to pick this up at the store: smack yourself.  One smell and youll be sold.
nice hoppiness and blend of citrus and bitter.  great clean and crsip finish
Pours smooth with a light 1/2 inch head. Lovely floral and grapefruit aroma. Full hoppy flavor with very little taste of alcohol. Simply one of the finest IPAs Ive found.

This is one beer that lives up to the hype.  It has all the features, aromas,  and tastes of a traditional  IPA, but is very well balanced.  The beer is a cloudy orange coloration with a minimal white head.  It is easy to drink because the alcohol isnt noticeable.  Some IPAs I have had have a strange bitter aftertaste or are overloaded with certain flavors.  Not so with this one.  This is one I will have again.
Smells very good and fruity.  Good amount of head.  The hops are very tasty with just a tad of bitterness.  My favorite overall beer at the moment.
Great IPA!! This is an old taste note, which I thought I"d already logged in here. Nice citrus hops with perfectly crisp finish. One of the few beers I could just drink all day.
Pours a honey gold with a huge creamy white head.  The aroma just gushes with candied fruit and citrus.  The flavor is a touch sweet with well balanced hops and a nice bitter finish.  Beautiful.
From a bottle poured nice amber color with a good amount of head.  Nice hoppy flavor with a lasting finish.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2008 Draft. Orange color with slightly off white head. Lots of citrus on the aroma. Some sweeetness. The flavor is full of hops with a nicely balanced sweetness some citrus. Finish is long and bitter.

12oz bottle,  pours copper w foamy head, Taste is hops and pine. aroma the same. Have had this numerous time and dislike it more each time. Over load of pine. The last time I had it I could not finish

mommy its all burny! topflight ipa that is strong enough but not overwhelming. wonderful aroma and taste of hops. slightly cloudy and golden this is plenty fruity, citrusy and floral. smooth and well carbonated such a wonderfull balance and body. the best simply must be tried! enjoy!

My new favorite IPA. This is absolutely delicous. A good foamy white head.  Color is a dark gold, with really good lacing. Smells hopsy, with a good flower smell to it. Taste is phenomenal, great hoppy flavor that goes down ever so smoothly. Delicous.

Good beer.  Ive had on tap and in bottle.  It may have been the night, but I liked the tap better.  Beer is very hoppy, and maybe a little too citrusy, but I liked it just the same.  I think I like DFH 90 minute IPA a little better, but very similar beers.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2009 one of the best out there. definitely stands apart in the IPA world. the aroma is absolutely unique and the best IPA aroma ive come across. huge fresh hops dominate with deeply floral aromas of roses, tulips, with some pine, grapfruit, and sweet apricots. the flavor is simply amazing. huge hop bite that tingles as you sip balanced by sweet citrus and floral flavors that are one of a kind. slight malt backbone adds balance to the bitter aftertaste. mouthfeel is extremely smooth. this beer is the perfect everyday drinker if you are lucky enough to be able to get it year-round. bells has really perfected this one. definitely one of my favorites.

Great IPA.  If you can get it on tap, do so.  Great nose, head and mouth feel on this ale.  Likely Cascade hops are the overwhelming aroma on this one.

Nice appearance as well as high alcohol makes this one a total winner.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2009 Overall, one of my favorite to drink on any given day.  Nearly prefect, all around beer that is complex enough never to get old.  Smell and taste are deep and evolving
Ive never given a beer a perfect score on any category. This beer however looked beautiful for a pale. Huge, I mean huge, head with an orange body. Nice full ale taste. Overall a great beer.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2009 Poured clear orange copper color with off white huge head. Strong smell of floral hops, citrusy, piney, grapefruit. Has a medium body that is creamy with crisp carbonation. Good stuff. My go to IPA that I can get in my area.

Summer of 2006 - Holy freaking WOW! I didnt think it was possible to be this blown away by any kind of pale ale. This beer was awesome! Beer poured an orangey color, absolutely huge, foamy head. There was so much lacing, it was more like the head clinging to the glass than normal lacing. The flavor was citrusy, but not just grapefruity, like other IPAs. Some sweetness from malt, caramel maybe and fruit and a perfect amount of bitterness. But the real highlight is the mouthfeel. This beer has the creaminess Id put up against any stout on draft or pale ale on cask anywhere. Phenomenal. I honestly dont think its possible to do an IPA better than this. I might have a new favorite brewery, after having this, Kalamazoo and Expedition!

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2008 This is the IPA that the beer gods would drink.  Terrifically balanced, plenty of citrus and pine notes.  When I think of IPA I think of this beer.  Not much head or lacing, but the head poured slight orange.  I think 7% is the perfect IPA alcohol content, any more then that and it loses a lot of smooth character.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2008 Golden orange with a tinged white head. High carbonation with a great hoppy flavor. What a great IPA.

Bottled. Wow...talk about refreshing! Light amber pour with some fine microbubble head and fizzy carbonation. Looks great. Sweet floral hops aroma with grass and pine notes, it smells of fresh orange slices and grapefruit. Clean, straight to the point flavor similar to the aroma with peppery hops. This beer is all about balance. Nothing stands out as too malty, sweet, or overly bitter. Finishes dry and crisp, with the alcohol barely noticeable. Hats off to Bells on this one. I could drink this all day!

12 oz. bottle. Fortunate to have the opportunity to have this beer since they dont sell Bells in Illinois. Poured out like gold! Nice head. Floral rich aroma, make my mouth water. Taste is smooth nearly perfect, clean and balanced. This will be the basis of all IPA from now on, best in palate and flavor. Top of my IPA chart.

Bottle at HogTownHarry Fest 08.  Gold with thick off white head.  This has a huge reputation so perhaps I was more critical with this than if it was just another beer.  Really resiny hop.  Piney grapefruit.  Some sherbert.  Then I tasted it.  Fairly thin and sharp in mouth.  Some decent fruit on end.  A pretty decent IPA.  Pretty easty to drink, malts are ok.  Certainly doesnt taste of 7.0%.  Its good.  Aroma is great.  Finish leaves me a bit cold.  Tangerine fruit is good and the hops are excellent.

Bottle about one -two months old. Aroma is mild floral hops, straw color with slight haze and good lacy head that holds well.  Initial flavor of hops and hint of mint and anise.  The beer finishes clean with little bitterness lingering.  nice full flavor on the pallete with just enough sweetness.

Had this on tap.  Nice copper color with a thick white head.  Floral aroma hits you right away.  The taste is floral hops with some pine and a bit of malt with a nice bitterness to it as well.  Once again Bells makes a great beer.

12 oz bottle
Aroma: pleasing mild floral 
Appearance: tall, creamy head that lasts and leaves a film on surface and glass; amber orange color, slightly cloudy
Taste: refreshing, pleasant bitterness thats just right and long lasting; finishes with a suggestion of sweetness. Invites sipping and savoring like an impressive wine.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 A great staple in my beer drinking. Very floral but well synchronized with the bitterness and sweetness of the malt. The smell is hoppy and the taste is far from monotone provide a long tasting experience.

this is a VERY good ipa.  nice and hoppy, but well balanced with a slightly caramely malt flavor.  nice orange/copper color with a small head.  went really well with the burrito it was sitting next to...

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 Very floral, both in flavor and aroma. Very easy on the palate, but it makes an impression for sure. Piney flavors and grapefruit abound in this IPA. Its very good - amazingly good.
Excellent, easily one of my favorites.  The floral aroma, gentle bite and clean finish embody what hop character should be.  Nice copper color too.

Bottle. Poured a beautiful copper color with a fluffy white head that lasted until the end. Huge citrus-flower aroma of hops. Great balance of big malt and hop flavors. Great mouthfell. One excellent beer.
Wonderful beer.  Pours a copper orange color with a white head.  Very hoppy aroma.  Delicious hop aftertaste lingers.  Very drinkable time after time.
I first had this IPA on tap (which is best to enjoy the floral aroma). Lovely rich golden color, slightly cloudy. A gorgeous, rounded hop flavor and fresh finish. Perfect for any season.
My personal favorite IPA.  Pleasing to the eyes, nose, and mouth.  Rich copper color with a creamy head.  Very up front with the hop flavor, with a crisp bittersweet finish.

12 oz. bottle. Pours copper and produces a nice off-white head. Aroma is bitter with citrusy bite right off the bat but also floral notes. The taste is nicely balanced with sweet malts and hops complimenting each other. The hops are the star here with citrus/resin shining without overpowering. A nice strong bitter finish with a medium light mouth feel. As IPAs go this one is outstanding with a balance that make this big hoppy beer a treat bottle after bottle.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2008 Appearance: Pours a hazy copper body with a large, foamy white head.

Smell: Pale malt aroma with notes of flowers, zesty citrus, and cooked pineapple rings.

Taste: Pale maltiness with a light touch of caramel sweetness. Fruity, even juicy citrus and pineapple flavors. Moderate bitterness and acidity. Crisp, relatively clean finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: A fine example of an IPA!

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2012 Great brew. Aroma is heavy hops with apple and a dash of oak. Pours a dark yellow with a frothy off-white head with excellent lacing. Taste is beautifully IPA with a nice bitter finish over its long duration. Light to medium body, creamy mouthfeel with something just south of lively carbonation. A nice warming finish. Leaves me feeling exceptionally refreshed, I could drink a lot of this stuff!  
re-rate courtesy of ucusty:
Pours with a hazy yellow body with an off-white head that leaves strong lacing. Aroma of grapefruity hops, toffee, some apple, lemon hops and a bit of barnyard (odd). Taste is a very malty and balanced IPA. Liveley carbonation. Ar:8 Ap:8 F:8 M:4 O:18 (odd that the re-rate is the same as the original). 
Bottle dated 4/25/2012. Consumed 1 month later. Pours with a crystal clear golden hued body with a big frothy white head that leaves good lacing. Aromas are floral, citrusy, grapefruit, tangerine, light pine. Medium iced tea. Light bready, caramel malt structure. Pretty clean ester wise. Flavors are of citrus, pine, grapefruit, corn nuts. A touch too sweet for my tastes, but still pretty good. Medium bitterness overall that doesnt linger. Hops are still the star, but there is some balance. Medium bodied, slightly fuller carbonation than expected. Pretty solid.

Draught @ Scottys Brewhouse in Indianapolis. Amber color w/ nice aromas (unfortunately I had a stuffy nose). This was sweeter than usual with a blend of citrus flavors and hops. Extremely smooth finish with plenty of lacing on the glass. This beer makes a perfect 6 pack for friends because it is not overpowering, bitter, or too sweet.
From a bottle.  Pours amber color.  Aroma of huge piney. citrusy, floral hops.  Taste is sweet from the malts and the cirtusy hops with some sticky piney flavors that coat your mouth.  Very good IPA.

Thanks jay23
 Bottle poured a nice clear golden yellow with a good two finger head 

Incredible floral hops aromas along with citrus and pine 

Another surprise to me that this beer was much sweeter than I expected more malt forward then the nice piney citric hops kick in 

Clean light palate nice carbonation 

Very drinkable, terrific IPA one of my tops so far
One of my personal favorite IPAs.  Thge head ius incrfedible.  The lacing is tremendous and there is a great floral and hoppy flavir.
Simply delicious! Only had it once a while back, but its good to finally get to rate it. Pours golden amber color with light head. Smells and tastes of sweet hops!

Very nice IPA, pours with a great head and lacing throughout. intense pleasing aroma as good as any IPA out there. tastes great but not as unique the aroma, still on par with any non imperial IPA youll find

before i try this bottle, let me say before larry pulled out of ill. this was my favorite beer. wish this bottle was bigger, now i really hope bells/kalamazoo brewing whatever he wants to call it gets back in illinios. about as well made as can get. hops, hops & hops, but the balance is what makes this beer so good to me. very well done

Bottle. Light to moderate malt aromas of roasted and nutty, moderate to heavy hops aromas of pine and grapefruit, light soap for the yeast, and pineapple, cherry, pepper and chalk in the background. The average sized head is creamy, white with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is sparkling clear, light amber/orange. Flavor is lightly sweet, acidic and bitter to start, then the long finish is lightly acidic, moderate to heavily bitter and a touch sour. Palate is medium, oily, and has a lively carbonation.
