It finishes lightly astringent and dry. A very fitting taste for an IPA and a perfect palate, but the hop aroma alone is reason enough to kkep going back to this excellent beer.

I really enjoyed this brew. Nice sweet flowery smell.  appearance slightly hazy honey color. The flavor is really striking very nice. Sweet, flowery. Creamy head hopy.. Very nice. This is really good. Very hoppy. l like the fish the most!
Nice head, pretty color.  Fresh aroma, nice grapefruit bitterness. Not for the faint of heart or the hopsphobe.    Will drink again, and again.

Poured an attractive orange/amber color with nice white head that hangs around a while and leaves good lacing.  Aroma is piney and citrusy hoppiness.  Flavor is beautiful balance of maltiness and hoppiness that again is piney and citrusy.  Mouthfeel is perfect and drinkability is great.  This is one fine IPA.

This is a heavenly American IPA.  Excellent hop balance -- enough bitterness and hop presence to make it phenomenal, without overdoing it and sending it to the second-tier West Coast variety.  This is definitely a top-tier ale not to be missed!
A piece of heaven in a glass. As one other rater put it, it would be a regular in my fridge if it were locally available to me. If you havent tried it, do yourself a favor.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2010 My favorite IPA so far...absolutely delicious in flavor...wonderful aroma...great character (yes, beer does have character). There is a malt presence in the background, which provides a nice bit of balance against the hops. All the typical hop flavors have come to party....citrus, grapefruit, bit of lemon....and lets not forget the piney hoppiness....and essential of any great IPA. A must have.

12 ounce bottle in pint glass.  Slightly hazy pale golden straw with lasting white head and full lace.  Citrus and fresh hop aroma.  Mild honey apricot fruity sweetness with bracing bitter lemon and fresh hop finish.  Medium body and medium carbo.  Absolutely delicious and refreshing.  Strong but not overdone or "extreme."  The perfect American IPA.

In my top five - and I love IPAs.  This beer manages a unique flavor while staying true to the style.  Great color, deep amber with a hint of orange, slight citrus taste and great hops flavor through the finish.

The best IPA I have ever sampled.  Aroma a mix of perfect hops and fresh oranges.  Beautiful creamy off white foam head with a rich orange color.  Flavor of florid hops and a touch of orange on the tip of the tongue...perfectly balanced, and not way overdone like most IPAs.  Finishes with a fresh, lingering hop flavor on the tongue, but with the perfect "bite."  Never have been disappointed with a Bells Beer, and keep up the good work Bells!!!

12 oz from dpjuart.  Pours a deep orange with a slight haze and some amber hues.  Had a thick frothy white head.  Smells of strong florals and citrus with a heavy dose of mangoes or apricots.  Pretty highly carbonated.  Orange or mango taste with the bitter hitting at the end.  Surprisingly subdued bitter considering the amount of hops in the nose.  It is a nice earthy citrus hops.  The carbonation gives it a good thick body.  A really high-quality beer.

12 oz. bottle 
pours a clear, burnt yellow color with a small, white head. A strong citrusy, floral smell is incredibly nice. Light bodied with an airy texture. A very good , grainy malt taste meshes nicely with the perfumy, spicey hops. 
A great ipa, this would be a regular in my fridg. if it were available locally to me. July 2005

Serving type: bottle
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Medium gold, with a very faint haze (from all the hops?). Head is dense and rocky, leaving lace after each sip, all the way down. Aroma is fresh, hoppy, very orange like (Amarillo?), with hints of pine. Flavor follows through with a definite orange-like hop flavor upfront, followed by a soft, sweet malt. Both carry through into the tail, which is well balanced and light. Great IPA, with a very fresh character.

Hazy, golden ipa with nice white head.
Floral hop aromas. Hoppy with citrus and pine. Well balanced with just enough malt flavors coming through. Smooth with good body. Higly drinkable.
Best IPA I had to drink.

12oz bottle at Annie Baileys Irish Pub, Lancaster, PA...pours vibrant orange-amber with a decent white head...aroma is clean, citrusy, floral...taste is of orange, hops, nice bitterness...decent lacing...really good IPA...hopefully i can find this in a 6-pack somewhere.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2010 Hazy orange pour with a thick white head.  Lots of piny dry hops on the aroma.  A very slight sweetness immediate hits the tongue before being overpowered by lots of bitter hops.  Some fruity hints - peach and citrus - though not as fruity as some beers (though those are mainly IIPAs;  this is one of the best IPAs have had.)  Some bread and yeast on the finish.  Nice body and perfect carbonation.  A top IPA!

Related: 6/4/10 dont know why ihad this at only a 4.  It is one of my favorites, especially on tap.  Definitely deserving of a 4.5.
By far and away one of my favorite and go to IPAs.  The hops are present at the start, middle and finish.  If I had one IPA to choose this woud be in the running.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2008 Okay let me preface this with BELLS TWO HEARTED ROCKS MY SOCKS. Had this on tap instead of bottle at work : the Sharp Edge Creekhouse in Pittsburgh PA.  Pours a light golden orange with a fluffy white head, the aroma is wonderful, floral citrus, and a whiff of sweetness.   Very smooth in transition of flavors grapefruit, some caramel like tones, perhaps some apricot.  Creamy mouthfeel, finishes with a refreshing hop crispness.  Not overly done just enough to tart the mouth.
On tap in Winona. had heard it was a very good ale. Definitely wasnt disapointed. would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Real hoppy aroma.  Seemed like it was dry hopped.  Taste was immediately hoppy as well.  Smooth finish and all around good hoppy ale.  Would buy again.

Bottle. [Thanks to my Secret Santa]
Pours a lightly hazy orange amber with a smallish bubbly/creamy white head. Good lacing. Aroma is brilliant, lots of hops. Lemons, grapefruit, pine, lavender, flowers and a little crystal-maltiness behind it. Low carbonation. Flavour is mildly bitter at first, then expands with a well-balanced malty base of sweetness, then finishes medium dry with a good powerful hop addition. Grapefruit hops are most apparent, so are lemony and grassy hops.

12oz bottle from ealdent. Pours a deep, golden orange with a slight haze and wisps of cloudiness. The head is thick and white, and it is relatively long-lived. The aroma is fantastic - a bouquet of hops, particularly citrus and floral smells. There is some malt sweetness in the aroma, too. The flavor follows the nose starting bittersweet with sweet crystal malts and a big citrus and earthy bitterness. The middle of the tongue picks up more bitterness - more earthy and herbal than citrus - and is still well balanced by malts. The ester profile is fairly clean. The finish is dry and bitter with notes of grapefruit juice. The mouthfeel is medium in body, creamy, and crisp; the carbonation is just right. Overall, a delicious American IPA.

Bottle.  Golden-orange, with medium white head, hazy.   Aroma is grapefruit, soap, lemon, perfume, and some caramel--smells very good.  Flavor is pretty good, with a semi-sweet maltiness, and a very hoppy flavor.  The hop balance is impressive--citrus up front, which mutates into a nice grassy bitter aftertaste.  Extremely tasty beer.

Nice IPA.  Pours hazy orange with a decent lingering white head.  Lacing all the way down the glass.  Aroma of heavy citrus.  Taste is also sweet with a citrus hop bite and strong malt backbone.  Fiinish is dry and very bitter.  Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated with a medium body.

One of the better IPAs that Ive ever had.  Absolutely delicious. 

Nice hazy orange, good foamy head.  

Great citrus/grapefruit aroma here.  Smells really fresh and hoppy.  

Very citrusy hoppy taste with a nice bitterness to the finish.  Lots of grapefruit here.  Very juicy.  

I have two bottles of this left and Im going to try to space them out so I can enjoy them.  Im definitely going to get more when I run across it again.  Damn good IPA that is all its cracked up to be.

Pours a beautiful orangish amber color with a thin, airy, white head. Great blend of hops and malt on the nose. Smells of citrus. Tastes sweet with a citrusy bite. Nice malt and hop backbone. Tingles up front. Sort of thick but not too thick. Good carbonation to this brew. This is a very drinkable beer.

My first beer from cask and love it. Cloudy burned orange with a nice off-white head and full lacing down the glass until I finished it. Looks unbelievable. Powerful scents of floral and citrus, strong hops, the nose is much better this time then out of the bottle. Tastes of strong citrus and powerful dry and bitter hops immediately followed by delicious malts. The carbonation is very low which allows more flavors to present themselves. Dry finish is perfect, no bitterness at all. An impeccable brew with an improved twist from the cask. MMM

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2008 This is about my 7th beer of Christmas 2007.  This is very highly rated IPA.  It is very good.  A floral nose greets you after pouring.  The grapefruit flavors are present as an after taste.  This medium bodied IPA is special.  the alcohol is well balanced with the hops bitterness.  The off orange slightly cloudy IPA poured with a two finger head that laced down the glass.  The head stayed with beverage.  This is an IPA to remember for the future. I had another recommended at Capital Ale House.  It is a great IPA.  The floral hop aroma hits you as you begin to drink.  I am raising my score.

My favorite beer overall, so I figured it should be my first review. Crisp, drinkable and perfectly hoppy, this is the holy grail of IPAs. Great floral and grapefruit taste, light orange-goldish color, with a fantastic finish.

Lighter color than Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale which I had earlier in the day.  More golden rather than copper like most IPAs.  Amazingly well balanced and very smooth.  Pineapple notes along with the normal citrus IPA flavors.  Seven percent alcohol?  I had one and I wanted about six more.  So delicious.
bottle. Copper color - a bit cloudy. Clean, but hoppy aroma. Very good - rich and very hoppy.

$9.49 for a six pack at Total Wine.   Wonderful hop aroma fills the room on opening the bottle.  Theres no mistaking its going to be a monster IPA.   Looks great with a small white head on hazy amber beer.   Flavor is much smoother than expected but absolutely loaded with floral and citrus hops.  Not overly sweet but has the pale malt sweetness necessary to match the hops, and a delightful bitterness on the end.  Smooth and soft and incredibly drinkable. Not even a small fault to be found  Near perfection in an IPA.   World class by anybodys standards.

12 oz. bottle pours a cloudy orange color into the tulip glass.  An inch of foamy, fluffy head gave way to sticky lacing on the sides of the tulip.  A very piney, flowery aroma was balanced nicely by a sweet malt scent.  A very drinkable IPA with hints of pine, grass, flowers and some malt.  A bitter taste and crisp, clean finish.  A nice IPA, but didnt live up to the hype for me.

5L keg can.  Whoah nelly,  this could be a problem...Pours a hazy amber with a nice thick white head.  Floral hops dominate everything in the aroma.  Flavor is floral hops,  grapefruit,  sticky malts,  and even more hops.  Finishes bitter and crisp,  but not overly done.  A really well done IPA.
Bought at a local grocery store.  Pours a hazey gold.  Smallish head.  Very smelly aroma of hops.  Tastes of varied hops, very chewy.  A nice example of the style.

Pours a deep, hazy golden with a generous white head that quickly retreats--very pretty.  Incredible hop aroma and complex hoppy palate, yet so drinkable.  In a world of many solid IPAs, this one still stands out as one of the most delicious and distinctive. Very close to a 5.0.

A Mes rate: 355ml bottle at Steves Xmas booze up.Utterly gorgeous amber gold colour with a stunning white head. Really close to a 5. Outfunkingstanding aroma. I really could sniff at this all day. So so nosable. Incredible hoppage. Grassy, floral, piney, spruce and everything else. A masterclass of an American hop aroma. Words can not do it justice. More show stopping hops in the flavour. Resinous and maybe a little caramel. Light sweetness. Outstanding bitter finish with amazing length. Bloody marvelous beer!

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2010 bottle on 7/4/10.  Two Hearted Ale lives up to its high ratings and praise among the craft beer community.  It is a very well balanced IPA which delivers on all fronts.  Two Hearted pours a deep yellow / light orange with a quarter inch white head.  Light citrus hops, sweet caramel malts and big orange peel.  Full mouthfeel with plenty of orange, lemon and light grapefruit hop notes followed by a smooth sweet malt backing towards the end.  The malts really round everything out well and take this beer to a new level.   Sweet and bitter finish.  Love it!

bottle.  Outstanding IPA from an extraordinary brewery.  Solid body and hop character throughout.  Pours a deep golden with a thin white head which becomes a thin white lacing.  The hops come through on the nose as you take a sip and flow throughout the top and back of your mouth.  Soft on the sides of the palate.  Average carbonation.... very crisp and easily drinkable.  Simply wonderful.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 A cloudy amber/orange color with a great head. The aroma is citrus, hops, and floral notes. The taste is quite hoppy, but not insanely so. A smooth mix of flowery and citrus sweet flavors abound. A distinct IPA flavor that is really well made. Im not a hophead, but this is a top IPA. A great drink. OK, I need to re-rate this, it is an amazing beer. Batch 9953 thanks to Timbo. Very fresh, huge oranges, peel and the fruit. Awesome. Can from Beermongers. Batch 15361. Lovely, soapy. Bitter. Perfect little 4 pack and can design.

Light brown unfiltered beer with a quickly feelting white head.  The aroma is filled with yeast and flowers and apples.  The hops are there, but are not overpowering.  The flavor is a lot more of what I was expecting out of an IPA.  Although, it is very nicely balanced so that the hops are not overly bittering or aromatic.

Wow, this is a really really great IPA with an amazing boquet of hops and flowers and otherwise on the attack.  Perhaps the best attack of any IPA I"ve ever had.  My only con would be is that the beer is a bit thin on the pallete and prefer a beer with more viscosity.  This goes right to my top 3 three IPAs of all time.

12 oz bottle.  Pours beautiful hazy deep orange with faint white head.  Scent is hoppy with citrus notes.  Flavor is very well balanced, although it is a hop heavy beer it is not overwhelmingly bitter and very smooth and easy to drink.  The beer that steered me towards ipas and other "hophead" beers, and still the best ipa ive had.
This is the beer that started me down the path to hop-head ruination.  Centennial hops and lots of them.  Floral/citrus notes, lots of IBUs and packs a real alcohol wollop.  And that aroma!
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2009 This is a top shelf IPA. Hops galore - pine, citrus, good bitters, good malt thickness. Awesome brew

12 oz. single bottle from Total Wine in Jacksonville, Florida.  FINALLY, BELLS BREWERY ARRIVES IN FLORIDA!  Pours a hazy amber color with a nice white head.  Aroma is nice with citrus and fruit tones.  Taste is amazing, I noticed a unique aftertaste that is, what, fruity?  This rocks.  Thanks to Total Wine for bringing this to Jacksonville!

From bottle : Pours a hazy apricot color with a half finger of white rocky head, that dies quick but leaves great lacing.  Aroma is wonderful, fruits, citrus and pineapple, flowery hops, it is very nice.  Taste is hoppy, with nice bitterness, also has a great balance with the malts to make it incredible drinkable.  Medium bodied with a smooth palate that is lively towards the end.  One of the best IPAs by far.

Wow this IPA has got to be my hands down favorite. Nose is fruity and hoppy but not dry. The taste is sweet and hoppy and I get a bit of cluster hops in my mouth. Taste malty but almost perfectly balanced. What a great beer, bells has done it again. Thanks Kryptic!
A very good IPA. Mine was a little sharp, could have used a little aging for a couple months.

Bottle.  Pour is golden orange with a thin white head.  Aroma is flowers, some citrus and a hint of pine.  Great balance in the flavor, rounded out with a nice amount of bitterness.  This is a classic IPA in my opinion, dont know why I dont get it more often.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2010 (bottle) Pours light cloudy amber with a nice soapy white head.  Aroma is wonderful, I could smell it even when my nose was some distance from my snifter.  Aroma consisted of a large dose of pineapple, nice orange with some grapefruit too.  Taste was lacking somewhat, but there was some caramel there, but mostly fruit grapefruit and orange, with a nice finish of bitter grapefruit peel.
Have revisited this beer often and it never disappoints.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2010 [Bottle] Pours slightly hazy orange with a small lingering white head. Huge fruity aroma of pineapple, lemon and grapefruit with a bit of malt in there as it warmed. Taste is a little bitter up front, followed by a nice maltiness that the citrus hops blend smoothly into. Could stand to be a little thicker and the finish could be a bit longer too. A very nice beer though.

Drewbeerme, thankyou! Pours a light amber with a foamy head. Hint of lacings and cloudyness. Nice flowery hoppy smell. Bitter with lots of hopsaromas. Pink grapefruit also some sweet berry-like hops aromas. Hint of caramel hidden soemwhere behind the loads of hops... Just enough to balance it. Medium bodied. Light carbonation. Bitter hoppy finish. Very yummy, Indeed!

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2008 Wow, 12/06/07 12 oz bottle.  the smell is better than christmas eve.  I could smell it all evening.  Great taste of hops/malt balance.  Notes of grape fruit and citrus.  This is an example of how all beers should taste.  Thank you god
Fantastic head, mindblowing aroma, and an absolutely fantastic body. The hop and malt balance is perfect for this IPA. I daresay, one of the best IPAs ive ever had the chance to taste.

The body on this beer is amber with a one finger white head. The aroma has a ton of grapefruit in it. That grapefruit is present in the flavor as well along with a bunch of hop bitterness in the flavor but it is balanced with the malt. As it warms up, the sweetness become more up front and brings the balance more toward the center. This beer has a medium body and it fits the beer perfectly.
BottledOrange, somewhat hazy colour. Head looked ok. Aromatic hop and apricot aroma. Flavour is more aromatic hops and apricots.
Mini-keg. Slightly cloudy copper pour, big foamy head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grassy floral hops. Flavor is bitter floral hops with hints of citrus.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2011 Pours a a clear amber/yellow with a nice head.  Smells like citrus; lots of grapefruit, lemon and, pine.  Bitter hoppy flavor with a strong, long lasting finish.  I was particularly impressed by this beer, it was more than good.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2007 bottle at ds.  pours a slightly hazy honey color, with a big fluffy off white head that lingers and leaves a good lacing.  big citrus pine aroma that i can still smell pretty strongly over the fryer grease that dominates the air by the bar.  floral and pine hop taste, with a good backbone of a bready milkshake malt.  solid bitter in the finish, with a touch of sweetness to temper it.  medium body and a good coating mouthfeel, with plenty of carbonation.  still one of the best beers to keep around.

rerate:  when not sitting near the fryers at ds, the smell comes out considerably more.  everything i said above, but with a candy bready note in addition.  a bit nutty in the flavor, and a penetrating bitter.  great stuff

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2009 Pours golden with large lacing white head. Huge citrusy and slightly floral hop nose, some peaches over a soft malt sweetness. Big orange hops, mild sweetness with a satisfying bitter finish. Solid goto IPA.
---original rate: 3.6---
Poured somewhere between golden and copper. Head doesnt stick around long. Very piny hoppy aroma and strong citrus/grass hop flavor matched with a nice malt backbone. I enjoy it, but still getting used to the style.

Two Hearted is the beer I drink most often.  Bottle.  Light amber color.  Nice head that dissipates moderately quickly.  Strong aroma of hops (piney and citric).  Light-medium mouth feel.  Nice hoppy taste with some grapefruit and nice bitter finish.  Not a lot of malt.  Easy drinking for an IPA.  When I want more malt, I go for DFH 90-Minute instead.

This beer is what I consider a "hole" in my ratings... a beer I first had years ago, and have probably had several times since then, but somehow never got rated.  And I dont remember it being this good... this is really an outstanding IPA, as in one of the best Ive ever had.  This might be my second favorite, only to DFH 90 minute.

12 oz bottle courtesy of franksnbeans.  Pours a cloudy, light amber color with minimal white head.  Wonderful aroma of hoppy citrus and sweet candied fruit.  Taste is very appealing sweet citrus with some smooth bitterness, not sharp.  Mouthfeel is medium.  I almost passed on this but am glad franksnbeans sent it because it was great.  Best IPA Ive had.  Definitely want more.
Hazy light amber color; big head. Aromatic hop, oranges and ripe apples. Good body, very malty, with strong hopping, some fruitness (oranges). Powerful and long final.

bottled; nice crisp taste hops; not much balance but par for the IPA course; nice hoppy smell; very clean mouthfeel; not a lot to distinguish it from other top shelf IPAs - hop devil, stones, etc. but excellent company

12oz Bottle, thanks Steve!  Excellent Stuff!   Love the hops!   Bitter but well balanced IPA/APA. The finish is long, earth/grass.  So drinkable, for a big beer.  Very impressive, and a great example of a beer style that I love.

12oz. bottle - pours cloudy, unfiltered orange/gold with a big, frothy white head. Aroma is very grapefruity, piney and extremely floral. All hops. Flavour is equally hoppy, a little more earthy/grassy than the aroma but still packs a big hit of citrus. Bitterness follows, but this is a very smooth and very well balanced IPA, highly drinkable. Spicy and crisp in the finish with a lingering hop aftertaste. Lovely beer.

Bottle.  Aroma piney and floral hops just spring out likes its mid spring in bloom.  Poures a golden amber.  Flavor is hoprific, lots of em in there no doubt a touch of toasted malt.  Palate is creamy yet thin and the finish is crisp hoppiness.  Overall, I cant believe Ive passed over this for so long.  Is there a beer that Larry and the crew make bad?

kinda cloudy, decent looking head.  looked syrupy coming out.  apricot and floral aroma.   light bodied, smoother than i was expecting.  tastes very good, but the after taste kind of kills it, its almost like drinking a stale fruit roll up.  like the smell, apricot and hoppy in taste.

Bottle. Very  wonderful aroma, pine, grapefruit, citrus, fresh and clean. Dark golden with an apricot hue, foam head very fulfilling and nice sticky lacing. Thick and chewy yet very sessionable when needed, great hoppy flavor and overall my favorite.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2007 Fantastic beer, great balance, I absolutely love the hopping ;-).  Wife drinks budlight and even she likes this one.  One of the few beers I stockpile.  Now that I can find it in the metal minikegs Im a happy camper .. of all Bells beers, this is the hardest to find in stock here in SWVA.
Strong hop aroma, but with a hint of sweetness.  Flavor follows suit.  Just a touch of sweetness with a lot of hops.  Very good  IPA.

Bottle.  Pours hazy golden.  Great floral aroma.  The hops are what this beer is all about, you can taste the hops all the way through.  Finishes very clean.  At 7% alcohol, this beer is rounded out.  One of the finest IPAs Ive had.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 batch 7951. hazy orange shade of brown with a fluffy short lived off white head. aroma is brown sugar/caramel, citrus and piney hops and some fresh pineapple. flavor is well balanced...not too sweet and the hops are there for sure but not prickly. aroma carries over to the flavor with the pineapple showing up again. hoppy dryness on the finish and long lingering aftertaste. creamy carbonation/mouth feel. 7/4/8/4/16/3.9
9223.

really malty and caramel-y up front. bitter and drying on the back and finish. crisp, extremely well balanced and terribly drinkable. 7/4/8/4/17/4.0
bottle.  Light hop aroma, followed by a strong hop flavor. A smooth drinker.
one word.....hops.  i tried this once a long time ago and didnt like it.  i dont know what i was thinking.
Charlotte-Draft.  The mild aroma does not prepare you for the citrus hop explosion that awaits.  This sucker was sweet as candy, VERY apparent hop flavor, but zero "pucker" effect. SOOOO smooth.

Pours a pretty foggy amber with a decent off white head. I could get a good whiff of this one even before I had poured it out of the bottle. Nose is perfumed pine hops. Flavor is a mouthful of hops that stays consistent.  Thick hop flavors just stay with you. Feel has a good carbonation to it and a the liquid is pretty good as well. Overall this is a very good IPA. Definitely one for the hop heads.

This beer has incredible balance. The nose opens with floral heather, and honied malt, with sweet stone fruit hops. The palate is immediately overwhelmed by a rich and crisp bitterness followed by a lingering malt sweetness. A true American classic.

Aroma is rich and resembles a Belgian Tripel or Quadrupel.  Flavor is great and opens a variety of flavors to the palate inlcuding many fruits and spices.  It drinks smooth and has a rich, clean, frothy head.  Definitely recommended!

Bottled sample, from my notes - Aroma is delicious citrusy, floral and sweet. Color is deep golden with a very slight haze(pour carefully). Streams of fine bubbles with a small head and clinging lacing. Incredible flavor and balance of sweet malt and citrus-floral hops, spice, vanilla. Dry, hoppy looooong lingering finish with just enough malt. Stunning!

Bottle.  Purchased at brewery.  Pours lovely golden colour, not as dark as many IPAs Im drinking these days. Very floral nose, reminiscent of Rogue or Stone (definitely west coast) but a little more floral, not as grainy.  This knocked me on my bum just with the nose.  The great thing about this beer is its not too hoppy, not too bitter.  My partner, a decided stout, porter and lambic woman, also loved this, and she tends to eschew the hoppier ones that make me have to sit down.  As she said, its very fresh tasting.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Case & Keg Beer World Boca Raton, FL at $2.00 Good

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2009 Orange with big, floatsam off-white head / Bright nose of citrus and hops / Medium, lively body with long, biting finish / Flavors of orange, grapefruit, and pine, with just a touch of candied sugar on the finish / A gold standard.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2007 12 oz,. bottle. Hazy old gold with a nice thick head. A well balanced IPA to be sure. No as much hop as I was expecting but right on the mark. This is a top IPA and now one of my favorites.

If you love IPAs then dig in!!!!

Enough hops to tame the beast inside you.  Lovely slightly cloudly amberish color.  Hops lingers even 30 mins after consumed.  Im not even a huge IPA fan, and I could appretiate this robust brew.

Tap. cloudy orange color with a thick off white head. Sweet floral aroma. Slight citrus kick. A little swseet with a hoppy bitter finish. Not as bitter as I expected it to be. This beer is well rounded and has more going on than just that hoppy bite one might expect from an IPA. B

Hops from beginning to end.  Bright golden color with significant white head and lots of hops in the nose.  Malt sweetness and hops come together at the taste for a very flavorful combination. An enjoyable IPA even for a non-hop head.

Slightly medicinal with fruity notes, reminds me of Flintstones vitamins. A lot of spice and mint, watermelon rind, a bit of sweetness and residual sugar in the resiny, oily palate. Overall, quite good and uniquely earthy.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2008 One of my favorite IPAs and a staple in my beer fridge.  Well balanced IPA with a good amount of bitterness and very hoppy.  Had this at the brewery but I really want them to ship it to Illinois again.
12 ounce bottle.  Gold color with a nice white head.  Taste has some citrus and some pine to it.  Finish is a little bitter. A well balanced IPA that is enjoyable start to finish.

A little super pungent at first, but then I start to really, really like it as I go down the bottle.  Tastes like nature, the nature the bottle alludes to.  I do want to know more about this "two hearted" concept... related to fishing?

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2013 ReRate: Bumped my score -- need to give my favorite beer my highest rating (technically 4.8 is my highest possible because I give every beer 3 for Appearance. all beers look good). This has been our goto brew for as long as its been available in Florida. The only other we get as regularly is jai alai cans -- but those are super fresh.  Not always the case with 2hearted, but still great.  Pairs well with most foods. Perfectly drinkable of my favorite style.  Original Rating 10/25/2007: 12oz bottle. Pours a clear golden with long lasting white head and decent lacing. Aroma of pine and floral hops and slight citrus bouquet. Very drinkable, refreshing, and well-balanced with a nice touch of bitterness. Hoppy and smooth. All around a good IPA.
IPA?  Well, maybe so, but a bit more substantial than most other IPAs.  Excellent overall, but does not "look good" in a glass.    Hence, just short of perfect.
Lovely IPA.  Current favorite for this hop head.  Well balanced hops - citrusy with a bitter finish.  Simply a joy to drink.

12 oz bottle. Light amber - orange with a nice off-white head. Citrus and pine hops in the nose. Very balanced flavor with a lot of malt up front and a huge bitter hop finish. Grapefruit and pine flavors. One of my favorite.

Sampled at the Newtown Brewfest 07 with Stegosaurus.  Thank god they were their this year. I love this company.
Hazy orange color with a citrus/pine hoppy aroma. Fruit/hop and sweet malt melted in my mouth with a perfect bells blend.

(Bottle, Akkurat, Stockholm, 19 Nov 2007) Orange colour, slightly hazy, with huge off-white head. Fruity, floral nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, orange peel and hints of pine needles. Fruity, floral taste with grapefruit, orange and pine needles. Great IPA with a lovely, but balanced, hop character.

12 oz bottle at Eulogy Bar, Philadelphia.  Hazy light amber/orange in color with a nice medium sized off white head that leaves a ton of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is of big, fruity, and resinous hops- grapefruit, orange and some passion fruit.  Taste is also very hoppy with a ton of citrus and a nice firm piney bitterness...medium bodied, a touch of sweetness across the palate.  Finishes bitter and it lingers nicely.  Another great beer from Bells.  Too bad Larry Bell hates NY!!!

12 oz bottle - pours a cloudy glowing golden creamed honey hue.  Large rocky head that lasts forever and leaves its mark all down the glass.  Huge grapefruity citrus aroma along with a decent amount of mint and rose petal.  Flavour just dripping with resinous hops, bitter, pungent, herbal, minty, green.  Good amount of grain to backup all this hop overload.  A touch of alcohol and some yeastiness as well.  Long fruity then bitter finish.  I only have three more, but I wish it was 3 cases........amaaaaaazing.  Best IPA Ive had, period.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2009 Bottle thanks to drewbeerme.  Poured a nice orange color with a fluffy white head.  Great aroma of flowery hops.  Decent malt backbone gives way to a awesome, fruity hop flavor.  Nice, sweet undertoness of something, toffee perhaps, round out the flavor.  Bites your tongue and is easy to drink.  Another great beer I have Drew to thank for.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2007 12 oz. bottle.  Pours hazy orange with a thick white head.  Good lacing.  Floral hop nose with hints of carmel.  Nice fully carbed mouth feel.  Head sticks around.  Wow.  Hop explosion.  Very earthy hop flavor with a nice malt backbone, Carmel malt flavors.  A very nice IPA.  One of the best Ive had.  To me, tastes more of a traditional English ESB, probably because of the hop varietals, although lacking in malt character (ESB-wise).  Big fan.  Definately glad I bought a case.  EDIT: 12/7/07-Theres definately a lemony/citrus taste to this also.  Fantastic beer.  One of my favorites.

Fuck yeah Bells. You continue to leave the slew a shit american microbreweries int the dust. Perfect IPA....I would love to taste a Bells double IPA. Have yall made one?.....Im in Florida and have only tasted five of your fine brews....

Poured from a bottle, this beer appeared to have evidence of more chill haze than I would have expected.  The head was large, though thin, but had good retention.  The aroma was full of somewhat sharp flowery hops with citrus in the background.  Flavor is milder than expected, but absolutely deliciously balanced.  Its mildly sweet with a smattering of grapefruit and a little pine on top of the crisp bitterness of the hops.  The mouthfeel is delicously silky and crisp.  This is an interesting beer to me.  Somehow the overall experience is greater than the some of its individual characteristics.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2009 Bottle pour but very good match to what I had @ HDG on tap. Great IPA. Super well balanced aroma and taste. Citrus, caramel, sweet fruits. Nice hoppy taste balanced by caramel malts and plums and citrus and pine. Deliciousness is what it is.

Very good IPA here. This is one of those beer that you can smell from across the bar. A gigantic hop aroma full of citrus, grapefruit, and tropical fruit causes your mouth to water. Flavor is very hoppy with a crisp bitter kick. Awesome beer.

From dra19 via trade.  Thank you Dennis!  The pour was a barely cloudy thin copper color with a decent light tan head that only provided minimal lacing.  The aroma was a pleasant blend of floral hops, sweet citrus and some barely noticeable caramel.  The flavor was surprisingly dominated by floral hops with citrus and pine not as in your face as I would have expected.  Almost medium bodied and a very creamy, very solid mouthfeel with a great finish.  Very good.

I fell in love with this beer again while in Indy.  I got it on tap at 2 different restaurants, and getting good beer on tap is a real treat.  II would move to Indy from Cincy just based on what I got on tap.

Back to the beer.  Great taste and smooth.  I liked how strong it was it didnt take much to get a buzz!  Enjoy it if you find it.

Great brew. My heart skipped abeat when I saw it at the liquor store in Minneapolis. Was not disappointed at all! If this were available in Seattle, it would be on my grocery list everytime. I wont go into the silly details of the taste. It is an awesome ale. Ship it to the WEST COAST PLEASE!

Since this is brewed with american malts and hops shouldnt IPA stand for Iraq Pale Ale? I bet our troops would love this one. Pours with a beautiful full offwhite head which lasts the whole beer, hop aroma is intense which suggests wethopping, Cant say as I agree that this beer is as bitter as everyone says, but it does dominate the flavor profile. Nicely done to style.

I think this is likely the closest Ive come to my ideal India Pale Ale.  This is the hyperbitter of such greats in the IPA biz as Stone IPA and I2PA, but with an awe-inspiring mouthfeel, unrivalled in all my hophead daze.  That is to say, there is no metallic afterfuzz peeling away molecule by molecule the gum tissue from my precious teeth.  I REPEAT:  This incredibly bitter beer is bitter, without the cringing aftertaste experience.   How do they do it, ladies and gentlement?  How do they do it?  Next thing you know theyll be bringing home our boys in Iraq and replacing em with robot fightin boys of steel!  Ahh science.  Buy beer first.  Ask questions later.  Two extra overall points because this beer shouldve scored a seven in palate.
Orange hazy brew with thick foamy off-white head. Heavy lacing, beautiful. Sweet citrus aroma with a slight pineyness. Wet and bitteeer. Piney burn. Finishes dry and bitter...did I say it was bitter?
Draught at Moondog, CLT, NC Light golden pour, small head, decent lacing. Hoppy aroma with very citrus and piney hop flavor.  A bit above your average IPA.

Picked up single 12-oz bottle from Cellars Wine & Spirits in St Paul, MN. Pours a clear copper amber brew with a creamy white head that slowly dissolves to a fine film and white ring. Aroma of various citrus zest, caramel malt, and plenty of hops to go around. Taste is medium bodied, lightly carbonated with a strong pine/grapefruit flavor that overpowers any caramel malt flavors. Finish is citrusy and then a strong and lingering bitterness follows. A terrific West Coast IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 This is a fantastic example of a fine IPA. IPA was a favorite style of mine a few years ago when I first started trying craft brews, and this beer brings me back to what a golden-fine hop-tastic ale can be. Its great and deservedly #2 highest rated IPA. TRY IT!

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2008 On tap at Thirsty Troll Brewfest
This was the best beer available at the festival.  Ive had it a couple of times now; this was just as good as I remember it being in the past.  Hopefully this makes as much money for Bells as it deserves.  While it is not quite the best IPA (that honor currently goes to Alesmith) it is certainly not second rate.  Not only is it excellent you should find it almost everywhere.
Aroma / Appearance - The golden yellow body had a nice tint as the sun trickled through it.  A white clean head sat on top gracefully guarding the beer beneath.  By now my nose was not quite as fresh as it was earlier in the afternoon but I was still able to pick up freshly mowed glass, orange rinds and aggressive hops.
Flavor / Palate - Bitter orange chocolate highlights the first sip.  Next comes wheat and lemons mixed with dry spices.  The hoppiness is very strong making this ideal for waking up the palate halfway through an evening.  It is almost aggressive enough to be an imperial IPA but not quite.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2009 This is a fine IPA that stands up well with spicy food.  It is hop heavy but not too bitter.  Its refined flavor make it the Bells flagship, the 7% ABV make it deadly!

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2008 9-20-07 bottle. Pours a cloudy orange amber color with fluffy head.  Wonderful, almost tart or tangy hops smell.  Very light and floral and fruity hops, which warms to smell a bit heavier.  Nice crisp, clean taste.  More carbonated than I expected, and is deceivingly light weight on the palate.  Taste is slightly soapy and drying.  Very smooth and enjoyable overall.  No strong, unwelcome bitterness.  As it warms it creates a sort of coating on the tongue.

deep golden with a frothy head. big piney and floral aromas. sticky lacing. flavor was grassy and a touch of critrus. big hoppy flavors throughout. mouthfeel was medium and well coating. nice bitter finish. classic daily drinker of an ipa.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2007 12oz.  Awesome amber/deep gold hue.  Dense, off-white head.  A bit more carbonation than I am used to, but is well suited to the hops and well integrated carmalized flavors.  And I love the label artwork.
Bottle, light orange/rust colour, cotton candy-hop aroma, sweet lemon flavour with a lovely hop finish
Bottle. Pours a nice amber. Citrus, caramel and hops in both the aroma and taste. Well balanced, nice finish.
Pours a clear orange color with a small white head.  Aroma is sweet, lemony.  Medium body, sweet and fruity, remids me of fruit loops cereal over grapefruit juice.  Excellent!

Bottle thanks to DrBayernRich golden amber pour with a big sudsy white head in a tulip.  Smell is sweet caramel like with a soapy floral hop aroma.  Nice hop flavor with a bit of a dull malt sweetness, however.  Not a bad IPA by any means, but I found it fairly mildly flavored in comparison to some others I liked more.
Golden orange color with white head.  Aroma is very strong of hops and citrus.  Lots of flavor, but not overly hopped.  Very smooth for a IPA.  Very clean finish.

Pours a nice golden color with a hint of orange. The head is light white. Its small, but it has good staying power. The beer is mostly clear with a light haze. The beer smells strongly of hops with sweet floral hint. This beer has a lot of flavor, but it isnt as overhopped as many IPAs Ive had. It has a nice malty flavor to start with. The hops hit in the middle of the drink, and the finish is fairly clean. For a beer with a lot of flavor it seems very drinkable.
This was recommened at Sams. 12oz. bottle. Orange in color. Smells strong and citrusy. Tastes great at first but the finish is lacking and thinner than other IPAs.
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text: Courtesy Haskells. Pours 4 cm. off-white head with vibrance and froth. Orange-gold color. Sparkling, coating lace that winks invitingly. Nose is huge floral and resinous hops with a hint of caramel malt. More piney hops on the tongue with spiced evergreen needle, fruits in the finish, caramel; maltiness is more apparent. Medium carbonation and full-bodied. Refreshing. Good IPA, although not very complex.

Tried this on tap recently at the waiters recommendation.  As a hop addict, this certainly hit the spot.  Extra bitter, yet very smooth aftertaste.  One of the best IPAs Ive had the pleasure of drinking.

If you like it bitter, youll love this one.  For me, though, the bitterness was just a little overpowering, to the point I couldnt detect much maltiness.  Nice finish and clean aftertaste of high-quality hops, but I coulnt drink more than a couple of these at a time

out of a bottle didnt pour it so i dont really know what i looks like but i gave it a 4 because the bottle is a nice looking bottle.  smelled a bit citrus like with some spice to it.  it tasted like bitter oranges average carbonation that felt well overall in the mouth.

This is HOP MADNESS but its one of the best commercial brews Ive tasted to date. Not for everyone though - about half of the people to whom Ive recommended this beer have not been as enthusiastic as I would have expected. Although brewed by Bells in Michigan, THA has a definite Northern influence evidenced by the use of loads of high alpha Cascade hops. 
Does anyone know why theres a fish on the label?

12 oz. bottle
Aroma:Sweet malty scent with spicy hops underneath
Appearance:Hazy bronze with a smallish head that lingers and laces well nonetheless.  I normally dont do this but I am going to have to take a point here for the artwork on the label.  A quality beer like this deserves something a little more professional looking instead of like something I printed off my home PC.  Now if this was the look they were going for than bravo.
Flavor:Hoppy makes me happy nicely balanced with the sweet malts
Palate:Bitter hops linger quite well with alcohol present but not overbearing by any means
Overall:Better than I expected honestly.  I dont think it is worthy of the 4s I am seeing but still I did like this beer a lot and it would be great for session drinking.

Bottle from kmweaver.  Thanks Ken!  Pours with nice 1 finger head.  Normally I pour so slowly this doesnt happen, so it was a nice surpise.  Small bubbles, medium fade, but lingering wispy surface of small bubbles.  Semi cloudy amber color.  Medium hoppy aroma over a malty base aroma.  Possibly a little melanoidal malt aroma.  Pleasant hop bitterness. High drinkability.  Very well done!

Pours copper colored with a big fluffy white head. Big hoppy floral aroma. Taste is malty smooth with a nice bang o hops that are balanced nicely. A nice dry hop bitterness in the aftertaste. Good easy drinking IPA, I think my friend Ian would love this.

6-pack 12 oz bottles...a very generous gift from some friends who recently road-tripped to Michigan (thanks C&M!)  Easily one of the best four or five bottled IPAs Ive ever tasted.  A hop-heads dream, hits all the right floral/piney/citrus notes but doesnt pummel you over the head with them.  Balanced excellence.

Fantastic aroma of caramel, orange, coriander, and thyme. Orange color with wisps of crimson, medium yellow head. Prominent alcohol taste and drier than expected. Tastes of pine needles, subtle citrus, with a nice lemongrass finish. Very good and nearly spectacular.
Poured with almost no head, followed by slight lacing that faded quickly.  Massive floral hops taste with a hint of pine.  Very crisp and enjoyable.

Medium head quickly disappears..almost no lace.  Not a lot of mystery to this one...loaded with hops.  This beer presents a floral taste accompanied by bitterness thoughout.  Strong lemon flavor.  Beers that offer the combination of bitterness and high alcohol levels score well here - this one will rank high.

Draft, Baja Bean, Staunton VA. Medium orange-amber color with offwhite head. Subdued nose of pineapple and grapefruit hops, pine, and some herbal/floral notes as well. Flavor is nicely balanced citrus hops, earthy hops, and sweet toasty malt. Creamy palate throughout, with a slightly hop-resin finish. Man, this is tasty stuff, made very drinkable by its subtlety.
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2009 Thanks to mreusch for the bonus! Golden hue with a frothy long lasting head, Very smooth, just the right hops, and a clean smooth finish.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, hop, citrus. Flavour is hop, fruit, citrus. Citrus and bitter finish. Nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2009 
Date: May 28, 2000
Mode: Bottle
Source: Roadtrip
Appearance: hazy yellow, frothy white head
Aroma: strong citrus hop aroma
Flavor: lots of tongue scraping hop flavor on top of slightly sweet malt base, light lingering bitter finish

Date: April 30, 2005
Mode: draft
Source: rich os new albany IN
Score: 3.4
Appearance: dark yellow with slight chill haze, thin white head and nice lace
Aroma: light sweet malty aroma with plenty of hops
Flavor: good solid hop flavor, touch of sweetness to balance, long bitter finish, nice touch of citrus in the aroma and flavor to add a bit extra complexity

Date: April 28, 2006
Source: brewpub
same as it ever was

Date: April 23, 2009
Mode: draft
Source: rich os new albany IN
Score: 4.1
Appearance: hazy orange, fine beige head, heavy lace
Aroma: the definitive huge sweet grapefruit aroma, fruity orange, lots of crystal sweetness balanced by citrus goodness
Body: big creamy body
Flavor: sweet fruity orange flavor like when you first break open an orange and dive in face first, light balancing bitterness keeps the sweetness in control without detracting from the fruity goodness
Overall: it just doesnt get any better than this

Date: December 09, 2009
Mode: cask
Source: taco mac alpharetta
Aroma: sweet citrus aroma, touch of grapefruit
Flavor: big grapefruit flavor, nice bitter grapefruit rind, sweet orange
Overall: milder on cask making it all that much more drinkable

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.5/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4
350 ml bottle from vintage cellars.  Hazy amber with a fizzy white head.  Floral citrus aroma.  Good crisp citrus taste strong pine notes, and a floral hoppy taste to the finish.

very good beer.  Balanced and still has enough bitterness.  Nice hops flavor and nice murky golden color.  S good beer if you havent more than one....so its always a good beer.  Nice als. vontent but bad name.  IPA should be somewhere instead of ale.
I remember this being better years ago.  Still a very solid IPA.  Would be a good session beer.

Bottle. (from trade with the_epeeist) Golden, almost clear body, under a white head leaving nice lacings. Piney, citrusy, beef-stock malty nose with resin as well. Even though the flavor is on the hoppy side, theres a balance to it, and I like it. It has a nice level of bitterness, with the usual flavors from the hops, and a good dash of malts. It could maybe have a little bit fuller body, but Im not holding it against it. The finish is long, resiny and fruity, with a nice bitterness. Lovely, really lovely IPA. (070719)

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2009 12 oz bottle, poured.  Close to orange coloring, short white head, with decent lacing on the glass  I would like to start by saying this is not what I expected from this beer.  I especially disliked what was left on the palate.  It was almost too bitter for my tasting, which I dont understand.  It was definitely a very floral aroma, and the taste to go with it.  Very hoppy with the back taste of malt.  Aside from the Amber Ale, this is my least favorite brew from Bells, and it pains me to say that.

4.09.2008 Edit

In light of my previous rating, I would like to amend something I stated.  This is not as bad as I made it sound.  I started drinking it more regularly and actually liked it a lot.  If you feel the way I did after my first try, give it another.  It has grown on me very nicely.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2008 Copper orange with finger sized head and good lacing.  Floral piney hops and quiet citrus aromas mark this brew and presented a hoppy, but not dominating scent.  The perfumey/floral hops are prevalent on the taste but are extremely well balanced by cereal malts, citrus and caramel sweetness.  This is one of the best IPAs I have ever had because of its directness, and its beautiful balance.  While I do enjoy a strongly hopped IPA, I prefer one which is in harmony with other factors in order to produce a great and well-balanced brew.

pours a hazy light copper with a nice head. aroma of pine and citrus with a touch of floral hops and a hint of sweetness. mouthful is crisp with a pleasant hoppiness and a hint of caramel and a good malt backbone, very very nice.

Pours a copper opaque color with a thin white head. Has a subtle taste of hops. Blended nicely with the malts. Citrus fruits are detected on the back end. Finishes with a smooth bitter taste on the tongue.

Poured a coppery orange color with a thin white head on top. It has a nice smell of citrus fruits and floral and piney hops. The flavor is much the same with the citrus fruits and hops. The hops arent overpowering at all which is good, but they let you know they are there. The citrus fruits and malt backbone give this a nice sweet flavor to go with the hop bitterness in the finish. It was a medium bodied beer with a nice long crisp finish to it. This was just a really solid IPA all around. I definitely want to try more of this brewerys stuff.
Good, easy drinking IPA.  Average hop aroma, but a heavy bitter flavor even for an IPA.

Great beer. Extremely well balanced and a highly drinkable IPA. PIney and citrus hop flavors and aroma. The alcohol is completely hidden by the flavors of the beer. Has a light, slightly sweet finish. I could drink these all night.

Bottle--First of all, give me a chance to get past the excitement.  There I am rummaging through the singles at the local produce market (it carries a fine number of beers, only a mile from the house).  I spy, sitting quietly all the way at the end of the counter, actually in the area behind a display stand are two six packs of Bells Brewery product.  Now, that cant be right, Ive heard that Bells is distributed in Florida but Ive yet to come across it.  Ive already faced disappointment that since Bells isnt sold in Illinois, Bells failed to arrive in my home after the famous 1000 mile beer run in July.  Now as I look closer at the six pack, sure enough the label and the bottle cap both indicate that this is the real stuff.  Great, superb and holy cow, its going in my cart.  Staring at the cart, I start to chuckle, wow, bananas, grapes, cantaloupe and beer, this will be make for an interesting story at the check out counter and to my wife.  

Wait a minute, whats the price?  I know Im buying the six pack no matter what, unless it costs something ridiculous.  Its then I notice thats no price on the shelf.  Wheres the beer guy, hmmmm, no where to be found.  What if the beer is part of his secret stash?  No, its on the shelf with other beer that is priced marked, so maybe not.  What if it doesnt ring up at the cash register, well then, I guess Ill have a great conversation with the beer guy about how he needs to get more Bells product on the shelf.  

I wheel the cart into the checkout line and here I am at the register, it rings up with no questions ask.  I giddily hop out to my car and several hours later, there it sits in my beer glass, waiting to be consumed.  

What about the beer, you say, shouldnt you describe the taste, the smell and the look of the beer.  Na, a thousand others have come before me.  Lets just say that the beer lived up to every one of its ninety-ninth percentile rating.  

So, just be happy with the story of the discovery of an excellent beer and be happy that not only it exists, but it is available to a large number of people all across the country, and isnt that whats this whole experience is about?

Postscript:  the beer fridge is full with Goose Island, Three Floyds, Bells, Dogfish and several Belgium beers, I guess that Florida (even though several where driven into the state), isnt that big of a beer wasteland anymore!

Produce place

Bottle. Has a great orange amber color and thick white head. The aroma is a mix of hops and citrus. The flavor is refreshing - I havent had another beer with such high floral qualities and the pine and citrus really gives it a mind clearing kick.

Bottle. 12 fl. oz. A hazy, light amber color with smooth looking white head. Powerful nose of grassy hops.  Full bodied with a silky, smooth texture.  Strong hoppy bitterness with a good amount of malt to balance it out and a clean finish.  Very satisfying. Cant find anything I dont like about this beer.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2007 I forgot how good this really was. The aroma is so fresh and hoppy with floral in the bakground. Huge frothy head. Lacing stays around for the experience. Taste is refreshing with the hops coming through evenly. Cant wait to have this one on the first snow day in northern Indiana.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2014 Rerating this beer after havingit again after several years and also trying many other IPAs. This is still a good beer but not as good as I originally thought. Lacks full flavor across entire palate. Its also alittle sweet for me. Has great aroma and is well crafted but lacks complete balance. Drinking Alesmith ipa compared to this is very different. Bells probably appeals to the average beer drinker, but any seasoned beer geek will prefer Alesmith!!

Botte.  Large frothy head with excellent lacing.  Amber color, very cloudy.  This is the Cadillac of IPAs.  Plenty of hoppy flavor, but it is the crispness and drinkability that make this beer one of my favorites.  Makes me want to take a road trip to Kalamazoo.  Bells hit this one right on the heald.
Bottle.  Frothy head and rose golden color.  Beautiful aroma and wonderful palate and almost perfect spice.  Lots of hops but never too bitter.  A benchmark IPA to judge others by.
the floral hops are augmented by a fruity spiciness that is quite outstanding - it really diversifies the taste

12 ounce bottle (thanks mom!)  Pours a nice amber color with a thick foamy off-white head.  Leaves a good bit of lacing down the glass.  Aroma of floral and citrus hops.  Taste is similar, a little spicy too.  Smooth drinking.  I could easily have several of these.  Great IPA.
Pours deceptively clear, & finishes off with almost an amber, which is odd for the hop content.  Very citrus-y overtones at first pour.  Very light/crisp for the well-rounded taste.

Pours a hazy honey colour with particulates and a large frothy off white head. Aroma of floral & some citrus hops and a malt outline. Initial taste is mostly floral hops and hints of citrus just like the aroma. Overlaying hidden sweet malts with a tidal wave of bitter hops for the finish. Crisp. Thinner body than expected. Slight Lacing of the glass with some head retention. Good Palate duration.

everything and more that i ask for in an IPA. the smell of this beer is a direct punch in the nose of hops. tasting revealed fresh floral and citrus hops that rested on the back of my tongue. one of my favorite IPAs.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2008 There are many IPAs I have tasted, but there a good dozen of extremely high quality  this is one of them. Lots of hops in this brew and they stay in the back of the throat, which is a good sign of an excellent IPA. The ale pours a copper cloudy color with the full citrus flavor of the freshly picked hops. This is just really great beer. This is a wonderful beer to surprise a big-time HopDevil fan with. Cheers to the Bells Brewery!
Huge floral citrus aroma.  Smooth mouthfeel ending in crispy resiny hop finish.  Very refreshing and quaffable.

My absolute favorite beer, simply a great IPA. Wonderful fruity-floral aroma. Surprisingly high in alcohol for as crisp and smooth as it is. Holds its head well, and has a brilliant orange-amber color.

Great beer, a new personal favorite.  Great spicy floral aroma, flavor perhaps not as complex as possible with only some hops, but overall a teriffic beer that has a great crisp taste, and reminds me why i love beer.

Golden body with slight haze (possibly from chilling it), big white head, nice floral nose. Surprisingly thin body for 7%, subtle hoppiness, very refreshing, tasty, nice, great hop character. Hides the alcohol exceptionally well. I wish I didnt have to drive to Ohio to get this one.
Its very hard not to give this a perfect score.  Quite possibly the perfect example of what I expect from an IPA.

poured into tulip.  pours a clear gold with mild bubbles and good white head.  sweet strong fresh hoppy smooth, mouthwatering, inviting, aroma.  very inviting initial sweetness with a mild hoppy finish.  citrus tones, and mouthwatering finish.  sweet citrus front to slight hoppy bitter finish with a crisp touch.  a very good, crisp, inviting, and high quality IPA.
As far as an IPA is concerned I was not impressed overall.  I went into this beer with alot of hype and it drastically failed to live up.  At best this is a decent session beer.
Pretty hazy orange with a small white head.  Sweet citrus aroma.  Very balanced sweet vs citrus hops taste with a mild bitter finish.  Refreshing.
12oz Bottle Pours out a nice clear amber topped with a cream white head. Sweet aroma of hops. Tast was great on a hot summer day. Got to love the hops. Thanks S Santa for this one.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2008 Pours a creamy apricot color w/ a fuming full creamy froth. Head retention is superb leaving behind a latherous lace. Aromas of bright hop flowers and citrusy malts. Full nectar w/ ample residual effers creating a soft cotton texture. Flavors are bright and clean w/ a crisp, snappy hop profile. Flavors of Life Saver lemon drops, citrus rind, sodium, and mild caramel malts create this wonderful specimen in a league all its own, Its not a malt bomb. All components are so well integrated I am left wondering how the heck do they do that ? The finish is long and is bittered better than well. I highly recommend this brew. its gotta be one of the best IPAs Ive had.

12 oz bottle.  Orange amber with average white head.  Nice citurs hop aroma with some pine as well.  Flavor is big pine and grapefruit with some sweet malt, caramel, and i think that Im getting some dough as well.  Med, creamy body.  I really love this brew.
draft.  orangish pour with minimal head.  pine and floral in taste.  well balanced.  clean finish. very tasty.

Cloudy orange color.  Smell of hops, grapefruit, malt, citrus peal, sugar, pine grass and flowers.  Taste of hops, pine, malt, sugar, flowers, caramel, orange peal, grapefruit and honey.  Great bitters at the end.  Nice!

Ill have to re-rate this one from my mixed Bells sixer from Chips in Outer Banks, NC. Well balanced mix of hops, malts and citrus but nothing overpowering. I prefer sticky IPAs. This one is clean and pleasant.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 Draft is a nice golden color with a small head.  The aroma is citrius and hops with a touch of fruit.  The flavor is complex  with a bunch of citrius flavor as well as just a hint of fruit sweetness before finishing hoppy and bitter.  The finish is not as dry as other IPAs.  This is a fantastic beer! Increased my flavor and aroma ratings.  This beer has really grown on me. It is one of my all time favorites!

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2007 I tend to favor the imperial IPAs, but I must say that this brew is one of the best IPAs Ive had yet. The complex hop bouquet nose greets you immediately. While the hop bill on this is no doubt a great combination, it is the delicate bread-like malt combinaton that impressed me the most. A near-perfect brew.

Overall, one of the best IPAs that Ive ever tasted...super citrusy hoppy aroma leads into an hoppy taste and hoppy finish. Summation: If you like a hoppy beer with a good balanced flavor, then this beer IS for YOU!!! Clean beer through and through. My favorite Bells beer...try a bottle, you wont regret it.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2008 Re-rate 10/19/08:Bottle. Batch 8677. Thanks a lot for this bottle archmik! Clear, maybe very slightly hazy, deep golden color. Aroma has quite a bit of floral hops with some citrus, but also a nice malty tone with caramel and some cookie notes. A sweetish flavor at first with some malt, continues hoppy and bitter with some grapefruit and with caramel lingering in the background. Medium-bodied with a rounded mouthfeel. A very good balanced IPA. 7/4/8/4/15=3.8
Bottle. Hazy orange with a medium white head. Flowery, citrusy, hoppy nose. Flavor starts with sweetish malts, then comes some nice citric hoppiness. A bitter finish with some grapefruit notes. Medium-bodied with a nice mouthfeel. Very good stuff! 8/3/8//16=3.9

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2007 Re-rate December 2007. Whoa man, this one is way better on draft!  Ive had the pleasure of drinking this one from the bottle, a regular keg, and a 5L home mini-keg, and the draft format works alot better with this beer.  The orange hops really "pop" and taste much fresher from the tap.  Likewise, the pour imparts a larger, fuller head, more intricate lacing, and a smoother, less sticky palate.  Im beginning to think I might have had a bad bottle for the first go round.  Awesome IPA.Original rating August 2007. Bottle at Redlight Redlight.  Courtesy boboski.  The body is a cloudy orange-amber color.  It looks rather syrupy, with thick legs like a desert wine would have.  Not much of a head, just a thin wispy film with a pure white buildup around the rim of the glass.  The aroma is obviously hoppy and piney, but there is plenty of caramel and toffee malt to balance it out.  The flavor has alot of orange in it, with grapefruit and pine resin both playing prominent roles.  There is obviously a high sugar content, as the palate is quite thick and sticky.  A little too sticky in my opinion.  A very nice IPA, but a little less sugary malts would make it ideal.
Grapefruity piney aroma, sweet and citrus hoppy.  Pours a pale amber.  Hops upfront, very piney, with citrus notes, grapefruit, hints of sweet malt, but definitely hoppy.  Pretty good IPA.

Thank you Yngwie for sharing this great beer! It has been on my wish-list, and Im not disappointed! Its warm orange with a nice head and a fruity, hoppy aroma with loads of citrus, tangerine being dominant. The flavour is nice, harmonic and delicious with lots of fruit/citrus, again tangerine is the most dominant. It also has nice caramel notes that balances the bitterness nicely. Its very charming and harmonic - yummi!!!! 2444

12 oz bottle- Door County.  Cloudy orange & fluffy head.  A blast of floral aroma hits you right away.  First taste was very dry, with strong hops present throughout.  Nice carbonation- a lot of bite to this beer.  I like the other reviewers use of "grapefruit" in describing the taste- quite accurate.  Really nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2008 Bottle. Cloudy copper with a medium and lasting head. Aroma of pine resin, fresh grapefruit and sweetened whole-grained granola. Flavor is grapefruit dominating some honey-drenched, bitterish pine cones, and Fruit Loops. Nice balance; the bitter resin counters the fruit loops perfectly in the aftertaste.  Palate is just shy of medium-bodied, sort of watery, and dry on the finish.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2008 Bottle: pours a cloudy orange with a thin, lasting head, hoppy aroma with some citrus, taste is quite hoppy and slightly bitter.  Very nice IPA.  Ill buy it again.

draft.  clear orange gold with moderate fluffy white head.  floral hop aroma. solid citrus taste - grapefruit flavor with a light/moderate bitter.  crisp finish, sugar levels are in good check.  great carbation as well.   this one is just perfectly balanced.  all the elements are distinct but not overbearing.  i think many breweries think that if you hop the hell out of it, it will automatically be a good ipa.  (the sebago i just tried is a good example).  this guy sets the bar for ipas imo.  is goot. belly goot.
Bartzillas Death Metal Beer Day June 07. Shared with Bartzilla, Naven, WeeHeavySD and others. 12oz bottle. Deep golden brew with a floral hoppy aroma. Flavor is sweetish with a clean hoppy finish.

Draft...light, cloudy presentation with fair head, this ale packs a mighty hop punch with an herbal aftertaste which reminds me of oregano or basil. The finish is thick and velvety. I liked this beer much more on draft than out of the bottle for some reason.
Poured a real hazy orange and real nice fluffy head.  Great citrus hop aroma.  Real nice hop flavor and some malt comes through to balance it out a little bit.  This is a great beer!!!

A tasty beer, but Im stunned by the 99 overall rating.  Pours hazy, unfiltered and light, light amber, huge head.  Ultra hoppy, fruity, sweet aroma.  Flavor is good, but faint  and watery.  The palate is excellent, as the light flavor instantly disappears after a swig, nothing lingers.  Id like an Imperial version of this beer.

Pours a cloudy orange with a small foamy head. Aroma is fruity & sweet but more than balanced by pungent floral hops. The taste is wonderful - medium crystal malt in such a quantity as to give great character and balance to the excellent hopping - very doughy and heavy but not cloyingly sweet. This has a great body, thin but not too thin, and decent carb. I have never tasted such a balanced, full-bodied IPA.

12 oz bottle friend picked me upp a 6 pack in kentucky.my favorite pale.floral, spruce, amber, clear, frothy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter, wonderful beer great choice for a pale.
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden-amberish hue with a nice, frothy white head.  Floral undertones hit the nose right from the start.  Perfect balance of malt and hops make this one to remember.

Nice murky orange-amber pour, with a foamy head that leaves pillow lace.  Beautiful mixture of citrus and floral notes in the nose.  Well done... wonderfully hopped from beginning to end, without overtaking any of the other portions of the brew.  Nice orange peel and grapefruit essence in the citrus dept.  Very quaffable, as the citrus and malt combine for a perfectly round and smooth mouthfeel.  Pine resin lingers in the finish, peppering the back of the mouth with a decent IBU.  Again, the drinkability is very much the biggest "pro" of this brew.  IPAs are my fave (as are doubles and impys), and this one doesnt disappoint.  ABV doesnt particularly show... possibly in the peppery aftereffects of the finish, there shines a note or two of alcohol, but well-integrated.

Bottle.  Great IPA,  Great aroma, great flavor.  This one starts great at the nose, has an extremely well balance, and finishes the same.  Very hoppy, but has the malt to balance.  Definately recommend this beer and will have again.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 This beer has more than 1000 ratings, yet I lived in the States for 30 years without coming across it. Now I live in Europe and had to get one through a trade (thanks, turdferguson). Appropriately, I drank it while watching "American Beer" for the first time. Pretty, hazy and sunshiny yellow-gold with frothy white head that lasted. Big, fresh hoppy aroma with citrus and floral notes. Tangy and bitter flavor with notes of lemon and cherry wood. Dry finish, mildly bitter aftertaste. Strikes me as a beer interesting enough to sip on a cold day, yet refreshing enough to glug a couple after mowing the lawn. Tasty and versatile and excellent.

On draft at Union Street Public House-Alexandria VA. Poured dark gold and hazy with a small, thick head. Aromas of hops-fragrant but not overwhelming. Tastes of hops but balanced enough to drink several. Very smooth palate and easy going down the throat. Very well done and will buy this when available.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: pours a golden orange with a nice frothy head....smells of hops, citrus...great refreshing taste with an awesome bitter finish...another great IPA from one of my favorite brewers

Nice hazy orange with quick fading white head.  Aroma is piny with grapefruit.  Taste is same, only thinly so, and disappointing and weak.  Mouthfeel is rather fizzy and detracts from hop taste.  Not sure what all the raving is about.  $3/12oz

Excellent IPA, although not hoppy as insanity or anything. Wicked sick label, eh? I wonder what the fish would think you if you forced him to swim in a vat of Two Hearted Ale. Hed probably think, "Nobodys ever died like Im about to die within 72 hours."

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2008 Pours a hazy copper color with monstrous lacing, carbonation and head. Aroma is very hoppy. Taste is hoppy as well but it finishes really smooth with little aftertaste which is surprising for an IPA. Good brew!
orangish appearance.  very nice flavor that is predominately hops but finishes with a nice balance.  a good beer, similar to but a step of from old dominions hop pocket

Bottle @ Akkurat, Stockholm. Pours a hazy pale golden color with a small off-white head. Malty hoppy citrus aroma. Sweet mlaty hoppy citrus flavor. Sweet malty finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

[386-20070630] Tap @ Winking Lizard (Cleveland, OH). Hoppy citrus grapefruit aroma. Clear, orange brown body with a long-lasting creamy white head and some lacing. Flavour introduces more hoppy citrus, though less grapefruit and more naval orange. Medium body. Quite nice.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2008 pours a somewhat cloudy dark yellow gold with a 1.5 finger fluffy white head. aroma is a powerful hop aroma with some malt and grapefruit, a touch of melon, and a touch of orange characteristics. has a medium to full body with good lacing and good carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma but stronger. has a nice smooth dry hop aftertaste and a touch of pine. the hops really do linger a bit afterwards and feels a little slick in the mouth. an AWSOME ipa one of the best!! i would pick this up by the case along with three floyds alpha king. hopefully bells comes back to Illinois very very soon!!!
re-rate awsome in a mini keg!!

(Bottle via trade with <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=3 target=blank>shigadeyo, thanks Craig!) Plenty of hops...Pours cloudy orangish gold with a tall frothy, pillowy white head. Big hoppy aroma of grapefruit and pine, as well as some caramel and vanilla. Mouthfeel medium-full, lightly pebbly. Big foamy rings of lacing. Flavor of grapefruit and pine, more towards grapefruit, with some caramel underneath esp. as it warms. Medium-heavy bitterness through palate from fore through finish.

The color was a golden with orange hues.  The head was thin, fizzy, white, and laced a little.  The flavor was apricot and hoppy, but not as bitter as expected.  The palate was perfectly carbonated and medium bodied.  The finish was hopps.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2007 Rerate:  Had to rerate this one...its seriously one of the absolute best IPAs in the world.  It is blended so well, the complexity, the smoothness, the layers of malt that fold in your mouth.  Great aromas that you can smell from 5 feet away.  Just a perfect blend! Everytime I have it, I expect the best, and it delivers everytime...almost better every time.
Pours great cloudy burnt orange with great lacing and nice long lasting off white head.  Extreme citrus notes on smelling and tasting.  Great bright flavor of hops, sooo citrusy.  Bitterness is lacking a little on the backend, but leaves a great refreshing clean taste afterwords.  The malt character gets exposed, with a great "unique" round semi sweet taste, just as the hops start doing the work.  Great, Great brew

One of the most citrusy ipas ive tasted, tons of lemon and lime. Very crisp and refreshing. Malt balance but not presence. Finishes of grapefruit and hops. lots of carbonation, full body and strong biterness. Very well done

not too loud at the beginning and quiet enough at the end. i think it was a nice balance as i kind of usually fear / love the thrillingly zesty first sip of IPA. this one hung in there the whole way without running me over like a circus bus. awesome job!

On tap at HDG.  Part 1 of an indetemerinate length ratings miniseries entitled "Getting back beastiefan2ks buddyship."  Poured a light amber color and smelled of pure hoppiness (no, not that beer from Alpine, which I havent had by the way).  Lots of grapefruit and pine present here.  Though Im generally not much of a hops guy, this is the type I enjoy most.  Ive heard stories about how insanely drinkable this beer is, but   I didnt know how true it was until I took my first...well all my sips.  The grapefruitiness jumps out at first, followed by malt support to give it balance.  The finish brings the hops back, as if I had forgotten what I was drinking.  A nice lingering bitter to this one, but not overwhelming.  Truly well done.  My new favorite IPA/IIPA, unless you count Houblon, which I dont...so there.

Draught at HDG.  Light orange/amber colored with an aroma of what seemed like a truckload of bright grapefruity hops.  The hoppiness struck me before the glass came within a foot of my nose.  Reminiscent of Hopslam.  The bright hops are obviously the star of the show, but the full and clean cookie/caramel malts provide a nice structure which supports and balances this fine green-flowery nectar. Interestingly, the hoppiness seems to start out like fresh grapefruit zest on the initial sip and morphs into more of a pine charater towards the finish.  However, theres no resin or astringency.  Im pretty sure that this is the best single IPA Ive had so far.

draft- incredible brew...strawberry/ester flavor explosion is almost immediate with some pineyness in the background. I thought this was a double, but I guess not. Thats okay. One of the best IPAs I ever had.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2007 Bottle. Pours golden with thick off-white head. Huge hop nose. Fragrant citrusy hops. Taste is lively citrus - orange, passionfruit, pineapple - backed by creamy malt. Very interesting that the bitterness is neatly balanced by the captivating flavors of the hop resins.

Orange color with stream of what looks like yest or bacteria inside - yuck.  Wonderfuly hop aroma.  Sweet grapefruity hop body with a little malt in there.  Excellent flavor but after the funk floating around, I dont think Ill finish.

From tap. Pours golden orange with a white head. Aroma is grape fruity. Flavour is grape with a mild malt profile beneath. Finish is dry and bitter. Another grape dominated ipa, not offensive nor really good.
Piney citrus aroma with a bit of cream.  Taste is a doughy malt blended with a sharp flavored hop syrup with a lemony aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2009 Bottle. Nose is extremely sweet hops, some light citrus notes of lemon and grapefruit. Touch of pine in there too. Color is clear orange with a nice lacing white head. Subdued bitterness, well balanced hop flavor with a very smooth palate. Hops show up all over the flavor but dont provide any harsh bitterness that is the downfall of so many IPAs. Sweet orange, musky pine, and just the perfect balance of sweet and bitter. Palate works perfectly for the style, providing one of the best examples of how to perfectly accentuate a hop-heavy beer.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2008 Amber pour with frothy white head and excellent lace!  Simcoe hops on the nose.  Malty backbone with loads of citrus flavor.  Well balanced, clean and crisp.

12 oz bottle thanks to vyvvy. Poured a hazy orangey/yellow with a thick frothy white head. Aroma was tons of citrusy hops and some caramel malt. Flavor is obviously hop dominant but was nicely balanced with a fair bit of maltiness. The palate was very smooth and this is just one fantastic beer all around. Once again Bells does not disapoint.

From the moment this bottle was opened it was pure joy.  The aroma is full and fruity...citrus notes all around (and somewhere in the backround I am catching the slightest honey twinge).  Sitting in the glass I can admire the cloudiness and the amber orange radiance.  Nice and hoppy, but very bery balanced.  For my own personal liking it could be a tad bit more bitter.  Great brew...thanks.

Pours a nice cloudy amber, with great laceing. Wonderful floral/citrus flavor with a slight bitterness that add to the complexity of this IPA. Its not too often you can find such a floral/fruity ale with that wonderful bitterness. A great example of what the Bells brewery is capable of. Would reccomend this ale to   
any real beer drinker, old or new. Outstanding.

My first taste of this was in bottle at Brickskeller in DC last year, and then again in bottle in Minneapolis in the winter, and now on my recent visit back to Minneapolis I see that its showing up on tap all over dive bars in Minneapolis.  This really makes me smile.  What an awesome beer.  Defines the true midwestern IPA style.  Pours with a nice clean, white head that dissapates quickly.  Nice and dry without a lot of cloying sweetness or nutty base malt character, which is perfect for this style.  And really delivers on the hops, cirtus, pine, with a touch of grapefruit..  If I had to guess - A mix of old standbys like cascade, and some new school hops like centennial, amarillo and maybe some traditional british hops such as fuggle or EKG.  Great complexity.  Can certainly compete with some great west coast IPAs.  Very well done, Bells.  Thank you for making my visits to the Midwest feel just a little more like home.

bottle available this summer at the Beer Bistro.  Wonderfully sweet and certifiable when it comes to hops!  The alcohol is smooth, but hits you quick enough.  Very refreshing beer.  Nice syrupy colour to it very full and vibrant.  I will be going back for this one a few more times this summer.
