UPDATED: APR 26, 2008 Wonderful aroma, a full bouquet.  Smell of pine, citrus, grapefruit.  Color is a nice ruby orange, small off-white cream head.  This beer is full bodied and wonderfully balanced.  A solid hop presence--piney and citrusy, but nicely balanced with a malty backbone.  This is by far the best IPA Ive ever had, and something I keep coming back to.

On tap at Bells Eccentric Cafe, poured into a pint glass.  This IPA poured a hazy coppery orange color with a 1/4 inch thick beige head that quickly faded away.  This beer had a huge floral, citrus hop nose.  Also some caramel and toffee notes.  The smell is beautiful!  The flavor was nice and citrusy.  Full of hops, but not overly bitter.  The balance between the huge flavor and bitterness is amazing.  The mouthfeel is slightly oily/resiny with minimal carbonation.  This is the best IPA I have ever had, hands down!!!

bottle....appearance:orange brownish tint with a hazy hue to it that was accompanied by an inch of white.....aroma: assertive flower and citrusy hoplicious nose...taste: more of that citrus sensation that evolved to an ever so slight bitter finish. theres some malt involved but it doesnt take away from forward-taste of the hops....could drink this all day. very tasty.
A 6 pack purchased at From the Vine. This is a spectacular IPA. Citrus and hops rise out of glass as soon as you start to pour. I taste orange and pine. A great example of the styoe.

Tap at Hop Devil: Pours a deep honey/orange color with a frothy/creamy white head. The aroma is extremely bright, crisp, citrusy and slightly herbal with a hint of berries. The flavor has loads of lemony zing and a spicy perfumy character. The hops are fresh and whole leaf-like with some lemon-rind brightness and a long clean dry finish. A very bright and quaffable IPA. Dangerously drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2008 amazing IPA, very well balanced between the hops and the malt. Amazing hoppy aroma, wonderful citrus, and floralness. Flavour was slight soapy, and piney, bu was also sweet, the hops really come through, notes of lemon, and  orange linge in the finish, wow, great stuff!
good brew nice hops on it.  One o bthe better brews ive had. Only 9 dollars for the 6 pack.  very enjoyable.

Hazy pale golden color with a thin off-white head.  Aroma was rich and malty with a definite citrus hop presence and a hint of caramel.  Flavors are a perfect blend of rich maltiness and strong bitter hops.  Some notes of caramel, grapefruit, wood, pine needles, and a certain earthiness.  Very drinkable rich and full mouthfeel with a clean and astringent finish.  I would have never realized that this beer was 7% abv just by tasting it... pretty amazing stuff.  Perfectly well-balanced.  Awesome.

My attitude toward this beer depends on the day.  Something about it is intimidating to me, even next to Dogfishs 90 and 120, as well as the Crooked Trees, Hopslam and even Founders Devil Dancer.  I cant explain why, but Ill try.  Something about the strong citrusy nose and hoppy aromas, the punch to the palate with more bitterness throughout the tastes of grapefruit peel and pine.  I mightve topped off a busy bar night long ago with this IPA, which could be why it is such a hard one to put away consistently nowadays.  A manly beer.  I cant even say I enjoy it so much as respect it.

The aroma was strong caramel with a fruity and citrusy orange/grapefruit presence. Hop aromas dominated with malt taking a backseat. The malty sweetness was light and the citrus presence was strong. In the glass the beer was slightly hazy golden amber with an off-white frothy head which laced the glass. The flavor was strongly centered on citrus, orange/grapefruit most notable.  Along with the hop flavor came a strong bittering and some caramel but the malt presence was not overly sweet. The flavor was also lightly bready. The body was medium and the carbonation left the beer creamy in texture. The citrusy hops lasted long into the aftertaste. A very nice pint! Pint at Tylers Durham.
user_location: North of Raleigh, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: JUN 26, 2007 Bottle and Tap.  Again and Again. Hop bitterness that lingers long into the finish.  It is very drinkable even though it ends on a slightly bitter note.  That is what gives it distiction.   It has a charm a lot of other IPAs dont have.  Also doesnt have the maltyness of say dogfish head ipas.  Very distinctive IPA.  My favorite everyday beer.  If you crave the citrus American hops then this is for you.  Also try Bells Expidition Stout and Hopslam if you can find it.  rr....The label has really grown on me as time goes.
light hop smell with a nice smooth hop,citrusy flavor.  i wouldnt call it 99th percentile but its a pretty decent IPA.  thanks to beerguy101

Big piney lime aroma. Hops are very evident. Flavor is light, yet somehow packs in a lot of flavors. Pine, hops, lime and other citrus, sweet maltiness....but without big heavy bite. Its still sticky, but not in an overbearing sense. Crisp dry finish. This is like diet IPA in that it is so much a session beer, despite its 7% (damn you Bells and your ability to mask alcohol). A staple as far as IPAs go. This is the real deal....still extremely enjoyable and stable as it warms up. This edges out the Titan from Great Divide, simply by beeing a smoother and lighter beer....oh and the obvious fact that the two hearted manages to slam you with so much hop flavor in the process. This stuff is simply incredible.

Bottle.  Lime, tangerine, and pine hops aroma.  Hazy orange-amber with moderate head and nice lacing.   Sligntly sweet  tangerine flavor quickly followed by moderate pine hops.  Strange finish - after swallowing get a watery slightly metallic taste with pine hops returning a few seconds later.  Nice that its flavor isnt the typical orange grapefruit.

One of "ye olde standbyes".  Just a perfect IPA, full of subtle citrus aromas, quite possibly the greatest mouthfeel ever and that wonderful sweetish malty finish.  Quite possibly the the only beer that maintains greatness on tap and in the bottle.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 This is a damn good and flavorful IPA. Such an undistinguished and frankly unsavorable logo on the bottle, I had never thought of buying this one and giving er a go. I regret not doing so sooner. Delicious and full of flavors, yet not overpowering and light enough to make a session. This is a very good beer.
Mini-keg review on 01/27/08

Pours a cloudy mango amber into my imperial pint glass. Big fluffy head, with lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is great; soft piney hops (but strong and prevalent), cider, pineapple. Flavor is awesome of course. Hops galore, grapefruit, pineapple, crisp apples. Delicious. Very drinkable, soft and easy.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2009 Rating and review fixed now that i have a better understanding on whats going on here.  Good lord i love this beer.  Pours a  yellow orange haze of a beer, but i dont know if its possible to see it through the aroma.  Its massive, and a fresh bottle of this will floor any hop-head.  The taste is fresh citrus, grapefruit, and if the color green had a taste, i think it would be something like this.  Wonderful.  Works any time of year, dead of winter or summer refresher.

bottle aprox. 9 months old. They stoped selling bells in illinois in sept, (distributing issues) so i held on to this one for warm weather. pours a cloudy golden orange color, with a tall head that sinks rather quickly without leaving any lace. smells of grapefruit and citrusy hops and a little like grape candy. taste is crisp with intertwining notes of lemon zest and sweet malts. well crafted with a refreshing and harmonious balance that make this easy to enjoy.

Heres an outstanding IPA.  Hazy golden orange and an impressive hop aroma gives you a hint of its flavor long before you drink.  I like to think when I drink this I am drinking nature itself.  Medium bodied and bold bitterness last in your mouth long after you swallow.

Orange, lightly copper tinted beer with a small white rim. Orange flavour, hops, but not exactly C-hops, but quite aromatic ones all the same. Dry taste, with classical cookie and hopcake, sultanas, keeping long in the flowery taste. Very carbonated for a USA beer, long lasting, bitterish flavours. Very restrained, and therefore excellent drinking ale.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2007 Bottle.  Pours a cloudy yet vibrant amber with a frothy ,somewhat lasting, off-white head.  Nose is mostly grapefruit with some corriandor, pine, and lemon rind.  Taste is dominated by grapefruit, but is balanced with a hefty malt profile.  Light to medium bodied.  Mouthfeel is very smooth with a long bitter finish.  I cant say enough good things about this brew.  I could drink this stuff all day and night!

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2008 Pours rich golden amber with a nice 3 finger head and beautiful lacing. On the nose: bright hops: citrus, tangerine, grapefruit, lemon zest even a hint of pine. Theres also some rich maltiness hiding there as well. Wonderfully vibrant on the palate and quite full bodied. Very complex flavor profile: instantly struck by the hops but some rich, sweet toffee/caramel-like malt flavors are hiding behind the hop attack. Excellent all around beer. Some are hoppier, some are maltier and some are more complex, but Two Hearted is very, very well balanced and quite drinkable. Close to perfection and insanely drinkable.

Large head.  Aroma is rich with spice and hops, but you can tell it is also just slightly thin/watery.  A little too light for my taste in the finish, just a little too much water, a touch too long of a finish, especially with this much hop bitter at the end.  I just think if it has that much in the way of hops, the finish should be a little quicker/dryer.  Overall a good beer, but I was just a little disappointed in the aroma/finish department.
Poured orange in color with an off white head.  Had a citrus/floral aroma.  Had a spicy palate.  Flavor was a crisp citrus and hops with a tiny bit of bitterness.

Delicious IPA with a nice orange cloudy color. Packaging says decant to serve, and it does look good in the glass. The beer has almost a tangy flavor with both bitterness and sweetness from the orange flavoring.

Bottle (batch 7717). Pours a light orange color with a creamy off-white head. Some is lasting leave good lacing. The aroma finds orange citrus and floral backed with some caramel. The flavor has orange peel and malty background. Medium body with a mild bitterness upfront that turns sweet.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2008 Great IPA.  Draft pour from Dickys Wild Hare in Fort Wayne, IN.  A nice clear orange-copper color with a single finger white head.  The lacing on this was remarkable as the entire opposite side of the glass was coated.  Consisted of orange and floral hop scents.  Very smooth brew, starts out tame with a killer orange slice taste which finishes in to a strong hop bite with some grapefruit in the aftertaste.  Another fine Bells brew.
Thick, off-white head, golden color.  Aroma is citrus, mostly of lemon and/or grapefruit.  Extremely hoppy with a bitter aftertaste.  Very tasty.

Bottle at homw - shared with Mette. Unclear amber - light yellow head. A high hoppy nose. Aroma: Citrus, pine, freshly cut grass, dry grass. Aroma: Citrus, grape, resin, grass, pineneedle, crisp. Simpel sugar sweetness. Soft mouthfeeling, light carbonated. High hoppy bitter finish !! Very nice but a bit too simpel.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2009 Bottle. A fantastic IPA. Clean tasting hoppy bitterness mixed with a mild sweetness of malt. Very floral and a bit fruity. Pours a big, solid head. Complex and drinkable at the same time. Ive had this one many many times and have never been disappointed. Its especially amazing when its at its freshest.
Another fantanstic beer from bells!!! nice off white head, good amber color like most IPAs good hop nose, well balanced good citrus flavour, really nice one surprised me!!! At beer bistro
Pours amber with a huge white head.  Aroma is piny, with hops and citrus.  Taste is full of pine, hops, and some citrus fruits.  A great IPA, another solid beer from Bells.
A great IPA. Superb. For a solid review..... think of the best IPAs youve had and then make them much much better. A strong delivery from Bells.
Pours a cloudy amber color with a huge soapy head. Aroma is pleasing-hops, citrus, pine. Body is heavy for an IPA. Taste is hop-loaded, but well-balanced with citrus.
Pours golden wit a big lacy head, stong hoppy aroma.  The right amount of carbonation. Complex taste, full of fruit and pine flavors.

12 oz bottle; pour yields a pale, slightly hazy golden hue with a big frothy head, leaving a silky lacing on the glass.  aromas are of big bitter hops, thick, musty scents, a tiny hint of salt, notable evergreen bark, and coriander in the back.  theres depth here.  the citrus does indeed shine through with a pleasant hop character on the palate.  mild spice, carbonation, and bitterness.  this is a very well crafted ale with high drinkability.  the aroma was a bit muted at first, but then opened up and burst into complexity.  truly a great ale.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2008 Man oh man oh man. Was I glad this showed up in NC. Let me say this, I am not a hop man and hence not an IPA man. Taking that into account I loved this beer. Poured a smooth peachy amber with a medium thin, creamy, white head with a slowly receding lace. The aroma was hoppy above all else, very sweet and very fruity, definite citrus. Absolutely tantalizing. The flavor was sweet, fruity, and they hops were masterfully done. Not over the top, very well maintained. The palate was bitter at the back of my mouth. God I loved this IPA. I literally could not stop drinking it.

Bottle dated 4 weeks old.

Poured a delicious looking hazed orange-gold ale in the glass with a puffy 3 finger white cap that lasts and laces the glass well.

Aromas are delightful: sweet malts under grape fruit tones and floral aromas...a light earthy mustiness...very much like Anchor Liberty but more pronounced.

Flavor and Mouth -Feel Profile: 

The delivery:
....up front thick caramelized malts to chew on which are almost instantly balanced off with a ceadr-citrus bittering. Silken mouth feel.

Mid palate: 
....you get some complexity of tastes as the hop alphas and yeast by-products produce some interesting succulent fruits-pine-citrus peel tones that blend with the sweet rich breadiness of the malts, much like a tart-floral marmalade on toast...perfect balance in this "big" rich full bodied ale.

The finish: 
...malt-hop balance slowly dissipates as the long finish becomes slowly more bitter an floral with a final light citrus peel after taste and a light warming from the 7%ABV.

A very well put together American styled IPA...not exactly in the Pacific NW style but it bears many characteristcs. tThe nose and flavor are infused with a wonderful hop mixture that indicates both hopback infusion and dry hopping. Smooth, Big flavor, well balanced, drinkable and satifying. This ale has all you ask for in a daily beer.

Rated 8/1/06:  Utterly awesome, this is another great example of what an IPA should be. Aroma is floral, citrusy, piney and hoppy, sweet and malty I could sniff this for a long time. Pour is a nice golden copper with a creamy thick white head and nice lacing. Mouthfeel is medium thick and really smooth with a creamy finish. Flavor is an intense mixture of malts and hops, truly remarkable. The drinkability of this is good the strong hop presence doesnt become overly bitter. Fantastic! Overall this will become one of my favorites.
Pours a cloudy amber color with a huge soapy head.  Aroma is pleasing-hops, citrus, pine.  Body is heavy for an IPA.  Taste is hop-loaded, but well-balanced with citrus.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2010 This stuff is GOOD.  I would compare it to Racer 5.  There are definitely a lot of hops in this beer.  It is VERY floral and citrus, making it incredibly refreshing.  The malt balances it out nicely, but still leaves a flavor very dominated by hops.  Very full flavor.  One of the best aromas ive smelled in a beer.  Nice.
Poured an amber color. Taste was mostly hops but not really overloaded. Very smoothe.
Pours hazy orange, thin white head.  Aroma is piney.  Lots of hops, yet there seems to be enough malt to provide some balance.  Good stuff.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2007 Hoppy citrus aroma with melons and orange. Pale golden yellow with a creamy white head. Grapefruit bitter with lots and lots of hops. Thick bitter body.

Bottle at the Pizzeria Paradisio: 
Pors nicely enough, smells wonderful enough and tastes even better that that!
Another great offering from Bells.
What else can be said?

Thanks to Nuts, on tap at Vintage Estates.  Ubiquitous pale yellow american beer appearance.  The smell is special, piny or heavy cannabis cola flowers aroma. Never smelled anything like this. Creamy alabaster white blanket for a head that hangs for a while. Very hoppy yet not overpowering bitter.  Can appreciate this even though IPA is not of my liking. Definitely one of the better tasting IPA Ive had. Medium low carbonation. Finish is lingering medicinal preservative qualities that linger for a medium amount of time.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 24, 2012 12oz bottle, $1.49.  Aroma is light citrus, orange with some light hopps tossed in.  Appearance is hazy light yellow/amber with an average frothy, mostly diminishing, off-white head that left a fair lace.  Flavor was kind of weak;  Lightly sweet and bitter.  Palate is light to medium bodied and watery flat.  My brother likes it and he isnt into tasting beer so its probably a good one for n00bz but I found it over rated.  Victory hopdevil is more of what Im looking for in an IPA.
Had on draft at local bar. Poured a cloudy amber color...Smelled like grapefruit. I am not a fan of IPAs but found this one quite drinkable. Taste was citrus, malts, and flowers...Decent.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2008 damn is this a good ipa. just boiling over with hop kick ya in the face when your down style. superb hoppy bite and finishes just great and bitter on the plate. seems to really linger out back while just inviting up front. second to i guess only furious. Strong grapefuit aroma and hangs on the palate out back all day long mmmm. TASTY Although sea hag is dam good too. GREAT beer by bells just awesome

This is a beer that could convert a lot of people over to IPAs. Pours a lightly cloudy amber with a large, frothy, lasting head that marks its descent as you enjoy its hoppy goodness. The aroma is a pleasant blend of citrus and flowers, and the palate is medium-bodied and slick with a nice bitter finish. The flavor is actually pretty sweet at the start (for an IPA), but the floral finish creates a very satisfying and balanced beer.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Draft at St. Stephens with dallas. Pours a golden body with small white head, nice lacing. Aroma is awesome pine hops, and some citrus notes. Mouthfeel is medium, flavor is same as aroma.
REVISIT 2014: Bottle on several occassions with Pat. Bells Two Hearted seems to have become a staple of the Philadelphia beer scene in the sense that it was one of the few beers with wide distribution that also moves fast enough to allow for consistently fresh bottles. Pours a light golden body with thick white head. Aroma is bitter lemon grass, crisp pale malt and bitter fruity hop. Mouthfeel is carbonated, crisp and light; notes of grass, pale malt, light sweetness and delicate spice. Reliable and sessionable.

Golden body and hazy.  Nice medium sized head with aroma of pine hops and floral malts.  Starts hoppy and then balances with malts before finishing with a dry note that makes you come back for more.  A nice savory beer.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2009 Pours sorta hazy golden, forming a white foamy head.  Aroma of crisp pines, wet forest hops, and lovely malts.  Flavor is of sweet malted floral hops.  Very well balanced.  A tinge of grapefruit going there too.  Pretty good IPA, not overwhelming.  Not very pungent as I was hoping for.  Would have gotten higher point from me, not up there with Hop Devil or Thunderhead, but not too bad either.  Easily sessionable.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass, hazy yellow with a thin head. Aroma was of citrus and orange peel. The flavor was complex with notes of orange peel, citrus, lime and floral hops. Bitter on the finish. Well carbonated. IPAs really arent my thing, but this is well done. It kind of grows on you.
Light golden hoppie stout.  Light hoppie scent.  This beer was a light ale color with a very bitter aftertaste.

Pungent grapefruit and yeast aroma. Deep golden color, semi opaque with white foamy head.  Flavor is full of citrus and  switches to malt halfway through.  Good range of flavors and complexity.  Grapefruit accents, slightly dry.  Lighter mouthfeel than some.  Well carbonated.  Very good and easy to drink.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2009 Bottled from batch 7770, received from pantanap in a recent trade. Pours with a small head that faded quickly and aroma of pine and hop. Flavor is nice with the good crisp clean and refreshing flavor all the way down. Very easy to drink. I cant wait to try to Hopslam!   
Re-rated on 10/08/09. Moved up from 3.7 to a 4.0. This is an exceptional beer, and one that Id go to regularly if available. Extremely quaffable for a 7% offering.

On Tap at Pracna Minneapolis (I have had this beer many, many times otherwise) IPAs are my favorite style, I love the citrus, Piney aroma and flavors.  This is my second favorite IPA I have ever had (Surly Furious is the only one I would prefer over this).  Aroma is a nice citrus hop, extremely inviting.  Color good golden orange.  White head sticks around pretty well. Taste, oh the taste is a wonderful pine, citrus hoppy well balanced flavor.   A little too carbonated for me, but let this one breate a little and it is perfect.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2007 I like this brew.  It has a very nice hoppy taste without being overly bitter.  It has a great all round finish. Competes well with Dog Fish Head 90 minute IPA.  Well worth the price.

Bottle, batch 7877, bottled on 3-26-07.  Pours orange with a large white frothy head that shrinks back a little bit but sticks around for the whole beer, the lacing is awsome too.  Looking through the glass it is very hazy with tiny particles floating around.  The aroma is all hops, a very citrusy aroma.  The initial flavor is quite bitter which sticks around for a while, the duration of the flavor is long.  The flavor is of citrus, mostly orange.  The body is medium with a oily and creamy texture with lively carbonation.  This is still one of my favorite IPAs.  This was the first craft beer I had, and I fell in love with it, and craft beer.  It was all down hill from there.

Tap.  Small white (fully dissapating) head into clear dark gold body.  Aroma was strong grapefruit and light molasses.  Flavor:  initially lightly sweet and finishes bitter with initialy sweetness intact.  Medium bodied.  Dry textured.  Lively carbonation.  Moderate lasting finish.  I am really impressed with this IPA.  I have been slightly dissapointed with other Bells brews, but this totally justifies their popularity.
A wonderful aroma of freshness and sweetness. There is a watered down flavor that hampers the beer at the end.. overall this is a good beer..
Pours gold into a shaker.  Pine and citrus aromas.  Clean, crisp and hoppy.  Lasting hop finish.
Awesome. This beer has an awesome floral aroma with a huge amount of hops. Great lingering finish.

*********BEER 800***********Cloudy golden-orange body with a full, 2mm thick head of white uneven-sized bubbles.  Smells of sweet hops, sugars, apricot, pear and faint peppermint.  Mouth feel is thin like a cold glass of water, but never watery.  Taste is cold crisp and big, full-on assault of citric hops, pine needles, caramel, transitioning to leather and biscuit dough. After is alcohol and bitter pine hops.  This beer is very linear, with the taste being even and transitioning perfectly.  Well-made, well-executed, well-controlled. Picked this up for a bargain at Whole Foods for $1.59/single.
Bottle.  Cloudy orangy amber color with a frothy white head.  Hops and oranges in the nose and more in flowery in the taste.  Mouthfeel was good.  One of my favorites.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2008 Im not a big hophead, but even I can get into this beer.  Great price and a very nicely balanced beer.  Nice hops and malts playing off each other.  Very good brew.  Must try for an IPA lover.

re-rate: After aquiring a bit more of a taste for hops and tasting a lot of other IPAs, I have to say this is definitely one of my favorites.  It only gets better on tap.  More floral and spicy.  Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2007 Bottle:  Pours with a cloudy orange body...Nice frothy head off-white head and excellent lacing.  Highly seductive aroma.  Extremely well balanced beer.  An amazing brew to enjoy any time.  Another great beer from Bells.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2007 12 oz bottle.  Side by side tasting with Three Floyds Alpha King.  Pours a pretty golden-orange color with nice lacing.  Smells citrusy, hoppy and sweet.  Taste is very smooth... not as hoppy as the Alpha King, more balanced.  A bit more carbonated, but still feels smooth in the mouth.

The smell alone is reason enough to buy this IPA.  The floral aromas are amazing and the taste backs it up.  Very hoppy, but I feel still balanced.  Probably my favorite IPA out there right now.  With the head stuck around longer, thats the only points Im taking away.

Pours a light copper to gold color with a creamy head that dissipates quickly. Smells of light caramel mixed with the scent of mouth watering sweet floral hop goodness. Taste is at first citrusy with grassy-ness with strong bitterness that lingers on the tongue with a very slight alcohol warmth. Nice medium to full bodied mouthfeel. My memory of this beer was more balanced but in reviewing it today the hop bitterness was very prominent. A solid IPA from Bells that I am sure I will drink many more of.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2007 Maybe my favorite APA/IPA after Alpha King -- not too hoppy, just perfectly balanced with hops and bitters.  I could drink a 6 pack of this on a nice summer day.  The Centennial hops are nice change of pace from the typical Cascade/Amarillo/Simcoe IPAs out there.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2009 Yellow pour, diminishing white frothy head (on tap) almost like soap bubbles, very floral hop aroma, tasted a little soapy but it may have been the glass, lively carbonation, bitter and crisp like it stops in you mouth .  Bells Brewery never disappoints. original rating 3.7, rerated from bottle, being on an IPA kick this one is very good, nector/citrus grapefruit, very nice texture and weight, this is very drinkable.  Good balance of bitter with finish...Very Nice

UPDATED: APR 14, 2007 This is an example of my fav type of IPA...citrusy and floral - - - very dry/crisp finish and very balanced.  Delicious and leaves you longing for the next sip.  Can be drank at night or in the sun!  Sweet label too.  Thanks to my bro for giving me a taste.
Light amber color with this head. Beautiful aroma WIth added citrus flover and plenty of hops.

12oz bottle, served in my brand new Duvel Tulip. Batch #7806, packaged on 01/22/2007. Pours a gorgeous golden orange/amber with a huge, pillowy white head. Excellent cobweb lacing on the glass. Nice lasting power on the head. Nose of floral hops, pine, citrus, grapefruit, Cannabis. Fore of the tongue is heavily astringent. Pine, hops, spice and grapefruit dominate. Back of the tongue is more of the same, with the floral notes shining through. Finish is crisp, dry and bitter. Full of hops. I like this a lot for some reason, even with not being a huge fan of I/IPAs so far. I think the absence of Cascade hops really helps.

Another winner from Bells. 3/3 for me personally so far.
33 cl bottle, Fargo. Light amber colour, thin head. Fantastic all hops aroma. Very dry bite, expands in the mouth to the back of the throat. Some sweetness at the end. Excellent ale.

This beer really hits the spot after a long day at work. Definitely a great session beer if it was available locally. Pours a golden amber with a 1" foamy white head. Sweet citrusy hops fill the nose, with hints of honeysuckle and a spring floral boquet. Flavor is a well balanced array of citrus hops with a sticky palate. Finish is rather brief with no lingering bitterness. A very fine example of an IPA, and a great daily drinker.

12oz Bottle, 6% a/v

Smells VERY hoppy with some pine and spicy smells mixed in. It pours a cloudy copper with a light brown head. The taste is of spicy and cedar with a bit of fruit and the aftertaste is a VERY hoppy sharpness. This is a great beer to sip on and as has been said a nice northern beer. Great for the cottage.

** You may not like this if your not a fan of hops **
This beer is the north. Bitter, piney, dry, you can taste every ingredient in this beer. Beautiful.

pours a nice golden color with a small white head that lingers. aroma is of citrus and piney hops with some sweetness. flavor mirrors the aroma, with the floral hops hitting you first, with a piney/citrusy hop finish and some caramel sweetness.  ultimately a pretty simple straight forward beer...a solid example of an IPA

UPDATED: APR 23, 2009 The aroma is full of pine and citrus hops with caramel malt. The appearance is golden amber with a two finger head. The flavor is balanced with lots of caramel malt and hops. The pine really comes through. The palate is sticky. Not all that complex but a Fantastic beer!

This is now avalable in Tampa.I personally did not enjoy this, however being that this an IPA all the characteristics are here.Hugh floral aroma with lots of hop flavor.Finish was hoppy with some bitterness.All hop heads will enjoy it

Bottle:  Pours a golden straw color with a large, frothy white head.  Spotty lacing.  Nose is a hefty blend of floral and citrus hops, hints of pine and sweet malt.  The taste is more hops led by florals and backed up by some citrus and piney notes.  A subtle malt sweetness ties it all together.  Very good.  Thanks to pantanap for sending this as a bonus brew!

12oz bottle. Pours a clear golden with a small long lasting white head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma of pine and floral  hops with a wonderfull sweet maltiness and a slight citrus boquet. Taste is of pine and floral hops with a well balanced malt sweetness and and good dry bitter finish. An amazing IPA that I look forward to drinking again.

Bottle at Tigers spring training game in Florida.I can not believe i have not had this yet being from midwest and always available.HOPPY and very smooth with a floral type of finish.Iwill try again in a different setting ,but i did enjoy this .CHEERS!

12oz bottle.  Pours a light golden/orange color with a gigantic, fluffy white head that leaves amazingly thick lace down the glass.  Beautiful hoppy, floral smell, as advertised.  Also, sweet, strong, resin.  The taste isnt quite as amazing as the aroma or appearance.  Its a lot smoother and milder than aroma would indicate.  Very drinkable, refreshing, and well-balanced with a nice touch of bitterness.  Hoppy and smooth.  All around a great IPA.
Pours a hazy golden with a thick white foamy head. Aroma of hops and hops and hops and more hops. Tastes of...hops. slight bitter finish.
Cask-conditioned tap. Hazy golden color, smooth and creamy~yet hoppy.took awhile to settle,head stayed almost throughout pint.yum.yum had another:)
Great color on the pour, fantastic.  Not a bitter taste at all, but i still know Im drinking some hops.  Very floary, and a tad bit citrusy. Love it.

Poured into pint glass, a very nice slighlty cloudy orange hue. Smallish head; very sticky lacing. Very pleasant aroma of citrus hops. You could almost just smell this beer. Excellent balance of citrus and hops flavor. Just bitter enough, but not enough to pucker your mouth. Predominantly orange flavors with some grapefruit in the mix. Finish is dry and clean. Exceptional drinkability. My favorite 60 minute IPA so far.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2007 Now this is what am IPA should be like.  This thing is the best example of an IPA that I have had to date.  Pours out a deep golden yellow color with a nice white head.  Aroma is very floral and very hoppy.  the taste is hoppy with a nice clean citrus finish.  Superb beer!

From a twelve ouce bottle purchased at "Kellers IGA "in Cincinnati, Ohio - This one poured a cloudy, golden brew with a tall white head and hoppy, piney aroma, Tastewise, this is a great beer, with the hops and malt in perfect balance.

Simply put one of the best beers of any type Ive ever had. 

Had a nice creamy head sitting on top of a brilliant cloudy beer. The taste and smell both yelled out hops! 

One of those beers a hophead would be more than happy to get ahold of, yet also has enough balance to even things out abit for something who is not a huge fan of hops. Bells continues to impress
Pours cloudy-yellow. VERY strong aroma of hops.  If you are a fan of IPAs  this one is for you.  Probably my favorite to drink.  Great job Bells.

Pours a hazy dirty-blonde with copper head.  Aroma has the distinct hoppiness of most IPAs.  Flavor is extremely well balanced and smooth.  The hops is evident but not overpowering and finish is a bit bitter as expected but not extremely dry.  Bells just puts out consistent high-quality brews.  This is another perfect example.

12 oz bottle smuggled across the Iowa border into the illegal lands of Chicago.  Wow I miss this beer.  Pours orange in color with a tall beige head.  Nice aroma of grapefruit, lots of it and tangerine, with a little citrus and pine.  That is a wonderful nose.  Grapefruit, tangerine, carmel, citrus flavors, abundant and delicious.  The malt is balanced really well with that biting hop.  I can drink a lot of this one.

True cask conditioned ale from firkin and poured from English pump engine.  I have had this in a bottle and other than appearance there is not much comparison.  I would rate the bottle a 3.9, maybe 4.  I think the 4.3 I have for this is a little conservative.  Clear, golden color with small lasting head.  Aroma is pretty much as advertised floral hops and citrus.  I think the mouthfeel strikes me as much as the flavor.  Smooth and creamy going down.  Hops?  Yes, you could say that.  I originally thought maybe oranges, but because of the bitterness, probably more grapefruit.  Well balanced.  I will be back tomorrow for another.
Spicy aroma with a clouded golden orange color and a long lasting head.  Strong hop taste that for me is right on par with DFH.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2008 Bottle.  Pour a goldish, almost cloudy settling mix.  Nice tight white head on top, after settling, great looking beer.  Aroma is hop and flowers.  Initial taste is hops, and citrus.  I would say it was mostly grapefruit.  Medium and finish has a nice crisp / bitter body with some malt and more hop in the finish.  This is a wonderfully balanced IPA that drinks perfect.  My best IPA to date.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2011 On tap at Tylers, Durham. Everything you could want from a pale, and Im thankful that its now in NC. Huge floral aroma, nice clean mouthfeel (a bit stickier than I remember, but bursting with floral hops even so), and with a bit of an edge. So satisfying.

bottle: pours a hazy looking orange colour with a small white head. aroma is about as perfect as i have smelled in an IPA it is vcery flora and sweet hop smell makes my mouth water. the flavour is a perfect balance of clean malts and flora hops with just a touch of earthness and bitterness in the finish. i am very impressed great  great beer thanks a lot temporrari for this beer

At first glance this seems to be the perfect IPA.  Hazy orange gold color, chunky white head that leaves awesome lacing.  Very pleasant citrus hop aroma -- not overpowering, not assaultive, just a great floral orange.  Taste is similar to Stone IPA but more subtly complex -- slightly spicy, lots of citrus, tangy.  Lightish mouthfeel, well-carbonated, totally drinkable.  Thanks so much to pantanap for sending this gem along.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2008 Pours an orangish-gold color with nice offwhite head.  Aroma is very citrusy, very much an orange aroma compared to the grapefruit you find in most IPA’s.  Taste much the same. .

This IPA just seems to sticky and floral to me.  The stink never comes off of your hands and I think if you give it time, itll remove the chrome off a trailer hitch.

Normally not my kind of brew, but this is a quality drink.   Hoppy, but earthy with lots of flavor.  Doesnt kill your taste buds right away, but keeps on coming with flavors of citrus, hops, and spices.  A great beer....
starts with a nice aroma of hops and fruits... pours clear golden ... Tastes bitter with citrus tones and finishes with a nice lingering after-taste of hops... very good IPA

12oz. Bottle
According to Bells website it was packaged 9/25/06. So it should be nice and fresh.

Two Hearted poured a slightly hazy gold. A good looking 1+finger white micro bubble head. Swirling carbonation rising from a few different points in my pint glass.

All I smell coming from this beer is hops, which is a very good thing. I smell a forest of pine trees and grapefruit. Makes my mouth water.

There is a small malt backbone coming through but its mostly a hop attack. My kind of IPA. Citrus(grapefruit) hops followed by a mouthful of oily pine needles. A nice bitterness follows that gets me ready for the next drink.

Mouthfeel is a little on the lighter side but still good. Its funny but even though its lighter it still coats my mouth. Nice amount of carbonation.

Drinkability is good. I could and have drank quite a few of these in a sitting. 

Sampled 10/13/06

[bottle, courtesy of Jah Noth] Powerful citrus hop aroma. Very nice, golden appearance. Grassy, fresh hop flavors with a bit of sweet malt and grapefruit rind bitterness. Medium/light body. Pretty awesome stuff. An outstanding IPA.

Aroma of fresh cut grass, hop oils, pumpkin, alcohol. Medium/light heavy body. Taste of hops, medium malt sweetness, more hops. So much hop presence, but thats the point. Simply impressed with the hop bill for the brew. Needed more malt to make this the ultimate IPA Ive ever had. Very close.

Pours a nice darkish orange color with a moderate head that settles down to a thin coating.  Nice floral aroma with some pine resin smells.  Very fresh smelling.  Medium-bodied.  The beer has a maltiness that supports the late hop kick nicely.  The hop taste lingers a bit on the palate, but the hoppiness is more subtle than aggressive.  A well-crafted, very drinkable IPA.  Im glad this will be easy for me to acquire now.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2008 Pours Golden with medium white head.  Nice citrus hop aroma.  Pretty complex taste with a grapefruit-pine hop kick. Subtle malt character giving way to a nice bitter finish.  Really good stuff.

Ah yes, thats centennial.  Floral, citrusy and a bit spicy.  Just a bit of malt to hold up the hops.  Good bitterness in the back, definitely outshining the sweetness.  Light body and a slightly thin palate.  Theres one place for improvement.  Otherwise, this isnt all that much of a "crafted" beer.  Its just centennial in your face.  I like the aroma better than the flavor, but its still a damn tasty beer.  Very good IPA, but still not my favorite.
Great tasting beer,One Of  Bells best.Creamy head and a nice amber looking beer.Piney fruit taste with a nice bite .A great IPA .
Bottle and what a bottle, caramel, hay, floral, citrus, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, average carbonation.

A classic American IPA. It pours the color would expect, has a perfect head, and then the nose- wow! Great hop aromatics. The taste is just perfect- fruity, perfume hops, without any astringent bitterness. Just amazing. Malts are then as a great backbone, but this beer is about the hops as it should be. The approachableness of the hops is what really sets this apart from the crowd. Any average non hop head can have a sip of this and say- this is a really tasty beer. That is an accomplishment that cant be understated- for the masses and for the hop head. Between Two Hearted and Stone IPA for the best all round IPA in the US, in my limited experience.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2007 Orange body with medium eggshell-white head collapsing to a thin layer. Really nice hop oil citric aroma, almost floral. Lemony citric hop flavor. Effective cascade and pale malt combination I think. Moderate bitterness, very slightly overcarbonated in my opinion. Definitely something a little fishy in the taste... Overall, a quite solid IPA, but maybe a little tame by todays standards to be truly great...

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2007 Clear fine amber slight yellow notes and a fine slightly tanned head. Nice and smooth hoppy taste. Malt, hay and slight hints of cinnamon. Really creamy, hoppy ale with huge taste and body.

Hinsdale, IL.  Bottle poured into my Sierra Nevada Pale Ale Glass.  Today I made the hour round trip  to Munster Indiana to pick up a case of these.  Also grabbed some Alpha King while I was there.  The Two Hearted Ale case is a plain brown box stamped with black letters.  When I got home and poured a Two Hearted Ale, I remembered why I bothered. This beer is a treat for the eyes, nose, and palate.  Pours a hazy light orange, lots of sticky lacing and a low head that quickly dissapates.  The aroma, I love the nose on this beer.  Floral, hops, citrus.  Hits you as soon as you open the bottle.  And the flavor, bitter hops, smooth, dry finish.  Just enough malt.

I have to say with a refrigerator stocked with Alpha King and Two Hearted Ale, its a real difficult choice.  I think Ill find myself going for the Two Hearted.  I

I was severely disappointed.  This beer was recommended by a coworker and rated so highly here that I was expecting more.  The grapefruit flavor was a definite plus for me in adding to overall complexity.  However, I found there to be too much of a reliance on the upper palate and too little of a well rounded flavor.

12 oz bottle.  Batch #7795.  Pours a light gold with a half-finger off-white head.  Aroma is of grapefruit, hops and pine.  Taste is sweet with a carbonated bitter pine grapefruit finish.  Light and smooth.  Very nice.

I have decided upon the same sentiments as Bullet2urbrain, seeing as that is what we discussed while we drank this one, as we are roommates.  In a not strange life-parter way.. Just two guys who live together and enjoy craft brews.  Completely platonic, I swear.  But honeslty, another great Bells brew, a great example of the style

Best part about this beer, its not a porter!

12oz bottle, Pours a nice copper color, the obvious scents of citrus and grapefruit are apparent.. taste is what sells me on this beer. tastes just like every good IPA should. Done right by Bells, a fantastic reprieve from a winter full of stouts.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2008 I get more grief over this beer from my friends than any other beer Ive rated.  Why?  Quite simply, because I havent posted a rating for this beer despite having it many times over the years.  However, I have recently had it again from both 12 oz bottles and draught (at Winking Lizard Tavern - Crosswoods in Columbus, Ohio on 2/07/2007), so its finally time to record some numbers and thoughts about this beer.  Maybe then my friends will let up on me or more likely, find another beer to hastle me about...

The bottled and draught versions of Bells Two Hearted Ale are  surprisingly identical in all ways.  This beer pours a copper color with hues of brown, red, orange, and golden yellow.  It has a creamy, near white head that has good retention and leaves a little bit of lacing on the glass.  The hoppy aroma is a nice bouquet of citrus, grapefruit, pine, floral notes, and some malt.  The initial  moderate malt sweetness is followed by a hefty dose of bitterness and the same hop flavors that were in the aroma, only stoner.  The bitterness lasts through the crisp finish and then some.  The body is medium to full and is smooth and slick on the palate.  Overall this is a well balanced, but intense IPA.  It has a tendency to wreck the palate after drinking a few of these!  Bells Two Hearted Ale is a  is probably best fresh in order to experience its wonderful hoppy aroma and flavor at their peak!  Bells does not disappoint and the Two Hearted Ale is one of their best mainstream brews...

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2007 beautiful copper color with off-white head, lacing evident.  citrus (grapefruit) and some pine aroma though somewhat  less of a bouquet than youd expect given the big taste (thats just speaking relatively - this stuff smell fantastic, but tastes even better).  very well balanced,  great lingering aftertaste without being overly bitter.  Not perfect, but its hard to imagine a better IPA.
Bottle. Thanks to BillVanE. Poured a golden color with a with frothy head. Aroma of citrus and hops. Taste of citrus and some spice and hops is great.

Are those hops or drugs Im tasting, by the time the four pint comes around I cant tell any more. This beer is a great IPA as long as you can stop at two or three but like every other Bells I cant!

Simply put I would not go out and buy a bunch of this because it is just a little too bitter for me and it needs more of the fruity qualities I taste. That may make it more palletable for me. Not exactly up to my tastes.

This is my favorite beer, conveniently available in Evansville or Louisville. Hazy apricot body is topped by a healthy head that is just offwhite. Humidly aromatic to the nose, with notes of kiwi, pink grapefruit, and orange blossoms. Perfumey, almost. Medium body supports waves of bitersweet fruity hop essence. Exceptionally well balanced. The ideal American IPA. Love this stuff!
Bottle.  Good floral hop aroma.  Very enjoyable flavor.  Lingering bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2008 This is my favorite session beer (at 6%, is that still ok?)  Deep golden / orange, beatiful piney bouquet.  Nice big pine and grapefruit hop flavor, slightly sweet, kind of oily.  Tastes bright and fresh; Ive bought cases of this and never had a bad bottle.  Love it!

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2007 12oz bottle, thanks to holdenn for boot legging this into chicago. pours dense orange with a nice glow and solid white head. nose is soft with citrusy hops, not a big hop aroma. taste is nicely balanced hops but nothing over the top and seems to not go for a the west coast PNW hop bomb. perhaps a hoppier english style IPA. this beer is very drinkable and no real flaws come to mind.3.9. 

batch 8220. Im really digging this, seems very fresh yet smooth and in amazing balance. very orangey, berry, citrusy. I could go for a fresh bottle of this anytime.

(Bottle) Pours a frothy white large head with a cloudy, lightly carbonated, minute sediment filled amber body. Nose of ahappy fulfilling citrus hops and rose water. Very sweet and piney mixed with Seville oranges. Nice sweet bitterness. Very good.

Pours a mildy hazy, yellow-gold.  small to medium head.  Aroma of grapefruit, a general citrus, and some floral notes.  Taste was of grapefruit, with a really good floral component.  Only small trace of malt.  Smooth, great mouthfeel.   Very refreshing.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2008 12 oz bottle...Wonderful grapefruit aroma and flavor to this. Pleasant hop flavor and bitterness, while maintaining good balance. Perfect carbonation, fairly light mouthfeel. One of the more enjoyable and sessionable IPAs Ive had.

Served from a 12 oz. bottle at the Wicked Hop in Milwaukee.  Strong hop aroma and flavor, nicely rounded without going over the top.  Medium bodied.  Long lasting bitter finish without harshness.  Very pleasant IPA.  Id do a better rating by my wife chews my butt when I take notes while we are out.

Strong and pleasant aromas of grapefruit, lemon, perfume and flowers.  Heady beer with an opaque orange sunset in the glass.  Tons of lacing.  Gently bitter hops up front.  Harsher, more bitter hops in the middle f the palate, and a hoppy finish that contains juicy grapefruit, orange and lemon.  Smooth and rich throughout.  Nearly-silent caramel malts in the deep background of this profiled palate.  A tremendous IPA, bold and American.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2008 pours with a medium head, with an aroma of apricots and floral hoppiness.  The taste is quite the same.  It is a great beer on tap, but I couldnt quite imagine drinking more than 2 of them.

The aroma is of grapefruit, it almost smells like a glass of grapefruit juice.  It pours a slightly hazy amber, with a minimal head that quickly fades, leaving only lacing behind.  The taste is of well balanced hops, blending citrus and bitter.  The palate has the very slight hint of oils of a good IPA, and the finish is crisp.  Another good addition from Bells.

Just got this is a trade. Very good looking brew. Nice thick color. Smell is a bit meh. The taste and drinkability on this are superb. Very smooth with strong flavor in it. Since im still not sure what or how describe the "mouth feel" ill say that this has a great mouth feel. I drink it and it tastes great.

12 bottle.  Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a memium-sized white head.  Lots of floral and citrus hop aroma.  Prominent flavors of orange and floral hops with some earthy undertones.  Although the hops are featured, the beer is very well balanced.  A very good IPA.

A: poured a beautiful golden orange with a huge frothy, white head and a ton of lacing

S: as is the case with many top beers of this style, the beer gives off an ample floral aroma. I am definitely getting some slight citrus and/or coriander scents as well. Very appealing.

T: A gorgeous wallop of hops smacks your tongue right off the bat, then the malts slip in to balance the overall flavor, and everything finishes at once, like a perfectly timed meal. Hop lovers will definitely want to grab this beer.

M: Not a ton of body, a tiny bit thin, but overall very nice.

D: Now here is where this beer truly shines. The excellent taste + reasonable alcohol content + an amazing level of refreshing qualities makes this an all-day drinker. Wonderful beer that I could and would go back to time & time again.

Recommended.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2008 On tap at The Good Beer Store in Chapel Hill, NC. Sipped while I shopped. Pours is deep orange with minimal white head. Smell if floral and citus hops. Flavor is full with hops with a lighter malt backbone. A solid ipa from a brewery that never dissapoints. 

Updated Rating: Now that this has been available in NC for some time, I have come to drink quite a bit of this stuff. I love it. Its the best beer out there for my money that I have regular access to.  Thanks so much for coming to NC Bells!

Pours an orange amber.  Smells of flowers and other hops.  It is bursting with hops!  A great combination without being too bitter.  It just hits the right amount and then it fades before it can even be remembered as a hopped up beer.
Pours dark gold and foggy with a big tenacious off white head. Smells like pine and citrus...Delightful! Taste is big hops with some lemon and pine again. What a nice IPA!

21st birthday present from Crosling. There will be a few of these. Thanks, bro. Delicious orange color with a slowly dissolving, fluffly white head. Subdued, hoppy floral aroma. Not quite as strong in aroma as I would have liked. Perfectly balanced hops; they are prominent without being overly bitter. Probably one of the best straight IPAs out there. Medium bodied, lovely on the palate. I only wish I had more...

Bottle.  Orangish color.  Strong citrus aroma, smells like hops in a brewery (or at least my kitchen when I home brew). Flavor is great, especially as it warmed a bit.  Fantastic hops flavor really makes this beer hit the spot.

Hazy orange appearance with a medium size white head and very nice lacing.  Resinous hop aroma, very citrusy, with a whiff of cookie dough under all the hops.  Flavors of pine, grapefruit and orange; some sweet malts add balance.  Bitter, medium bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel.  Lasting finish turns a little sweet at the end.

Pours a orangish pink color, very pretty.  I got a strong citrus smell with hints of vanilla, and floral notes.  Tasted of pretty strong citrus mixed in with light hops and litle orange peel in there as well.  This beer is put together very well.  Nice citrus in the finish that stays a little while.  Excellent brew.

It pours out clean and clear (if poured carefully) with an agressive and sticky bone head. Color is reminiscent of a sunset or the flesh of a peach. The lacing sticks all the way down.

Oh, the nose on this beer. Its home-made shortcake, glazed with citrusey pulp, vanilla and orchid petals. Hoppy to the extreme but showing a wonderfully sweet malt base. 

Its full, but not fat or bloated in the mouth. Perfectly carbonated, keeping it light, but not thin... just right. When it hits your tounge, its citrus bitter, rolling directly into sweet shortbread and vanilla malts. Plenty of fruit character shows, with some apricot and other fleshy stone fruits. The hop flavor doesnt back off though, its there, and very strong, a lucious mix of citrus fruits, grapefruit, satsumas (mmmm) and the lovely spring like flavor of flower petals. All of this is rolled up into an ellegant dance of malt and hops... perfection. Seriously.

I will always have a mild love affair with this beer.
Pours an amber/gold with thick puffed head.

smells of citrusy hop/pine/diacitle

tastes of hop/grapefruit.lemo zest/ and pine nuts, Its delicious!

could drink all day if it werent so alcoholic! If you dont have it available, GET IT!

Tap at The Good Beer Store.  Very appealing cloudy light orange color.  Intense aromas of sweet fresh fruits: pineapple, banana, limeade, along with a bit of yeast and a definite hops presence.  The taste is quite an experience: fruity, sweet hops balanced with a yeasty, bready backbone.  BItterness is perfectly controlled.  There is plenty of body with carefully concealed alcohol.  I had tried this some time ago in bottle and was not very impressed, but after trying it on tap this has become one of my favorite IPAs!

Pour is deep gold, not as dark as I usually think of from an IPA. Lots of soft white foam that sticks around absolutely forever. Some nice pine and citrus hops in the aroma.

Yum. Good tasting beer. Solidly built, with ample hoping, but not so much as most good American IPAs. Very clean and refreshing, the first sips begs a second. The first glass begs a second.
Its ok.  Its not fantastic, but its definitely not the worst IPA ive ever had.  Its a solid, well balanced IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2009 Bells Two Hearted Ale is my 100th rating.  Wow, I finally made it.  Bells is a good IPA, a very good IPA.  The aroma is citrus and floral, while the beer is very sharp and bitter with the same notes.  Just a very good, well made IPA. Nothing over the top, but good.
---Update---- 9070 Consumed May 5th.  
Wow.  So much more orange and dank.  Lots of bright hop flavors mixing with the crisp biscuit malt to create an absolutely stunning experience.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2007 On cask (yes, cask) at the Happy Gnome in St. Paul, MN. The aroma is strongly citrus-hoppy, and that is great for a hops lover like me. Pours a clear amber with virtually no head. The flavor is very pleasantly hoppy. There are slight fresh apple notes. The hops overwhelm the other flavors. Overall, I would characterize the taste as subdued, which is a strange thing to say about a hops-oriented legend like Two Hearted. The beer is very smooth and undercarbonated, producing a dull effect in the palate, likely an effect of the cask. This dull texture is a poor complement to the sharp hops. I definitely prefer the traditional non-cask version. I had Two Hearted a few weeks ago on non-cask tap. I didnt rate it formally, but I figured at the time that it would have earned about a 4.

Re-rate, 2-18-07: I tried Two Hearted again last night, this time in an approximately 4 oz. sample poured from a 12 oz. bottle at an American IPA tasting hosted by tennisjoel. It was the sixth of ten that we tried. Of the five of those ten that I had previously rated, this is the only one that I am re-rating, as it is the only one whose rating would have changed substantially. Clean-smelling, hoppy aroma features citrus (lemon, grapefruit) and pine. Pours a clear golden amber with a moderate amount of white head and good legs. Flavor of candy lemon sour hops; extremely citrusy. Like a hoppy limoncello, and I mean that as a compliment. Sharp and lively in the palate (a welcome upgrade from the dull cask experience); medium body. This is just a very good beer. Two Hearted is not quite as good as the wonderful HopSlam, but it does show a strong family resemblance. It came in second place on my ballot among the ten in the IPA tasting (to Surly Furious).

Original rating from cask: 9/3/7/2/14:3.5

Updated rating from bottle: 8/4/8/4/17:4.1
A strong cascade nose with a dark, golden color. A little strong in the hop-bitterness, but an excellent beer for those who love hops.
Orange, rust colored pour.  Nice thick white head.  Aroma of hops, citrus, flowers and some faint pine, with even a hint of malt.  Great hoppy-citrus taste with a bitter finish.

A grapefruity aroma with a touch of evergreen. An orangish pour with the prominate guey lacing. A jump out there hops flavor with a very nice bitter. A malt bill that levels this beer out to a very smooth flavor. Just a slightly thin palate and o so fizzy carbonation that kept this beer from being even better.  A thin palate is the only thing that keeps this from being soo much better. Still a damn fine beer.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2007 Big fan! I compare all IPAs to Furious, and this is right there so its good! Bells is always a good bet, and this will certainly make it to my fridge more then once. Plenty o hops for sure, it will let u know!

This  golden orange  IPA has a 2" rockey white head which stands up. An impressive blend of aromatic hops, citrus overtones and hints of pine this is a beer that starts out strong and finishes pretty true to deliver a well balanced IPA. Very drinkable and a real palate teaser. One of the best blends of IPA out there and worthy for any red blooded Muskie fisherman.

Oooooohhh thats so pretty. Dark copper, perfectly dark copper. Moderate head and nice bubbly look. So pretty. I think I smell pine through my allergies. Aggressive but balanced bitterness. Alittle salty but very nice. It feels somewhat fuller than normal. Not extremely carbonated but enough to give  it some personality. This is a truly great beer.
Bright orange in color with big, thick, long-lasting head. I didnt get the strong aroma most mention- thought it was rather faint. Flavor was very citric and hoppy. Too much grapefruit.
Seriously good IPA.  Bottle from Waldo Pizza, KC.  Shared w/ Ben...opened his eyes it did.  Hoppy, grassy, citrus aroma.  Delicious hop and flowery flavor.  Yum.

Poured from a 12oz bottle a straw yellow with a generous white head. Aroma was of wonderful citrus and floral hops and a sweet malt lurking in the back. Flavor was just wonderful a nice citrus hop a touch of grapefruit peel and just a hint of malt.

Bottle, poured light amber orange, white head, scent of flowers, sweet malt, caramel, citrus, little pineapple, whiff of vanilla, taste of malt, pine needles, light grapefruit, lots of lacing on the glass, hop bite on the tongue, nice mouthfeel, when drinking this ale, I feel as though I am going up and down a roller coaster of hops, really is a wonderful drink, this ale never seems to dissappoint me, like a childs Christmas Morning in a glass.
Probably my favorite single IPA.  Flowery, pineapple aroma. Similar flavors and a piney, clean aftertaste that lingers for minutes.  Just terrific!

Pours a two finger white head that fades to a thin layer leaving a good lace. Cloudy amber color. Light carbonation and medium bodied. Hoppy nose. Starts balanced, sweetness in the background but hops dominate as this IPA is true to style. $1.89 for a 12oz bottle from Chalet Party Goshen, In.

12oz bottle-pours a thick foamy to rocky slightly off white head and hazy yellow/gold color.  Aroma is lots of citrus hops-lemon zest.  Taste is lots of light citrus hops-lemon zest, some bitterness, some malt(?)  OK carbonation.  Nice.

12 oz bottle into a Tulip glass.  Thanks to asteele8 for this one!  This one pours a beautiful hazed and clouded golden orange with a retentive white head that succombs to the rim of the glass.  The aroma is exactly what I love out of a well crafted IPA: pines, pineapples, grapefruit citrus, a bit of honey, and bread.  The flavor starts off sweet with a bit of malt and then gets progressively more IPA from there.  Pine needles, lots of grapefruit citrus notes, a  bit of oranges, and bitter hops continue to glow on the palate all the way through the finish.  A tiny bit of yeast is present in the body.  A very velvety feel in the mouth, this one is moderately carbonated, but SMOOTH at the same time.  A nice hop presence lingers on the palate for a good moment after the sip.  A seriously damn good IPA here folks!

Bells Two Hearted Ale
12 oz bottle
Packaged 11/06, fished out 12/06
Moderate pour in a tulip glass.

Poured a clear amber with an average white frothy somewhat lasting head with layered rings of lacing denoting my sip timeline.

Smelt of strong oily pine resin, grapefruit rinds, fish, light peaches, strawberries, and sweet bread.

Taste was upfront medium strong bittersweet spruce and moderate bitter and sour grapefruit followed by a moderate bitter and skunky and fishy  resin taste on a long peach and spruce finish.  Palate was medium bodied, creamy, softly carbonated, and lightly astringent.

Overall, a very satisfying soft yet hearty IPA.  Excellent flavors, and well balanced in its flavor profile.  Ive nothing bad to say really.  Its just good.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Courtesy of GoBlue. Fairly light amber golden with a creamy, off-white head. Fresh, citrusy aroma with some pine needles. Medium body with some caramel and a distinct, perfumy aroma hoppiness. Solid bitterness in the finish. A nice IPA. 191206

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orangish color with a fat off white jead. Aroma is sweet and piney from the hops. Taste of hops and citrus that starts slightly bitter but finishes with a bit of fruity sweetness. A nice all around beer!

Bottle. Cloudy golden colour with a little white head. Aroma of sweet malt and little hoppy with notes of pines, floral and parfume. Flavour of malt with notes of pine-like, very well hopped. High carbonation. Ends with a pleasent bitter finish.

fine beer.  the first sip I wasnt sure I would like it as much as I do.  the citrus flavors are strong, but mellow(not actually, but in taste) after awhile.  doesnt feel heavy in the stomach.  quality.  $9 for six.

Tap and bottle. Looks like a murky lake with the sunn shining on it.  Tastes like a mixture between a flower and fruit garden.  Though its been said already, its a very well balanced beer that goes down smooth with a strong grapefruit aftertaste.

(Bottle) Pours an orangy tan with a large white head. Nice hoppy aroma, with more citrus than I expected. Lemon and grapefruit notes really shine through in this beer. Dry and moderately bitter. Full mouthfeel. A good offering from Bells.

Pours a light yellowish brown with a small, white head that lingers.   Aroma is strong and hoppy, with herbs.  Parsley and grass, smells delicious.  The flavor is a lot more subdued, but still very hoppy, with grapefruit and orange at the front.  Theres some earthy herbal flavor as sips go through, and the beer finishes with more grapefruity bitterness.  This brew is spectacular.  Pungent, hoppy aroma, and smooth, drinkable flavor.
light orange color with grapefruit like aroma.  its hugely hoppy but well balanced.

This Ale from western Michigan is currently my favorite beer.  It has a brilliantly sharp floral flavor that is simple but perfect.  Its fruity but dry and although I love it, Id never describe it as "well balanced."
Slightly hazy, orange color, big floral and citrus aroma, not extremely bitter for an IPA but more floral and citrusy, grapefruit.  Well balandce, Very drinkable.

amber, hazy, white foam, frothy, average carbonation, bitter, 
Poured great with a wonderful head.  Refreshing taste with a great hops finish.  I will buy again!

Nice clear amber color with a thick and tall white head.  Aroma is of green hops, fruit, honey, and malt.  The taste is wonderful.  Clean, crisp, and somewhat light taste that combines hops, pine, malt, and lemon.  Somewhat bubbly or carbonated in the mouth, it tingles all the way down.  It finishes very clean.  A very enjoyable IPA.

(Bottle) Pours clear amber. Piny and floral, green hops in aroma with some notes of fruits and strawberry jam. Rasin. Some malty sweetness. Fresh, clean, crispy flavour with pine and some apricot. Light raisiny bitter ending. Light to medium body. A more malty, compact body would make this a perfect IPA.

Deep gold to bright orange in color with thick, lasting white head, very cloudy if you arent careful to hold back the yeast in this bottle conditioned beer.  Vibrant citrus aroma with just a hint of malt.  Flavor explodes with citrus; lemons and oranges predominate with just a touch of grapefruit.  Spicy undertones with malt to balance, slightly sweer without being cloying.  Medium bodied with a refreshing carbonation bite.  Just a great, great example of what an American IPA should be.

Bottle from Iowaherkeye; Thanks Joey; Nose of citrus, hops, some caramel malt, and a little pineyness; hazy amber-orange with a big glass-lacing, orange-tinged head that lasts pretty long.flavor is mostly hops, with a little caramel that balances it, in the light to medium body, the hops lasting to a nice finish.

Superb tangerine color with a yeasty white head, two fingers.  Nice lacing as the head subsided slightly.  As other reviewers mentioned it has a very good balance of malt and hop flavors for a hoppy IPA.  Citrusy aroma and a nice amount of similar hop flavor with solid malt backbone.   Great flavor and finish that does not get dulled after a few bottles.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2006 Hazy, orange/gold color, with a nicely-lacing head. Good balance of hops and malts in the initial flavor, and a very pleasant hop bitterness in the finish. Good carbonation. The more sips I have of this, the more I like it. Extremely drinkable.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass.
Pours a golden color with a 2 inch head that recedes and leaves alot of sticky lacing on the glass.
Smell is of citrusy hops and slight yeast.
Taste is citrusy hops with a slight twist of lemon. This is a very balanced and smooth IPA. Not the punch or bite that the Hopslam has(which I love). This has a very smooth mouthfeel that makes this beer HIGHLY sessionable. This is a beer that you could pick up a sixer and take to a party and not have any problem drinking all of.
I would highly recommend this beer to anybody.

Xmas gift from MrBendo. #7703  Aroma of citrus.  Hops aromas remind me of Stone IPA.  Slightly hazy and very gold in color. Perfect appearance for an American IPA.  Flavor is very floral.  Jasmine and fruity pebbles with a hop bitterness palate.
Hazy golden color with white foam head. Aroma of hops, floral, piney and grapefruit. Grapefruity taste with slight bitter after taste. Very mild IPA.
One of my favorite beers from bells. Nice strong hop flavor. Start to finish a very fine hearty ale. If you see this try it you will like it.
bottle; hazy dark yellow  or light orange.  smells like a bottle of hops.  pure hops.  tastes like bitter, floral, and spicy hops.  hope you enjoy hops.

Hazy yellow-golden color with a medium head. Very stong hoppy aroma. Taste is slighty bitter, with evident grapefruit and the powerful taste of hopps. That description did not due this beer justice. Very well balanced, amazing beer.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2007 bottle. batch 7703. Poured hazy yellow/amber with a medium head.  Fair lacing left as the head dissipates slowly. Strong floral and citrus hops aroma, with some malt. Flavor is grapefruit and pine. A little pale malt to help the balance.  A pleasant, dry finish. Medium to light body.  Excellent IPA.
Pours a hazy orange color from the bottle with a fair head.  Aroma & tste is of citrus and hops.  A greay IPA!

Bottle.   Pours a lush copper with a spectacular rocky white head that just wont quit, great lacing.   Smell is floral, grapefruit, lemon, pine.   Taste is more of the same, floral, grapefruit, lemon, pine.   Super crisp, smooth, medium body.   Measuring stick IPA!

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2008 This is my favorite IPA. Its a beautiful copper-orange color and smells like a floral garden of hoppy goodness. Taste is no disappointment either: bitter with lots of hops and citrus, with a superior after-taste that is pleasant and crisp. Incredibly well-crafted session IPA.
Pours a hazy orange color with white head.  Aroma is of bitter citruis hops.  Some nice malts backed up by a bitter hoppy finish.  A balanced well hopped IPA.

12oz bottle thanks to Jaye.  Pours light golden colour with lots of off white foam, and it sticks around for a while.  Aroma of citrus hops and a little malt.  Taste is very smooth, with proper amount of IPA hop bitterness.  Flavour dies away rather abruptly, leaving a thirst for me.  A nice IPA.

The aroma hits you in the face the moment you open the bottle, very hoppy, citrus, lemon, pine and flowers.  Poured a murky blonde with a thick, foamy, lacing white head.  Citrus flavors, orange and lemon, very fresh flavor.  Bitter, astringent finish and slightly soapy and thick on the tongue and mouth.  Great smell, great hop taste.  This is a beer for the hop lovers.

Grand IPA to say the least. The hazy orange color and hoppy aroma lets you know that Mr. Hop is here and he ready to do some beatin! Funny how a beer can be both bitter and sweet at the same time. This one pulls it off. Not as strong as would be expected, but I would classify this as a good "sippin beer"
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Medium orange/amber color - soft creamy head.  Aroma is sweetly citrus, with notes of bubblegum and other fruits.  Fabuolusly hoppy flavor, rich and lively.  Finish is sweet and clean without being cloying.  Truly a world-class IPA.
it tastes like a pale ale made by bells.  it has a decent taste but definatly worth trying

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2008 12 oz bottle.  Purchased at Chevy Chase Wine and Liquor in Washington DC.  Pours straw colored with a large white head.  The hop aroma is omniprescent I could smell it immediatley after the pour.  The taste is hoppy and bitter with a lingering bitter edge.  Its refreshing but sharp, not as drinkable as other IPAs, but definetly good.

smells sweet; pours cloudy pale that you can almost see through.  It has a very lite and unique flavor that isnt the best example of an IPA but its memorable and has lots of character.  If your looking for somthing with more punch I suggest you look elsewhere, but for something strong (% wise) yet smooth this is a good buy.

12 oz bottle. Hazy orange color with thin white head that left a bit of lace on the glass. Distinct vegetal, floral hop aroma. The hops come out again in the flavor, of course, and are accompanied by an adequate, but marginalized malty backbone. Nice and bitter on the tongue.

bottle.  hazy golden/orange pour with almost no head.  citrus, big malt and hop aroma.  big floral hops battle malts.  creates an interesting and different palate.  slight bitter finish.  this is a complete beer

Aroma has alot of citrus.Pours a copper color with a white head.Taste is a great balance of hops and malt.At first you get the big hops then a good bit of malt with a nice bitter finish.If I plan on drinking alot this is the one I usually go to.Very easy to drink.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2007 22 OZ bottle from shigadeyo (Thanks!). She pours a hazy orange/copper with an average size white head. Nice floral aroma with some sweet mandarin orange, caramel malts, some pine and perhaps some floral hops. Tastes just like it smells, and is pretty sweet for an IPA. The hops are there in abundance, however there is a strong malt backbone as well. It is not a hop-bomb, but it is a very tastey hopy (not bitter) beer.

Bottle; pours light honey orange with a generous creamy head, good lacing all the way down.  Very inviting floral aroma with hoppy citrus follow through.  The hops definitely come through in the taste, but I found this to be a very mature, complete flavor, with a nice clean finish.  Keeps you coming back for more with each sip; this beer delivers!

12oz bottle:  Pours a big head, white, foamy, creamy, good lacing.  Cloudy amber color, good bubbles, fizz.  Very strong hoppy aroma, fresh smelling.  Bitter taste, some sweet mid-taste, somewhat smooth/bitter aftertaste.  Creamy.  A good IPA, but a little strong and unbalanced.  A little acidic.
Nice aroma, tart with a level of sweetness. great after taste. was recommended by a friend. One of the best Ive had.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2007 Bottle, thanks zeswaft.  Honey colored with a fluffy white head.  Tart, hoppy aroma, slightly sweet and sticky.  Cirtrusy.   Really smooth flavor.  Hoppy and bitter with a balanced level of sweetness.  Piney.  Really well balanced and a great, dry finish that leaves some sweetness.  This is a really nice IPA, definitely one of the best that Ive had.  Rerate... very good, but not as crazy-good as I remember.  Im bumping my rating down a bit.

Ah, a classic IPA that reminds me a little of a good weiss beer in the use of hops, hazy appearance and the lemony character in the aroma.  Pleasant mouthfeel that rounds out the palate and quenches your thirst.  Leaves your lips smacking for more.  Light caramle and toffee notes help to creat a nice balance between the hops and malt.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2008 Pours a medium amber with average sized head. Aroma is big on the floral and also a tad of citrus. Flavor is great. Hoppy citrus with some piney floral in the background. Just a little bitter finish (which isnt bad). Such a well rounded (solid) brew. Always seems to be in my fridge.

Bottle. Pours a hazy light copper color with a nice foamy off-white head on top. Hops and grapefruit dominate the aroma of the beer. Hints of sweet malts such as caramel and toffee are in the aroma as well. Hops hit the tongue on first sip. A grapefruit/citrusy hop taste that starts with a bitterness. The middle part of the taste is caramel and toffee bringing out the malt backbone of this beer. The finish is sweet at first and ends with bitterness shortly after the beer as been swallowed fully. Another great beer out of the Midwest!
Bottle- Wow, this beer is good. Standard amber, gold head with citrus aroma. Drinks easily. Tastes smoothly of hops, while still maintaing a malt balance.

I cant believe I havent rated this since Ive been drinking it for a couple years.Golden pour,decent lasting head. Aroma is pineyhops and grapfruit. Decent lacing. Tastes pretty much how it smells with a great body and mouthfeel. Too bad they are pulling out of IL for a spell. Should have stocked up on this.

Slightly hazy gold pour with a small foamy off-white head.  Strong caramel malt aroma with a pronounced note of grapefruit and other citrus fruits.  Lots of piney, grapefruit hop flavor with a solid caramel malt background.  Nice creamy medium body.

Id heard a lot of positive buzz about this beer before trying it for the first time.  Now, in my part of the world at least, it seems like it occupies sort of a gold standard of craft beer (IPAs at least).  Appearance is amber and cloudy.  Gead sticks around, and around.  This particular example was still sitting around even after the glass was empty.  Aroma is definitely hoppy, and a bit sweet.  Flavor is hops plus citrus and very pleasant.  And after, you get those great hop-flavored burps!  Ive had it before, and Ill be having it again.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2006 Very stinky! Smells of hops and friuts. Very creamy medium body tastes like pine hops spices and fruit. Great taste quite complex. Bells really cant make a bad beer
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2007 Bottle @ Coles Buffalo NY. One of the best IPAs i have had to date. Smooth drinking with the right balance of hops. Beautiful head & nice creamy body. Wish i had more

12 oz. Bottle.  Beautiful white, lacey head and a hazy, golden color.  Strong aroma of citrus, even when nose is feet away from the glass.  Noted stong pine aroma when nose was closer to the beer.  Flavor was dry and hoppy, with grapefruit notes.  Nice long finish on this beer.  Glad I have five more to drink.

Stumbled on this at a good restaurant in Akron.  This is one great IPA. Great hop aroma and a nice crisp taste.  Not over the top and not too pine resin-like.  A little different that some of my other favorite IPAs.  A little smoother to drink.

12-oz., thanks to MTDSHN--thanks, Mike, this stuff is incredible! Pours the cloudy amber with the moussy white head. Lots of floral/orange/sherbet hops on the nose. Creamy body. Good chew to the mouthfeel; pleasantly high-moderate carb. Lots of citrus (orange, a little lemon, slight grapefruit) through the palate. Grea thop variety and a nice sweet easy drinking malt backbone. 6 ounces into the first one, its obvious that this is one of the great session beers of all time. Not to mention probably the greatest label--no shilly shallying around, just a great image and the name.

Bottle. Pours a nice deep golden brown with little head or lacing. Aromas of hop, sugar, quite a bit of spice (cinnamon). Flavor is fairly sweet with a good hop background that leaves a somewhat drying aftertaste. An excellent IPA and a good example without overdoing it in the hops.

Pours a hazy light orange color with thin white head. Good lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, hops, grass. Full balanced flavor with a citrus hop punch, mostly grapefruit, with a nice hop bitterness. Nice malt background to give it an even sweetness and round out a really fine IPA. Very drinkable.
This is the way that an American IPA should be.  Has a great hoppy taste, almost a candied citrus fruit taste.  The head is a creamy chewy white.  The nearly perfect American IPA!

UPDATED: APR 18, 2008 Bottle.  Strong hoppy grapefruit aroma, clean, fresh, and yes, oily.  Hazy orange pour with light visicarb and a bubbly/fluffy and lacing beige head.  Very crisp, extremely dry taste.  Grapefruit and citrus, hop overload, woody, medium-full soft body.  Chewy, spicy malt.  Floral sweetness and a little mouth-puckering tang.  Grapefruit lingers long into the aftertaste.  Straightforward, but very, very flavorful and well crafted - flawless, even.  Has sort of a playful lightness to match its elegant sophistication.  Refreshing! [3.8] Pretty much the go-to summer IPA in Bells distribution area - lovably dry and bitter, enough citrus to quench and call me back for more.  And a great bang for the buck.  [4.0]
