UPDATED: NOV 30, 2005 Pours dark amber with big creamy white head, mostly lasting. Nice lacing. Big aroma, pine and grapefruit. Smells very fresh. Flavor is grapefruit, orange peel, caramel malts, with a piney, earthy dry finish.  Dances on the tongue for a wonderful mouthfeel. Fantastic  texture, medium body, smooth and creamy. Very easy drinking, tough to put this one down. Outstanding IPA.

12oz bottle.  Grapefruit hop aroma, very fresh.  You can almost smell a "grean" leafy plant.  Some light caramel also.  Varies bottle to bottle within this six pack.  Very nice amber-orange color with an inch tall off-white head.  Nice malty flavor with brilliant grapefruit bitterness and a slight metallic note.  Again, varies bottle by bottle.  One bottle tasted like it still had hops floating in it, the one Im currently rating is a bit more subdude.  Medium body with an oily palate and a slightly dry finish.  I really liked this beer, but it wasnt consistent.  All bottles were from batch 7010.

Pours a light and cloudy amber body. Aromas are citrus, cotton candy, pine needles, malt, and some floral hints. Taste is bitter sweet, candy, pine, with some vegetal flavours to accompany. Pretty damn good IPA if you ask me. Thanks Diana!
Good India. Incredibly citrusy, slightly piney aroma. Fairly pale, with assertive bitterness and hop flavor. Solid malt base stays out of the way of the lupulin. Good beer, great brewery.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2008 12 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a thin white head.  Centennial hops dominate the aroma with that distinct citrus nose.  Malts and hops compliment each other nicely.  A very solid beer and worth its lofty rating.

Pours a light orange/golden color with a solid two finger head that sticks around for a while, with quite a bit of lacing.

Has a really nice pine, citrus, floral hop smell to it.

Taste is initially piney, foloowed by slightly bitter hops, and finishes with a nice sweet malt that keeps the hops from overwhelming. 

Really nice IPA that I wish I had more of.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text:
Bottled.
Clear amber coloured with a huge off white head.
Sweet aroma of hops, pine needles and caramel.
Flavour of hops, pine needles, fruits and caramel.
Bottled. Pours a dark golden/orange with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet malty and very hoppy. Taste is sweet, notes of fruit and rasins, and very hoppy. Long sweet and bitter aftertaste
Bottle. Orange colour with a big white head. Sweet malty, very hoppy aroma and taste. Medium body and a sweet hoppy finish.

this was awesome.  the malts and hops are well balanced.  very east coast IPA feel to it.  bitter finish but nice and creamy to start with.  the orange, lemon and pine aromas and flavors work themselves in with the hops.  excellent.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2008 rerate, batch 8359. God, this stuff is good when its fresh! Floral, bitter, with an almost candy like sweetness, but balances out before it goes overboard. It leaves you with a long wonderfully bitter aftertaste, and you just cant wait to have another swig. I had to re-rate this, only because i love it so damn much.
Smell is of piney hops. The color is amber. The head is a nice light white. The taste is full with a nice citrus hop cut. It is a classic IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2008 Clear gold color with a very large rocky white head. Lots of lacing.  Hoppy full aroma with a mildly hoppy flavor.  I dont know why this is so highly rated.  Seemed pretty standard to me. 6/5/6/3/16

RERATE:  Deep golden pour with a nice white fluffy head.  Aroma is caramel malts with a nice dose of flowery hops.  I’m still less than impressed with this beer.  It’s obviously quality, but I’m not sure what makes it stand out from all the other quality IPAs out there? 6/3/6/3/17
Nice strong aroma with a taste of citrus and strong hops. Subtle malt aftertaste prevents it from being overhopped. This is a beer Im gonna wish I could get my hands on more often.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2006 Rerate:  Had this on tap at the Fiddlers Hearth.  Man it was truly fantastic.  Fresh aroma and flavor.  Really hit the spot.
Two Hearted Ale has fine balance all the way through.  In the aroma, the Centennial hops and sweet malt intertwine great.  The bitterness is kept in check with a good malt back bone.  It poured a hazy yellow-orange and a small off white head.  The medium body makes this beer a staple beer in most households.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2007 Thanks to Pailhead for this one. Massive citrus/hop aroma. Very aromatic beer. Cloudy/yellow/gold with a two finger thick head. Surprisingly light though still very citrusy and hop flavored. A lot of grapefruit rind in the finish. An excellent maxing and relaxing brew that lives up to its rating.
Big creamy head.  Look orange but has a hint of grapefruit taste.  Solid IPA with the usual hops but more flavor and complexity than most.

Bottle. Bright orange amber, medium fluffy head. Lots of hops in the aroma (cascade), grapefruit, some earth. Sticky pine medium body, west coast all the way. Harsh carbonation really bothered me in this one, adds to the bitterness. There are better IPAs.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2006 One Ive had many times, this time in a bad from a bottle, poured into a glass.
Pale amber with a nice head.  One of the more ridiculously hoppy IPAs Ive run across.  Sometimes more piney, sometimes more floral.  The malts underneath are especially pleasant, sweet, and smooth, but they are overpowered a bit.  Not my favorite IPA, but close.
Rerate note!  If you can find Cask Aged Two Hearted (called Hand Pulled at the Berkley Front in Berkley, MIchigan) GET IT!  Its very different from the regular, smooth and aromatic in a way that far exceeds the regular!  I would rate it a 4.4 at least!

I buy a six almost every week. There are few beers that taste like Two Hearted: hops like no other. Bells is our states best kept secret. Even local bars dont carry this on tap for some odd reason. Brilliant beer.
Did enjoy this one very much.  Very full and dark IPA with nice hoppiness everywhere.  Not over the top and drinkable.  Glad I finally was able to taste a Kalamazoo beer.

Picked up this bottle on a recent trip to Cleveland.

Pours a hazy copper with a creamy ivory head. Lots of draping lace down the side of the glass. Smells of cirtusy hops and light fruity malt.

Taste is dominated by intense floral and citrusy hops. Theres some light pale malt crispness in there but this brew is all about the hops. And while the beer may be unbalanced the hops flavors are nicely balanced with each other. Bitter and sweet citrus intertwined. Long lingering bitter aftertaste and crisp. Taste leaves you craving more. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2009 Bottle for this rating, but I have had it at the brewery also. Two Hearted Ale pours a deep yellow( not quite orange) with a nice off-white head. I had forgotten how good the hop aroma is with this beer. It reminds me of smelling the hops in the package as I add them to homebrew. It has an excellent hop flavor, but isnt particularly bitter at first, BUT, it then finishes very dry. I love very hoppy beers, but this is just slightly thin in body. It is very good, but its thinness keeps it from being one of the truly elite American IPAs to me. Overall- very good!

Sampled on draft @ the Hop Leaf in Chicago.    Golden, bubbly appearance and a citrus nose.  Two hearted Ale is an excellent hoppy IPA bolstered by a malt backbone.   Bitter aftertaste has your lips waiting for another sip.

Bottle from ughsmash.  First off, Im sure theres a story behind it, but Im not really positive that I want to look at a picture of a fish while drinking a beer.  This is an excellent IPA, and has very intense aromas and flavors, but it lacks complexity.  First pop the cap, and youre ready for salad.  Very hoppy aroma.  The hops in the flavor are wonderfully balanced by a malty sweetness.  And, this balance is throughout the trip, across the tip of the tongue, as it lingers in your mouth, and finally as it hits the back of your throat, the hops and malt are there in equal amounts.  Where this one lacks is thats all there is.  Deep, but not wide.  Either way, its a good IPA.  Again, thanks to Ughsmash for a great trade!

Nice hoppy smell.  After the first sniff I knew I was in a great tasting IPA.  It had a nice orange color.  The taste was hoppy up front, then balanced out by a sweet malt taste.  This went very nice with spicy and sweet black beans

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2008 Bottle and draft. Hazy, golden body with a large, lasting, creamy off-white head. Big floral and citrus aroma with notes of grapefruit and orange. Hints of toasted grain and dough. The flavor is moderately sweet and moderately bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet, moderately bitter and moderately acidic. Dry, lasting finish. Tastes of citrus, perfume emerge along with some spice hints, particularly coriander. Medium body with a velvety texture. Lively carbonation. An outstanding, world-class IPA. I have had this beer many times, both on draft and bottled and it has never failed to please. Rerate 12-23-08.

Deep golden color, vey clear fro the bottle.  Very nice off-white to white head.  Lite malt aroma with stong hop aromas.  Earthy to grassy in aromas no to very little yeast aromas.  Strong hop bitterness with malt just to balance.
Bottled. Orange coloured. Nice very hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavour with lots of fruitiness and bitterness. Tasty.

A very nice pale orane color with the yeast adding a richer bronze color.  Head is pale in color and generous, very dense.  Aroma is characteristic of what I expect from this beer...huge perfumey, citrust, mixed fruit cup, Centenniel hop aroma.  The yeast aroma is subdued.  Solid bitterness, tasty orane hop/malt interaction, slight residual malt sweetness fights with the bitterness on the palate.  Body is med/full and is swept away slowly by the bitterness.  From start to finish the maltiness envelops the rest of the flavor characteristics.  The bitterness smacks at the initial sip and remains throughout the beer and creates a cleansing finish accentuated by perfumey, ethereal hoppiness.  The mid palate is dominated by the orangey malt/hop flavor interaction.  The layers of flavor and complexity are amazing and intense.  I could probably make this score a 5 if I rated this based upon the real ale version.

Pale peach color with a generous fluffy white head. Citrusy, piney, pineapple aroma. Flavor is very fruity, Citrus, piney, grapefruit bitter with a long dry citrus zest finish. Hoppy, but well balanced. Light smooth palate.

Wow. This is a great IPA. Orange mid-dark color. Amber and red tint and a nice white head. As soon as I poured this beer I was overcome by the hop aroma and then later the hop flavor. Floral hops characterize this beer as the dominating gustatory trait but there is so much more. Mid-range bitterness brought out some tasty pine notes. Great IPA and really awesome bottle art.

slightly hazy orangey golden color, fluffy tall white head.  aroma is floral and perfumey hops.  flavor is strong hops, mostly bitter, but also balacnced with sweetness that is just far away form being too strong.  nice full carbonation but not too much.  finsih and aftertaste is not too bitter either.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2007 2nd Rerate:  I just wanted to mention that out of a 10 beer IPA head to head taste test, IMO this beer came out on top.  Quality...quality...quality!!!  

Rerate:  I had to rerate this as it is such a great IPA.  Top notch.  I believe this is comes close to Alpha King and is one of my favorite IPAs.  And I can get it at MGM, so its in my neighborhood. 

Liked the head on this beer.  Great taste; had the IPA bitterness to it, but not too strong.  Orange color with floral hops present.  This is one beer I could enjoy over and over.  Original Score: 4.1

Bottle.  Light golden-copper in colour with a thin white lasting head.  Arome was of floral hops, some orange citrus, pale malts and almost sickly sweet.  The flavour was of floral hops first, orange and pine near the back of your mouth, some light malts - becoming earthy.  Soapy bitter mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbonation.  Finishes with a lingering bitterness.  This must have been an older bottle, I have to get a fresh sample and rerate this.

More of Belgian golden ale look to it then an IPA. Orange with just a trace of amber. Perfect head with picturesque lacing through out my gulping. Very hoppy smell with a slight scent of evergreen fir. Very hoppy, almost too much for my personal liking. As it warms a tad, the malt kicks in to balance the bitterness out a little. Like others, I detect grapefruit in the finish. Very well done.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2005 I really enjoyed this IPA. The aroma is full of citrusy hops with a slight bit of crystal-esque malts. The initial taste is full of hops but the mouthfeel and general balance make it not overbearing. Its smooth and fairly light-bodied. The finish is crisp and leaves a nice grapefruit essense behind. Delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2006 In the bottle at the 2005 Bad-burek party. If I had two hearts, Id give them both to this beer. DELICIOUS! Looks like an IPA: amber with an off-white head. Taste is nearly unmatched. This is sweet, but balanced well with the hops. Outstanding smoothness, but with enough bittering units to remind you that you are drinking an IPA. Well worth the exhorbitant price charged by most liquor stores. UPDATE 11/2006: In the bottle at the Max & Joes Tavern Michigan Beer tasting (11/21/6). Such a delightful fresh hop aroma. A near perfect IPA.

Bottle, orange pour and a good off-white head.  Big floral and citrus hop aroma.  Lots of good hop flavor too, with a very good balanced malt body.  Sweet upfront, and a nice hard bitter bite at the end.

Balanced citrus-hop perfection.
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Oak Lawn, IL<font size=-1>

Amber-orange pour with a creamy-white head that receded rather quickly.  Formed a light spotty layer on top, and nice intricate lacing as it went down.  Dense floral, piney, and citrusy aromas hit the nose, and were very pleasant.  At first taste, hops dance across the palate.. this had a light and lively mouthfeel.  Solid malt backbone held up the citrus and grassy flavors well.  Refreshing citrus finish.  This is a great IPA!

Nice orange-amber, dense creamy head, recedes slowly leaving nice lace.  Aromas of fruit, flowers, ester, green pepper, and wet concrete.  Fantastic huge hop bitterness.  Slightly tart, fruity without being sweet, some moderate maltiness, but alcohol and hops are predominant.  Mouthfeel is solid and fizzy, most refreshing but leaving a nice citrus aftertaste.  The web site alludes to Hemingway, fishing, and Michigans Upper Peninsula outdoors experience.  It all fits as Id call this a real mans man ale.  Just big and brawny in every respect.

12oz -  Very strong floral hop aroma.  Smells fresh and sticky.  Yellow-orange color with a medium head that quickly dissappear but leaves great lacing.  Huge hop blast on the tounge with just enough malt to smooth it out.  Sliky smooth going down and leaves a nice hop aftertatse.  A very drinkable IPA Im sure I will have much much more of.

Absolutely delicious. The best IPA I have ever tasted. I cant imagine an IPA getting any better than this. This is a superlative IPA. It reminds me of autumn, of fishing in a trout stream, of Nick Adams and his sister hiding from the law in Hemingways The Last Good Country. This is The Last Good Beer from The Last Good Country. It must be. Pours a deep-red-copper cum sunset red/brown with a hint of rainbow trout pink. Forms a tannish head, very soft. Taste is Centennial hops all over the place. Its two hearts run into your refrigerator and drag their malty bloody selves across your kitchen floor.

Pale yellow gold color, with a medium sized rocky head.  Sweet amarillo hop aroma with a slightly sweet malt undertone.    Slight floral acridness in the nose, quickly followed by muted citrus and slightly grassy hop flavors, with a crisp and slightly astringent finish complemented by lingering sweetness.  Mouthfeel is very balanced.

Im not going to tell you what color this pours or what hints of what random fruit I get when I taste it. Im simply going to tell you that this is one of the best beers Ive ever had. Bells (or Kalamazoo Brewing Co.) is easily one of the best breweries in the country.
Draft. Pours an orange color with a white head. Nose is floral and citrusy. Taste is hoppy with note of earthy grass tones and a bit of caramel sweetness. Good beer.

Thanks Chuck!  Chuck didnt like this much, so he gave me practically his whole beer.  Served at about 58 degrees, this one is really scrumptious.  The aroma is oranges and pine hopes with some sweet caramel malts.  Poured a orangish color with an awesome head and lacing.  The palate was dry, well carbonated, and had a good mouthfeel.  The flavor was very good.  Lots of pine and orange hops with sweet caramel malts.  Mmmm....  How a man could part with this is unknown.  Its SOOO good.

Pours an orangish color w/ a nice white head that laces well and some carbonation rising up the side of the glass.
smells of a big citrus and floral hops a touch of pepper as well.  Palate was dry and well coating medium body a little tart.  Flavor is a big grassy floral hop very piney and bitter.  Not one of my favroites its just to simple all crisp hop not much else.. I can detect a tiny malt in it but its just dominated by the hops.

Pours a slightly cloudy golden color with a medium white head. Excellent flavor of floral and peppery hops, theres a piney thing going too but the pepper is dominating. Excellent of floral, peppery and piney hops with caramel and a bitter finish, like with the aroma the pepper is the dominating element. The body is medium with an oily but mostly dry texture, the carbonation is soft. Its an excellent IPA but if the pepper would have been more subdued I would have enjoyed it even more. Thanks to csbosox for sending this my way.

Gorgeous orange/amber with a medium, soapy/frothy head; light lacing.  Big aroma of citrus, hops, heavy pine.  Flavor is good but not awesome: light malt and immediately a noticeable spiciness; heavy hops; excellent alcohol warmth (astounding for 6%, really).  Medium- to full-bodied but clean.  I dont usually care that much for IPAs because they are too over-hopped; somehow this beer manages to be very heavily hopped but not offensively so.  Certainly just about the best IPA Ive had to date, though not in my top 5% of beers overall.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2008 Orange pour lots of carbonation. Aroma is citrus hops. Flavor is citrus hops and lots of them with a subtle caramel maltiness to really back this up. Straight hop juice and this is just a great tasting slam it down IPA

UPDATED: APR 14, 2007 If you love Colt .45 (I feel sorry for you!), You wont like this brew, Its just like mybrainhurts says this beer is a mid west take on the ipa style. Bells is really a great company and I cant wait to try more brews from them

Couleur orangée pâle, semi opaque, parsemé dune grosse mousse crémeuse formant plein de reliefs sur le verre.  Aromes très floraux et dagrume (citron, pamplemousse rose) possédant aussi une bonne touche résineuse suggérant les conifères et le pin.  Malt biscuit ainsi quune touche de caramel viennent apporter une belle balance à la quantité remarquable de houblon.  Corps de densité moyenne, texture presque crémeuse, carbonatation bien présente.  Une référence en terme dIPA américaine.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 The best of the best; the creme de la creme; I get the pleasure of having cask conditioned 2H at a local pub; 2H in a bottle or on tap is amazing, but cask conditioned will blow your mind.  With the CC you get much more of the true goodness - the flowery, citrusy taste will nicely coat your palate, without the typical hops explosion. I loved the beer before; now I am obsessed.

pours a nice orange color with an ample white head,  looks appealing but nothing extraordinary.  Nice hoppy aroma and a very hoppy flavor.  Very piney bitter flavor, definately a solid IPA not my favorite, but certainly worthy of its reputation
I was very impressed with this beer. Almost like a midwest take on west coast IPA. Very hoppy and delicious. I am really becoming a fan of bells brews. Solid and good!
It smells good but it tastes weird. Its bitter at the end, Im kinda drunk. The guy below me describes it well.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2007 Bottle.  Pours a nice frothy white 1" inch head that diminishes to 1/4".  Hazy orange color.  Strong floral hops and big citrus aroma, a lot of orange in this one.   Taste of caramel malt and finishing with with the spicy bitterness of the hops, the orange flavors make it an interesting and enjoyable IPA. I had a lot of IPAs rated above this one, but after revisiting it I realized its a true masterpiece.

After a bad experience with their Cherry Stout I had to try something else a little more redeeming. This poured out a slightly murky golden orange with a tall white rocky head. As the head shrank into the body scattered lacing was left to coat the glass. Very hoppy aroma with citric and floral hops coming out in abundance. There was a slight hint of malt to it at times. Taste was very similar very hoppy all the way through this one with citric and earthy flavors coming together for a great taste. A bitter hoppy aftertaste is how this ended. Mouthfeel was creamy with about a medium body. I could drink this all day, great flavor and aroma too bad I only picked up 2 bottles. Highly recommend to all hop heads and anyone that likes a good brew.

Pours a cloudy orange with a creamy offwhite head that laces well.  Aroma is beautiful like a walk on a spring day.  Floral and hoppy as Ive ever experienced.  Some notes of grass and pine.   The flavor is much of the same with some malt background, citrus, hops and a hint of spice.  This is amazingly smooth and drinkable for an IPA.  It finishes quite crisp and delicious on the palate.  It manages to not get you with that harsh bitterness.  This is a great beer and will likely become my summertime goto this year on the deck.  Delicious!

pours a cloudy orange with a creamy white head that fades down to a nice layer of lacing.  aroma is huge on hops, a little grassy and a little citrus going on. great flowery hop flavor and what i like the most is the smoothness to the finish.  it doesnt smack you across the face with bitterness, but instead maintains a nice even flavor all the way through.  if all ipas were this good, i could forsake stouts (not really, but this is a great beer).

Thanks to Duane. Wow hops, poured an orange, with a huge fizzy head, Immediate hops to the nose. Along with some citrus and  flowers. The foamy head is still hanging around.  I can finally rate a hoppy pale after mowing the lawn. I am enjoying this, just wish there was a bit more malt to balance this out. This is a good IPA and coming from a non-hop head, real good.

Hazed golds and ambers, creamy white head.  A beautiful bouquet of aromas with huge amounts of spring florals and citrus up front, with lesser notes of pine and earth, and light sweet caramel tones lurking just under the surface.  Taste was pretty close to the aroma with grapefruity hops blending harmoniously with the lightly sweetened malt backbone.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, floral , citric, bittersweet finish.  What a perfect session IPA...if...well it was available local of course.  Larry...are you listening??

Clear gold in colour. Great spice and citrus hop aromas. More of the same citrus and spice with regard to the flavor. The malt presence is somewhat muted, creating a refreshing and lighter body, and the bitterness is lasting. Perhaps not as complex as some, but this is still a great beer.
cloudy, golden color.  mild hoppy aroma.  but the flavor is a bit mild (if hoppy), with a slight bitter finish.  overall, it is more mild than i enjoy.  not bad, but not a bell ringer.
ALEFEST 05  Great IPA.  One of the top five of this style Ive had.  Best beer at the Festival. Soft yet full flavor.  Great hops finish!
Great smell of hops right upfront.  Good body and bitter finish. An excellent IPA.
great hop aroma and flavor..light, a bit thin, but refreshing and nice. there is a minimum of 75 characters..blah blah blah

I just got done drinking a glass of this with diner and I checked to see what I had rated it, and I guess I havent got around to it yet. This is a beer that I have drank a lot of in the last year. I guess Ill rate it now. 12oz bottle from the cellar (the one I had before was from the fridge). Served in my NB worthy glass @ 56°. Pours golden orange with a 1" rocky white head. Lots of small bubbles. The aroma is floral and piney hops. Almost smells like KB. The flavor is honeyish at first then the piney hops kick in with their bitterness. The beer seems different after each sip; one time the piney hops are in control, then on the next sip the floral hops are in control, after that the citrus hops take charge . The hops are big, but kept in check by the wonderful honey malt. This is just a beautiful IPA. It is not so bitter as to make it (somewhat) difficult to drink, yet not so balanced that you yearn for the bitterness of the hops to go along with the hops aroma and taste.

My first IPA (Other then Keiths....If this counts as an IPA that is....)

Pours golden amber, very cloudy and fizzy with a very long-lasting head.  Mouthfeel is somwhat fissy.  Grapefruits, Lime and mild floral aroma.  Citrus and strong malt flavours with a very strong, lingering bitter malt finish.

Thanks to jables for this beer.

Pours a clear effervescent amber with a fizzy off-white head.  Aroma of piney hops.  Taste is hoppy, bitter, and dry with a touch of toffee in the finish.  A good IPA, but not as complex as Id hoped.

Bottle. Hazy golden color with a good sized white head. Big time citrus/hop aroma with some sweet malt also. Flavor is definitely on the hoppy side.
Grapefruit flavor is very prevalent with a slight malty backbone. Somewhat one dimensional but still quite delicious.
Tap: orange/yellow, small head...floral aroma and awesome hops scent. Very hoppy but balanced well, Mouthfeel is somewhat rough but finishes faily smooth. A decent IPA

An orange beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma is sweet and very freshly hoppy with notes of hop oils - very powerful aroma. The flavor is sweet and quite hoppy, that gives flavors of oranges, flowers as well as hints of grapefruit. Very refreshing yet with a powerful body.

03.30.05  12oz bottle thanks to wulfhere.  Pretty glowing golden orange with large off-white head of fine bubbles.  Sweet malt aromas are nearly hidden beneath giant floral and grapefruit hops.  Resinous flavors, quite dry front and middle, exciting hops.  But the malts struggle to keep up and even any residual sweetness is tainted by an attack of bitterness and back-of-the-palate astringency.  Lovely mouthfeel is soft, brisk, bubbly, yet full.  Very tasty in the vein of popular IPAs, but I think more backbone would go a long way in making this one a more substantial brew.  Thanks Willie!

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2005 bottle.  a deep honey gold, slightly cloudy with an extremely thick foamy head.  even though I am not a hop head, this IPA is well balanced and very enjoyable!!!

had this again for just the 2nd time last night ( 11/26/05 ) and since this was one of the first IPAs Id ever tried, felt I needed to raise the rating a bit.  such a smooth and well balanced IPA.  may become a regular in my frig this next summer.

Smell of fresh oranges hits your nose after pouring a light orange/gold color with a big white head that settles down with time.  Taste is very balanced and enjoyable with citrus, light sweet malts, and some cascade hops blending well.  Finish is extremely pleasant not leaving any trace of bitterness in my mouth.  There was something fishy about the packaging, though.

bottled: poured into chilled glass. lovely deep amber color. perfect long lasting head... i drank the whole thing and the head was still about 1/4 inches. Great smooth hoppy taste and aroma. Similar to other IPAs as far as Palate. Strongly recommend this one.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2008 This was a very citrusy IPA, big floral hop character, sweet citrus hop syrup smell. A kinda citrus candy sweetness travels throughout this brew finishing with a nice grapefruit flavored hop bitterness, and an earthy heartiness to the finish. Pours very light, a deep gold color, very clear, with a white head.

Among the best standard IPAs Ive ever had, this was an incredibly enjoyable brew.  Solidly hoppy, with a greatly complex malt behind it.  I really wish Kalamazoo would go ahead and bring it down to NC.

Great, multi-flavored IPA that leads my list of the regular IPAs. Outside of an Imperial IPA, this is hop heaven in my opinion. But this beer doesnt stop there as there is a lot going on. My first taste made me think of licorice, but after a few sips I started to differentiate the hops from the piney, citrus flavor and the diacetyl that does help this beer. On draught, the aroma is almost too perfumy and pungent (my bar neighbors always seem to notice the aroma when I have a glass of it), but the taste is incredible with a variety of distinct flavors screaming for attention. Out of the bottle, the aroma is more subdued and the taste a bit flatter, but still head and shoulders above the competition. If Kalamazoo Brewing makes a bad beer, I havent found it, and this may be their best.
Pours cloudy yellow/gold, with a small, white head. Aromas are pine, grapefruit, some malt and fruit. hoppy flavors of pine and grapefruit, and fruit.

Bottled: Orange coloured. Clear. Fruits, hops, some citrus, nuts in the aroma. Flavour is hoppy, sweet and fruity. Ends on a light bitter note. Is sweet and refreshing. Nice one. Thankz to my secret santa BBB63

This is good stuff, period.  As far as ale is concerned, this is where is it at.  The only place they blew it was the label.  Instead of a fish, they should have put a sunset over the ocean, or a beautiful woman in a bikini, or a bunch of teenage friends in a convertible on a friday night.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 Light honey gold color with a fine white head with excellent of retention.  Lots of fresh hop aroma that suggestes sweetness--though not from the malt.  Light malt profile is very well integrated with fruity, citrus (lemon, grapefruit) hops flavors.  Body is quite light on its feet--balancing all flavor characteristics and producing a highly flavorful, refreshing, powerful IPA.  Sidenote: wins my award for coolest beer lable.

A nice, hoppy beer.  Pours a dark gold with little head.  Aroma is of citrusy hops.  Taste is hop forward, but I think it has some nice balance to it as well.  If youre looking for a hoppy beer, its hard to beat bells two hearted.

Poured a medium, cloudy orange color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of grapefruits, citris and flowers. Tastes of oranges, grapefruit, pine and malt. Has a nice sweet and bitter balance. Very good. Thanks to goldtwins for trading me this one.

Lighter colored malts used in this very intriguing IPA. Had a very nice head with lots of lace and pleasing yellow gold color. Very pronounced fresh hop aroma and flavor with a points of sweetness to set it off. Nicely carbonated and great mouth feel. Had this on draft at Bodega. Cant wait to have another.

Poured a cloudy orange yellow with a big thick creamy white head and thick lacing.
Aroma is grapefruit, citrus, lemon and hops.
Flavor is awesome.. bitter hops, citrus and grapefruit.
All hops on the palate.
This is a great beer! I wish they sold Bells out here!!
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2007 Golden yellow with good head, but nasty yeast.  Outstanding flavor.  Has a sweet syrupy grass-like flavor reminiscent of three floyds dreadnaught.
beutiful in my glass perfect two finger head which slowly receeds and leaves some nice lacing. aroma is mostly hopps and malt. taste is the same. nice golden color. another great beer from bells.

Had two on tap at Bennos... feel comfortable with this rating. Cloudy bright orange/yellow body, white creamy head with excellent lacing. Aroma was mostly citrusy lemon hops, but not as much malt. Same with the flavor. It tastes like what I imagine hop candy would taste like. The hops were mostly a bright citrusy thing, but almost stale (but not old stale... maybe some underlying complexity that adds this flavor, like yeast perhaps). The sweetness is there to to make it palatable, but this is all about the hops. Quite a delicious elixir.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2006   Pours similar to the Stone Brewing IPA with a cloudy orange and very creamy head.  The head is great and has a very good lacing to it.  The aroma is apparent as soon as you open the bottle.  It consists of citrus orange, hops, graitfruit and peach. 

Re-rate- Had this at Barcade last night.  I didnt realize how good this is the first time I had this.  Maybe I had a bad bottle or something because this was great the second time around.  Similar to the Stone IMO.
Bottle. Dark amber color with medium rocky head. Crisp aroma of hops and malt. Good complex flavor with strong finish. Another very good Bells brew.
When poured right out of the bottle has a citris smell or maybe peach.  Nice cloud like light colored head.  Smooth citris or floral flavor with hoppy finish

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2007 My regular "go-to" beer. Im in the mood for this every single day of my life. Cloudy bright orange with a fluffy, medium white head. Vibrant aroma of citrus/orange and fruitiness. Has notes of sweet pale malt, lemon, orange  zest and grapefruit. Pleasantly citrusy. Very well balanced with ample but very smooth bitterness. The citrus and overall flavor profile can best be described as "bright". Medium bodied with a smooth texture and moderate carbonation. The lacing hangs on the glass in sheets, good head retention. Excellent, satisfying drinkin beer all around. Remarkably consistent from batch to batch.
Favorite IPA by far.  Extremely hoppy smell, pours well leaving a nice head and a cloudy orange body.  Perfect bitterness throughout.

Great IPA, nice hoppy aroma. Poured real well, head and lacing excellent.Dry hoppy flavor, with a little citrus ? Nice light orange coloring slightly cloudly. When the bottling is on its hard to beat this beer.

Pours a murky dark golden color with a medium head.  Nice hoppy aroma with orange, pine, lemon and an addition of spices. Flavor follows suit.. A very hoppy orange, pine, lemon and floral flaver..  very bitter with just a hint of malt..  This is a hop heads delight.. I love it..

Pours pale orange with a nice thick cap of creamy white foam. Wonderful fragrant hop aroma! Orange peel, cinnamon, lemony sourness. Very bright, spicy spring-like aroma. Fairly light on the palate, while still conveying a feeling of substance. Taste is soft maltiness and grapefruit rind, with a puckering, mouthcoating bitterness. A terrific IPA, full of flair and respect for the style. A worthy beer for my 50th rating.

Sorry. I just dont get it. This beer has had much fuss about it, & its just not that good. 12 oz. brown, longneck bottle.
No freshness date seen anywhere.
Poured out a hazy, piss yellow color, with a sticky white head. Nothing special there. Aromas are pretty much non-existent. Flavors are kind of bland, body is thing & watery. Certainly not worth the hype.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2005 Minor rating update from recent bottle that was slightly more enjoyable the second time around.  Appearance is mostly translucent, with a tiny floating white head that breaks away at the edges. Smelled sweet, and of wheat, caramel, floral hops and pine resin.  Taste of citrus fruits - predominantly of oranges - along with nice bittering agents and an in-your-face floral hop bouquet.  Hop bitterness is most accentuated as it curtails around the sides of the tongue in the finish.  Creamy and full yet clean all around.  A standard for other IPAs to aspire to.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2005 Nose-kicking hops out of the goblet. Light bright orange color is rather attractive.  Mouthfeel is more substantial than I expected-nice surprise there.  Tastes heavily of grapefruit with hint of golden raisin.  Finish isnt as overpowering as it might have been.  Above average IPA for me, as I enjoyed this beer that is not one of my favorite styles.

Copper color with a decent head that lasts.   Aroma is citrusy with some pine with that typiclal centennial hop aroma.  Slight light crystal malt aroma as well.  Tastes a little light for a great IPA, but this is still pretty good.  Moderately hoppy and bitter with just enough light malts to make it balanced.  Pretty good but I was slightly let down- not enough body or hops for me.

Damn fine beer. I am quite glad they have turned this beer into a year round offering. It has become quite a cult classic here in minneapolis in the bars and Liquir stores. This beer screams hops from your nose to your tounge. Gene Simmons would have a hard time waving his tounge around after a few of these. Unfiltered joy as are most of kalamazoo brewings beverages.

Bottle thanks to styles: Its hazy and light amber colored with a creamy eggshell head that fades to a ring around the glass and really lasts.  The aroma here is typical american IPA - the citrus, floral hops - but theres much more fresh pine scented hops in this one than usual.  I can taste lots of hops - grapefruit, pine, flowers, grass, citrus, as well as some sweet malt, sugar, candy, light caramel.  Medium amounts of carbonation, light to medium bodied, and slick and oily on the tongue.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2005 Pours a semi cloudy gold orange color with a nice amount of froathy white head.  Aroma is floral and citruscy, hints of grapefruit and orange, but not too much so.  You can smell it from a good 4 feet away.  Makes my mouth water.  Taste is a little sweet at first but then you get hit with a big grapefruit hop flavor that stays with you for a while.  Hops tickle the palate.  Overall, pretty good, but I think if the hops was mellowed just a wee bit that it could be wonderful.

This is a great big BITTER IPA.  Bells once again goes all out (maybe even experiments) and comes up with another winner.  The more of their beers I have, the more respect I develop for their skills and artistry.

Poured a little cloudy orangey golden with a fluffy white head...all hops in the nose...grapefruit, orange, lemon, resin...fantastic taste...fantastically balanced...sweet malts up front followed up by a smooth fade into a warm spicy hop finish...goodness...

Bottle.  Pours a murky, sort of striated orange with clusters of particulate suspended throughout.  Great head that actually climbs about one and a half inches out of the glass!  Head is white and laces decently as I go.  Nose is superb with sweet touches of pineapple, orange and tangerine along with a slight earthy aroma.  Taste is disappointing.  Sort of metallic and musty, not crisp or hoppy as I would expect.  Not much greatness here, and I wonder if my bottle is an old one... it is better than a lot of IPAs, but I expected this one to rival Hop Devil, Stoudts and Stone and this bottle is certainly not in their league.  I guess Ill have to try it again.  Disappointing to say the least.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2005 Amazing aroma, fruity and scented. Smacks sweet and tart on the palate, with barely bitter but rich aftertaste. Perfect blend of hops and malt. Very complex, but refreshing and crisp beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy straw color gold with a decent white head.  Scent is that of pine, and light citrus.  Refreshing crisp taste with just the right amount of hops for bitterness.  Light body but very refreshing. Pleasantly semi-dry finish.  An excellent IPA by all means!!

Decent white head that reduces to a thin foam and a fine dense sheet of lacing.  Low carbonation.  Nice dense head reforms upon swirling.  Great aroma.  Citrus, pine, floral hops a-plenty.  Once you sift your way through the hops you can detect a nice bready malt aroma.  Color is a a hazy golden amber.  Fizzy in the mouth with a nice hops presence.  Extremely well balanced.  Good bitterness.  Slight warming from the alcohol.  Very easy drinking.  Finish is bitter, slightly dry and clean.  Little lingering hops bitterness.  A top notch IPA.  Thanks to goldtwins for this gem.

One of my perrenial favorites.  A great goto beer that always satisfies.  Since bottling in the new plant, I have notice a better conistency (i.e. no infections) but a thinner body.  A decent trade off but surely it is lacking the thicker mouthfeel than I noticed a few years back.  Nice however and a definately one of the more consitent beers if you need a good hop thrashing.

Magnificent head.  Orange color slightly cloudy.  The aroma is incredible.  Not sure if I smell flowers or grapefruit or both.  Just the right amount of malt and hops for me.  Dont think Ive ever had anything this perfect.  Everything an IPA should be.  This may be my new favorite.
Nothing new can be said about Two Hearted.  Its great!  You are missing out on a vital sensual experience if you have not drunk this beer.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2005 A great everyday beer.  This is the IPA I compare all others against and nothing has knocked it out of first place yet, not even my own homebrew.  The hops the malt make my taste buds dance for joy.  Thanks Larry

UPDATED: APR 30, 2006 This beer is amazing.. you can already start to tell when you first pop the cap and smell the sweet aroma.  The tase is an great blend of citrus and a slight bitter hoppy flavor.  Great Beer if you drink a couple, way too sweet after a while
user_location: originally from Michigan, New York, USA

text: Hoppy hoppy hAppy... Its what bells pale ale wishes it could be.  Malty enough to appease the general audience.  those hop heads such as I will agree, this is what old world pales should be, cold be, woud be... but this is the king of citurs/PINE/bitter

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2005 First off, great aroma.  Like a budding boquet of flowers mixed with orange and grapefruit.  The flavor is evener bolder.  The taste is crisp - beer was bottled only one month ago.  Great IPA.  This is the beer that made me love beer.  Comfort food if you will.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2006 a very cloudy yellowish orange body (great appearance); much carbonation; hoppy notes for both the aroma and flavor, with subtle malts...to the harvest ale i had at founders ales; crisp palate; a perfect hop/malt juxtaposition

Densely clouded yellowy orange hue, moderate head formation. Well pronounced blend of grapefruit and orange in the aroma, with a mild caramel balance. Sharp spicey grapefruit palate, light caramel. Fairly light in body and fizzy. Very appetizing overall but just needed a little more body.

Quite possibly my favorite beer for general consumption.  Pours nice, nice big creamy head over a orange-gold hazy liquid.  Scents of grapefruit, juniper and hops match well with the first sip in which evergreen and hops flavors become more intense without overpowering maltiness.  Slight warmness due to alcohol content makes this a great in winter, while crisp flavoring is nice when its hot, too.  Top notch!
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours with an orangey tint, hazy with hop sediment, and a lasting ecru head. Overwhelming grapefruit nose with honey and seawater in the background. Happily, the godnotanothercascadeipa aroma belies the fresh, crisp compexity of flavors that follow: butterscotch malt, lemon zest, inviting fruitiness, and gingery peppery spice. Mellow earthy bitter aftertaste with impressions of lemon pepper. Saison-like. Somewhat oily palate is perfectly tempered by prickly carbonation.

Pours orange with a big white head that lasts awhile. Big grapefruit aroma. Well balanced malt/hop flavor with a medium hops finish. Could be a little hoppier but really enjoyed anyway. Could drink this at almost any time. Well done.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2005 Poured a thick, bright white head that dissipated quickly.  Fruity....very strong citrus notes that made for a clean finish along with the obvious hoppiness.

(12 oz bottle, obtained in trades with Goblincat and hopsrus, thanks Mike and John!) The nose is lightly malty, but fairly bready, slightly sour and mildy hoppy.  But I think the flavor is a bit of a let down after smelling the inviting aroma.  This is a pretty light flavored IPA, enjoyable, delicate, but not a big IPA.  A light, sweet, bready maltiness leads the way, with some fruitiness and moderately bitter hops for good balance.  The claim of "enormous hop additions" seems a bit self inflated if you ask me.  Medium bodied.  Not exactly clean and crisp because the level of hops isnt all that big.  Golden orange color and fairly cloudy.  Pours a large, whitish head that is very bubble -- large bubbles, in fact -- and forms craters as it falls away.  Dense, intricate lacing is left on the glass.

Very Pleasant and sharp hops.  Grapefruit, raw flower and lite grain/grass.  Nice medium gold/brown color with a small and lasting head (the last part was surprising to me).  The flavor was similar to the aroma at the begining with grapfruit hopw and other citrus straight away.  There are some lite malts that help with balance but his is a hopy ale all around.  Good.
Wonderful floral hoppy aroma. It has a nice orange colour and an awesome head that sticks around. It is very bitter, yet smooth and easy to drink. It has a nice compliment of malts as well.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2005 Huge orange-pine-citrus hop nose with nice, soft, underlying doughy malt/yeast aroma. Hazy orange-tan with off-white, dense, lasting finger of head that sticks to the glass and excellent, fine-bubbled carbonation. Fruity and hoppy up front with pine-orange hop flavour and intense bitterness. Feels very clean in the mouth. Theres plenty of malts here to support all those hops but hoppiness overshadows a bit - though it works very well. Medium-light body. Refreshing.  Bottle. Thanks, Silphium!

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2008 Current rating: cask @ Beer Engine, 3/08
One of the best IPAs Ive ever had.  Miles beyond this in bottle or draught (and I had a pint on draught the night before having this cask version.) Layers or malt & hop not even hinted at in those other serving formats.  Copper tan head with nice lacing.  Nose is.... no.  This goes beyond my usual "nose is...  flavor is... comment on the body" format.  This is stunning.  Damn close to perfection.  This is one of those pints that Ill tell stories about for years to come, like the Storm King I had on cask at the Victory Brewpub years ago when Storm King was at the top of its game.  This is what Peter Bouckart (sp?) of New Belgium is talking about when he says that brewers are creating art that gives people "10 minutes of pleasure."

Do you remember the first time you found you loved IPAs?  That definitive moment where it all clicked?  For me it was Hop Devil.  It was just this absolutely amazing thing that I had never experienced before.  This perfect, logical expression of happiness in flavor form.  This beer is that, all over again, even after my taste buds have been jaded by 92 other IPAs and 54 double IPAs.  This is an epiphany.

The only problem with this beer is that I cant share it with my friends.  Someday.  

But for now, just fucking wow.


Original rating from a bottle: 8/3/7/4/17.  3.9
Big citrus nose - nice malt, spicy flavor is very juicy orange.  peppery, grapefruit, earthy caramel.  Orange grapefruit finish.  Nice.  A little too tangy for me.
A cloudy /frothy looking beer.  Has a perfect balance of fruit and hops.  Liked so much I bought a keg of it to enjoy through the winter

Foggy gold color with a perfect fluffy white head.  Apple, hops, dough are the aroma.  Very smooth and subtle IPA.  So many IPAs are overhopped and it overwhelms the smaller characteristics.  This brew is just awesome.
Great cloudy golden color. Solid head and lacing. Medium body, slightly creamy. Very hoppy, with exploding fruity taste from the hops. Very well balanced overall. Good hoppy aftertaste.

murky dark yellow body with a one inch head that simmered down,but not completly.man this has a great aroma.it contained a bit of vanilla,citurs,hops,and flowers.the flavor is even better.perfect balanced brew for sure.with flavors of vanilla,flowers,and hops.alot of ipas are to bitter but this is perfect.you cant get much better than this!!!!
On draft at the St James Tavern in Columbus.  Gorgeous pour; heavenly bouquet.  This beer is dripping with hops:  juicy, flowery, grapefruity hops.  In Bells, the Midwest has a genuine treasure!

Wow.  Such a quality beer.  Aroma of rain water, peaches, and the west coast beaches.  The first impression is more of a mouth feel than a taste as this is the creamest beer I have tried.  A quality balance between malts and hops.    A strong hops prescense and taste.  The mouthfeel is the distinguishing trait.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2005 Golden orange with a fluffy off-white head. Leaves nice lacing all the way down the glass with a great head retention. Sweet citrus aroma that closely resembles juicy fruit gum. Hops are very mild, noticable, but not strong. The flavor was a light lemon and orange peel mix. This beer is real smooth with good malt. The flavor finishes with a floral taste.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2005 The Two Hearted poured a hazy golden color.  It had a thick fluffy white head that had great retention and lacing.

The aroma was grapefruity, apricoty, piney hops.  A little on the subdued side, but nice.

The flavor was grapefruity malts with a hoppy, bitter finish that dominated more as it sat and warmed.  Just the right balance of hops, fruitiness and malts.  It had a smooth and velvety mouthfeel.

Overall, an excellent IPA.  A little more subdued than I expected, but very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2010 12oz. bottle:  The beer pours a fairly hazy, golden color, with a little sediment.  There was a bit of a white head on it.  It has a very nice aroma.  The main nose is that of floral hops.  Strong, but not overpowering.  A hint of sweetness in the aroma also.  Upfront taste of hops.  Strong, but not overdone.  Aftertaste has a bit of orange to it, a hint of both sweetness and tartness.  Quite good!  Update:  Had this on tap today.  Still quite good, but had to adjust the numbers a bit!

Mellow pour with ample, cake-like head that sticks to the drinking device.  Smells great, tastes better.  No hints of anything.  A great IPA with lots of hops.  Orange, sweet and strong.  This one will be a regular in the cooling unit.  My only question is, where can I get it on tap???

Tap at Hopleaf, Chicago  Golden/Autumnal color...nice head, fruity, peachy aroma.  Orange, fruits, mix in with solid malt backdrop...jazz drones on amongst the loud chatter...very nice balance of malt and bitterness/hops...But dont misunderstand, this is hoppy...yeast kicks in nicely as well.

Pours hazy gold. Nose is a very strong floral hops. Note: Very strong. This ale has more hops than any I can remember right off. A very floral taste and sharp bite. Incredible if you like that, but not so good to people like my wife who thought it too overwhelming. I like this one because I like hops. Very good.

Orange in color with minimal head. Aroma of citrus and floral hops. Taste, wow, what an intense, fresh hop punch this beer packs. Grapefruit is the other prominent flavor here, and the balance between the two is simply wonderful.
Cloudy gold pour a white head and lots of sediment in the glass. Strong hoppy aroma and intense hoppy taste, smooth going down and very refreshing. Nice Ale.

You can tell they use the hops in this beer.  You really have to be ready when you take the first sip of this beer.  This is my favorite IPA but I am sure that has something to do with the fact that my heart is with the Upper Peninsula.  Make sure you take the time to pour this beer into a glass because it is good looking and really brings a lot to the beer.

Bottle:  Nice citrus hop nose.  Pours  a hazy yellow with lots of sediment.  Decent white head with decent retention.  Okay lacing.   Lots of citrus in the initial taste, then the hops kick in in the finish.  Stronger citrus taste than most IPAs balances nicely with the hoppy finish.  I could do withou the slight sour taste in the finish, but that really doesnt do much to hurt the rating.   Great balance equals great beer.

Pours out a nice light orange hue of gold. Has a decent sized dense, creamy head, with a nice aroma of hops that tells of the taste of the beer. It has a nice dry hop taste that is balanced pretty well to make it a nice smooth brew.
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2006

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2008 bottled: now anything with a fish on the bottle i already start to become uninterested....why do so many american micros have a fasination with animals on the label....think of something original you slackers. was a golden color with a nice crisp white head. nose of grassy citrus notes.  nicely hopped...not over the top and maybe not enough....the way i like them....smooth backbone of malt pushes the back door open to a slight bitter grapefruit end. all in all swell. not swill. ya! i just had this again in minnesota and thought it was fabulous...nice solid ipa flavors

golden copper with white head.  Big dry-hopped nose of fresh centennials? Piney/citrus aroma.  Hops are definitely the focus here being very assertive, but somehow it balances well with the malt.  Nice dry-hopped IPA

355 ml bottle courtesy of jsquire. Hazy deep golden colour with a lasting frothy and rocky off-white head. Caramel, bread, grapefruit, and other citrus in the aroma. Big malt backbone of caramel, toffee, and bread with a lingering grapefruit and lime accented bitter finish. Medium to full bodied, juicy and refreshing mouthfeel.

On tap @ Buckeye Brewing:  Hazy light amber w/ a lasting white head.  Grapefruit citrusy hop aroma, as well as caramel malt, alcohol, and some grassy hop notes in the first sniff.  Hints of toasty malt; alcohol esters are moderate.  Flavor is well balanced to bitter, but not overdone; medium citrusy grapefruit hop; yeasty & toasty malt flavor. Hops in the finish & aftertaste.  Finish is semi dry and lightly grassy.  Smooth m/f, medium body, low carbonation, and hints of alc. warmth.  Very different than the bottled version.  Seems more well rounded and less noticeably bitter than the bottle.  Definitely more drinkable.

I cant believe I havent rated this yet because Ive had this beer more than any other IPA.  Pours a golden color with a thick white head.  Smells of fresh hops, very citrus like.  Tastes smooth and balanced.  Highly recommended

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2009 Hops galore and bitter all the way, but still crisp and pretty easy going down.
Had on tap recently on Mackinac Island and very good.

On tap ,ABR.Golden amber.Almost like you are standing in a pine forest cutting grapefruit.I am growing more into IPAs and this beer is an example way.Gotta love that hop flavor of this beer.Nice body and finish.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2007 Pours a golden orange hue with a light slightly frothy white head.  Aromas of roses, citrus goods, and HOPS... Mouth feel is medium bodied and damn this is bitter... almost like eating a grapefruit or lemon straight.   Flavors range from... wait...damn bitterness.... Oh my... of all beers that I have had, none seem to this bitter on the palate.  Almost lie the feeling after rinsing your mouth with Listerine.  Flavors of oranges, lemons, and, one more time, damn... the bitterness. Mouth feel is light to medium bodied and this brew would probably go well with some heavy foods like a steak or chicken in a heavy sauce.  Truly unique in the world of IPAs.

Sparkly burnt orange in color with a thin-but-frothy nearly white head.  Highly carbonated.  Citrusy, flowery aroma.  Extremely crisp, citrusy flavo with floral undertones.  Very hoppy without the extreme bitterness in the finish.  The fourth Bells beer Ive tasted--havent been disappointed yet!!

Bright head, typical of good quality IPAs. Pleasant looking gold ale . 
Refreshing hop nose , intense yes but not over the board . Medium bodied , oily texture , very smooth and drinkable . I like the way it was balanced , crisp , clean , well rounded . Well done Guys!

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2007 This beer hit me strong and hard on the first taste.  Simply excellent.  A hoppy flavor that I hadnt tasted before.  I enjoyed the slight fruity aftertaste.  This is the best brew I have tasted.  I cannot find anything wrong with this one.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2009 a good ipa, but not one of my faves.   bells in general seem to make quality brew, and this was no different.  just not really anything special about it.  hoppy, crips, citrusy, a bit fruity.  
rerate: fresh bottle.  absolute favorite fresh.  So well hopped, in a different way then those over the top(still great) california style ipas.  I

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2006 If you like hoppy ales, youll love this beer.  Intense aroma coming from a thick head.  Drink it slowly, enjoy the citric hop flavor filling the mouth and sinus cavities.  Enjoy the mildly bitter aftertaste.  Enjoy.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>

Great floral aroma. Apricot, cat pee, ozone, pine. Fruity sweet rinds. Medium amber, light haze, thin lacing head. Medium bodied with medium-high carbonation. Starts fruity with apricot, spice. Medium carbonic acidity. Huge fruity floral hops presence, with big bitter mouth-drying finish. After is bitter and just a bit peppery. Very nice IPA.

Wow, I really like this beer. Cloudy. Sweet floral hoppy grapefruit aroma. A very well balanced IPA. Good hops mainly in the end that are balanced with great malt flavors. One of the better IPAs I have had. Very easy to drink.

12 oz bottle.  Clear golden color and a fine head.  The aroma is medium to high hops.  The centennial throughout is quite nice.  It is fairly bitter but there are flavor and aroma hops to round it out nicely.  The flavor leaves you with a touch of lime.  Great beer.

Aroma is a blend of malt and hops, cloudy apricot, and a finger of white foam. Very hoppy taste at first, with malt coming in after. Well balanced, nicely bitter. Lovely!

 Thank joey_capps.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2005 Picked up this beer on a trade in Coventry last weekend (where a song about my ratebeer user name was played).  Huge sticky head atop a murky orange/brown body.  Sweet orange aroma.  Great citrus hop flavor with a nice lemon taste.  A most excellant ipa.

thanks again to mwsf. murky orange, grapefruit aroma, tasted quite sweet, plenty of lychee and quite bitter. better than average ipa, i´m just disappointed i didn´t get to taste any other bells beers in the states

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2006 Sampled this beer at the Great Taste of the Midwest in Madison WI.  Even though my scores on this are accurate and well researched, ?Da Man? wants me to say more about the beer, so I will.  I love Bells, and this is one of the better IPAs Ive had in a long time.  A very nice beer.
Had this up in Coventry, VT on sunday for breakfast(before breakfast)Was quite a treat of an IPA.Huge yummy citrus nose.Well balanced overall and I wish I could get this on the regular.

What goodness from such an unassuming trout bottle!  Aroma of citrus (lemon, grapefruit and HUGE orange).  Appears hazy, and almost murky dark gold/light orange.  The flavor is so rich and full, with orange and even some gin in the taste.  The only flaw is a little alcohol coming thru (a shame at 6%).  Would make the perfect transition beer for those needing an intiation into american craft beer.  This is Dreadnaughts not-so-distant smaller cousin.

Draft. Bright, hazy gold. Off-white head w/ fine bead & excellent lace. Robust, very fresh aroma of citrus & pine w/ lovely notes of caramel & vanilla. Full-bodied. Nice & sticky. Flavour is complex, very hoppy & bitter w/ long lingering finish. Still the malt is there to support. Excellent beer.

Hazy golden color.  Small head.  Aroma was the familiar hoppy IPA smell that one usually gets.  Reminds me of the Dogfish 90 minute.  Not painfully hoppy, which in my opinion is a plus.  Perhaps one of the best IPAs that I have ever had (tho I?ve only had a handful-ha!) My introduciton to Bells beers. I am impressed and I will return for more.

bottle. one of the spoils from a recent midwest adventure. pours a slightly hazy almost orange yellow. clumpy fat white head with specks in it. leaves tendrils of foam floating deep within the glass. aroma reminds me of the candy lick-em-ade powder i used to eat as a kid, very sweet take on the standard ipa aroma that alerts you that some thing new is afoot. flavor is a smooth balanced hoppy greatness. mouthfeel of an orange sherbert freeze with bitterness that is phenomenal. nice citrus flavor that is strong but not too overpowering. not for the weeak or those who dont appreciate a good IPA.

Bottle. Nose is a very piney hop. Hazy gold body with a one finger foamy head. You can smell the hops from a meter away. Sweeter than most IPAs. The hops are so well rounded words escape me. Perfectly hopped. Not too powerful, not too light. Under the hops is a citrusy sweetness that puts this beer over the top. This is one of the best IPAs I have ever had the pleasure of tasting.

Wow!  Delicious IPA.  Beautiful Hop Aroma destinguishable from 10 feet away.  Poured a Dirty Golden yellow with a fast disapating head.  A gorgues Blend of subtle malts and Intense Hop additions has moved this to the Top of my list.  Well Done!

Thanks again to TAR for this brew, hooking me up with another solid IPA! This beer poured a yellow and slightly orange color with a thick soapy white head which diminished rather quickly. The aroma was of floral hops, pines, caramel, syrupy nectary thickness, apricots and citrus. The taste is heavy nectar with piney bitterness in the finish. The finish is slightly dry and malty leaving a nice bit of lacing on my glass. This is a very solid IPA.
REAL good IPA. Bells got it really right on this one. Nice lingery head and lacing. Smooth with just the right IPA hop blast. Awesome aroma. Very citrusy and spicy. Just added to my top 10 list.
Gold in colour. Large, fluffy head. Predominately hoppy aroma. High alcohol, but smooth taste. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Nice beer.

Good, I mean really good IPA.  Im starting to think that the Midwest has a better handle on IPAs than the West Coast...maybe the tide is shifting?  Anyway, it pours a nice orange color with a medium white head.  Aroma is grapefruit but with enough malt to back it up.  Flavor is wonderfully sweet and bitter.  Smooth body.  One of the better "session"  IPAs out there, IMHO.

Hazy orange color with big white head. Aroma is dominated by citrisy hops. The tatse is too, but there is enough malt to back it up. Bitter and citrisy all the way through. Makes me want more. A very enjoyable beer.

Good thick head...smells like a bitter. Taste reminds me of cheap gin and sweet and sour sauce. I expected more. Extremely bitter and unsatisfying aftertaste. Crisp and dry ale with a lame finish. Boo.
Gorgeous hop aroma, with citrus and pine. Nice mouthfeel with bitter hop finish balanced nicely. Tons of flavor and very refreshing. One Awesome Beer!!!
(draft) This seems to be a favorite, but I just dont get it.  The smell of old socks was just too much for me.  I couldnt finish the glass.
Thanks to slikwily for this. Great IPA with fresh bread maltiness with a sharp finish. Hazy gold with a long lasting rocky white head. Citrus hop notes in the nose with some resin. Very nice.

This one comes trade with Indra. Two Hearted IPA is terrific. Definitely one of the top 3  Ive had. Hoppy, citrusy, big flavor, great malt. Bells stock in my opinion is a high riser.  Started with a bad one and the rest just keep making me rethink my first impression of this brewer.
Hazy Orange Coloring. White Frothy Head.  Citrus Aroma... Sweet.  Hops... Grapefruit definitly.   Aftertaste has some Bark.  Very Wonderful Beer!

Hazy amber with a frothy white head.  Aroma is hops/grapefruit and inviting.  Medium to full bodied with good carbonation and a biting feel in the mouth.  Flavor was citric and sweet and very refreshing.  Excellent.
Very tart.  grapefruit notes in the flavor  Well-carbonated; aroma of clean hops but is a bit faint.  Not quite the reddish color or highlight that I associate with the style.  Decent, not great.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2004 WOW! Quite possibly my favorite IPA as of yet. Pours a beautiful orange haze with a decent head of slightly off-white. Flavor is all citrus and pine hopped up to next friday. Having been said, also a very well balance beer, not too hoppy, not too malty, just right!

Thanks to CaptainCougar for this one! This was milder but very well balanced IPA. A very floral, pine, and citrus aroma. The flavor on this defines balances. A very soft mouthfeel with some oranges, lemons, and grapefruit. Bells simply kicks ass! I cant wait to try more.

Pours a hazy orange color with an average white head. Aroma is floral with hops. Flavor is earthy hops. I was expecting this beer to knock me off my feet, but it did not. Still an above average IPA. I enjoyed it.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2012 Cloudy, dirty orange-colored beer with a stellar foamy head.  Nice pungent earthy aroma.  Bountiful floral flavors -- orange rind tartness and spice.  Beautiful beer.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2010 Both floral and bitter in its hop content, this is a distinctly balanced IPA. The medium level alcohol strength is hidden enough to make this one worthy of multiple bottles in one sitting.

On tap at Handlebar in Chicago, $3 on Saturdays! Anyway, what can I say but wow! This was a nice nice nice nice beer. Smelled distinctly piney with some citrus, Very solid malt backbone to balance out the crazed hop mayhem. Actually, I jest. The hop series in this IPA is not too complex, though it does a great job of making a terrificly balanced brew. Deep gold with a rockin rocky head. Amen.

poured a cloudy golden with off white head. aroma grapefruit, yeast, lemon,orange, hops, pine. flavor orange, hops, supriseingly the grapefruit was weak compared to the aroma, floral. bells does it for me again. good beer

on tap served nice and cold.  hops are apparent in the nose.  a little sweet on the onset followed by a nice crisp and clean bitter hop finish.  grapefruit in the flavor.  a pint of this on tap cost 3 dollars on a saturday night at the HandleBar in Chicago.  highly recommended

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2014 Ah IPA another of my favorite styles. I have managed to have this beer several times in the past but for some reason I have never managed to rate it. Sampled from a typical 12 oz brown bottle this fine beer poured a rich golden color with a medium sized yellow-white head. Very pretty. A strong grapefruit, pine  and sweet sugary scent fairly explodes from the glass as one can smell this one before the glass is even taken in hand. The front taste is sweet and pear like with a thick mouthfeel. Then on comes full bore hops. Strong elements of grapefruit that become dominant and linger forever on the aftertaste. Really a very fine IPA.

Gosh this beer has a lot going for it. The color is somewhat unusual for an IPA.  As my wife called it, a golden honey color.  An outrageous melding of scents in the aroma.  Everything is here, bananas, citrus (lemon, grapefruit most prevelant), hops and possibly some spice.  If I give it some thought Im sure I might find something else in the aroma.  The beer is a nice balance of citrus flavors, mostly grapefruit.  With a genuine hop finish.  Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2008 Great fruit nose of  orange,  apple and almost rosey notes.  Slightly murky orange color with big white rocky head that has good lacing. Big citrus flavors like grapefruit and orange. Nice creamy texture.  Hoppy but very balance with a great grain profile and a dry finish.  This is one great beer.

re-rate
Holy Crap. Alan (Fly) brought by a 5L mini keg of this for New Years Eve!  Great beer!

bottle.  Huge rocky off white head.  Cloudy light orange color. Aroma lightly sweet, citrus, peach, and grapefruit.  Light body.   Light malt sweetness backed by big hop flavor of citrus/grapefruit.  Long pleasant bitterness, good balance.

golden, big lacey white head.  very fruity aroma with peach, melon, white grape, citrus, pine and earth.  flavour has lots of citrus up front and piney and flowery hops dancing on the tongue.  nicely balanced.  very nice.

Looks a little weak after the pour, but when you take a taste all is forgiven. This is a great ale! Nice citrusy notes. Wonderful hoppiness. Decent malting in the background. This puppy packs a slight punch despite its initial look. Buy this beer.

Poured a little lighter than expected golden color, white head. Big floral aroma, lightly sweet, quite hoppy. Flavor was piney and lemony, hops were definitely kicking, yet not overpowering.  Medium boded, finishes bitter, very drinkable. Very good, thanks NorthYorkSammy.

Pours a hazy pale gold color with small head.  Pine dominates the aroma.  Nice pine hop aroma to start, some sweetness in there too.  Leads to a dry finish with a decent bitterness.  Very pleasing to me.

Piney hop aroma with hints of sour apple.  Pours a moderately hazy pallor yellow color with a small white head.  Start seems to be missing something. Very Very dry and tangy at the finish.  A good IPA, but I think Im missing something here that everyone else tastes.
This is an incredible beer. Great bitterness and smooth like nothing i can write on this page. Fruity and malty combined with hundreds of other flavor impressions. Great.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2006 Feb 2006 Bottle. Hazy golden orange body, with a small creamy white head. Fairly hoppy aroma with a touch of resiny citrus. Flavour is quite bitter, but is lacking in hops flavour and character, but some pleasant grapefruit. Medium palate. I would love to try this on tap to see what it is like very fresh. 7/3+/7-8/3+/16

June 2004 Bottle. Hazy golden amber with a very nice fluffy white head. Citrusy hops in the aroma. Bitterness in the flavour is a bit stronger than indicated in the aroma. Lots of resiny humulin lingering in the aftertaste. Very nice but a bit unbalanced with the hops dominating over the malt which is not an altogether bad thing depending what you are in the mood for. Thanks very much for the bottle NorthYorkSammy. 7/4/8/3/17 3.9

crisp and lemony citrus. Grapefruit Bitter sipping with fruity salt, and bitter aftertaste with high but effective complementary hops. Lots of initial and remaining foam. Light texture. Floral aroma. Alcohol punch

Very cloudy golden color with a tall foamy heady that would do a Duvel proud.  The underlying natural carbonation is steady and delicate.  The aroma is fresh hops with pine resin and hay.  The taste is that of pine resin and pepper like hop heat tempered with the flavors of mandarin orange, caramel malt, and the gritty, earthy yeast.  The beer is creamy smooth like a stick of butter melting on your tongue.  This is a very good and well balanced IPA that lacks a lot of complexity, but turns that into a strength rather than a weakness.

Hazy amber with tiny suspended particles. A good sandy head. The aroma starts off a ragged tangle of citric centennials. The hops mellow as the beer warms, letting a soft fruitiness through in the aroma and an off dry maltiness through in the flavor.
12oz bottle. Very hoppy. American Hops.  Yellow in color. Big hoppy aroma. Starts with a big head but then fades. Ok.

A great IPA!  Pours an orangey-copper with a thick, pillowy head that lasts and leaves very well defined lace on the glass.  Aroma is very citrusy, piney, and hoppy.  F;avor is very hoppy, though a great toasted malt flavor comes along to mellow things out to a bitter grassy finish.  Fantastic!

12 oz bottle. Pours yellow clear with big head that fades before you know it. Nice hops and somewhat rich malts (nutty flavor). Finish is simple with little to no aftertaste. Very easy drinkable beer malts does not over power this above  avg beer. And sweetness is very low key(which i like)
12 oz bottle. Yellow with a cloud of yeast. Head starts big and fades. Big hoppy aroma. Nice hoppy flavor. Like Stone, but with less malt, so not quite as good.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Slight cloudy yellow orange color, medium sized white head. Citrusy hops in the aroma, pine resin, sharp, clean, fresh. Flavor is creamy, hoppy, bitter, good but nothing too interesting. A nice, simple IPA. Nothing fancy, but soild.
This has to be one of the best IPAs Ive ever had. Hops, water, alcohol, its all in this beer!
Pours golden with a white fluffy head. The lace lasts to the end of the glass. Hop aroma hit me as soon as I opened the bottle. A balanced IPA, neither the malt or the hops over-power each other.

Pours a off yellow with a big fluffy head.  The first thing you notice is the hop aroma.  I can smell it in the bottle before I ever pour it. Flavor is where the beer loses its points.  Sure the hops are in there you can smell them but I cant really taste them.  Average IPA at best.  This brew actually smells better than it tastes.

I wanted to try this one for a long time.  Finally got my hands on a bunch of different Bells, and this was one that didnt live up to the legend.

I notice IPAs definitely lose a bit if they age, maybe I had a bottle past its prime?
Very typical light amber colored with a nice thick head. 
The aroma was of fresh floral hops, taste was a nice balance with a bit of malt midway.  Very little bitterness in the aftertaste.  Maybe it was good in its prime, but this one tasted average to me...
I really wanted this to be so much more!

Pours mostly yellow with a frothy white head that I managed to get about 1 inch over the top off the glass.  Very citrucy/grapefruit hop aroma, very powerful as well.  Cant seem to smell any malts at all.  Oh well.  The taste is pretty underwhelming.  Its quite bitter and quite tangy, but aside from a mellow malt body around mid tongue, there really isnt much to taste.  Goes down clean and has a pleasent aftertaste tho.  Im a little let down :(  Its tasty, and it sure smells nice, but Ive definately had better IPAs.

Pours a nice golden amber with  thick off-white head. Nice floral hop nose, along with notes of citrus and spice. Full mouthfeel. Grapefruit, lemon zest, pine needles, and black pepper on the tongue. Good bitter hop finish. A really good IPA. Well-ballanced and easy drinking. I want more!

For a style with a lot of competition, this beer truly stands out. It pours a nice, thick head with _layered_ lacing that lasts to the end of the glass. The initial aroma is strongly rosy with a little hop perkiness. The beer is well carbonated and bubbles out quite nicely on the palate. As its sipped, a unique yet simple maltiness affirms itself, and the floral aromas blend together with citrus tangs and well-pronounced hops and some hard-to-describe nutmeg-like spice elements. In my opinion, the problem with a lot of IPAs (including most of the big ones) is that they simply dont use enough hops to balance the malts and allow the nuances to show through. However, this brew is bold enough to virtually make that statement in its commercial description. The result of this well-balanced brew is that the aftertaste immediately shows the same strong rose aroma as the initial impression -- yet after half a minute or so it evolves into a refreshing lemon, and a couple minutes more its the typical, generic malt/hop aftertaste, sort of like trainmen on a caboose waving to kids on a bridge - to me, this progression is the highlight of drinking Two Hearted Ale! Perfect for a warm day in May after dropping things off at Goodwill during spring cleaning.
This is a great IPA. Citrus, grapfruit, pine hoppy and malty flavors.  Finishes clean, crisp, and dry, Recommended.

Sweet, floral, citusy hop aroma... Golden yellow color with a slight haze..  Good toasty maltiness at first quickly overtaken by the citrusy/hoppy flavor and bitterness. There is a lingering toastiness and bitterness. Medium low body with high carb. Overall this is one of my favorite IPAs to drink. I cant get enough of this beer. It is also one of the beers I continue to try and clone in my homebrewing...

bottle: straight poured into a tulip glass, creating a large white frothy head.  light gold (i like gold) cloudy from a good amount of sediment floating in the glass. Smells of a mellow hop, floral, citrusy aroma. There is no incredible hop explosion from this ipa..Fairly carbonated ale, with somewhat of a thin to moderate mouth feel, and a fruity aftertaste.  well balanced, but I think i was biased in thinking that it would be bombastic..chill

Medium fast fading head. Nice, mostly clear orange-yellow color. Fresh hoppy and citrusy aroma. Flavor is strongly hoppy and floral balanced nicely by maltiness not detracting from the top notch hop character. In terms of an IPA, the bitterness is slightly on the low side, but made up for by the quality of the hops.
Unfiltered cloudy amber color.  Straight-up hop aroma of a typical American IPA.  Definitely an easy drinker.  Good summertime IPA.  I'm quite fond of the two-hearted.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2005 So in my glass is the famous Two Hearted IPA. It looks good, potent dark sun yellow, lightly hazy, with a great very foamy and rocky white head, highly carbonated in appearance. Acute citrusy C-hops nose, very flowery, sweet, sour, hints at lemon pie, lilac (orval anyone?), grapefruit, grass. Solid toasty/cookie malt attack early like a good pils, quickly complemented by the direct floral and citrusy hops. Great flavor development for an IPA, but you know where theyre from, hopheads neck of the wood and always lacking a touch of "multidimensionality". Tremendous velvety texture, less carbonated than anticipated. Clean and long oily bitter finish. Quite good, but top 100 in the world? I think not. Maybe a top 10 IPA though. Thanks Jeff.
suberb fruity hopiness but w/o some of the apple notes I detect in quite a few midwest IPAs.  There is a formidable malt undertow to support the hopiness.  Another top tier effort from Bells

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2008 [bottle] Pours a hazy amber with a very thick white head and lots of carbonation. Very strong hoppy and citrusy aroma. Tangy and a bit peppery taste with a hint of the citrus aroma. Very smooth and crisp.
Well rounded IPA.  Poured golden yellow with nice head.  Citrus aroma that is evident in the taste.  Strong hops add to good mouthfeel and smooth finish.
Pours hasy yellowish with thick head.  Strong hop nose.  Mildly tangy, citrusy,  somewhat like a Belgian-wit.  Nice dry finish.

Had this at the Clark St. Ale House in Chicago. On hand pump - my first one! Good and cool, not cold. The large white head faded to a small one that stayed around. Lots of lacing. The aroma had orange peel and flowers. The taste was tangerine and slightly sweet. This was a medium nouthfeel. Absolutely delicious.

I got tricked into having an IPA by my waitress.  I'm just not a fan of the style although this one had a bit of a light refreshing aftertaste.  One true downside was it looked like a standard bland yellow beer.
