Flavors bounced all around my mouth like a bullet in a metal room. Hop flavors kept my attention all the way down the glass, and then left me yearning for more. Chewy, juicy finish. Bitterness in the aftertaste built nicely.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2009 rerated 6/20/2009:  Its like I just cut open a bag of hops and stuck my face into it.  Oranges and pine are the dominate aroma.  A hazy yellow with a well retained foam that would make any brewer envious.  Its still quite "chewy" and the presence of Tang finds its way into the profile.  Malt heartily keeps this hop bomb balanced.  This is a well crafted, consitent  offering from one of the midwests great breweries.** 5/4/2009:  Chewy does not even begin to describe this meal. It was a nice change, but I do not think I really want my IPAa to be as thick as a barleywine.  Great hop bite to it that is evenly matched by the malts.  Overall a nice beer.

Re-Rate 5/1/2002. This years batch is just as good. Still has that wonderful balance of hops with a nice malty/yeasty backbone. This is a strong contender to be my beer of the summer. Great cloudy yellow color. Huge pillowy  head. Just an amazing hop aroma and taste. Just loads of hops but still well balanced. Great IPA!
Bottle & Tap.  Few IPAs can compare to Bells Two Hearted Ale.  This beer has a strong smell that grabs you with each sip.

A fine IPA from Larry Bell.  Lighter hop nose, good color and mouthfeel, perfect IPA hop flavor, and (suprisingly for Bells), not much malt prominence.  Not suprisingly (at 7% alcohol), it is a dab light bodied.  Very, very good take on India Pale Ale.  One complaint:  Why is this seasonal??  But for lovers of the brew who miss it off season, try Bells Third Coast, if you havent - that should tide you over!
One of my favorite IPAs.  Smells like hops and citrus.  This beer will wake up you taste buds.  I find myself getting bored with the flavor of some IPAs, but this one tastes better all the time.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 Rich straw-hued body. Fluffy and sticky, stark white foam. Divine aroma of bubblegum and fresh-picked Centennial. Subtle nutty yeast and flower petals. Fluffy and creamy on the palate. Bottle-conditioned. Elegantly understated, softly citric hop flavors underlain with gobs of soft, yeast esters. Crisp pale malts balance the softly floral hops in the dry finish. Hop burps continue to rekindle the flavor with abundant notes of flowers and citrus. Solid. 

Re rate:  Metallic aroma and flavor lowers my rating from last years sample - Notes of bubble gum from the yeast and a sticky head.  Wonderful hop sack aroma.  A hop heads satisfaction, thats for sure.  Great mouth feel due to the bottle conditioning.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: DEC 3, 2003 Very nice.  The head is amazingly stiff- a bit like sea foam.  Extremely hoppy, as much as Victory hop devil.  However, it's got a fuller, smoother taste and mouthfeel.  The hops are actually a bit too vicious for my taste on certain days.

Golden, straw colored, almost like a hefe-weisse, with a stacked, foamy head.  Strong, floral hop bouquet, with prominent grapefruit, other citrus.  Ill probably revisit once Ive got a few more IPAs under my belt, but yeah I liked this one.

I am blown away by the aroma of this mega-hoppy IPA! It was on tap, so the bottled stuff may not be as wild. Its citrusesque flavor makes it a favorite IPA. The re-rate is due to having the bottle which presented a little less flavor and aroma.
Cloudy, pineapple yellow color.  Citrusy, pineapple, hoppy nose.  Very bitter, citrusy, long palate.  A little bitter for my tastes, but a great beer.

Semi-cloudy, golden/orange. Huge head with a awesome nose of cascades,peaches and apricot. Medium and creamy body with substanial malt backbone, almost biscuity. Sharp bite on tounge. Huge blast of hops with some sugary/fruity sweetness to counteract. Very big, very balanced IPA. One of the best I have had. Damn tasty!
Once again another great from Kalamazoo.  Strong hops

Way too flowery.  The extreme hop level made me feel like I was drinking a wet-nap  I was dissappointed, since everything else Ive had from Bells has been excellent.  Certainly not my mug of beer.
it kind of tastes like a mix between fruity pebbles with a little bit of cocoa pebbles mixed, the key is the hops.  Quality, quality brew.
Words cant accurately describe this ale.  Almost a hint of root beer flavor in this one.  Much more enjoyable off the tap than out of the bottle, but either way it is worth trying.
A nice IPA. A fruity nose and taste. A nice dry finish. The head fades quickly which is a bit of a disappointment.

Excellent hop aroma and nice head from the pour from the bottle.  The color was a little cloudy, but the flavor matched the hoppy nose.  Its a well balanced IPA with hops leading the way from the nose to the aftertaste.  Even the burps have a dry hopped taste to em.

Way too much hops for me. I like the english ipa over the american style. Someone gave me a 6-pack and I struggled through four then I mixed one with a Skull Splitter now I have to go buy more of this AND more SkullSplitter.

Begins with an explosion of hops in the nose, and in the cataclysmic head.  The head subsides into spectacular lacing and the first rocky cascadified sip into smoother, softer, but still aggressive flavours as the decent malt catches up to the hops.  Quite cloudy and extremely entertaining in the glass.  VENOM is dead on with the carrot - I noticed that too and its a new one for me.

Simply Awesome.  The only downfall of this is the extreme unfiltered appearance.  It is extremely cloudy and near orange in color.  Its hoppy taste takes over your palate and has almost a fruity after taste.  Its fairly generic label might have you pass right by for something with a bt more attraction... well the atraction of this one is not what is on the outside of the bottle but whats on the inside!
Cloudy gold color. Huge head that lasts a long time. Very strong hop aroma. Pretty similar it taste to Stone IPA

This is not an IPA in the truest sense of style.  The over the top cascade aroma, puts this beer in a style of its own.  I give this beer such a high rating because it is absolutely addicting.  I spend half the year waiting for this brew to go back on to the shelves of local beer merchants.  And every year, it surprises me.  Well worth a taste.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2003 Update:  2003-04 versions sampled in Oct, Nov '03 were firm in character but bland and totally lacking in the Two Hearted "brightness."  Dec '03 versions sampled so far are much better and are beginning to approach the fantastic 2001-02 versions.  The rocky, white lace left after an exhuberent pour is starting to come back.  The awesome smell is evident after cracking the bottle, but still not quite as strong in the glass.  I have only one question... who is the idiot that keeps this from being a year round brew?  

.............................................. Prior Review: I was pleasantly surprised when I opened a bottle of this very plainly marked beer.  It has a huge aroma and is somewhat overwhelming at first.  Things settle down quickly though as the brew reveals itself to be one of the top IPA's around.  It's a unique and well thought out beer.  Consider yourself lucky if you actually find a six pack on the shelf.  The 2001-02 version definitely had more personality than the 2002-03 version.  I hope it's simply a case of Bell's notorious quality contol and not a fundamental "blanding-out" of the recipe.

Pale orange color; Holy Moly, the head started to come out of the bottle before I could pour- stayed frothy and rocky (extra points in overall for this); tell-tale citrus and spice. Citrus from the Cascade married to some spicy hops. Belgian-style head on top of an APA?? Spiciness mellows out nicely at the 3/4 mark of the glass.

the label is weak and nebulous-- if i may hazard an opinion of the books cover.  the prose within however -- that is, the content--is a mark twain of ales.  the color is about pantone 1225, pale orange, too cloudy to read a neon billboard through.  a swirl of the glass encourages a galaxy of diminutive bubbles. the aroma is clean northwoods pine, those centennial hops embrace you like a golden retriever.  this is a pricey beer in my part of the world, but theres enough stuff floating in this one beer to brew a keg of budweiser.  tres yummy.

I have never come across a beer that had such a powerful hop aroma before.  I smelled it the instant that I opened the bottle.  Head was huge (I poured it too fast and lost some of the beer to my kitchen counter in fact).  Cloudy orange color.  The taste was about as expected - very powerful hop flavor, but oddly not as overpowering as Id expected.  The solid malt base prevents that.  I kind of wish tha I could get more of this, but you cant get it in these parts.  Thanks Proc!

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2003 Quite the cloudy little burger this beer, the color a nice orange, the head gigantesque, spumescent, and as it dematerializes the lace magically appears as a silky sheet to occult the glass. The nose is dominated by the hop floral crispness; sweet malt underlies this olfactory delight. Start is sweet and malt laden, top is middling in feel, finish is moderately carbonated the hops puissant, aftertaste hop spicy and dry, quite long lasting, another beer meant for the Hop Heads amongst this most august group of beer lovers.
Everything an IPA should be.  Stout bitterness and an aroma like you just cut into a bale of hops. Unlike many IPAs this one has the body and punch to back up the hops and not taste overbalanced.
this beer absolutly rocks. Smells like a handfull of freshly picked hops. well balanced and crisp, with a deliscious dry finish

Wow.  Incredible head, lingers forever.  Unusually creamy for an IPA, great mouthfeel on this one.  Huge hops, but one of those rare big-hop IPAs where the malts actually manage to balance things out.  Great, great brew.
A really amazing ale.  A very unique hop aroma, I just sampled a 3 year old bottle and the hops are still there--and wonderful.
This is an excellent IPA.  Really hoppy and complex, with a strong corriander taste.  This isnt my favorite style, but its great for what it is.
Absolutely horrible tasting. Very strong with a foul flavor. As far as im concerned bells sucks and so does this ale of theirs. Everyone else likes it though, so I wont rate it that bad

Great stuff; extremely crisp, complex hop flavor--all sorts of spiciness, from cloves and coriander to black pepper--going on there. Mine had a perfectly acceptable malt body to keep the balance intact.

Let me tell you. I feel lucky living so close to the Bells Brew Pub. This beer (a winter seasonal) is what really turned me on to experimenting with good beers. An excellent example of an IPA. Mishawaka Brewing has an even better version. This though is a most noble beer.
Very hippity-hoppity.    A warming fruit nose greets you and spicy flavour pulls you in.   Very good and in top form.
good brew, lots o hops, youve gotta be in the mood for this one, but a good choice.  bells rules.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2003 Drippingly juicy hop aroma, very citrusy and piney, with notes of golden pineapple sweetness.  Dense, darker yellow in color, bottle is quite heavily sedimented.  Creamy, impressive, very much lasting head leaving thick lace sheets.  Initial citric hop bite, then a bit of lightly fruity sweetness, followed by a wash of fresh hop flavor.  Finish is equally infused with hop bitterness and drying.  Quite a powerful and punchy IPA.

All the great things Ive read about
this one were right on the money.  Im
glad I took that trip to the Midwest, where
I was able to enjoy a sixer of these.
Great hop aroma (smells like a fresh bag
of hops) and flavor.  Another great AIPA
for all the hopheads to seek out.
UPDATED: JUL 10, 2003 Its Bells.  Its always good
Big, chewy IPA.  A plethora of flavours.
Although this one is an IPA, the beer is not overly bitter and the hop flavor does not dominate.  A well-balanced ale with the familiar Bells flavor.  Nice job Larry!!
This beer is good, with a hint of more goodness.
This is one of my all time favorite beers, the floral smell and taste of the hops is wonderful.  If you are a hophead this is a must try for your list!
